阿诺德最重要的思想包含在“当代批评的功能”和“诗歌研究”两篇文章中。他强调保持“无私”对文学的重要性，他的意思是在政治上超然并且不致力于任何具体的行动纲领。文学批评的目标是获得纯粹的、无私的知识，换言之，用他最喜欢的另一句话来说，就是简单地欣赏“物体本身就是它的真实面目”，而不是想将获得的洞察力强加于特定行动路线的服务中。阿诺德的关键文学批评手段是试金石的概念，它避免了对理想文学品质的任何定义，而只是建议使用过去文学的各个方面作为衡量和评估当今文学的手段。Touchstone 的工作方式在 JA Cuddon 的《文学术语和文学理论词典》（第 3 版，Blackwell，1991 年）中得到了简明的解释：

Arnold’s most significant thinking is contained in the essays ‘The Function of Criticism at the Present Time’ and ‘The Study of Poetry’. He stresses the importance for literature of remaining ‘disinterested’, by which he means politically detached and uncommitted to any specific programme of action. The goal of literary criticism is that of attaining pure, disinterested knowledge, that is, to use another of his favourite phrases, of simply appreciating ‘the object as in itself it really is’ without wanting to press the insight gained into the service of a specific line of action. Arnold’s key literary-critical device is the notion of the Touchstone, which avoids any definitions of desirable literary qualities, and merely suggests using aspects of the literature of the past as a means of measuring and assessing the literature of today. The way the Touchstone works is concisely explained in J. A. Cuddon’s Dictionary of Literary Terms and Literary Theory (3rd edition, Blackwell, 1991):

试金石是……所谓的，因为它可以试金。马修·阿诺德 (Matthew Arnold) 在他的论文《诗歌研究》( The Study of Poetry , 1880) 中结合文学标准和标准使用了这个词：
A touchstone is … so-called because gold is tried by it. Matthew Arnold used the word in his essay The Study of Poetry (1880) in connection with literary criteria and standards:

阿诺德建议我们应该“时刻牢记大师的诗句和表达，并将它们作为试金石应用到其他诗歌中”。他建议他的 Touchstone 方法应该为诗歌的“真实”而非“历史”或“个人”评价提供基础。（参见 Cuddon，第 980 页。）

Arnold advises that we should ‘have always in mind lines and expressions of the great masters, and apply them as a Touchstone to other poetry’. He suggests that his Touchstone method should provide the basis for a ‘real’ rather than an ‘historic’ or a ‘personal’ estimate of poetry. (See Cuddon, p. 980.)

二十世纪上半叶，英国的主要批评人物是 FR Leavis、TS Eliot、William Empson 和 IA Richards。除了艾略特之外，所有人都在 1920 年代和 30 年代在剑桥大学，参与了那里开创性的英语学校，该学校对直到 1970 年代的全球英语教学产生了强大的影响。艾略特对公认的批评思想的贡献是最大的，他的主要批评思想是：

In the first half of the twentieth century, the key critical names in Britain were F. R. Leavis, T. S. Eliot, William Empson, and I. A. Richards. All except Eliot were at Cambridge in the 1920s and 1930s, involved in the pioneering English School there which had a powerful influence on the teaching of English worldwide up to the 1970s. Eliot’s contribution to the canon of received critical ideas was the greatest, his major critical ideas being:

“感性分离”的概念，是在他对赫伯特·格里尔森 (Herbert Grierson) 版的《形而上学诗人》( The Metaphysical Poets) 的评论文章中发展起来的，
the notion of the ‘dissociation of sensibility’, developed in the course of his review article on Herbert Grierson’s edition of The Metaphysical Poets,
诗歌“非人格”的概念，在他的两部分论文“传统与个人才能”的过程中得到发展，以及
the notion of poetic ‘impersonality’, developed in the course of his two-part essay ‘Tradition and the Individual Talent’, and
“客观关联”的概念，在他关于哈姆雷特的文章中得到发展。
the notion of the ‘objective correlative’, developed in his essay on Hamlet.

所有这些想法都引起了争议：“感性分离”发生在 17 世纪，将思想与感觉彻底分离的想法是一个从未找到过历史证据的想法。在他职业生涯的后期，艾略特否认他认为分裂是由英国内战引起的，尽管他相当隐晦地补充说，他认为这可能是由与导致内战的因素相同的因素引起——一个很好的区别。这个想法的最佳用途只是作为一种描述我们在形而上学诗人身上发现的心灵和情感的特殊品质的方式：作为一种历史概括，它似乎完全没有支持。对这个想法最好的批评可以在 Frank Kermode 的书Romantic Image 中找到。

All these ideas have become controversial: the idea that a ‘dissociation of sensibility’ occurred in the seventeenth century, radically separating thought from feeling, is one for which historical evidence has never been found. Later in his career Eliot denied that he thought the dissociation had been caused by the English Civil War, though he added rather cryptically that he thought it might have been caused by the same factors as those which brought about the Civil War – a nice distinction. The best use of the idea is simply as a way of describing the special qualities of mind and sensibility which we detect in the Metaphysical poets: as a historical generalisation it seems quite without support. The best critique of the idea can be found in Frank Kermode’s book Romantic Image.

非人格化的想法在一定程度上是艾略特的一种方式，它使当前对诗歌的思考偏离了源自浪漫主义的原创性和自我表达的思想。艾略特自己的个性，以及他在哈佛接受的教育，使得这种对个人的强调非常令人反感。他认为诗歌不是个人情感和个人经验的倾诉，而是通过一种传统感对个人的超越，这种传统感通过个人诗人说话，并由个人诗人传播，这对他来说更为合适。他说，诗人作品中最好的部分不是那些最原始的部分，而是那些通过他最清楚地听到前人的声音的部分。因此，个体的思想、经验的人类、和诗歌中说话的声音。这不是一个原创的想法——正如我们所看到的，雪莱在他的为诗歌辩护——但艾略特是第一个将其作为整个诗歌美学基石的人。

The idea of impersonality was partly Eliot’s way of deflecting current thinking about poetry away from ideas of originality and self-expression which derived from Romanticism. Eliot’s own personality, and the education he had received at Harvard, made this emphasis on the individual highly distasteful. It was much more congenial to him to see poetry not as a pouring out of personal emotion and personal experience, but as a transcending of the individual by a sense of tradition which spoke through, and is transmitted by, the individual poet. The best parts of a poet’s work, he says, are not those which are most original, but those in which the voice of his predecessors can be most clearly heard speaking through him. Hence, there is a large distinction to be drawn between the mind of the individual, experiencing human being, and the voice which speaks in the poetry. This was not an original thought – Shelley, as we saw, had something very like it in his Defence of Poetry – but Eliot was the first to make it the cornerstone of a whole poetic aesthetic.

最后，客观关联实际上是英国经验主义态度的另一种概括：它认为在艺术中表达情感的最佳方式是在手势、动作或具体象征中找到某种载体，而不是直接或描述性地接近它. 毫无疑问，这是事实：让人物（或叙述者）说出他们的感受，在小说或诗歌中收效甚微：它必须以某种方式通过言语或行动表现出来。这可能与模仿和叙事之间的古老区别（最早由柏拉图提出）差不多。前者是某种东西的表现，如果是戏剧的话，用角色自己的话，或者我们在舞台上实际看到的动作，而后者是告诉观众或读者他们自己看不到或在角色的直接讲话中体验不到的事情。因此，艾略特的所有主要批评思想都是有缺陷的和不能令人满意的，也许它们长期流行表明它们是在理论真空中产生的。

The objective correlative, finally, is really another encapsulation of English empiricist attitudes: it holds that the best way of expressing an emotion in art is to find some vehicle for it in gesture, action, or concrete symbolism, rather than approaching it directly or descriptively. This is undoubtedly true: little is gained in fiction or poetry by having characters (or narrators) say what they feel: it has to be shown in some way in words or actions. This is perhaps little more than the ancient distinction (first made by Plato) between mimesis and diegesis. The former is a showing of something, in the character’s own words, or in actions which we actually see on the stage, if it is a play, while the latter is telling the audience or reader about things they don’t see for themselves or experience in the direct speech of the characters. All Eliot’s major critical ideas are thus flawed and unsatisfactory, and perhaps their long-standing currency is indicative of the theoretical vacuum into which they were launched.

在理论运动之前最有影响力的英国批评家是 FR Leavis。利维斯和上个世纪的阿诺德一样，认为文学的研究和欣赏是社会健康发展的先决条件。他也不相信抽象思想，并寻求一种绕过固定标准的文学欣赏系统（如阿诺德的试金石），而是主张对文本的品质持开放态度。最后，像阿诺德一样，他拒绝任何将文学或批评直接政治化的尝试。

The most influential British critic prior to the theory movement was F. R. Leavis. Leavis, like Arnold in the previous century, assumed that the study and appreciation of literature is a pre-condition to the health of society. He too distrusted abstract thought and looked for a system of literary appreciation (like Arnold’s Touchstones) which by-passed fixed criteria, arguing instead for an openness to the qualities of the text. Like Arnold, finally, he rejected any attempt to politicise either literature or criticism directly.

然而，两者在一些值得注意的方面有所不同：例如，阿诺德或多或少地认为过去伟大作家的万神殿是理所当然的：例如，他不质疑但丁的卓越，这就是但丁可以成为试金石的原因. 相比之下，利维斯有时会写文章攻击主要知名人物的声誉，事实上，他的方法的本质是论证某些声誉经不起他经常推荐的那种仔细的文本审查。阿诺德在他的批判思想中，似乎本质上是在许可和鼓励业余爱好者。你可能没有读完所有内容，他暗示（你怎么可能，因为你没有专业评论家的无限时间？），但如果你读过最好的，并且可以识别它的品质，那么你就可以自信地阅读新作品并达到对它的真实判断。这种“新教”美学鼓励个人读者与文学巨匠之间建立直接关系。

The two differ, however, in a few notable regards: Arnold, for example, takes the pantheon of past great writers more or less for granted: he does not question the excellence of Dante, for instance, which is why Dante can become a Touchstone. By contrast, Leavis sometimes wrote essays attacking the reputations of major established figures, and, indeed, it was the essence of his method to argue that some reputations would not stand up to the kind of close textual scrutiny he constantly recommended. Arnold, in his critical ideas, seems essentially to license and encourage the amateur. You may not have read everything, he implies (how could you, since you don’t have the unlimited time of the professional critic?), but if you have read the best, and can identify its qualities, then you can be confident in looking at new writing and reaching a true judgement on it. This ‘protestant’ aesthetic encourages a direct relationship between the individual reader and the literary greats.

FR Leavis 最初是艾略特的批评作品和诗歌的崇拜者，但后来大大改变了他的观点。他避免创造批判词汇，而是使用已经建立了外行意义的单词和短语作为批判术语：例如，“生活”几乎被利维斯用作批判术语，“感受经验”的概念也是如此. 对利维斯来说，最关键的考验是工作是否有利于“生活”和活力。利维斯的极受欢迎部分是因为他本质上是约翰逊和阿诺德的结合化身，再次提供了前者的道德主义和后者的社会视野和反理论的批判实践。利维斯的影响力如此之大，以至于在这里无需多说。

F. R. Leavis began as an admirer of Eliot’s critical work as well as of his poetry, but later greatly modified his views. He avoided the coining of critical vocabulary, and instead used as critical terms words and phrases which already had established lay senses: ‘life’, for instance, is used by Leavis almost as a critical term, as is the notion of ‘felt experience’. For Leavis the crucial test is whether the work is conducive to ‘life’ and vitality. Leavis’s extreme popularity was partly due to the fact that he was essentially a kind of combined avatar of Johnson and Arnold, offering again the former’s moralism and the latter’s social vision and anti-theoretical critical practice. Leavis is still so pervasive an influence that little more need be said about him here.

威廉·恩普森 (William Empson) 和 IA 理查兹 (IA Richards) 或许可以被视为一对，尽管后者在 20 年代后期是前者的导师。恩普森的书七种类型的歧义（1930 年）本身就有点其效果模棱两可。一方面，它对文本的超近距离阅读表现出那种以文本为主导的极端，这可以看作是上述英国批评“第一轨道”传统的逻辑发展。书名中的“歧义”一词可以翻译为“口头上的困难”，恩普森通过一丝不苟的文本手术来阐明他的例子，而不是引用更广泛的背景。然而，另一方面，Empson 对语言的基本态度是，它确实是一种非常不稳定的媒介：当我们处理语言时，我们需要意识到整个事物很可能会爆发出我们从未怀疑过的意义根本。当我们从歧义类型 1 到类型 7 时，我们似乎正在接近语言的边界，领土最终变得无法映射，而且我们似乎最终会研究语言不确定性的空白。这可以看作是英国传统中对语言作为媒介的不可靠性的后结构主义观点的预期（见p. 62 ). 但是将语言置于任何上下文中自然会减少或消除歧义。（例如，“pain”这个词，当你单独听到它时，它是有歧义的，因为它听起来和“pane”一样，但是在任何实际使用情况的上下文中遇到它，歧义就会消失。）因此后来的恩普森通过特别强调在他看来文学作品所基于的自传语境，从语言的空白中退出。

William Empson and I. A. Richards can perhaps be taken as a pair, though the latter was the tutor of the former in the late 1920s. Empson’s book Seven Types of Ambiguity (1930) was itself somewhat ambiguous in its effects. On the one hand, its ultra-close readings of texts demonstrated the kind of text-led extreme which might be seen as the logical development of the ‘track one’ tradition of British criticism described above. The word ‘ambiguity’ in the book’s title can be translated as ‘verbal difficulty’, and Empson unravels his examples by meticulous textual surgery, rather than references out to a wider context. On the other hand, though, Empson’s basic attitude towards language is that it is really a very slippery medium indeed: when we handle language we need to be aware that the whole thing is likely to explode into meanings we hadn’t suspected of being there at all. As we go from ambiguity type one to type seven we seem to be approaching the frontiers of language, where the territory eventually becomes un-mappable, and we seem to end up looking into a void of linguistic indeterminacy. This can be seen as an anticipation from within the British tradition of post-structuralist views about the unreliability of language as a medium (see p. 62). But the placing of language within any context naturally tends to reduce or eliminate ambiguity. (For instance, the word ‘pain’, when you hear it spoken in isolation, is ambiguous, since it sounds the same as ‘pane’, but encounter it in the context of any actual situation of usage and the ambiguity disappears.) Hence the later Empson drew back from the linguistic void by stressing, in particular, the autobiographical context in which literary works, in his view, are grounded.

最后，IA 理查兹 (IA Richards) 是去语境化文学方法的先驱，这种方法从 1930 年代到 1970 年代在英国成为常态，成为“实用批评”，在与“新批评”大致相同的时期在美国成为常态。理查兹 (Richards) 在 1920 年代为学生和导师提供未经注释的匿名诗歌进行评论和分析的实验产生了消除公认观点和知识的支柱并培养基于第一手观点的“真实判断”的理想。很容易看出这与阿诺德的“试金石”之间的联系。可以肯定的是，这一决定性的“李嘉图式”时刻如此彻底地确立了批评的“第一轨道”“实用”传统如此之久，以至于选择性失忆症降临到该学科上，并被广泛认为是唯一的曾经存在的传统。

I. A. Richards, finally, is the pioneer of the decontextualised approach to literature which became the norm in Britain from the 1930s to the 1970s as ‘practical criticism’ and in America during roughly the same period as the ‘New Criticism’. Richards’s experiments in the 1920s of presenting students and tutors with unannotated, anonymous poems for commentary and analysis gave rise to the ideal of removing the props of received opinion and knowledge and fostering a ‘true judgement’ based on first hand opinion. It is easy to see the connection betwen this and Arnold’s ‘Touchstones’. What is certain is that this decisive ‘Ricardian’ moment established the ‘track one’ ‘practical’ tradition of criticism so completely for so long that a selective amnesia descended on the discipline and it came to be widely regarded as the only tradition that had ever existed.

自由人文主义与“理论”之间的后续冲突是一个非常基本的冲突，但值得提醒我们自己的是它实际上比 1970 年代在英国、美国和其他地方以如此强大的力量爆发时要古老得多。类似的辩论和争论发生在 1930 年代，例如在我们可能被视为典型的英国自由主义人道主义者的 FR Leavis 和批判理论家 René Wellek 之间。利维斯和韦勒克在利维斯的期刊《审视》(Scrutiny) 上争论文学批评与哲学之间的关系。韦勒克反对利维斯的观点很简单，实际批评是不够的——他应该阐明他的阅读和他的程序所基于的理论假设。在韦勒克看来，一系列对利维斯《重估》中浪漫主义诗人的“细读”在理论上的真空中提供给读者。正如他礼貌地说的那样，“我希望你能更明确地陈述你的假设并系统地为它们辩护”（Scrutiny，1937 年 3 月，p. 376). 拒绝将自由人文主义方法简单地视为“做”文学的“自然”和理所当然的方式，是理论对它的一般回应的症结所在。尽管不像韦勒克那么客气，但理论家提出了与他相同的要求——在阅读和批评文学作品时，说明你做了什么，为什么这样做，这样你的方法就可以与其他人一起评估。这种需求隐含的观点是，如果这些事情变得明确（正如我们在上一节中试图做的那样），那么自由人文主义假设和程序的弱点就会变得明显，其他方法将有机会取代它们。

The subsequent conflict between liberal humanism and ‘theory’ is a pretty fundamental one, but it is worth reminding ourselves that it is actually much older than the 1970s when it broke out with such force in Britain, America, and elsewhere. Similar debates and arguments took place in the 1930s, for instance between F. R. Leavis, whom we might regard as the archetypal British liberal humanist, and the critical theorist René Wellek. Leavis and Wellek debated the relationship between literary criticism and philosophy in the pages of Leavis’s journal Scrutiny. Wellek’s point against Leavis was simply that practical criticism was not enough – he ought to spell out the theoretical assumptions on which his readings, and his procedures generally, were based. In Wellek’s view a series of ‘close readings’ of Romantic poets in Leavis’s book Revaluations is offered to the reader in a theoretical vacuum. As he politely put it, ‘I could wish that you had stated your assumptions more explicitly and defended them systematically’ (Scrutiny, March 1937, p. 376). This refusal to accept the liberal humanist method as simply the ‘natural’ and taken-for-granted way of ‘doing’ literature is the crux of theory’s general response to it. Though less politely than Wellek, theorists make the same demand as he did – spell out what you do, and why, when you read and criticise literature, so that your methods can be evaluated along with others. Implicit in this demand is the view that if these things are made explicit (as we tried to do in the previous section) then the weaknesses of liberal humanist assumptions and procedures will become apparent, and other approaches will have a chance of replacing them.

本节中讨论的所有人物的作品都可以在English Critical Texts编集中找到。DJ Enright 和 Ernst de Chickera（牛津大学出版社，1962 年）。

The work of all the figures discussed in this section can be found in the collection English Critical Texts, ed. D. J. Enright and Ernst de Chickera (Oxford University Press, 1962).

实践中的自由人文主义

Liberal humanism in practice

或许没有必要提供一个全面的自由人文主义实践的例子，因为阅读本书的任何人肯定都熟悉这种实践。然而，主要出于比较的目的，我将勾勒出我认为是对埃德加爱伦坡的故事“椭圆形肖像”（见附录 1）的典型自由人文主义解读，因为该故事稍后将用于说明实践中的结构主义, 和叙事学。

It is perhaps unnecessary to supply a full-scale example of liberal humanist practice, since that practice will surely be familiar to anyone reading this book. However, I will sketch out, mainly for comparative purposes, what I would consider to be a characteristic liberal humanist reading of Edgar Allan Poe’s tale ‘The Oval Portrait’ (see Appendix 1) since the tale will be used later to illustrate structuralism in practice, and narratology.

对这个故事采取自由人文主义的方法（或者更具体地说，利维派方法）可能会关注故事中“艺术”与“生活”之间明显的价值观冲突。评论和解释的中心点可能是道德主义论点，即真正的价值在于独特个体的“生活”，而艺术家未能认识到艺术对公共现实的必要服从性是灾难性的。此外，当艺术家们开始将自己视为浮士德式的超级英雄，能够跨越品味、禁忌和行为的所有界限，甚至承担起创造和牺牲生命本身的上帝般的角色时，就犯下了一种狂妄自大的行为，最终枯竭艺术本身的生命源泉。因此，这个故事中的艺术家在他孤立的炮塔中，像吸血鬼一样吸食他的保姆的生命能量，

A liberal humanist approach to this tale (or, to be more specific, a Leavisite approach) might focus on the evident conflict of values in the story between ‘art’ and ‘life’. The central point of commentary and interpretation might be the moralist argument that true value lies in the ‘lived life’ of the unique individual, and that it is disastrous for the artist to fail to recognise a necessary subservience of art to a communal reality. Further, when artists begin to see themselves as Faustian super-heroes, able to cross all boundaries of taste, taboo, and conduct, and even to assume the god-like role of creating and sacrificing life itself, then a hubristic act is committed which ultimately dries up the sources of the life of art itself. Hence, the artist in this tale in his isolated turret, feeding vampire-like on the vital energies of his sitter, is an emblem of a debased and degenerate form of art whose values are of the purely aesthetic ‘art for art’s sake’ kind and have no reference to any wider notion of personal and psychic health.

这种方法有两点很突出：首先，这种阅读（最终）是由其道德信念（当然，它们本身值得称赞）驱动的，而不是由任何构成文学批评系统方法的模型驱动的。上面的草图中对“生命”的大力支持使得“Leavisite”一词似乎很适合应用于它。它的第二个值得注意的方面是它似乎绕过了形式、结构、体裁等问题，直接开始讨论内容问题。如果草图被填写，无疑会有对结构、符号和设计等特征的评论，但它们可能在本质上是次要的，旨在作为对主要内容的具体支持阅读的重点，也就是所采取的道德立场。当然，我并不是认为这种方法一文不值：我的目的只是描述它的特征并将其与其他方法区分开来。

Two things stand out in this approach: firstly, this kind of reading is driven (ultimately) by its moral convictions (laudable in themselves, of course) rather than by any model of what constitutes a systematic approach to literary criticism. The robust championing of ‘life’ in the above sketch makes the term ‘Leavisite’ seem an appropriate one to apply to it. The second notable aspect of it is that it seems to by-pass matters of form, structure, genre, and so on, and launches straight into the discussion of matters of content. If the sketch were filled out, there would doubtless be comments on such characteristics as structure, symbol, and design, but they would probably be secondary in nature, intended as concrete support for the primary focus of the reading, which is the moral position taken. I am not, of course, dismissing such an approach as worthless: my intention is simply to characterise it and distinguish it from other approaches.

向“理论”的过渡

The transition to ‘theory’

战后时期批判理论的发展似乎包括一系列“浪潮”，每个浪潮都与特定的十年相关，并且都针对刚刚说明的自由人文主义共识，成立于 1930 年代至 1950 年代之间。在 1960 年代，首先出现了两种较老但仍未被吸收的相互竞争的新方法，它们是1930 年代开创并在 1960 年代重生的马克思主义批评，以及同一时期的精神分析批评。同样在 1960 年代自我更新。与此同时，两种新的方法正在对自由人文主义正统观念发起强有力的直接攻击，即1960 年代初期出现的语言批评，以及在 20 世纪末开始成为重要因素的早期形式的女权主义批评.

The growth of critical theory in the post-war period seems to comprise a series of ‘waves’, each associated with a specific decade, and all aimed against the liberal humanist consensus just illustrated, which had been established between the 1930s and the 1950s. In the 1960s, firstly, there were two older, but still unassimilated, rival new approaches, these being Marxist criticism, which had been pioneered in the 1930s and then reborn in the 1960s, and psychoanalytic criticism, which was of the same vintage and was similarly renewing itself in the 1960s. At the same time two new approaches were mounting vigorous direct assaults on liberal humanist orthodoxies, namely linguistic criticism, which came into being in the early 1960s, and early forms of feminist criticism, which started to become a significant factor at the end of the decade.

然后，在 1970 年代，有争议的新批评方法，特别是结构主义和后结构主义，在英国和美国的文学评论界传播开来，两者都起源于法国。这两者的影响是如此强大，以至于在 20 世纪 70 年代末和 80 年代初产生了一种情况，这种情况经常被称为英语学科的“危机”或“内战”。这两种方法的问题集中在语言和哲学的相关问题上，而不是历史或背景。在 20 世纪 80 年代发生了一种转变，有时被称为“转向历史”，历史、政治和背景重新成为文学批评议程的中心。因此，在 20 世纪 80 年代初期，出现了两种新的政治/历史批评形式，即来自美国的新历史主义和文化唯物主义来自英国。两者都采用了所谓的“整体”文学方法，旨在整合文学和历史研究，同时保持过去十年结构主义者和后结构主义者的一些见解。

Then, in the 1970s news spread in literary-critical circles in Britain and the United States of controversial new critical approaches, in particular structuralism and post-structuralism, both of which originated in France. The effect of these two was so powerful as to produce, by the late 1970s and early 1980s, a situation which was frequently referred to as a ‘crisis’ or ‘civil war’ in the discipline of English. The questions these two approaches centred upon concerned matters of language and philosophy, rather than history or context. In the 1980s a shift occurred which is sometimes called the ‘turn to history’, whereby history, politics, and context were reinstated at the centre of the literary-critical agenda. Thus, in the early 1980s two new forms of political/historical criticism emerged, new historicism from the United States and cultural materialism from Britain. Both these take what might be called a ‘holistic’ approach to literature, aiming to integrate literary and historical study while at the same time maintaining some of the insights of the structuralists and post-structuralists of the previous decade.

最后，在 1990 年代，似乎正在发生从总体宏大解释的普遍逃避，似乎决定性地转向分散、折衷主义和“特殊利益”形式的批评和理论。因此，被称为后殖民主义的方法拒绝对事物进行普遍适用的马克思主义解释的想法，并强调后帝国国家和人民的分离性或差异性。同样，后现代主义强调许多当代经验独特的碎片化性质。女权主义也显示出融入一个被称为性别研究的松散联盟的迹象，同性恋文本作为不同的文学领域出现，因此暗示并产生适当的和独特的批评方法：这个 1990 年代联合会的一部分是黑人女权主义（或“女性主义”）批评。像现在这样一本书的必要限制使得不可能包含所有内容，并且暂时它不会冒险超出第 15 章概述的早期后千禧年发展。

Finally, in the 1990s a general flight from overarching grand explanations seemed to be taking place, and there was what seemed a decisive drift towards dispersal, eclecticism, and ‘special-interest’ forms of criticism and theory. Thus, the approach known as post-colonialism rejects the idea of a universally applicable Marxist explanation of things and emphasises the separateness or otherness of post-imperial nations and peoples. Likewise, postmodernism stresses the uniquely fragmented nature of much contemporary experience. Feminism, too, shows signs of dissolving into a loose federation known as gender studies, with gay and lesbian texts emerging as distinct fields of literature, and hence implying and generating appropriate and distinct critical approaches: also part of this 1990s federation is black feminist (or ‘womanist’) criticism. The necessary limits on a book like the present one make it impossible to include everything, and for the time being it does not venture beyond the early post-millennial developments outlined in chapter 15.

批判理论中的一些反复出现的观点

Some recurrent ideas in critical theory

这些不同的方法各有其不同的传统和历史，但有几种观点在批判理论中反复出现，似乎形成了可被视为其共同基石的东西。因此，将“理论”当作具有一组基本信念的单一实体来谈论“理论”是有道理的，只要我们意识到这样做是一种简化。下面列出了这些反复出现的基本理论思想中的一些。

These different approaches each have their separate traditions and histories, but several ideas are recurrent in critical theory and seem to form what might be regarded as its common bedrock. Hence, it makes some sense to speak of ‘theory’ as if it were a single entity with a set of underlying beliefs, as long as we are aware that doing so is a simplification. Some of these recurrent underlying ideas of theory are listed below.

1. 许多我们通常认为是我们存在的基本“给定”的观念（包括我们的性别认同、我们的个体自我以及文学本身的观念）实际上是流动的、不稳定的东西，而不是固定可靠的本质. 它们不是在事实和经验的现实世界中稳固地“在那里”，而是“社会建构的”，也就是说，依赖于社会和政治力量以及不断变化的观察和思考方式。用哲学术语来说，所有这些都是偶然的类别（表示一种暂时的、暂时的、“依赖于环境”的状态）而不是绝对的那些（即固定的、不可变的等）。因此，永远无法建立包罗万象的固定“真理”。所有形式的智力调查的结果都只是临时的。没有固定可靠的真理这样的东西（大概是这样的说法除外）。在这些问题上，理论所攻击的立场通常被简称为本质主义，而本书中讨论的许多理论都将自己描述为反本质主义。

1. Many of the notions which we would usually regard as the basic ‘givens’ of our existence (including our gender identity, our individual selfhood, and the notion of literature itself) are actually fluid and unstable things, rather than fixed and reliable essences. Instead of being solidly ‘there’ in the real world of fact and experience, they are ‘socially constructed’, that is, dependent on social and political forces and on shifting ways of seeing and thinking. In philosophical terms, all these are contingent categories (denoting a status which is temporary, provisional, ‘circumstance-dependent’) rather than absolute ones (that is, fixed, immutable, etc.). Hence, no overarching fixed ‘truths’ can ever be established. The results of all forms of intellectual enquiry are provisional only. There is no such thing as a fixed and reliable truth (except for the statement that this is so, presumably). The position on these matters which theory attacks is often referred to, in a kind of shorthand, as essentialism, while many of the theories discussed in this book would describe themselves as anti-essentialist.

2. 理论家们普遍认为，所有的思考和调查都必然受到先前意识形态承诺的影响和很大程度上决定。因此，无私探究的概念是站不住脚的：他们会争辩说，我们没有人能够站得住脚从天平上回来，冷静地权衡：相反，所有调查人员的拇指都放在天平的一侧或另一侧。每个实际程序（例如，在文学批评中）都预设了某种理论视角。否认这一点只是试图将我们自己的理论立场视为“常识”或“简单给出”的东西而不受审查。当然，这种论点是有问题的，而且通常只是作为对反对者提出的具体论点的反驳而明确提出来的。这种观点的问题在于，它往往会连同其他所有项目一起抹黑自己的项目，引入一种相对主义，这种相对主义会禁止争论并切断任何承诺的基础。

2. Theorists generally believe that all thinking and investigation is necessarily affected and largely determined by prior ideological commitment. The notion of disinterested enquiry is therefore untenable: none of us, they would argue, is capable of standing back from the scales and weighing things up dispassionately: rather, all investigators have a thumb on one side or other of the scales. Every practical procedure (for instance, in literary criticism) presupposes a theoretical perspective of some kind. To deny this is simply to try to place our own theoretical position beyond scrutiny as something which is ‘commonsense’ or ‘simply given’. This contention is problematical, of course, and is usually only made explicit as a counter to specific arguments put forward by opponents. The problem with this view is that it tends to discredit one’s own project along with all the rest, introducing a relativism which disables argument and cuts the ground from under any kind of commitment.

3. 语言本身制约、限制和预定我们所见。因此，所有现实都是通过语言构建的，因此没有任何东西以毫无疑问的方式简单地“存在”——一切都是语言/文本构建。语言不记录现实，它塑造和创造现实，因此我们的整个宇宙都是文本的。此外，对于理论家来说，意义是由读者和作者共同建构的。它不仅仅是“在那里”等待我们到达文本之前，而是需要读者的贡献才能使它成为现实。

3. Language itself conditions, limits, and predetermines what we see. Thus, all reality is constructed through language, so that nothing is simply ‘there’ in an unproblematical way – everything is a linguistic/textual construct. Language doesn’t record reality, it shapes and creates it, so that the whole of our universe is textual. Further, for the theorist, meaning is jointly constructed by reader and writer. It isn’t just ‘there’ and waiting before we get to the text but requires the reader’s contribution to bring it into being.

4. 因此，任何提供权威解读的主张都是徒劳的。文学作品中的意义从来都不是固定可靠的，而是多变的、多面的、模棱两可的。在文学中，就像在所有写作中一样，永远不可能建立固定和明确的意义：相反，语言的特征是产生无限的意义网，因此所有文本都必然自相矛盾，因为解构过程将揭示。在这些问题上没有终审法院，因为文学文本一旦存在，就被理论家视为独立的语言结构，其作者总是“死去”或“缺席”。

4. Hence, any claim to offer a definitive reading would be futile. The meanings within a literary work are never fixed and reliable, but always shifting, multi-faceted and ambiguous. In literature, as in all writing, there is never the possibility of establishing fixed and definite meanings: rather, it is characteristic of language to generate infinite webs of meaning, so that all texts are necessarily self-contradictory, as the process of deconstruction will reveal. There is no final court of appeal in these matters, since literary texts, once they exist, are viewed by the theorist as independent linguistic structures whose authors are always ‘dead’ or ‘absent’.

5. 理论家不相信所有“总体化”的概念。例如，“伟大的”书籍作为一个绝对的和自我维持的类别的概念是不可信的，因为书籍总是产生于特定的社会政治情况，这种情况不应该被压制，因为当它们被推广时往往会发生这种情况到'伟大'。同样，“人性”的概念，作为一个广义的超越特定种族、性别或阶级观念的规范也不可信，因为它在实践中通常以欧洲为中心（即基于欧洲白人规范）和男性中心（即基于男性规范和态度） ). 因此，诉诸普遍化的、假定具有包容性的人性观念，在实践中很可能会边缘化、诋毁、甚至否认女性或弱势群体的人性。

5. Theorists distrust all ‘totalising’ notions. For instance, the notion of ‘great’ books as an absolute and self-sustaining category is to be distrusted, as books always arise out of a particular sociopolitical situation, and this situation should not be suppressed, as tends to happen when they are promoted to ‘greatness’. Likewise, the concept of a ‘human nature’, as a generalised norm which transcends the idea of a particular race, gender, or class, is to be distrusted too, since it is usually in practice Eurocentric (that is, based on white European norms) and androcentric (that is, based on masculine norms and attitudes). Thus, the appeal to the idea of a generalised, supposedly inclusive, human nature is likely in practice to marginalise, or denigrate, or even deny the humanity of women, or disadvantaged groups.

总结这五点：理论上：

To sum up these five points: for theory:

政治无处不在，
Politics is pervasive,

语言是构成性的，

Language is constitutive,

真理是暂时的，

Truth is provisional,

意义是偶然的，

Meaning is contingent,

人性是一个神话。

Human nature is a myth.

如果在本书后面的部分，或者在你学习理论的后期，你开始发现你对事物的理解正在下滑，那么回到这个列表来提醒自己理论所体现的基本思维框架是值得的。您遇到困难的概念很可能会变成这些立场之一的版本。

If, at later points in this book, or later in your study of theory, you begin to find that your grasp of things is slipping it would be worthwhile coming back to this list to remind yourself of the basic frame of mind which theory embodies. It is very likely that a concept with which you are having difficulty will turn out to be a version of one of these positions.

选读

Selected reading

代表自由人文主义立场的书籍

Books representing the liberal humanist position

Alter, Robert,意识形态时代的阅读乐趣（Simon 和 Schuster，1989 年；rpt。WW Norton，1997 年，带有新序言）。

争论性的反理论介绍，“阅读的消失”，以及最后一章，“多重阅读和不确定性的沼泽”；中间的章节是关于传统的文学批评概念，如“性格”、“风格”和“视角”。

Alter, Robert, The Pleasures of Reading in an Ideogical Age (Simon and Schuster, 1989; rpt. W. W. Norton, 1997, with a new preface).

Polemical anti-theoretical introduction, ‘The disappearance of reading’, and final chapter, ‘Multiple readings and the bog of indeterminacy’; the chapters in between are on traditional literary critical concepts such as ‘Character’, ‘Style’ and ‘Perspective’.

Gardner, Helen，为想象力辩护（牛津大学出版社，1984 年）。

基于响应 Frank Kermode（当时的理论拥护者）的一本书的讲座课程。积极捍卫传统的人文主义学术和批评，反对她认为是理论的有害影响。

Gardner, Helen, In Defence of the Imagination (Oxford University Press, 1984).

Based on a course of lectures responding to a book by Frank Kermode (then a champion of theory). A vigorous defence of traditional humanist scholarship and criticism against what she saw as the malign influence of theory.

Gribble, James，文学教育：重新评估（剑桥大学出版社，1983 年）。

1980 年代早期的几本书之一，它捍卫了传统文学学术以反对理论。见第一章，“文学与真理”：第四章，“批评对理论的服从”：第五章，“文学与情感教育”。

Gribble, James, Literary Education: A Re-evaluation (Cambridge University Press, 1983).

One of several books from the early 1980s which mounted a defence of traditional literary scholarship against theory. See chapter one, ‘Literature and truth’: chapter four, ‘The subjection of criticism to theory’: chapter five, ‘Literature and the education of the emotions’.

Steiner, George,真实存在：我们所说的有什么意义吗？(Faber, 1989; rpt. University of Chicago Press, 1991)。

施泰纳是一位通晓多种语言、博学的人文主义者，他的作品从来都不是反理论的。在这本书的三篇长文中，他努力解决将理论说明与对文学和其他艺术做出反应的实际经验联系起来的问题。

Steiner, George, Real Presences: Is There Anything in What We Say? (Faber, 1989; rpt. University of Chicago Press, 1991).

Steiner is a polyglot, polymath humanist whose work has never been anti-theoretical. In the three long essays in this book he grapples with the problem of relating theoretical accounts to the actual experience of responding to literature and the other arts.

Watson, George，文学的确定性：论战论文（Harvester，1989）。

沃森对当代理论的反对是绝对和无条件的，正如本书的标题所暗示的那样。

Watson, George, The Certainty of Literature: Essays in Polemic (Harvester, 1989).

Watson’s opposition to contemporary theory is absolute and unqualified, as the title of this book implies.

关于英语作为一门学科的兴起的书籍

Books about the rise of English as an academic subject

Baldick, Chris, The Social Mission of English Studies 1848–1932（牛津大学出版社，1983 年）。

马修·阿诺德 (Matthew Arnold) 对英国文学批评史进行了清晰的论证。详细，并带有清晰的介绍。

Baldick, Chris, The Social Mission of English Studies 1848–1932 (Oxford University Press, 1983).

A clearly argued history of literary criticism in England from Matthew Arnold. Detailed, and with a clear introduction.

Doyle, Brian，“英语研究的隐藏历史”，重读英语，编辑。Peter Widdowson（梅休恩，1982 年），第 17-31 页。

问“英语为什么以及如何成为高等教育的主要科目？” 一个有影响力的帐户，虽然重点与我在这里提供的略有不同。

Doyle, Brian, ‘The hidden history of English Studies’ in Re-Reading English, ed. Peter Widdowson (Methuen, 1982), pp. 17–31.

Asks ‘why and how did English become a major subject in higher education?’ An influential account, though the emphasis is slightly different from the one I have offered here.

伊格尔顿，特里，“英语的兴起”，他的文学理论第一章：介绍（布莱克威尔，1983 年；第二版，明尼苏达大学出版社，1996 年）。

关于“英语”发展的论战性且可读性很强的描述，与道尔的观点大体一致。

Eagleton, Terry, ‘The rise of English’, chapter one in his Literary Theory: An Introduction (Blackwell, 1983; 2nd edn. University of Minnesota Press, 1996).

A polemical and very readable account of the growth of ‘English’, broadly in line with Doyle’s.

Graff, Gerald，专业文学：制度史（芝加哥大学出版社，1987 年）。

详细介绍了美国英语研究的发展情况。

Graff, Gerald, Professing Literature: An Institutional History (University of Chicago Press, 1987).

A detailed account of the growth of English studies in the United States.

Kearney, Anthony, The Louse on the Locks of Literature：John Churton Collins（苏格兰学术出版社，1986 年）。

柯林斯是 19 世纪英语研究的先驱。这本令人愉快的书包括了媒体和议会就拟议的“英语”这一新学科进行辩论的记述（我在本章的相关部分对此进行了描述）。

Kearney, Anthony, The Louse on the Locks of Literature: John Churton Collins (Scottish Academic Press, 1986).

Collins was a nineteenth-century pioneer of English studies. This enjoyable book includes an account (on which I have drawn in the relevant part of this chapter) of debates in the press and Parliament on the proposed new academic subject of ‘English’.

Mulhern, Francis, The Moment of Scrutiny（新左派书籍，1979 年）。Scrutiny是 FR Leavis 于 1932 年创立的期刊，因此这本广受推崇的书延续了 Baldick（上图）离开的“英语”故事。

Mulhern, Francis, The Moment of Scrutiny (New Left Books, 1979). Scrutiny was the journal founded by F. R. Leavis in 1932, so this widely respected book continues the story of ‘English’ from where Baldick (above) leaves off.

Palmer, DJ，英语研究的兴起（牛津大学出版社，1965 年）。

一个可读的帐户。

Palmer, D. J., The Rise of English Studies (Oxford University Press, 1965).

A readable account.

Potter, Stephen, The Muse in Chains: A Study in Education (Cape, 1937, rpt. Folcroft, 1973).

早期英语的早期记述。十九世纪的试卷样本（包含在附录中）非常有启发性。

Potter, Stephen, The Muse in Chains: A Study in Education (Cape, 1937, rpt. Folcroft, 1973).

An early account of early English. The specimen examination papers from the nineteenth century (included in the appendices) are very revealing.

Tillyard, EMW, The Muse Unchained: An Intimate Account of the Revolution in English Studies at Cambridge（伦敦，Bowes & Bowes，1958 年）。

继续波特（上图）离开的英语故事，描述 1920 年代和 30 年代的剑桥以及理查兹、恩普森和利维斯的早期职业生涯。Palmer、Potter 和 Tillyard 共同提供了所谓的自由人文主义对其发展的解释，这与 Baldick、Doyle、Eagleton 和 Mulhern 提供的解释截然不同。

Tillyard, E. M. W., The Muse Unchained: An Intimate Account of the Revolution in English Studies at Cambridge (London, Bowes & Bowes, 1958).

Continues the story of English from where Potter (above) leaves off, describing Cambridge in the 1920s and 1930s and the early careers of Richards, Empson, and Leavis. Palmer, Potter, and Tillyard together provide what might be called liberal humanism’s own account of its development, distinctly different from that offered by Baldick, Doyle, Eagleton, and Mulhern.

2

结构主义

2

Structuralism

结构主义鸡和自由人文主义蛋

Structuralist chickens and liberal humanist eggs

结构主义是 1950 年代在法国开始的一场知识运动，最早出现在人类学家克劳德·列维-施特劳斯 (1908-) 和文学评论家罗兰·巴特 (1915-1980) 的作品中。很难将结构主义归结为一个单一的“底线”命题，但如果被迫这样做，我会说它的本质是相信事物不能孤立地被理解——它们必须在它们属于更大的结构（因此称为“结构主义”）。结构主义主要在 20 世纪 70 年代传入英国，并在整个 80 年代获得了广泛的影响，甚至声名狼藉。

Structuralism is an intellectual movement which began in France in the 1950s and is first seen in the work of the anthropologist Claude Lévi-Strauss (1908–) and the literary critic Roland Barthes (1915–1980). It is difficult to boil structuralism down to a single ‘bottom-line’ proposition, but if forced to do so I would say that its essence is the belief that things cannot be understood in isolation – they have to be seen in the context of the larger structures they are part of (hence the term ‘structuralism’). Structuralism was imported into Britain mainly in the 1970s and attained widespread influence, and even notoriety, throughout the 1980s.

这里讨论的结构是我们感知世界和组织经验的方式强加的结构，而不是已经存在于外部世界的客观实体。由此可见，意义或意义并不是事物内部的一种核心或本质：相反，意义总是在外部。意义永远是事物的一个属性，字面意义上意义被赋予以人心为物，不蕴于其中。但是，让我们尝试具体说明在考虑文学时主要根据结构来思考可能意味着什么。想象一下，我们面对一首诗，比如多恩的《早安》。作为结构主义者，我们的直接反应可能是坚持认为，只有当我们首先对它所模仿和颠覆的类型有一个清晰的概念时，它才能被理解。任何一首具体的诗歌都是某一体裁的具体例证，体裁同具体例证的相互关系恰如英语中的某个词、某句话同英语的关系，后者形成一个完整的结构，有着种种规则和约定。就多恩的诗而言，相关的体裁是阿尔巴或“黎明之歌”，这是一种可追溯到十二世纪的诗歌形式，其中恋人哀叹黎明的来临，因为这意味着他们必须分开。

The structures in question here are those imposed by our way of perceiving the world and organising experience, rather than objective entities already existing in the external world. It follows from this that meaning or significance isn’t a kind of core or essence inside things: rather, meaning is always outside. Meaning is always an attribute of things, in the literal sense that meanings are attributed to the things by the human mind, not contained within them. But let’s try to be specific about what it might mean to think primarily in terms of structures when considering literature. Imagine that we are confronted with a poem, Donne’s ‘Good Morrow’, let’s say. Our immediate reaction as structuralists would probably be to insist that it can only be understood if we first have a clear notion of the genre which it parodies and subverts. Any single poem is an example of a particular genre, and the genre and the example relate to each other rather as a phrase spoken in English relates to the English language as a structure with all its rules, its conventions, and so on. In the case of Donne’s poem the relevant genre is the alba or ‘dawn song’, a poetic form dating from the twelfth century in which lovers lament the approach of daybreak because it means that they must part.

但是反过来，如果没有宫廷爱情概念的一些概念，就很难理解阿尔巴，而且，作为一首诗，阿尔巴预设了对被称为诗歌的传统表达形式所包含的内容的知识。这些只是多恩的诗歌所属的一些文化结构。“结构主义” 方法实际上带着我们越来越远离诗歌本身，进入那些宏大的、相对抽象的领域，诸如体裁、 历史、 哲学，而不是像盎格鲁-美利坚学术传统所要求的那样，步步逼近文本。现在，如果我们使用鸡和鸡蛋的粗略类比，我们可以考虑包含结构（alba，宫廷爱情，诗歌本身作为一种文化实践）作为鸡，个人例子（在这种情况下是多恩的诗）作为鸡蛋。对于结构主义者来说，确定鸡的确切性质是最重要的活动，而对于自由人文主义者来说，对鸡蛋的仔细分析是最重要的。

But the alba, in turn, can hardly be understood without some notion of the concept of courtly love, and, further, the alba, being a poem, presupposes a knowledge of what is entailed in the conventionalised form of utterance known as poetry. These are just some of the cultural structures which Donne’s poem is part of. You will see that your structuralist ‘approach’ to it is actually taking you further and further away from the text, and into large and comparatively abstract questions of genre, history, and philosophy, rather than closer and closer to it, as the Anglo-American tradition demands. Now if we use the crude analogy of chickens and eggs, we can regard the containing structures (the alba, courtly love, poetry itself as a cultural practice) as the chicken, and the individual example (Donne’s poem in this case) as the egg. For structuralists, determining the precise nature of the chicken is the most important activity, while for the liberal humanists the close analysis of the egg is paramount.

因此，在文学的结构主义方法中，存在着一种远离对单个文学作品的解释的持续运动，以及一种平行的驱动力，以理解包含它们的更大的、抽象的结构。正如我在本节开头所建议的那样，这些结构通常是抽象的，例如文学或诗歌的概念，或者叙事本身的性质，而不是像阿尔巴的历史那样“纯粹”具体的细节或宫廷爱情，毕竟，我们可以很容易地从传统的文学史中找到这两者。结构主义在 20 世纪 70 年代在英国和美国的到来引起了很大的争议，正是因为这些国家的文学研究传统上对结构主义者想要提出的那种大型抽象问题兴趣不大。1920 年代英语研究中所谓的“剑桥革命”宣扬了与这一切相反的观点：它要求在脱离所有更广泛的结构和语境的情况下对文本进行仔细研究：它无情地“基于文本”并倾向于排除更广泛的问题、抽象的问题和想法。这种意义上的结构主义颠覆了英语研究，并且贬低了大约半个世纪以来它所珍视的一切，提出了长期被压抑的问题，例如：“我们所说的‘文学’是什么意思？” “叙事是如何运作的？” “什么是诗意的结构？” 总之，传统批评家不欢迎他们应该将注意力从鸡蛋转移到鸡的建议。

Thus, in the structuralist approach to literature there is a constant movement away from the interpretation of the individual literary work and a parallel drive towards understanding the larger, abstract structures which contain them. These structures, as I suggested at the start of this section, are usually abstract, such as the notion of the literary or the poetic, or the nature of narrative itself, rather than ‘mere’ concrete specifics like the history of the alba or of courtly love, both of which, after all, we could quite easily find out about from conventional literary history. The arrival of structuralism in Britain and the USA in the 1970s caused a great deal of controversy, precisely because literary studies in these countries had traditionally had very little interest in large abstract issues of the kind structuralists wanted to raise. The so-called ‘Cambridge revolution’ in English studies in the 1920s had promulgated the opposite to all this: it enjoined close study of the text in isolation from all wider structures and contexts: it was relentlessly ‘text-based’ and tended to exclude wider questions, abstract issues, and ideas. Structuralism in that sense turned English studies on its head, and devalued all that it had held dear for around half a century, asking long-repressed questions such as: ‘What do we mean by “literary”?’ ‘How do narratives work?’ ‘What is a poetic structure?’ Traditional critics, in a word, did not welcome the suggestion that they ought to switch their attention from eggs to chickens.

父亲的迹象——索绪尔

Signs of the fathers – Saussure

正如我们所说，尽管结构主义真正开始于 1950 年代和 1960 年代，但它的根源在于瑞士语言学家索绪尔 (Ferdinand de Saussure，1857-1913) 的思想。索绪尔是现代语言研究方法发展的关键人物。在 19 世纪，语言学者主要对语言的历史方面感兴趣（例如研究语言的历史发展和它们之间的联系，以及推测语言本身的起源）。索绪尔转而关注当今使用的语言的模式和功能，强调意义是如何维持和建立的，以及语法结构的功能。

Though structuralism proper began, as we said, in the 1950s and 1960s, it has its roots in the thinking of the Swiss linguist Ferdinand de Saussure (1857–1913). Saussure was a key figure in the development of modern approaches to language study. In the nineteenth century linguistic scholars had mainly been interested in historical aspects of language (such as working out the historical development of languages and the connections between them, and speculating about the origins of language itself). Saussure concentrated instead on the patterns and functions of language in use today, with the emphasis on how meanings are maintained and established and on the functions of grammatical structures.

但是，对于结构主义者后来发现如此有趣的语言结构，索绪尔究竟是怎么说的呢？这可以概括为三个声明。首先，他强调我们赋予词语的意义纯粹是任意的，并且这些含义仅由约定维护。也就是说，词是“无动机的符号”，这意味着词与其所指代的事物之间没有内在联系。例如，“小屋”这个词就其意义而言一点也不“恰当”，而且所有的语言符号都是这样随意的。（有少数拟声词如“布谷鸟”和“嘶嘶声”的小例外，但即使这些词因语言而异。）坚持语言符号是任意的也许是一个相当明显的观点，但事实并非如此一个新的说法（柏拉图在古希腊时代说过），但它是一个新的概念来强调（这总是更重要），结构主义者感兴趣的是，如果作为符号系统的语言是基于这种任意性的，那么语言不是世界和经验的反映，而是与它完全分开的系统。这一点将在后面进一步展开。

But what exactly did Saussure say about linguistic structures which the structuralists later found so interesting? This can be summarised as three pronouncements in particular. Firstly, he emphasised that the meanings we give to words are purely arbitrary, and that these meanings are maintained by convention only. Words, that is to say, are ‘unmotivated signs’, meaning that there is no inherent connection between a word and what it designates. The word ‘hut’, for instance, is not in any way ‘appropriate’ to its meaning, and all linguistic signs are arbitrary like this. (There is the minor exception of a small number of onomatopoeic words like ‘cuckoo’ and ‘hiss’, but even these vary between languages.) Insisting that linguistic signs are arbitrary is a fairly obvious point to make, perhaps, and it is not a new thing to say (Plato said it in Ancient Greek times), but it is a new concept to emphasise (which is always much more important), and the structuralists were interested in the implication that if language as a sign system is based on arbitrariness of this kind then it follows that language isn’t a reflection of the world and of experience, but a system which stands quite separate from it. This point will be further developed later.

其次，索绪尔强调词义是（我们可以称之为）关系的。也就是说，任何词都不能孤立于其他词来定义。任何给定词的定义取决于它与其他“相邻”词的关系。例如，“hut”这个词的确切含义取决于它在“范式链”中的位置，即在功能和意义上相关的一系列词，每个词都可以替换给定句子中的任何其他词. 这种情况下的范式链可能包括以下内容：

Secondly, Saussure emphasised that the meanings of words are (what we might call) relational. That is to say, no word can be defined in isolation from other words. The definition of any given word depends upon its relation with other ‘adjoining’ words. For example, that word ‘hut’ depends for its precise meaning on its position in a ‘paradigmatic chain’, that is, a chain of words related in function and meaning each of which could be substituted for any of the others in a given sentence. The paradigmatic chain in this case might include the following:

茅屋棚小屋房子豪宅宫殿
hovel   shed   hut   house   mansion   palace

如果从链中删除其他任何一个词，则这些词中任何一个的含义都会改变。因此，“小屋”和“棚子”都是小型和基本结构，但它们并不完全相同：一个主要用于庇护所（例如守夜人的小屋），而另一个主要用于存储：没有另一个，每个都必须包含两者这些含义，因此将是一个不同的词。同样，豪宅可以定义为比普通房屋更大更宏伟但不如宫殿更大更宏伟的住宅。因此，我们通过解释它的含义如何与它两侧的两个词的含义相关来定义“豪宅”。如果我们有成对的对立面，那么单词的这种相互定义的方面就更加明显了：例如，术语“男性”和“女性”主要具有彼此相关的含义：每个都表示缺少另一个包含的特征，所以“男性”可以被看作主要表示“非女性”，反之亦然。同样，如果没有“夜晚”的相关概念，我们就没有“白天”的概念，如果没有“坏”来定义它，就没有“好”的概念。语言的这种“关系”方面引起了索绪尔的一句名言：“在语言中只有差异，没有固定的术语”。那么，所有的词都存在于“差异网络”中，就像这些“二元组”或成对的对立词，就像前面给出的“住所”词的范例链。

The meaning of any one of these words would be altered if any one of the others were removed from the chain. Thus, ‘hut’ and ‘shed’ are both small and basic structures, but they are not quite the same thing: one is primarily for shelter (a night-watchman’s hut, for instance), while the other is primarily for storage: without the other, each would have to encompass both these meanings, and hence would be a different word. Likewise, a mansion can be defined as a dwelling which is bigger and grander than a mere house, but not as big and grand as a palace. Thus, we define ‘mansion’ by explaining how its meaning relates to that of the two words on either side of it. If we have paired opposites then this mutually defining aspect of words is even more apparent: the terms ‘male’ and ‘female’, for example, mainly have meaning in relation to each other: each designates the absence of the characteristics included in the other, so that ‘male’ can be seen as mainly meaning ‘not female’, and vice versa. Similarly, we could have no concept of ‘day’ without the linked concept of ‘night’, no notion of ‘good’ without a ‘bad’ to define it against. This ‘relational’ aspect of language gave rise to a famous remark of Saussure’s: ‘In a language there are only differences, without fixed terms’. All words, then, exist in ‘differencing networks’, like these ‘dyads’, or paired opposites, and like the paradigmatic chain of ‘dwelling place’ words given earlier.

索绪尔用一个著名的例子来解释他所说的语言中没有固有的固定意义——8.25 日内瓦到巴黎特快列车的例子（见课程，第 108-9 页，以及乔纳森·卡勒对这个例子的讨论在结构主义诗学中， 第 11 页）。是什么赋予这列火车以其身份？它不是什么实质性的东西，因为每天都会有不同的引擎和车厢、不同的司机和乘客，等等。要是晚了，连8点25都不走。它甚至必须是火车吗？我有一次在南安普敦车站问布莱顿火车，检票员指着车站外的一辆公共汽车说，“就是这样”。那是一个星期天，由于线路上的工程施工，正在使用公共汽车服务将乘客运送到正在施工的路段之外。那么，有时候，“火车”不一定就是火车。索绪尔的结论是，唯一赋予这列火车身份的是它在差异结构中的位置：它介于7.25 和 9.25 之间，也就是说，它的身份纯粹是相关的。

Saussure used a famous example to explain what he meant by saying that there are no intrinsic fixed meanings in language – the example of the 8.25 Geneva to Paris express train (see the Course, pp. 108–9, and Jonathan Culler’s discussion of this example in Structuralist Poetics, p. 11). What is it that gives this train its identity? It isn’t anything material, since each day it will have a different engine and carriages, different drivers and passengers, and so on. If it is late, it won’t even leave at 8.25. Does it even have to be a train? I once asked at Southampton station for the Brighton train, and the ticket collector pointed to a bus standing outside the station and said, ‘That’s it’. It was a Sunday, and because of engineering works on the line a bus service was being used to ferry passengers beyond the sections being worked upon. Sometimes, then, a ‘train’ doesn’t have to be a train. Saussure’s conclusion is that the only thing which gives this train its identity is its position in a structure of differences: it comes between the 7.25 and the 9.25, that is, its identity is purely relational.

第三，对于索绪尔来说，语言构成了我们的世界，它不仅仅是记录它或标记它。意义总是归因于由人的心智，由语言建构和表达的对象或想法：它并不已经包含在事物之中。此过程的著名示例是在“恐怖分子”或“自由斗士”等配对选项之间进行选择。没有中立或客观的方式来指定这样的人，只是选择以某些方式“构建”该人的两个术语。同一概念的另一个例子可以从撒切尔政府在英国征收的国内税的两种方式中看到：这种税收的反对者称之为人头税，唤起了中世纪和农民起义的形象。政府本身称该税为社区征收，避免使用负面的“税”字，而使用更受欢迎的术语“社区”。特定个人使用的这种税收的术语立即表明了一种政治立场，而且，同样，没有中立或“客观”的替代方案可用。有人说每个故事都有三个版本，你的版本，我的版本，真相，但这里的情况比这更复杂，因为所有可用的术语都是纯粹的语言——没有关于这些安全存在于语言之外的事情的真相。

Thirdly, for Saussure, language constitutes our world, it doesn’t just record it or label it. Meaning is always attributed to the object or idea by the human mind, and constructed by and expressed through language: it is not already contained within the thing. Well-known examples of this process would be the choice between paired alternatives like ‘terrorist’ or ‘freedom fighter’. There is no neutral or objective way of designating such a person, merely a choice of two terms which ‘construct’ that person in certain ways. Another example of the same concept is seen in the two ways of referring to the domestic tax imposed in Britain by the Thatcher government: opponents of this tax called it the poll tax, evoking images of the Middle Ages and the Peasants’ Revolt. The government itself called the tax the community charge, avoiding the negative word ‘tax’ and making use of the favoured term ‘community’. The term for this tax used by a given individual immediately indicated a political position, and, again, no neutral or ‘objective’ alternative was available. It has been said that there are three versions of every story, your version, my version, and the truth, but the case here is more complicated than that, since all the available terms are purely linguistic – there is no truth about these matters which exists securely outside language.

无论我们在哪里看，我们都会看到语言以这种方式构成世界，而不仅仅是反映它。例如，颜色词使现实成为现实，它们不只是命名“那里”的事物：光谱不分为七种原色；所有的颜色相互融合。所以我们可能有十四个名字而不是七个。另一个例子是我们对一年四季的称呼。我们有四个不同的名称（“春天”、“夏天”等），但实际上这一年是连续不断的，没有任何中断或决定性的变化。实际上，它并没有分成四个。为什么没有六个季节，或者八个？由于一年四季都在不断变化，因此可以在任何地方进行划分。因此，季节是一种看待年份的方式，而不是自然界的客观事实。所以索绪尔的思想强调语言是任意的、相关的和构成的，这种思考语言的方式极大地影响了结构主义者，因为它给了他们一个独立的系统模型，其中各个项目与其他项目相关联从而创建更大的结构。

Wherever we look, we see language constituting the world in this way, not just reflecting it. For instance, the words for colours make a reality, they don’t just name things which are ‘there’: the spectrum isn’t divided into seven primary colours; all the colours merge into one another. So we might have had fourteen names rather than seven. Another example is the terms we give to the seasons of the year. We have four distinct names (‘spring’, ‘summer’, etc.), but actually the year runs continuously without any breaks or decisive changes. It isn’t, in reality, divided into four. Why not have six seasons, or eight? Since change is continuous throughout the year the divisions could be made anywhere at all. The seasons, then, are a way of seeing the year, not an objective fact of nature. So Saussure’s thinking stressed the way language is arbitrary, relational, and constitutive, and this way of thinking about language greatly influenced the structuralists, because it gave them a model of a system which is self-contained, in which individual items relate to other items and thus create larger structures.

索绪尔做出的另一个区分为结构主义者提供了一种思考与文学相关的更大结构的方式。他使用术语langue和parole分别表示一方面作为系统或结构的语言，另一方面表示该语言中的任何给定话语。只有当你已经掌握了我们称之为“法语”（即语言）的整套语言行为规则和惯例时，法语中的特定评论（假释的样本）才对你有意义。因此，个别评论是一个离散的项目，只有在以经典结构主义的方式与更广泛的包含结构相关联时才有意义。现在，结构主义者利用通过将单个文学作品（比方说小说《米德尔马契》）视为文学语言的一个例子来区分语言/语言。它也只在一些更广泛的包含结构的上下文中才有意义。因此，与假释米德尔马奇相关的语言是将小说作为一种体裁，作为文学实践的主体的概念。

One other distinction made by Saussure gave structuralists a way of thinking about the larger structures which were relevant to literature. He used the terms langue and parole to signify, respectively, language as a system or structure on the one hand, and any given utterance in that language on the other. A particular remark in French (a sample of parole) only makes sense to you if you are already in possession of the whole body of rules and conventions governing verbal behaviour which we call ‘French’ (that is, the langue). The individual remark, then, is a discrete item which only makes sense when seen in relation to a wider containing structure, in the classic structuralist manner. Now, structuralists make use of the langue/parole distinction by seeing the individual literary work (the novel Middlemarch, let’s say) as an example of a literary parole. It too only makes sense in the context of some wider containing structure. So the langue which relates to the parole Middlemarch is the notion of the novel as a genre, as a body of literary practice.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

考虑一下本节到目前为止关于语言的一些要点。

Consider some of the points made so far in this section about language.

首先，你能想到其他语言构成现实的例子，而不仅仅是命名已经存在的东西吗？您的示例可能与上述示例类型相似（“自由斗士”、“人头税”、季节）。您可能还想考虑在这种情况下的重要性那些被称为“施行”的“言语行为”，即它所指定的现实的话语，例如做出承诺（“我保证告诉他”）或正式开设一些新设施（“我现在宣布这座桥打开')。

Firstly, can you think of other examples of language constituting reality, rather than merely naming something which is already there? Your examples may be of a similar type to those mentioned above (‘freedom fighter’, ‘poll tax’, the seasons). You may also like to consider the significance in this context of those ‘speech acts’ which are known as ‘performatives’, that is, the kind of utterance which is the reality it designates, such as making a promise (‘I promise to tell him’) or formally opening some new facility (‘I now declare this bridge opened’).

其次，你能看出索绪尔关于语言和现实的论证路线有什么破绽吗？例如，设定一个纯粹差异的范畴是否有意义？评论家克里斯托弗·里克斯曾经提出的反观点中，你是否看到任何力量，你不能只有差异，你必须在事物之间有差异？（请参阅他在伦敦书评中的文章“In Theory” ， 1981 年 4 月，第 3-6 页。）如果您接受 Ricks 的论点，并同意事物之间只能有差异，那么这对索绪尔论点有何影响语言只有差异，没有固定的术语？

Secondly, can you see any flaws in the line of argument about language and reality put forward by Saussure? For instance, does it make sense to posit a category of pure difference? Do you see any force in the counter-view once put forward by the critic Christopher Ricks, that you can’t just have difference, you have to have difference between things? (See his article ‘In Theory’ in London Review of Books, April 1981, pp. 3–6.) If you accepted Ricks’s argument, and agreed that you can only have difference between things, what implications would this have for the Saussurean argument that languages have only differences, without fixed terms?

第三，你相信那列火车吗？它在时间表中的位置真的是唯一赋予它身份的东西吗？Saussure 用另一个例子补充了这个例子：

Thirdly, are you convinced by that train? Is its position in the timetable really the only thing which gives it its identity? Saussure supplements the example with another one:

为什么一条街可以完全重建，而且还是原来的样子？因为它不构成纯粹的物质实体；它基于某些条件，这些条件不同于适合条件的材料，例如它相对于其他街道的位置
Why can a street be completely rebuilt and still be the same? Because it does not constitute a purely material entity; it is based on certain conditions that are distinct from the materials that fit the conditions, e.g. its location with respect to other streets

（课程，第 108-9 页）

(Course, pp. 108–9)

一个相反的论点可能是 8.25 必须像火车一样才能成为 8.25：如果一群鸽子从车站的天篷下出现，没有人会说“8.25 去巴黎了”：同样，它是确实，一条给定的街道在很大程度上具有相关性——您通过说它是在“Y”街和“Z”街之间成直角的那条街来定义“X”街。尽管如此，在两者之间伸展的一根绳子不会被误认为是街道。

A counter-argument might be that the 8.25 has to be train-like before it can be the 8.25: nobody will remark, ‘There goes the 8.25 to Paris’ if a flock of pigeons emerges from under the station canopy: likewise, it is true to say that a given street has a largely relational identity – you define ‘X’ Street by saying that it’s the one that runs at right angles between ‘Y’ Street and ‘Z’ Street. All the same, a piece of string stretched between the two will not be mistaken for the street.

结构主义的范围

The scope of structuralism

但结构主义不仅仅与语言和文学有关。当索绪尔的作品在 1950 年代被我们现在称为结构主义者的人们“吸收”时，他们的感觉是索绪尔的模型如何语言作品是“可转移的”，并且还可以解释所有的意指系统是如何工作的。人类学家 Claude Lévi-Strauss 将结构主义观点应用于神话的解释。他建议，神话循环中的个别故事（假释）没有单独的和固有的意义，只能通过考虑它在整个循环（语言）中的位置以及该故事与其他故事之间的异同来理解。在序列中。

But structualism is not just about language and literature. When Saussure’s work was ‘co-opted’ in the 1950s by the people we now call structuralists, their feeling was that Saussure’s model of how language works was ‘transferable’, and would also explain how all signifying systems work. The anthropologist Claude Lévi-Strauss applied the structuralist outlook to the interpetation of myth. He suggested that the individual tale (the parole) from a cycle of myths did not have a separate and inherent meaning but could only be understood by considering its position in the whole cycle (the langue) and the similarities and difference between that tale and others in the sequence.

因此，在解释俄狄浦斯神话时，他将俄狄浦斯的个人故事置于与底比斯城相关的整个故事循环的背景下。然后他开始看到重复的主题和对比，并将这些作为他解释的基础。在这种方法中，故事及其所属的循环根据基本的对立来重构：动物/人、关系/陌生人、丈夫/儿子等等。故事中的具体细节是在一个更大结构的背景下看到的，然后这个更大的结构被视为具有明显的象征、主题和原型共鸣（如艺术与生活之间的对比）的基本“二元对”的整体网络，男性和女性，城镇和乡村，讲述和展示等，如后面的“实例”所示）。

So in interpreting the Oedipus myth, he placed the individual story of Oedipus within the context of the whole cycle of tales connected with the city of Thebes. He then began to see repeated motifs and contrasts, and he used these as the basis of his interpretation. On this method the story and the cycle it is part of are reconstituted in terms of basic oppositions: animal/human, relation/stranger, husband/son and so on. Concrete details from the story are seen in the context of a larger structure, and the larger structure is then seen as an overall network of basic ‘dyadic pairs’ which have obvious symbolic, thematic, and archetypal resonance (like the contrast between art and life, male and female, town and country, telling and showing, etc., as in the ‘worked example’ later).

这是典型的从特殊到一般的结构主义过程，将个别作品置于更广泛的结构背景中。更广泛的结构也可以在例如作者作品的整个语料库中找到；或关于该特定主题的写作体裁惯例（例如，讨论狄更斯的小说《艰难时期》就其偏离小说惯例和其他更流行的类型而言，如情节剧或民谣）；或在识别潜在的基本“二元组”的集合中。这个意义上的符号系统是一个非常广泛的概念：它意味着任何具有文化意义的有组织和结构化的符号集。这一类包括的现象多种多样，例如：文学作品、部落仪式（比如毕业典礼或雨舞）、时尚（服装、食品、“生活方式”等）、时尚风格汽车，或广告内容。对于结构主义者来说，我们所属的文化可以像语言一样被“阅读”，使用这些原则，因为文化是由许多结构网络组成的，这些结构网络具有重要意义并且可以被证明以系统的方式运作。这些网络运行通过作为符号系统的“代码”；它们可以像语言一样进行陈述，并且可以被结构主义者或符号学家阅读或解码。

This is the typical structuralist process of moving from the particular to the general, placing the individual work within a wider structural context. The wider structure might also be found in, for instance, the whole corpus of an author’s work; or in the genre conventions of writing about that particular topic (for instance, discussing Dickens’s novel Hard Times in terms of its deviations from novelistic conventions and into those of other more popular genres, like melodrama or the ballad); or in the identification of sets of underlying fundamental ‘dyads’. A signifying system in this sense is a very wide concept: it means any organised and structured set of signs which carries cultural meanings. Included in this category would be such diverse phenomena as: works of literature, tribal rituals (a degree ceremony, say, or a rain dance), fashions (in clothing, food, ‘life-style’, etc.), the styling of cars, or the contents of advertisements. For the structuralist, the culture we are part of can be ‘read’ like a language, using these principles, since culture is made up of many structural networks which carry significance and can be shown to operate in a systematic way. These networks operate through ‘codes’ as a system of signs; they can make statements, just as language does, and they can be read or decoded by the structuralist or semiotician.

例如，时尚可以像语言一样被“阅读”。单独的项目或特征被添加到一个完整的“服装”或“外观”中，具有复杂的语法组合规则：我们不穿晚礼服和地毯拖鞋：我们不穿军装来听课，等等。同样，每个组成符号的含义都来自结构上下文。当然，许多服装时尚都依赖于以一种“有意识”的方式打破这些规则，但是这种打破规则的“声明”（例如，制作看起来像内衣的外衣，或者以明显粗糙的方式裁剪昂贵的面料）方式）取决于明显被蔑视的“规则”或惯例的先前存在。例如，在时尚界（1994 年底），暴露的接缝、皱巴巴的面料等特征的组合，对穿着者来说太大或太小的服装代表了被称为（在这种情况下令人困惑）解构主义的时尚。然而，将这些特征中的任何一个从所有其他特征中剔除，它们只会表明你把夹克翻了个底朝天，或者不相信熨烫。同样，这些单独的项目在整体结构中占有一席之地，而结构比单独的项目更重要。

Fashion, for instance, can be ‘read’ like a language. Separate items or features are added up into a complete ‘outfit’ or ‘look’ with complex grammatical rules of combination: we don’t wear an evening dress and carpet slippers: we don’t come to lectures in military uniform, etc. Likewise, each component sign derives its meaning from a structural context. Of course, many fashions in clothing depend on breaking such rules in a ‘knowing’ way, but the ‘statement’ made by such rule-breaks (for instance, making outer garments which look like undergarments, or cutting expensive fabrics in an apparently rough way) depends upon the prior existence of the ‘rule’ or convention which is being conspicuously flouted. In the fashion world, for instance, (late 1994) the combination of such features as exposed seams, crumpled-looking fabrics, and garments which were too big or too small for the wearer signified the fashion known (confusingly, in this context) as deconstruction. Take any one of these features out of the context of all the rest, however, and they will merely signify that you have your jacket on inside out or don’t believe in ironing. Again, these individual items have their place in an overall structure, and the structure is of greater significance than the individual item.

结构主义早期的另一位主要人物是罗兰巴特，他将结构主义的方法运用到现代文化的一般领域。他在一本名为Mythologies的小书中从文化人类学家的角度审视了现代法国（1950 年代）他于 1957 年在法国出版了这本书。这本书审视了许多以前从未进行过智力分析的项目，例如：拳击和摔跤之间的区别；吃牛排和薯条的意义；雪铁龙汽车的造型；Greta Garbo 脸部的电影图像；一张阿尔及利亚士兵向法国国旗敬礼的杂志照片。他将这些项目中的每一项都置于更广泛的价值观、信仰和符号结构中，作为理解它的关键。因此，拳击被视为一项与压抑和耐力有关的运动，这与摔跤不同，摔跤在摔跤中夸张地展示了痛苦。拳手被打不痛叫，任何时候都不能无视规则在比赛期间，拳击手像他自己一样战斗，而不是假装是一个虚构的恶棍或英雄的精心伪装。相比之下，摔跤手则充满攻击性地咕哝和咆哮，精心展示痛苦或胜利，并像夸张的、比生活中的恶棍或超级英雄一样夸张地战斗。显然，这两种运动在社会中具有截然不同的功能：拳击体现了生活中有时必需的坚忍不拔的精神，而摔跤则表现了善与恶之间的终极斗争和冲突。因此，巴特在这里的方法是经典结构主义者的方法：单个项目被“结构化”，或“被结构语境化”，并且在这样做的过程中，层层意义被揭示出来。

The other major figure in the early phase of structuralism was Roland Barthes, who applied the structuralist method to the general field of modern culture. He examined modern France (of the 1950s) from the standpoint of a cultural anthropologist in a little book called Mythologies which he published in France in 1957. This looked at a host of items which had never before been subjected to intellectual analysis, such as: the difference between boxing and wrestling; the significance of eating steak and chips; the styling of the Citroën car; the cinema image of Greta Garbo’s face; a magazine photograph of an Algerian soldier saluting the French flag. Each of these items he placed within a wider structure of values, beliefs, and symbols as the key to understanding it. Thus, boxing is seen as a sport concerned with repression and endurance, as distinct from wrestling, where pain is flamboyantly displayed. Boxers do not cry out in pain when hit, the rules cannot be disregarded at any point during the bout, and the boxer fights as himself, not in the elaborate guise of a make-believe villain or hero. By contrast, wrestlers grunt and snarl with aggression, stage elaborate displays of agony or triumph, and fight as exaggerated, larger than life villains or super-heroes. Clearly, these two sports have quite different functions within society: boxing enacts the stoical endurance which is sometimes necessary in life, while wrestling dramatises ultimate struggles and conflicts between good and evil. Barthes’s approach here, then, is that of the classic structuralist: the individual item is ‘structuralised’, or ‘contextualised by structure’, and in the process of doing this layers of sigificance are revealed.

早年的罗兰巴特也对文学方面进行了具体的考察，到70年代，结构主义在巴黎乃至世界范围内引起了广泛关注。1970 年代，许多英国和美国的学者在巴黎学习了主要结构主义人物（其中包括 Colin MacCabe）的课程，然后回到英国和美国，热衷于在这里教授类似的想法和方法。结构主义的主要著作是法语，这些著作在 1970 年代开始被翻译并以英语出版。许多英美人士着手阅读尚未翻译的材料，并为说英语的读者解释结构主义；这些重要的调解人包括：美国人乔纳森·卡勒 (Jonathan Culler)，他的著作《结构主义诗学》出现于1975年；英国评论家特伦斯·霍克斯 (Terence Hawkes)，他的著作《结构主义与符号学》于 1977 年作为梅休恩出版的名为“新口音”的新系列的第一本书问世。霍克斯是该系列的总编辑，其使命是“鼓励而不是抵制文学研究的变革过程”。另一个有影响力的人物是英国评论家弗兰克克莫德，当时他是伦敦大学学院的教授，他热情地撰写了关于罗兰巴特的文章，并设立了研究生研讨会来讨论他的作品（尽管他在 1990 年代晚些时候退休后被认为与许多更传统的方法）。最后，还有伯明翰英语教授大卫洛奇，他试图将结构主义的思想与更传统的方法结合起来。这种尝试的典型代表是他的著作《Working with Structuralism 》 （1980 年）。

Roland Barthes in these early years also made specific examinations of aspects of literature, and by the 1970s, structuralism was attracting widespread attention in Paris and world wide. A number of English and American academics spent time in Paris in the 1970s taking courses under the leading structuralist figures (and these included Colin MacCabe) and came back to Britain and the USA fired up to teach similar ideas and approaches here. The key works on structuralism were in French, and these began to be translated in the 1970s and published in English. A number of Anglo-American figures undertook to read material not yet translated and to interpret structuralism for English-speaking readers; these important mediators included: the American, Jonathan Culler, whose book Structuralist Poetics appeared in 1975; the English critic Terence Hawkes, whose book Structuralism and Semiotics came out in 1977 as the first book in a new series published by Methuen called ‘New Accents’. Hawkes was the general editor of the series, and its mission was ‘to encourage rather than resist the process of change’ in literary studies. Another influential figure was the British critic Frank Kermode, then professor at University College, London, who wrote with enthusiasm about Roland Barthes, and set up graduate seminars to discuss his work (though he later in the 1990s became identified, in retirement, with much more traditional approaches). Finally, there was David Lodge, Professor of English at Birmingham, who tried to combine the ideas of structuralism with more traditional approaches. This attempt is typified by his book Working with Structuralism (1980).

结构主义批评家做什么

What structuralist critics do

1. 他们（主要）分析散文叙述，将文本与一些更大的包含结构相关联，例如：

1. They analyse (mainly) prose narratives, relating the text to some larger containing structure, such as:

(a) 特定文学体裁的惯例，或
(a) the conventions of a particular literary genre, or
(b) 互文联系网络，或
(b) a network of intertextual connections, or
(c) 潜在的通用叙事结构的预测模型，或
(c) a projected model of an underlying universal narrative structure, or
(d) 叙事的概念是反复出现的模式或主题的复合体。
(d) a notion of narrative as a complex of recurrent patterns or motifs.

2. 正如现代语言学所描述的那样，他们根据与语言结构的一系列潜在相似之处来解释文学。例如，列维-斯特劳斯提出的“神话主题”的概念，表示叙事“意义”的最小单位，是在语素类比的基础上形成的，在语言学中，语素是语法意义的最小单位。语素的一个例子是添加到动词以表示过去时的“ed”。

2. They interpret literature in terms of a range of underlying parallels with the structures of language, as described by modern linguistics. For instance, the notion of the ‘mytheme’, posited by Lévi-Strauss, denoting the minimal unit of narrative ‘sense’, is formed on the analogy of the morpheme, which, in linguistics, is the smallest unit of grammatical sense. An example of a morpheme is the ‘ed’ added to a verb to denote the past tense.

3. 他们将系统模式和结构化的概念应用到整个西方文化领域，并跨越文化，将从古希腊神话到肥皂粉品牌的任何事物都视为“符号系统”。

3. They apply the concept of systematic patterning and structuring to the whole field of Western culture, and across cultures, treating as ‘systems of signs’ anything from Ancient Greek myths to brands of soap powder.

结构主义批评：例子

Structuralist criticism: examples

我将这些例子建立在巴特的书S/Z 中描述和展示的文学分析方法的基础上，1970年出版。这本书约有两百页，是关于巴尔扎克三十页长篇小说《萨拉辛》的。巴特的分析方法是将故事分成 561 个“lexies”或意义单位，然后他使用五个“代码”对其进行分类，将其视为所有叙事的基本底层结构。因此，就我们关于结构主义的开场白而言（它旨在通过将单个项目置于其所属的更大结构的背景下来理解单个项目）这里的单个项目是这个特定的故事，而更大的结构是代码，巴特认为它产生了所有可能的实际叙述，就像语言的语法结构可以被看作产生了所有可能的句子，可以用它写或说。1970 年，因为 1970 年属于通常被认为是巴特的后结构主义阶段，通常被认为是从他 1968 年的论文“作者之死”开始（如本书所示）。尽管如此，我仍将S/Z主要视为结构主义文本的原因首先是与先例和既定习俗有关：例如，在许多最著名的结构主义书籍（如特伦斯霍克斯的结构主义和符号学、罗伯特·斯科尔斯的文学结构主义和乔纳森·卡勒的结构主义诗学）。第二个原因是，虽然S/Z显然包含许多颠覆结构主义的自信实证主义的元素，但它本质上是结构主义的，因为它试图将小说中可能的巨大复杂性和多样性减少到五个代码的操作，无论这种练习可能被认为是半开玩笑的. 实际上，事实是这本书介于结构主义和后结构主义之间：561 个词典和五个代码在精神上与巴特 1968 年论文“分析叙事结构”中的“高级”结构主义相关联，而 90 年代-三个穿插的题外话，以及他们对叙事的更自由的评论，预示着他 1973 年出版的书“文本的乐趣”的“完整”后结构主义。

I will base these examples on the methods of literary analysis described and demonstrated in Barthes’s book S/Z, published in 1970. This book, of some two hundred pages, is about Balzac’s thirty-page story ‘Sarrasine’. Barthes’s method of analysis is to divide the story into 561 ‘lexies’, or units of meaning, which he then classifies using five ‘codes’, seeing these as the basic underlying structures of all narratives. So in terms of our opening statement about structuralism (that it aims to understand the individual item by placing it in the context of the larger structure to which it belongs) the individual item here is this particular story, and the larger structure is the system of codes, which Barthes sees as generating all possible actual narratives, just as the grammatical structures of a language can be seen as generating all possible sentences which can be written or spoken in it. I should add that there is a difficulty in taking as an example of structuralism material from a text by Barthes published in 1970, since 1970 comes within what is usually considered to be Barthes’s post-structuralist phase, always said to begin (as in this book) with his 1968 essay ‘The Death of the Author’. My reasons for nevertheless regarding S/Z as primarily a structuralist text are, firstly, to do with precedent and established custom: it is treated as such, for instance, in many of the best known books on structuralism (such as Terence Hawkes’s Structuralism and Semiotics, Robert Scholes’s Structuralism in Literature, and Jonathan Culler’s Structuralist Poetics). A second reason is that while S/Z clearly contains many elements which subvert the confident positivism of structuralism, it is nevertheless essentially structuralist in its attempt to reduce the immense complexity and diversity possible in fiction to the operation of five codes, however tongue-in-cheek the exercise may be taken to be. The truth, really, is that the book sits on the fence between structuralism and post-structuralism: the 561 lexies and the five codes are linked in spirit to the ‘high’ structuralism of Barthes’s 1968 essay ‘Analysing Narrative Structures’, while the ninety-three interspersed digressions, with their much more freewheeling comments on narrative, anticipate the ‘full’ post-structuralism of his 1973 book The Pleasure of the Text.

巴特在S/Z中确定的五个代码是：

The five codes identified by Barthes in S/Z are:

1. proairetic 代码此代码提供操作指示。（“船在午夜航行”“他们又开始了”等）

1. The proairetic code This code provides indications of actions. (‘The ship sailed at midnight’ ‘They began again’, etc.)

2.解释代码该代码提出了提供叙事悬念的问题或谜团。（例如，“He knocked on a certain door in the neighborhood of Pell Street”这句话让读者想知道谁住在那里，那是什么样的街区，等等。）

2. The hermeneutic code This code poses questions or enigmas which provide narrative suspense. (For instance, the sentence ‘He knocked on a certain door in the neighbourhood of Pell Street’ makes the reader wonder who lived there, what kind of neighbourhood it was, and so on.)

3.文化代码本代码包含超出文本之外的对被视为常识的内容的引用。（例如，“Agent Angelis 是那种有时穿着奇怪的袜子上班的人”这句话唤起了读者脑海中对这种人的预先存在的印象——一种笨拙无能的刻板印象，也许，对比这与“代理人”概念中包含的敏捷效率的形象有关。）

3. The cultural code This code contains references out beyond the text to what is regarded as common knowledge. (For example, the sentence ‘Agent Angelis was the kind of man who sometimes arrives at work in odd socks’ evokes a pre-existing image in the reader’s mind of the kind of man this is – a stereotype of bungling incompetence, perhaps, contrasting that with the image of brisk efficiency contained in the notion of an ‘agent’.)

4.半码这也叫内涵码。它与主题相关联，当围绕特定专有名称组织时，此代码（上面提到的书中的 Scholes 说）构成一个‘字’。下面的第二个例子演示了它的操作。

4. The semic code This is also called the connotative code. It is linked to theme, and this code (says Scholes in the book mentioned above) when organised around a particular proper name constitutes a ‘character’. Its operation is demonstrated in the second example, below.

5.符号代码该代码也与主题相关联，但可以说是在更大范围内。它包含与最基本的二元对立相关的对比和配对——男性和女性、夜晚和白天、善与恶、生活和艺术等等。这些是对比元素的结构，结构主义者将其视为人类感知和组织现实方式的基础。

5. The symbolic code This code is also linked to theme, but on a larger scale, so to speak. It consists of contrasts and pairings related to the most basic binary polarities – male and female, night and day, good and evil, life and art, and so on. These are the structures of contrasted elements which structuralists see as fundamental to the human way of perceiving and organising reality.

由于最后两个代码产生了最大的困难（尤其是在区分一个与另一个时），我将依次使用每个代码作为示例的基础，从符号代码开始，我将使用它作为组织原则来说明整个故事的解释，这个故事是“椭圆形肖像”（转载于附录 1），作者是 19 世纪早期的美国作家埃德加·爱伦·坡，他受到了结构主义者和后结构主义者的极大关注。就上面的“结构主义者做什么”活动列表而言，这是类别 l.(d) 的示例，将叙事结构视为反复出现的模式和主题的复合体。
As the last two codes have generated the greatest difficulty (especially in distinguishing one from the other) I will use each in turn as the basis of an example, beginning with the symbolic code, which I will illustrate in use as the organising principle for the interpretation of an entire tale, the story being ‘The Oval Portrait’ (reproduced in Appendix 1), by the early nineteenth-century American writer Edgar Allan Poe, an author who has received considerable attention from both structuralists and post-structuralists. In terms of the ‘What structuralists do’ list of activities above, this is an example of category l.(d), treating narrative structure as a complex of recurrent patterns and motifs.

在讨论它时，我将寻求你作为这篇结构主义批评的合著者的帮助。请求帮助的时间点由“停止并思考”标题指示。

In discussing it I will enlist your help as a co-writer of this structuralist critique. The points at which your help is requested are indicated by the ‘STOP and THINK’ heading.

情节的简要工作总结可能会有用。在一个未命名的欧洲国家似乎发生内战期间，一名受伤的军官（正如我们可能假设的那样）在最近废弃的城堡避难。他睡觉的房间里有一幅极其逼真的年轻女子肖像，他在房间里发现了这幅肖像的书面记录，讲述了这位艺术家是如何成为她的丈夫，他对这幅肖像的创作如此着迷他没有注意到，当“生命”在画中被点燃时，它同时从画中人身上消失了。在故事的结尾，使肖像变得完美的最后一笔色彩的放置与保姆的死亡相吻合。

A brief working summary of the plot may be useful. During what appears to be a civil war in an unnamed European country a wounded officer (as we may assume him to be) takes refuge in a recently abandoned chateau. The room he sleeps in contains an extremely lifelike portrait of a young woman, and a written account of this portrait, which he finds in the room, tells how the artist was her husband, who had become so carried away with the creation of the portrait that he failed to notice that as ‘life’ was kindled in the painting it simultaneously drained away from the sitter. At the end of the tale the placing of the final touch of colour which renders the portrait perfect coincides with the death of the sitter.

自由人文主义和结构主义阅读之间最基本的区别在于，结构主义对结构的评论，符号和设计变得至高无上，成为评论的主要焦点，而对任何更广泛的道德意义的强调，以及广义上的解释本身，都大大减少了。因此，结构主义者不是以自由人文主义的方式直接进入内容，而是呈现一系列平行、回声、反思、模式和对比，这样叙述就变得高度图式化，实际上被翻译成我们可能称为口头图。当我们试图进行结构主义批判时，我们正在寻找什么，以及我们希望在哪里找到它，可以如下图所示。我们正在寻找左边列出的因素，我们希望在右边列出的故事部分中找到它们：

The most basic difference between liberal humanist and structuralist reading is that the structuralist’s comments on structure, symbol, and design become paramount and are the main focus of the commentary, while the emphasis on any wider moral significance, and indeed on interpretation itself in the broad sense, is very much reduced. So instead of going straight into the content, in the liberal humanist manner, the structuralist presents a series of parallels, echoes, reflections, patterns, and contrasts, so that the narrative becomes highly schematised, is translated, in fact, into what we might call a verbal diagram. What we are looking for, as we attempt a structuralist critique, and where we expect to find it, can be indicated as in the diagram below. We are looking for the factors listed on the left, and we expect to find them in the parts of the tale listed on the right:

列举一些可能在 Poe 的故事中挑选出来的相似之处等，也许是说明这一切的最好方式。首先，故事本身有一个二元结构（成对对立结构），由两个对比鲜明的部分组成：第一部分是“框架”叙述，包含对受伤军官的第一人称叙述，而第二部分是他在这幅画的评论中读到的故事中的故事。这两部分的叙事节奏差异非常明显，前者从容不迫，甚至沉闷，反映了军官脚踏实地、理性的头脑，而后者则越来越不连贯，反映了艺术的狂热。创造，以及受害者/保姆健康的快速下降。

Listing some of the parallels, etc., which might be picked out in Poe’s tale is perhaps the best way of illustrating all this. Firstly, then, the tale itself has a binary structure (a structure of paired opposites) made up of two contrasting halves: the first part is a ‘framing’ narrative, containing the first-person account of the wounded officer, while the second is the story-within-the-story which he reads in the commentary on the painting. There is a very marked difference in narrative pace between these two halves, the first being leisurely, ponderous even, reflecting the down-to-earth, rationalistic mind of the officer, while the second moves with increasingly disjointed rapidity, reflecting the frenzy of artistic creation, and the rapid downward spiral of the victim/sitter’s health.

故事中的第二个对比是城堡本身在两半中发挥着截然不同的功能。在前半部分，它是军官的避难所和休养所，在那里他从敌人那里找到了安全，我们可以假设，他恢复了健康。相比之下，在下半场，对于保姆来说，这是一个危险和最终毁灭的地方，在那里她被交付给她的艺术家丈夫的心血来潮，她的生命被耗尽。

A second contrast within the tale is that the chateau itself performs very different functions in the two halves. In the first half it is a place of refuge and recuperation for the officer, where he finds safety from his enemies and, we may assume, recovers his health. In the second half, by contrast, it is a place of danger and ultimately destruction for the sitter, where she is delivered to the whims of her artist-husband and her life is drained away.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

现在，寻找两半之间的其他对比。例如，每一半都有两个人之间的关系（第一部分是军官和贴身男仆，第二部分是艺术家和他的妻子）：这两种关系有何不同？每个关系中的权力分配不均，但效果不同。究竟如何？每对夫妇的成员对彼此所做的事情和为彼此所做的事情是否有相似之处？

Now, look for other contrasts between the two halves. For instance, each half features a relationship between two people (the officer and the valet in the first part and the artist and his wife in the second): how do these two relationships differ? There is an unequal distribution of power within each relationship, but the effects are different. How, exactly? Is there a similarity in what the members of each couple do to and for each other?

两半中的主要“演员”（分别）是受伤的军官和艺术家。在这两者的精神状态中可以观察到哪些对比？

The main ‘actors’ in the two halves are (respectively) the wounded officer and the artist. What contrasts are observable in the mental state of these two?

前半部的军官和后半部的画家，从某种意义上说，都在全神贯注于一幅画，但艺术在两半中的作用是截然不同的。对比究竟是什么？

Both the officer in the first part and the artist in the second are, in a sense, engrossed in a painting, but the role of art in the two halves is very different. What exactly is the contrast?

所有这些都是两半之间的对比、平行等。里面还有很多两半。首先，一方面是丈夫自我陶醉的艺术狂热，另一方面是丈夫对新婚新娘的那种更为传统的外向性激情，这两者之间存在着强烈的暗示对比。这位丈夫并没有被她迷住，而是“在工作之前就沉迷于”自体色情的沉思中。事实上，这种婚姻在某种意义上是重婚，因为丈夫被描述为“在他的艺术中已经有了新娘”。他与新婚新娘单独度过的几周创作这幅画是对蜜月的一种持续的负面模仿。被关在一起数周后，画家丈夫“从工作中获得了狂热而炽热的乐趣，日以继夜地工作”，最后“画家对工作的热情变得狂野起来”。实际上，

All these are contrasts, parallels, etc., between the two halves. There are also many more within the two halves. Firstly, there is a strongly implied contrast between the husband’s self-absorbed artistic frenzy on the one hand, and a more conventional outwardly directed sexual passion of the kind which might be expected in a husband for a new bride. Instead of being fascinated by her, this husband is ‘entranced before his work’ in auto-erotic contemplation. Indeed, the marriage is in a sense bigamous, since the husband is described as ‘having already a bride in his art’. The several weeks he spends alone with his new bride executing the painting are a kind of sustained negative parody of a honeymoon. Locked up together for several weeks, the husband painter ‘took a fervid and burning pleasure in his task and wrought day and night’, and towards the end ‘the painter had grown wild with the ardour of his work’. In fact, he has spent this ‘honeymoon’ in passionate involvement with the first bride rather than the second.

第三个层次的对比和相似之处是那些与叙述机制有关的对比和相似之处，例如呈现和语言，以及内容。例如，其中一个是两半的叙述者之间的平行。两者都有一定程度的匿名性，并且在第二种情况，匿名是完全的，因为我们根本不知道故事中故事的“模糊和古怪的词”的作者的身份。（唯一有名字的人物是贴身男仆佩德罗，故事中最不重要的人物。）但是罗兰·巴特鼓励结构主义者向文本提出“qui parle?”这个问题。- '谁在说话？' ——如果我们在故事的第二部分问这个问题，那么答案将涉及将叙述者从中立的旁观记录者的位置上移开，因为这个故事一定是由目睹这些事件而没有尝试任何干预的人写的。至少，这个目击者是一个没有洞察力的人，与那些看到这幅画像的人没有区别，这些人“低声说出它的相似之处，就像一个巨大的奇迹，并且证明画家的力量不亚于他深深地爱着他描绘得如此出色的她”。
