A third level of contrasts and parallels are those which concern narrative mechanisms such as presentation and language, as well as content. One such, for instance, is the parallel between the narrators of the two halves. Both have a degree of anonymity, and in the second case the anonymity is complete, since we are given no information at all about the identity of the author of the ‘vague and quaint words’ of the story-within-the-story. (The only named character is Pedro the valet, the least important figure in the tale.) But structuralists are encouraged by Roland Barthes to ask of a text the question ‘qui parle?’ – ‘Who is speaking?’ – and if we ask that question of the second part of the tale, then the answer will involve dislodging the narrator from the position of a neutral spectatorial recorder, for this account must have been written by someone who witnessed these events without attempting any intervention. At the very least, this witness is someone without insight, indistinguishable from those who, having seen the portrait, ‘spoke of its resemblance in low words, as of a mighty marvel, and a proof not less of the power of the painter than of his deep love for her whom he depicted so surpassingly well’.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

第一个叙述者也可以被视为在某种程度上是有罪的，并且故意对所目睹的事件视而不见。我们可以更进一步吗？两个叙述者之间是否存在相似之处，使得第一个叙述者通过所使用的语言与艺术家丈夫的态度保持一致？

The first narrator, too, can be seen as to some degree culpable, and as wilfully blind to the events witnessed. Could we go further? Is there a parallel between the two narrators, such that the first is aligned, through the language used, with the attitudes of the artist-husband?

例如，您如何看待他对这幅画的长时间沉思？文本的那部分是否有元素与艺术家在创作这幅画时长时间注视他妻子的流离失所的色情相提并论？故事中有两个（不只是一个）强烈的男性凝视例子。查看文本中单词“gaze”和“glory”（或“gloriously”）的分布。看看在每个案例中描述时间流逝的方式。在这两种情况下，都有一个视线被移开的时刻：这种平行的意义是什么？

For instance, what do you make of his prolonged contemplation of the painting? Are there elements in that part of the text which parallel the displaced eroticism of the artist’s protracted gazing on his wife as he makes the painting? There are two examples, not just one, of an intense masculine gaze in the story. Look at the distribution of the words ‘gaze’ and ‘glory’ (or ‘gloriously’) in the text. Look at the way the passing of time is depicted in each of these cases. In both cases there is a moment when the gaze is averted: what is the significance of this parallelism?

所有这些对比都是一种非常特殊的对比，只适合这个故事。然后我们可以执行一个简化的步骤就像找到一组数字的最小公分母，因为这些项目可能被简化为一组更概括的项目：生活与艺术、男性与女性、光明与黑暗（在启蒙和道德意义上）的对比和冲突愚昧，以及纯粹的物理术语），看和做，现实和表现。结构主义者的论点是，叙事结构是建立在这种潜在的对立面或二元体之上的，因此诸如此类的对比是所有叙事得以充实的骨架结构。如果我们不得不减少甚至这个二元组列表，以实现一对，那么它必须是艺术/生活对比，因为这个故事似乎主要是关于生活和艺术被视为整体心理经济中的因素。

All these contrasts are of a very particular kind, proper to just this one tale. We may then perform a simplifying move which is rather like finding the lowest common denominator of a set of numbers, for these items might be reduced to a set of more generalised ones: the contrast and conflict between life and art, male and female, light and dark (in the sense of enlightenment and moral benightedness, as well as in purely physical terms), looking and doing, reality and representation. The thesis of the structuralist is that narrative structures are founded upon such underlying paired opposites, or dyads, so that contrasts such as these are the skeletal structure on which all narratives are fleshed out. If we had to reduce even this list of dyads, to achieve a single pair, then it would have to be the art/life contrast, since the tale seems most to be about life and art viewed as factors in an overall psychic economy.

显而易见的最后一个问题是问这个故事站在这个二分法的哪一边。毫无疑问，它是站在艺术一边的，因为它是艺术创作的行为，而且在较小程度上，是对艺术作品的思考，这在故事中被描述得最生动、最热情，而不是任何意义上的浪费一个年轻的生命。这个“热情、狂野、喜怒无常的人”的狂热造就了一件栩栩如生的艺术作品，仿佛是神的产物。这不是捍卫“生命”的方式。“官方”这个故事是对牺牲年轻生命的虔诚抗议，但在实践中，牺牲是一种充满爱意的嫉妒。正如 DH Lawrence 没有说的那样，永远不要相信道德，相信故事。

The obvious final question is to ask which side of this dichotomy the tale is on. There can surely be little doubt that it is on the side of art, for it is the act of artistic creation, and, to a lesser extent, that of contemplating a work of art, which is most vividly and passionately described in the tale, rather than any sense of the waste of a young life. The frenzy of this ‘passionate, wild, and moody man’ produces a work of art so lifelike that it seems the product of a divine being. This is no way to champion ‘life’. ‘Officially’ the story is a pious protest at the sacrifice of a young life, but in practice the making of the sacrifice is presented with a kind of loving envy. As D. H. Lawrence didn’t quite say, never trust the moral, trust the tale.

那么，符号代码就这么多了。第二个例子集中在semic 代码文本中的操作。正如我们所说，这个代码与表征和主题化过程相关联，但在比符号代码更小的范围内运行。对于霍克斯来说，在前面提到的书中，它“利用暗示或”意义的闪烁“，并且鉴于它通过单个单词和短语的细微差别来运作，在行动中欣赏它的最佳方式是使用什么的变体教育家称之为“完形填空程序”，它涉及从文本中删除单词，让读者通过从上下文和整体结构中得出推论来填补这些空白。

So much, then, for the symbolic code. The second example centres on the operation within a text of the semic code. This code, as we have said, is linked with the process of characterisation and thematicisation but operates on a smaller scale than the symbolic code. For Hawkes, in the book mentioned earlier, it ‘utilises hints or “flickers of meaning”’, and given that it operates through the nuances of individual words and phrases, the best way to appreciate it in action is to use a variation of what educationalists call ‘cloze procedure’, which involves deleting words from a text and having readers fill these gaps by drawing inferences from context and overall structure.

下面的段落是默文琼斯小说的开头。中心人物阿米蒂奇先生出现在开场场景中，他的角色立即确立。我在文本中留下了空白，并在相关句子的末尾列出了几个可能填补空白的词（在每种情况下，其中一个是作者实际使用的词）。你会看到这个字符被果断地改变了，根据你选择的单词来填补空白，让我们感受到 semic 代码实际上在工作。为便于参考，对段落进行了编号。就“结构主义者做什么”列表而言，这是 1.(c) 的一个例子，即将文本与一个潜在的普遍叙事结构的预测模型相关联，因为评论家会假设巴特斯的五个代码是所有叙事运作的基础。现在花时间为每个空白选择一个词，然后再继续我的评论。

The passage below is the opening of a novel by Mervyn Jones. The central character, Mr Armitage, is presented in the opening scene and his character immediately established. I have left gaps in the text and have listed at the end of the relevant sentences several words which might fill that gap (one of which, in each case, is the word actually used by the author). You will see that the character is decisively altered, according to the word you choose to fill the gap, enabling us to feel the semic code actually at work. The paragraphs have been numbered for ease of reference. In terms of the ‘What structuralists do’ list, this is an example of 1.(c), that is, of relating the text to a projected model of an underlying universal narrative structure, since the critic would assume that the five Barthesian codes are fundamental to the workings of all narratives. Spend time now selecting a word for each gap before going on to my commentary.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

1. 约翰·爱德华·斯科特·阿米蒂奇：五十五岁，身高五英尺十一英寸，体重十三英石三______。[磅、盎司]

1. John Edward Scott Armitage: fifty-five years old, five feet eleven inches tall, weight thirteen stone three ______. [pounds, ounces]

2. 6 月 8 日：一个晴朗的早晨，汽车收音机的节目改变是九点十五分，也正是他在 ______ 手表上查看时间的九点十五分。[多功能，Swiss，Swatch，Timex，Pocket，米老鼠]

2. June the eighth: a fine morning, nine-fifteen by the programme change on the car radio, also nine-fifteen exactly as he checked the time on his ______ watch. [multi-function, Swiss, Swatch, Timex, Pocket, Mickey Mouse]

3. Hendon Way，北行。阿米蒂奇开着一辆捷豹，刚好跑进去。它的新奇让他很高兴——皮革的______气味，里程表上整齐的零。他是那些车龄不超过一年的人之一。[丰富，甜美，令人陶醉，性感，奢华]

3. Hendon Way, north-bound. Armitage was driving a Jaguar, just run in. Its newness pleased him – the ______ smell of the leather, the neat zeros on the mileage dial. He was among those men whose car is never more than a year old. [rich, sweet, heady, sexy, opulent]

有进一步的描述，然后阿米蒂奇放慢车速看两个搭便车的人。他们符合他的可接受标准，他提出让他们搭便车，但对他的提议的回应是片刻的犹豫。正文继续：

There is further description, then Armitage slows the car to look at two hitch-hikers. They meet his standards of acceptability, and he offers them a lift, but the response to his offer is a momentary hesitation. The text resumes:

4. 男孩依旧露出愉快的笑容，但没有上车。现在他似乎在考虑，不仅仅是方向，还有汽车，甚至是阿米蒂奇本人。事实上，搭便车的人正在决定是否接受司机，而不是反过来。阿米蒂奇是_____。再过几秒钟，他可能就会气愤不已。但女孩说：“这很好——是的——超级棒，真的。” [困惑，难过，目瞪口呆]

4. The boy still presented his pleasant smile, but did not get into the car. Now he seemed to be considering, not only the directions, but also the car, and even Armitage himself. The hitch-hiker, in fact, was deciding whether to accept the driver instead of the other way round. Armitage was _____. In a few seconds more he might have been indignant. But the girl said: ‘This is fine – yes it is – super, really’. [baffled, stumped, gob-smacked]

5. 她急切地说着，实际上对男孩的犹豫有些不耐烦。她也对阿米蒂奇微笑，但更多比愉快，______，他想。当然，他们很幸运能够驾驶一辆新捷豹长途旅行。女孩清楚地意识到这一点；此外，她似乎很乐意和阿米蒂奇一起旅行。他一想到这个想法，阿米蒂奇就发现这是荒谬的。然而，能给人这样的印象对她来说是一件很吸引人的事情。[愉快地，愉快地，邀请地，愉快地]

5. She spoke eagerly, indeed with some impatience at the boy’s hesitation. And she too smiled at Armitage, but more than pleasantly, ______, he thought. Of course, they were lucky to get a long ride in a new Jaguar. The girl clearly realised this; she seemed, moreover, to be happy to travel with Armitage. As soon as this notion occurred to him Armitage saw that it was absurd. Yet it was an attractive thing for her to give such an impression. [happily, cheerfully, invitingly, gleefully]

6. 她 ______ 到前排座位，男孩坐到后排。阿米蒂奇迅速开走，赶在一辆搬运车前面。他以一种突进的方式开车，抓住每一个机会，以咆哮的三档超车。他遇见，又打消了那个女孩在他身边让他大展身手的念头。[快跳，重重扑倒，妖娆滑，轻松滑，笨拙挤，悄悄滑]

6. She ______ into the front seat, and the boy got into the back. Armitage pulled away quickly to get ahead of a removal van. He drove in a thrusting style, seizing every opportunity, overtaking in roaring third gear. He met, and then dismissed, the thought that the girl’s presence beside him had made him show off his skill. [jumped quickly, plumped heavily, slid seductively, slid easily, squeezed awkwardly, slipped quietly]

我将简要评论每一段中的空白。

I’ll comment briefly on the gaps in each of these paragraphs.

首先，出版文本中的单词是“盎司”，其精确度立即让人联想到一个对生活非常精确和有序的态度的人。（有多少人知道自己的体重精确到盎司？）

In the first, the word in the published text is ‘ounces’, the precision of which immediately suggests a man with a very precise and ordered attitude to life. (How many people know their weight to the nearest ounce?)

在第二段中，如果我们更换他的手表，阿米蒂奇的性格就会完全改变。在文本中，他的“瑞士”手表强化了本书前几行中已经确立的井然有序、小康生活的形象。但半码的“意义闪烁”可以立即将他变成一个拥有多功能数字时计的上了年纪的小玩意儿，或者是一个拥有时髦 Swatch 手表的忠实追随者，或者是一个拥有怀表的老古董，或者带着玩笑的米老鼠手表，尽情享受派对生活和灵魂。

In the second paragraph the character of Armitage is completely changed if we change his watch. In the text his ‘Swiss’ watch reinforces the image of the well-ordered, well-to-do life already established in the first few lines of the book. But the semic code’s ‘flicker of meaning’ can instantly change him into an ageing gadget-faddist with a multi-function digital timepiece, or a dedicated follower of fashion with a trendy Swatch Watch, or an old fogey with a pocket watch, or a hearty life-and-soul-of-the-party type with a jokey Mickey Mouse watch.

第三段中的“甜美”、“醉人”、“性感”等词几乎把阿米蒂奇变成了一个皮革癖，而“富有”则带有一定的直接和粗俗，暗示他对事物的愉悦感成正比他们的成本。文本中的“华丽”保留了这一元素，但似乎暗示了对质量和工艺本身的欣赏。

In the third paragraph the words ‘sweet’, ‘heady’, and ‘sexy’ all come close to turning Armitage into a leather fetishist, while ‘rich’ has a certain directness and vulgarity which implies that his pleasure in things is in direct proportion to their cost. The text’s ‘opulent’ retains an element of this but seems to imply an appreciation of quality and craftsmanship for its own sake.

在第四段（在小说中经常出现），叙述声音使用的词的种类反映了所描述的人物。“stumped”暗示了一种有失尊严的无知，“gob-smacked”更是如此，而文本中的“baffled”暗示了一个习惯了一定程度尊重的具有一定地位的人的尊严被冒犯了。

In the fourth paragraph (as often in fiction) the kind of word used by the narrating voice reflects the character being described. ‘Stumped’ suggests an undignified cluelessness, as, even more so, does ‘gob-smacked’, whereas the text’s ‘baffled’ implies the offended dignity of a man of some standing accustomed to a degree of respect.

在第五段中，阿米蒂奇对女孩微笑本质的看法是他刻画人物的一个关键因素。文字让他看到她“愉快地”微笑，表明他很高兴看到对自己的积极反应。如果她在微笑，在他看来，“诱人”，那么暗示他的动机完全是性的。另一方面，“兴高采烈”会让她变成一个孩子而不是一个成年人。

In the fifth paragraph Armitage’s perception of the nature of the girl’s smile is a crucial element in his characterisation. The text has him seeing her as smiling ‘cheerfully’, indicating that he is pleased to perceive a positive reaction towards himself. If she were smiling, in his view, ‘invitingly’, then the implication would be that his motives were entirely sexual. ‘Gleefully’, on the other hand, would make her into a child rather than an adult.

在最后一段中，遗漏的短语表明，尽管如此，阿米蒂奇还是觉得这个女孩很有魅力，并且在身体上意识到了她。文字告诉我们，她“轻而易举”地坐进了前排座位，暗示着某种纤细的优雅。阿米蒂奇的注意力没那么集中在男孩身上，所以他只是“钻进”了后面。如果我们颠倒这两个短语，则暗示阿米蒂奇对男孩比对女孩更感兴趣，因此：“她坐在前排座位上，男孩很容易滑到后排”。这具有将阿米蒂奇构建为同性恋的倾向，即使没有做出这样的明确声明。

In the final paragraph the missing phrase indicates that, all the same, Armitage finds the girl attractive and is physically aware of her. The text tells us that she ‘slid easily’ into the front seat, implying a certain slender gracefulness. Armitage’s attention is less directed towards the boy, so he simply ‘got into’ the back. If we reverse these two phrases the implication is that Armitage is more interested in the boy than the girl, thus: ‘She got into the front seat, and the boy slid easily into the back’. This has the effect of tending to construct Armitage as homosexual, even though no such explicit statement is made.

那么，这个简单的“完形填空”练习表明了符号代码在字符构造中的一些小规模但同样重要的工作，同时还展示了该代码如何按顺序开始激活主题主题，例如与 Armitage 相关的有序和控制的概念。

This simple ‘cloze’ exercise, then, indicates something of the small-scale, but none the less crucial, workings of the semic code in the construction of character, while also showing how, in sequence, this code can begin to activate thematic motifs, such as the notion of orderliness and control associated with Armitage.

从同一段落中可以很容易地说明其他两个代码的操作。例如，解释法典在其中显然很重要。就在小说的开头，读者必须被吸引到推测可能的结果、解开谜团以及预测事件和动机的可能模式的过程中。因此，在这个例子中，我们会立即参与回答诸如“这次会议的结果是什么？”之类的问题。“搭便车的人真的像他们看起来那样无辜吗？” “随着小说的进展，阿米蒂奇的信心会在某种程度上动摇吗？” 最后，当我们被告知阿米蒂奇“是那些人中的一员”时，在第三段中可以看到文化代码的一个例子谁的车子从来没有超过一年”，其中​​的文字吸引了我们对这种人的先验知识，认为他们是具有一系列相关特征和习惯的独特类型。最后一个代码，即符号代码，很难在小说的如此简短和早期的摘录中检测到，并且已经在 Poe 的示例中进行了详细说明。

The operation of two other codes could easily be illustrated from the same passage. The hermeneutic code, for instance, is obviously important in it. Right at the beginning of a novel the reader has to be drawn into the process of speculating about possible outcomes, working out enigmas, and predicting the possible patterns of events and motives. Thus, with this example we are immediately involved in answering questions like ‘What is going to happen as a result of this meeting?’ ‘Are the hitch-hikers as innocent as they seem?’ ‘Will Armitage’s confidence be shaken in some way as the novel progresses?’ Finally, an example of the cultural code is seen in the third paragraph when we are told that Armitage ‘was among those men whose car is never more than a year old’, where the text appeals to our prior knowledge of this kind of man as a distinct type with a whole range of related characteristics and habits. The last code, the symbolic, would be difficult to detect in such a brief and early extract from a novel, and has already been demonstrated at length in the Poe example.

选读

Selected reading

Barthes, Roland, The Semiotic Challenge,译。理查德·霍华德 (Black-well, 1988)。

最著名的结构主义评论家的散文；参见第三部分“Edgar Allan Poe 的一个故事的文本分析”，关于“M. Valdemar 案中的事实”。

Barthes, Roland, The Semiotic Challenge, trans. Richard Howard (Black-well, 1988).

Essays by the best-known structuralist critic; see chapter in section three ‘Textual analysis of a tale by Edgar Allan Poe’, on ‘The Facts in the Case of M. Valdemar’.

巴特，罗兰，罗兰巴特读者，编辑。苏珊·桑塔格 (Vintage, 1993)。

Barthes, Roland, A Roland Barthes Reader, ed. Susan Sontag (Vintage, 1993).

Culler, Jonathan，结构主义诗学（Routledge，1975 年）。

这本书立即确立了作者作为困难理论“调解人”的声誉。彻底，但很少简洁。

Culler, Jonathan, Structuralist Poetics (Routledge, 1975).

A book which immediately established the author’s reputation as a ‘mediator’ of difficult theories. Thorough, but seldom succinct.

Culler、Jonathan、Barthes（方塔纳，1983 年）。

Culler, Jonathan, Barthes (Fontana, 1983).

Culler, Jonathan, Barthes：一个非常简短的介绍（牛津平装本，2002 年）。

Culler, Jonathan, Barthes: A Very Short Introduction (Oxford Paperbacks, 2002).

Hawkes, Terence,结构主义和符号学(Methuen, 1977)。

重要系列中的开创性书籍。相当于 Culler，但在我看来做得更好，因为系列格式使简洁和紧凑。

Hawkes, Terence, Structuralism and Semiotics (Methuen, 1977).

A pioneering book in a key series. Equivalent to Culler, but does it better, in my view, because the series format makes for brevity and tightness.

Scholes, Robert，文学结构主义：简介（耶鲁大学出版社，1974 年）。

一本令人钦佩的书。不要被它的年龄推迟。您将找不到与之匹配的任何东西。

Scholes, Robert, Structuralism in Literature: An Introduction (Yale University Press, 1974).

An admirable book. Don’t be put off by its age. You won’t find anything to match it.

Sturrock, John,结构主义(Paladin, 1986)。

涵盖各个领域（语言、社会科学等）的结构主义。第四章对文学结构主义及其前身进行了简洁明了的叙述。

Sturrock, John, Structuralism (Paladin, 1986).

Covers structuralism in a variety of fields (language, social sciences, etc.). Chapter four is a good, succinct account of literary structuralism and its antecedents.

3

后结构主义与解构主义

3

Post-structuralism and deconstruction

结构主义与后结构主义的一些理论差异

Some theoretical differences between structuralism and post-structuralism

后结构主义是结构主义的延续和发展还是对结构主义的一种反叛？在一个重要的意义上是后者，因为一种非常有效的反抗方式是指责你的前任没有勇气坚持自己的信念。因此，后结构主义者指责结构主义者没有遵循他们的知识体系所基于的关于语言的观点的含义。正如我们所见，结构主义的一个典型观点是，语言不仅仅反映或记录世界：相反，它塑造世界，因此我们如何看待世界我们看。后结构主义者认为，这种信念的后果是我们进入了一个充满不确定性的宇宙，因为我们无法访问任何超出语言处理范围的固定地标，因此我们没有确定的标准来衡量任何事物。如果没有一个固定的参考点来衡量运动，您根本无法判断自己是否在运动。你可能有过坐在一列静止的火车上，而另一列火车介于你和远处站台之间的经历。当那列火车开始移动时，你可能会觉得这是你的正在移动的火车，当另一列火车离开并且您再次看到平台的固定点时才意识到事实并非如此。后结构主义说，实际上，通过适当地采纳结构主义者对语言的看法，固定的知识参考点将被永久删除。或者，换个比喻，在太空中，没有引力的地方，就没有上下，这些关于语言的声明将我们带入一个没有引力的宇宙，没有颠倒或正向上升。这种没有智力参考点的情况是描述后结构主义者所说的去中心化宇宙的一种方式，根据定义，我们无法知道我们在其中的位置，因为之前定义中心的所有概念，因此边距也以稍后描述的方式被“解构”或破坏。

Is post-structuralism a continuation and development of structuralism or a form of rebellion against it? In one important sense it is the latter, since a very effective way of rebelling is to accuse your predecessors of not having the courage of their convictions. Thus post-structuralists accuse structuralists of not following through the implications of the views about language on which their intellectual system is based. As we saw, one of structuralism’s characteristic views is the notion that language doesn’t just reflect or record the world: rather, it shapes it, so that how we see is what we see. The post-structuralist maintains that the consequences of this belief are that we enter a universe of radical uncertainty, since we can have no access to any fixed landmark which is beyond linguistic processing, and hence we have no certain standard by which to measure anything. Without a fixed point of reference against which to measure movement you cannot tell whether or not you are moving at all. You have probably at some time had the experience of sitting in a stationary train with another train between yourself and the far platform. When that train begins to move you may have the sensation that it is your train which is moving and only realise this isn’t so when the other train has gone and you again see the fixed point of the platform. Post-structuralism says, in effect, that fixed intellectual reference points are permanently removed by properly taking on board what structuralists said about language. Or, to change the analogy, in space, where there is no gravity, there is no up and down, and these pronoucements about language send us into a gravity-free universe, without upside down or right way up. This situation, of being without intellectual reference points, is one way of describing what post-structuralists call the decentred universe, one in which, by definition, we cannot know where we are, since all the concepts which previously defined the centre, and hence also the margins, have been ‘deconstructed’, or undermined, in the manner described later.

正如这里所暗示的，后结构主义的典型关注点乍一看似乎很遥远。我们可能会问，为什么对语言的这种持续的高度焦虑，在大多数时间似乎都可以很好地用于日常目的时？但经过反思，我们可能会发现，正是在语言焦虑这个问题上，我们最容易认同后结构主义的担忧，因为每当我们不得不在日常日常使用之外的任何层面使用语言时，这些焦虑情绪似乎非常普遍。与我们非常了解并且地位与我们自己相同的人交流。例如，想想任何不太直接的语言情况，比如写信给你的银行、写一篇文章、在聚会上与陌生人建立友谊，或者发送一封吊唁信。在这些情况下，还有更多，几乎所有人都感到焦虑，担心语言会表达我们不想要的东西，或者传达错误的印象，或者暴露我们的无知、冷酷或困惑。即使当我们使用像“如果你明白我的意思”或“以某种方式说话”这样的短语时，也有同样的潜在意义，即我们并没有真正控制语言系统。这些感觉，从字面上看，与解构主义的典型代表——激进的语言怀疑主义实际上是相同的，或者至少肯定有相同的来源。那么，这是进入后结构主义心态的一种方式，这种心态很大程度上存在于我们大多数人所经历的态度和焦虑之中。即使当我们使用像“如果你明白我的意思”或“以某种方式说话”这样的短语时，也有同样的潜在意义，即我们并没有真正控制语言系统。这些感觉，从字面上看，与解构主义的典型代表——激进的语言怀疑主义实际上是相同的，或者至少肯定有相同的来源。那么，这是进入后结构主义心态的一种方式，这种心态很大程度上存在于我们大多数人所经历的态度和焦虑之中。即使当我们使用像“如果你明白我的意思”或“以某种方式说话”这样的短语时，也有同样的潜在意义，即我们并没有真正控制语言系统。这些感觉，从字面上看，与解构主义的典型代表——激进的语言怀疑主义实际上是相同的，或者至少肯定有相同的来源。那么，这是进入后结构主义心态的一种方式，这种心态很大程度上存在于我们大多数人所经历的态度和焦虑之中。

The characteristic concerns of post-structuralism, as hinted at here, may at first seem pretty remote. Why this constant high anxiety about language, we might ask, when it seems to work perfectly well most of the time for day-to-day purposes? But on reflection we may find that it is precisely on this matter of anxiety about language that we can most easily identify with post-structuralist concerns, for these anxious feelings seem remarkably pervasive whenever we have to use language at any level beyond that of casual daily exchange with people we know very well and whose status is the same as our own. For instance, think of any slightly less straightforward language situation, like writing to your bank, writing an essay, striking up a friendship with a stranger at a party, or sending a letter of condolence. In these cases, and many more, there is an almost universally felt anxiety that the language will express things we hadn’t intended, or convey the wrong impression, or betray our ignorance, callousness, or confusion. Even when we use a phrase like ‘If you see what I mean’ or ‘In a manner of speaking’ there is the same underlying sense that we are not really in control of the linguistic system. These feelings, writ large, are really the same, or, at least, surely have the same source, as the radical linguistic scepticism which is so typical of deconstruction. Here, then, is a way into the post-structuralist frame of mind which lies very much within attitudes and anxieties which most of us experience.

然而，简单地在以下四个标题下列出结构主义和后结构主义之间的一些区别和区别可能会有所帮助。

However, perhaps it will be helpful simply to list some differences and distinctions between structuralism and post-structuralism, under the four headings below.

1.起源结构主义最终源于语言学。语言学是一门始终对建立客观知识的可能性充满信心的学科。它认为，如果我们准确地观察，系统地收集数据，并进行逻辑推理，然后我们就可以得出关于语言和世界的可靠结论。结构主义继承了这种自信的科学观：它也相信方法、系统和理性能够建立可靠的真理。

1. Origins Structuralism derives ultimately from linguistics. Linguistics is a discipline which has always been inherently confident about the possibility of establishing objective knowledge. It believes that if we observe accurately, collect data systematically, and make logical deductions then we can reach reliable conclusions about language and the world. Structuralism inherits this confidently scientific outlook: it too believes in method, system, and reason as being able to establish reliable truths.

相比之下，后结构主义最终源于哲学。哲学是一门学科，它总是倾向于强调获得关于事物的可靠知识的困难。这种观点体现在尼采的名言“没有事实，只有解释”中。可以说，哲学本质上是怀疑的，通常会削弱和质疑常识性的概念和假设。它的程序通常始于质疑通常认为理所当然的事物的本来面目。后结构主义继承了这种怀疑主义的习惯，并强化了它。它认为对科学方法的任何信心都是幼稚的，甚至从确定地知道我们不能肯定知道任何事情，充分意识到这样做所带来的讽刺和悖论。
By contrast, post-structuralism derives ultimately from philosophy. Philosophy is a discipline which has always tended to emphasise the difficulty of achieving secure knowledge about things. This point of view is encapsulated in Nietzsche’s famous remark ‘There are no facts, only interpretations’. Philosophy is, so to speak, sceptical by nature and usually undercuts and questions commonsensical notions and assumptions. Its procedures often begin by calling into question what is usually taken for granted as simply the way things are. Post-structuralism inherits this habit of scepticism, and intensifies it. It regards any confidence in the scientific method as naive, and even derives a certain masochistic intellectual pleasure from knowing for certain that we can’t know anything for certain, fully conscious of the irony and paradox which doing this entails.

2.语气和风格结构主义写作倾向于抽象和概括：它的目标是一种超然的、“科学的冷静”的语气。鉴于它源自语言学，这正是我们所期望的。像罗兰·巴特 (Roland Barthes) 1966 年的作品“叙事结构分析导论”（转载于Image, Music, Text, ed. Stephen Heath, 1977）这样的文章是这种语气和处理方式的典型代表，其分立的步骤有序地阐述，完整与图表。风格是中立和匿名的，这是科学写作的典型风格。

2. Tone and style Structuralist writing tends towards abstraction and generalisation: it aims for a detached, ‘scientific coolness’ of tone. Given its derivation from linguistic science, this is what we would expect. An essay like Roland Barthes’s 1966 piece ‘Introduction to the Structural Analysis of Narrative’ (reprinted in Image, Music, Text, ed. Stephen Heath, 1977) is typical of this tone and treatment, with its discrete steps in an orderly exposition, complete with diagrams. The style is neutral and anonymous, as is typical of scientific writing.

相比之下，后结构主义写作往往更情绪化。通常语气急促而欣快，风格张扬而刻意炫耀。标题很可能包含双关语和典故，并且论点的中心线通常基于双关语或某种文字游戏。
Post-structuralist writing, by contrast, tends to be much more emotive. Often the tone is urgent and euphoric, and the style flamboyant and self-consciously showy. Titles may well contain puns and allusions, and often the central line of the argument is based on a pun or a word-play of some kind.
解构性写作通常着眼于语言的某些“物质”方面，例如作家使用的隐喻或单词的词源。总的来说，它似乎旨在提供一种参与的温暖，而不是超然的冷静。
Often deconstructive writing fixes on some ‘material’ aspect of language, such as a metaphor used by a writer, or the etymology of a word. Overall it seems to aim for an engaged warmth rather than detached coolness.

3.对语言的态度结构主义者认为世界是通过语言建构的，因为除了通过语言媒介我们无法接触到现实。全部都一样，它决定接受这个事实并继续使用语言来思考和感知。毕竟，语言是一个有序的系统，而不是一个混乱的系统，所以意识到我们对它的依赖并不一定会导致智力上的绝望。

3. Attitude to language Structuralists accept that the world is constructed through language, in the sense that we do not have access to reality other than through the linguistic medium. All the same, it decides to live with that fact and continue to use language to think and perceive with. After all, language is an orderly system, not a chaotic one, so realising our dependence upon it need not induce intellectual despair.

相比之下，后结构主义在坚持认为现实本身实际上是文本的观点的后果方面更加原教旨主义。后结构主义发展了对实现任何目标的可能性的最终焦虑。通过语言获得知识。在它看来，语言符号不断地漂浮在它应该指定的概念之外。因此，后结构主义者谈论语言的方式涉及一种基于液体的相当强迫性的意象——符号漂浮在它们指定的东西之外，意义是流动的，并且受到不断的“滑移”或“溢出”的影响。这种语言液体，不可预测地四处溅洒和溢出，违背了我们在我们称之为文字的容器中小心地将意义从“给予者”传递到“接受者”的尝试。我们不能完全控制语言的媒介，所以意义不能在固定的地方播下，就像有人种了一排马铃薯种子一样；它们只能随机散布或“散布”，就像播种机走来走去并挥舞着手臂散播种子，
By contrast, post-structuralism is much more fundamentalist in insisting upon the consequences of the view that, in effect, reality itself is textual. Post-structuralism develops what threaten to become terminal anxieties about the possibility of achieving any knowledge through language. The verbal sign, in its view, is constantly floating free of the concept it is supposed to designate. Thus, the post-structuralist’s way of speaking about language involves a rather obsessive imagery based on liquids – signs float free of what they designate, meanings are fluid, and subject to constant ‘slippage’ or ‘spillage’. This linguistic liquid, slopping about and swilling over unpredictably, defies our attempts to carry signification carefully from ‘giver’ to ‘receiver’ in the containers we call words. We are not fully in control of the medium of language, so meanings cannot be planted in set places, like somebody planting a row of potato seeds; they can only be randomly scattered or ‘disseminated’, like the planter walking along and scattering seed with broad sweeps of the arm, so that much of it lands unpredictably or drifts in the wind.
同样，词的含义也永远不能保证百分百纯正。因此，词语总是被它们的对立面“污染”——你不能在不参考白天的情况下定义夜晚，或者在不参考邪恶的情况下定义善。或者它们被它们自己的历史所干扰，以至于过时的感官在当今的使用中保留了一个麻烦和幽灵般的存在，并且很可能在我们认为可以安全使用它们的时候出现。因此，像“客人”这样看似无辜的词在词源上与“hostis”同源，意思是敌人或陌生人，从而无意中表明了客人总是可能不受欢迎的身份（见下文，第 68 页）). 同样，长期处于休眠状态的词语隐喻基础经常会因为它们在哲学或文学中的使用而被重新激活，然后干扰字面意义，或干扰单一含义的陈述。因此，语言焦虑是后结构主义观点的基调。
Likewise, the meanings words have can never be guaranteed one hundred per cent pure. Thus, words are always ‘contaminated’ by their opposites – you can’t define night without reference to day, or good without reference to evil. Or else they are interfered with by their own history, so that obsolete senses retain a troublesome and ghostly presence within present-day usage, and are likely to materialise just when we thought it was safe to use them. Thus, a seemingly innocent word like ‘guest’ is etymologically cognate with ‘hostis’, which means an enemy or a stranger, thereby inadvertently manifesting the always potentially unwelcome status of the guest (see below, p. 68). Likewise, the long-dormant metaphorical bases of words are often reactiviated by their use in philosophy or literature and then interfere with literal sense, or with the stating of single meanings. Linguistic anxiety, then, is a keynote of the post-structuralist outlook.

4.项目这里的“项目”是指每个运动的基本目标，他们想说服我们的是什么。结构主义首先质疑我们对现实进行结构化和分类的方式，促使我们摆脱习惯性的感知或分类模式，但它相信我们可以由此获得更可靠的事物观。

4. Project By ‘project’ here I mean the fundamental aims of each movement, what it is they want to persuade us of. Structuralism, firstly, questions our way of structuring and categorising reality, and prompts us to break free of habitual modes of perception or categorisation, but it believes that we can thereby attain a more reliable view of things.

后结构主义更为根本：它不相信理性的概念，也不相信人类作为一个独立实体的想法，更喜欢“溶解”或“建构”主体的概念，据此我们可以认为是个体实际上是社会和语言力量的产物——也就是说，根本不是本质，而仅仅是“文本组织”。因此，它的怀疑主义火炬烧毁了西方文明赖以建立的思想基础。
Post-structuralism is much more fundamental: it distrusts the very notion of reason, and the idea of the human being as an independent entity, preferring the notion of the ‘dissolved’ or ‘constructed’ subject, whereby what we may think of as the individual is really a product of social and linguistic forces – that is, not an essence at all, merely a ‘tissue of textualities’. Thus, its torch of scepticism burns away the intellectual ground on which the Western civilisation is built.

后结构主义——去中心化星球上的生活

Post-structuralism – life on a decentred planet

后结构主义于 1960 年代末在法国兴起。与这种出现最密切相关的两个人物是罗兰巴特和雅克德里达（1930-2004）。巴特这段时期的作品开始发生性质转变，从结构主义阶段转向后结构主义阶段。通过比较巴特对叙事本质的两个不同描述，可以看出差异，每个阶段都有一个描述，即论文“叙事的结构分析”（1966 年首次出版，并在Image, Music, Text, ed. Stephen Heath, 1977) 和文本的乐趣(1973)。前者是详细的、方法论的和令人生畏的技术，而后者实际上只是一系列随机的叙述评论，按字母顺序排列，因此，当然，强调了材料的随机性。在这两部作品之间出现了至关重要的论文“作者之死”（1968 年），这是巴特从结构主义转向后结构主义的“转折点”。在那篇文章中，他宣布了作者的死亡，这是一种断言文学文本独立性的修辞方式，它不受任何关于作者可能有意或“精心设计”的概念的统一或限制的可能性进入工作。相反，这篇文章声明了彻底的文本独立性：作品不是由意图或上下文决定的。相反，文本由于其所有这些限制的性质而自由。因此，正如巴特在文章中所说，作者死亡的必然结果是读者的诞生。因此，1966 年的论文和 1973 年的书之间的区别在于，注意力从被视为作者创作的文本转移到被视为读者创作的文本，并且可以说是由语言本身创作的，因为正如巴特 (Barthes)还说，在没有作者的情况下，破译文本的要求变得徒劳。因此，后结构主义的早期阶段似乎允许并陶醉于意义的无休止的自由发挥和对所有形式的文本权威的逃避。后来，芭芭拉·约翰逊 (Barbara Johnson) 的引文（第 68-9 页）中建议从这种文本宽容不可避免地转变为更有纪律和更严格的文本共和主义。为了她，

Post-structuralism emerged in France in the late 1960s. The two figures most closely associated with this emergence are Roland Barthes and Jacques Derrida (1930–2004). Barthes’s work around this time began to shift in character and move from a structuralist phase to a post-structuralist phase. The difference can be seen by comparing two different accounts by Barthes of the nature of the narrative, one from each phase, namely the essay ‘The Structural Analysis of Narrative’ (first published in 1966 and reprinted in Image, Music, Text, ed. Stephen Heath, 1977) and The Pleasure of the Text (1973). The former is detailed, methodological and forbiddingly technical, while the latter is really just a series of random comments on narrative, arranged alphabetically, thereby, of course, emphasising the randomness of the material. Between these two works came the crucial essay ‘The Death of the Author’ (1968) which is the ‘hinge’ round which Barthes turns from structuralism to post-structuralism. In that essay he announces the death of the author, which is a rhetorical way of asserting the independence of the literary text and its immunity to the possibility of being unified or limited by any notion of what the author might have intended, or ‘crafted’ into the work. Instead, the essay makes a declaration of radical textual independence: the work is not determined by intention, or context. Rather, the text is free by its very nature of all such restraints. Hence, as Barthes says in the essay, the corollary of the death of the author is the birth of the reader. So the difference between the 1966 essay and the 1973 book is a shift of attention from the text seen as something produced by the author to the text seen as something produced by the reader, and, as it were, by language itself, for as Barthes also says, in the absence of an author, the claim to decipher a text becomes futile. Hence, this early phase of post-structuralism seems to license and revel in the endless free play of meanings and the escape from all forms of textual authority. Later there is an inevitable shift from this textual permissiveness to the more disciplined and austere textual republicanism suggested in the quotation (pp. 68–9) from Barbara Johnson. For her, deconstruction is not a hedonistic abandonment of all restraint, but a disciplined identification and dismantling of the sources of textual power.

1960 年代后期后结构主义发展的第二个关键人物是哲学家雅克德里达。事实上，后结构主义的起点可以看作是他 1966 年的演讲“人文科学话语中的结构、符号和游戏”（多次重印，例如以缩写形式出现在 KM 牛顿的《二十世纪文学理论：读者》中，麦克米伦出版社，1988 年）。在本文中，德里达在现代看到了一个特定的知识“事件”，它构成了与过去思维方式的彻底决裂，并将这种决裂与尼采和海德格尔的哲学以及弗洛伊德的精神分析松散地联系起来。该事件涉及我们知识领域的“去中心化”。在此事件之前，所有事物都有一个规范或中心的存在被认为是理所当然的：因此，正如文艺复兴时期的口号所说，“人”是衡量宇宙中所有其他事物的尺度：西方白人的着装规范、行为规范、体系结构、思想观点等提供了一个坚实的中心，可以检测到偏差、偏差和变化，并将其识别为“其他”和边缘。然而，在二十世纪，这些中心被摧毁或侵蚀；有时这是由历史事件引起的——例如第一次世界大战摧毁了稳定的物质进步的幻想，或者大屠杀摧毁了欧洲作为人类文明的源头和中心的观念；有时它是因为科学发现而发生的——比如这个概念的方式相对论摧毁了时间和空间作为固定和中心绝对的观念；有时，最后，它是由知识或艺术革命引起的——例如本世纪头三十年现代主义艺术拒绝诸如音乐和谐、叙事中的时间顺序和视觉表现等核心绝对主义的方式艺术世界。

The second key figure in the development of post-structuralism in the late 1960s is the philosopher Jacques Derrida. Indeed, the starting point of post-structuralism may be taken as his 1966 lecture ‘Structure, Sign and Play in the Discourse of the Human Sciences’ (variously reprinted, for example in abbreviated form in K. M. Newton’s Twentieth Century Literary Theory: A Reader, Macmillan, 1988). In this paper Derrida sees in modern times a particular intellectual ‘event’ which constitutes a radical break from past ways of thought, loosely associating this break with the philosophy of Nietzsche and Heidegger and the psychoanalysis of Freud. The event concerns the ‘decentring’ of our intellectual universe. Prior to this event the existence of a norm or centre in all things was taken for granted: thus ‘man’, as the Renaissance slogan had it, was the measure of all other things in the universe: white Western norms of dress, behaviour, architecture, intellectual outlook, and so on, provided a firm centre against which deviations, aberrations, variations could be detected and identified as ‘Other’ and marginal. In the twentieth century, however, these centres were destroyed or eroded; sometimes this was caused by historical events – such as the way the First World War destroyed the illusion of steady material progress, or the way the Holocaust destroyed the notion of Europe as the source and centre of human civilisation; sometimes it happened because of scientific discoveries – such as the way the notion of relativity destroyed the ideas of time and space as fixed and central absolutes; and sometimes, finally, it was caused by intellectual or artistic revolutions – such as the way modernism in the arts in the first thirty years of the century rejected such central absolutes as harmony in music, chronological sequence in narrative, and the representation of the visual world in art.

在由此产生的宇宙中，没有绝对值或固定点，因此我们生活的宇宙是“去中心的”或本质上相对论的。我们所拥有的不是移动或偏离已知中心，而是“自由游戏”（或文章标题中的“游戏”）。在演讲中，德里达将这个去中心化的自由游戏世界视为解放，就像巴特在《作者之死》中庆祝作者的消亡一样，迎来了一个欢乐的自由时代。这个新的去中心化宇宙的后果是无法预测的，但我们必须努力避免成为“那些……面对尚未命名的自我宣告而将目光移开的人”（牛顿，第 154 页）). 这种强烈的、类似宗教的呼吁，呼吁我们不要把眼睛从光上移开，这是后结构主义写作中经常带有世界末日色彩的典型基调。如果我们有勇气，这意味着，我们将进入这个尼采式的新宇宙，那里没有确定的事实，只有解释，没有任何解释带有权威的印记，因为不再有任何权威中心可以呼吁验证我们的解释。

In the resulting universe there are no absolutes or fixed points, so that the universe we live in is ‘decentred’ or inherently relativistic. Instead of movement or deviation from a known centre, all we have is ‘free play’ (or ‘play’ as the title of the essay has it). In the lecture Derrida embraces this decentred universe of free play as liberating, just as Barthes in ‘The Death of the Author’ celebrates the demise of the author as ushering in an era of joyous freedom. The consequences of this new decentred universe are impossible to predict, but we must endeavour not to be among ‘those who … turn their eyes away in the face of the as yet unnameable which is proclaiming itself’ (Newton, p. 154). This powerful, quasi-religious appeal to us not to turn our eyes away from the light is typical of the often apocalyptic tone of post-structuralist writing. If we have the courage, the implication is, we will enter this new Nietzschean universe, where there are no guaranteed facts, only interpretations, none of which has the stamp of authority upon it, since there is no longer any authoritative centre to which to appeal for validation of our intepretations.

次年，德里达出版了三本书（译为《言语与现象》、《文字学》 、 《写作与差异》），这证实了德里达的崛起). 所有这些书都是哲学而非文学主题，但德里达的方法总是涉及对其他哲学家作品的选定方面进行高度详细的“解构”阅读，这些解构方法已被文学评论家借鉴并用于文学阅读作品。从本质上讲，对文学文本的解构阅读往往会使它们成为我们一直在讨论的去中心化宇宙的象征。以前被视为统一的艺术作品的文本被证明是支离破碎的、自我分裂的和无中心的。他们总是被证明是“结构、符号和游戏”结尾处预测的“怪物诞生”的代表。

Derrida’s rise to prominence was confirmed by the publication of three books by him in the following year (translated as Speech and Phenomena, Of Grammatology, and Writing and Difference). All of these books are on philosophical rather than literary topics, but Derrida’s method always involves the highly detailed ‘deconstructive’ reading of selected aspects of other philosophers’ works, and these deconstructive methods have been borrowed by literary critics and used in the reading of literary works. Essentially, the deconstructive reading of literary texts tends to make them emblems of the decentred universe we have been discusssing. Texts previously regarded as unified artistic artefacts are shown to be fragmented, self-divided, and centreless. They always turn out to be representative of the ‘monstrous births’ predicted at the end of ‘Structure, Sign, and Play’.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

后结构主义的重要著作是德里达的《文字学》一书。“文本之外没有任何东西”这句​​口号是这本书中被引用最多的一句话，但它通常被断章取义以证明一种极端的文本主义，认为所有的现实都是语言的，因此可以谈论毫无疑问存在于语言之外的“真实”世界是毫无意义的。

A key text in post-structuralism is Derrida’s book Of Grammatology. The slogan ‘There is nothing outside the text’ is the most frequently quoted line from this book, but it is usually quoted out of context to justify a kind of extreme textualism, whereby it is held that all reality is linguistic, so that there can be no meaningful talk of a ‘real’ world which exists without question outside language.

今天否认这种观点是德里达实际提出的观点正变得越来越普遍，虽然我不建议你在这个阶段尝试阅读整本书，但你可以通过使用我在引言中描述的精读技巧，获得书中出现此评论的部分的详细知识。该部分的副标题是“价格过高”。方法问题”（第 157-64 页）。

It is becoming common today to deny that such a view is the one actually put forward by Derrida, and while I do not recommend that you attempt to tackle the whole book at this stage, you could put yourself considerably ahead of many commentators and critics by acquiring a detailed knowledge of the section of the book in which this remark occurs, using the intensive reading technique I describe in the Introduction. The section is subheaded ‘The exorbitant. Question of method’ (pp. 157–64).

德里达在这一部分写的是卢梭的《语言起源论》，但他不再质疑自己解释这篇文章的方法，也不再质疑所有解释的本质。他对“补充”的概念进行了辩论，这个词在法语中也可以表示替代，在语言替代或代表现实的意义上。（这个想法在Of Grammatology的前几页中有概述，第 141-57 页。）但是这种“站在”的本质究竟是什么，因为“写作的人被铭刻在一个确定的文本系统中”（第 135 页）。 160)，也就是说我们都继承了语言作为一个现成的系统，它自己的历史、哲学等等已经“内置”了？从这个意义上说，有人可能会争辩说我们不是用语言来表达自己，而只是语言的某些方面：

Derrida is writing in this section about Rousseau’s ‘Essay on the origin of languages’, but he stops to question his own method of interpreting this text, and hence the nature of all interpretation. He debates the concept of the ‘supplement’, a word which in French can also mean a replacement, in the sense that language replaces or stands in for reality. (This idea is outlined in the immediately preceding pages of Of Grammatology, pp. 141–57.) But what exactly is the nature of this ‘standing in’, since ‘the person writing is inscribed in a determined textual system’ (p. 160), which is to say that we all inherit language as a ready-made system, with its own history, philosophy, and so on already ‘built in’? In this sense one might argue that we don’t express ourselves in words, merely some aspect of language:

作家用一种语言和一种逻辑写作，其适当的系统、规律和生活，他的话语根据定义不能绝对支配。他使用它们只是让自己在某种程度上受制于系统。并且阅读必须始终针对作者所命令的和他所不命令的与他所使用的语言模式之间的某种关系，作者没有察觉到这种关系。这种关系不光影、弱点或力量的某种定量分布，而是批判性阅读应该产生的一种意指结构。
The writer writes in a language and in a logic whose proper systems, laws, and life his discourse by definition cannot dominate absolutely. He uses them by only letting himself, after a fashion and up to a point, be governed by the system. And the reading must always aim at a certain relationship, unperceived by the writer, between what he commands and what he does not command of the patterns of the language that he uses. This relationship is not a certain quantitative distribution of shadow and light, of weakness or of force but a signifying structure that critical reading should produce.

(Derrida, Of Grammatology, p. 158 )

(Derrida, Of Grammatology, p. 158)

因此，阅读和解释不仅仅是再现作者在文本中所想和表达的内容。这种不充分的解释概念德里达称之为“双重评论”，因为它试图重建一个预先存在的、非文本的现实（作者所做或所想的）与文本并存。相反，批判性阅读必须产生文本，因为文本背后没有任何东西可供我们重构。因此，在这个意义上，阅读必须是解构的而不是重建的。这就是德里达发表评论的地方，他后来称之为“这篇文章的轴心命题，即文本之外没有任何东西”（Of Grammatology， 第 163 页）：

Reading and interpretation, then, are not just reproducing what the writer thought and expressed in the text. This inadequate notion of interpretation Derrida calls a ‘doubling commentary’, since it tries to reconstruct a pre-existing, non-textual reality (of what the writer did or thought) to lay alongside the text. Instead, critical reading must produce the text, since there is nothing behind it for us to reconstruct. Thus, the reading has to be deconstructive rather than reconstructive in this sense. This is the point where Derrida makes the remark which he later calls ‘the axial proposition of this essay, that there is nothing outside the text’ (Of Grammatology, p. 163):

阅读……不能合法地将文本越过文本之外的东西……或者朝向文本之外的所指，其内容可能发生，可能已经发生，在语言之外，也就是说，在我们在这里赋予那个词的意义上, 在一般写作之外。这就是为什么我们在这里冒险应用于示例的方法论考虑密切依赖于我们在上面阐述的一般命题；关于指称或先验所指的不存在。文本之外没有任何内容。
Reading … cannot legitimately transgress the text toward something other than it … or toward a signified outside the text whose content could take place, could have taken place, outside of language, that is to say, in the sense that we give here to that word, outside of writing in general. That is why the methodological considerations that we risk applying here to an example are closely dependent on general propositions that we have elaborated above; as regards the absence of the referent or the transcendental signified. There is nothing outside of the text.

（《文字学》， 第 158 页）

(Of Grammatology, p. 158)

他进一步扩展了这一点并重申“在人们认为可以被限制为卢梭文本的东西之外，除了写作之外什么都没有……打开意义和语言的是写作作为自然存在的消失”（第 159 页）。

He expands this further and reiterates that ‘beyond and behind what one believes can be circumscribed as Rousseau’s text, there has never been anything but writing … what opens meaning and language is writing as the disappearance of natural presence’ (p. 159).

无论如何，你不会发现德里达的这些页面很容易，但它们会回报一些密集的工作，最好是在小组讨论中。它们是否使您能够准确地确定德里达所说的关于世界与世界之间关系的内容，他的观点是否像他们经常被指责的那样鲜明和不妥协？

You will not find these pages of Derrida by any means easy, but they will repay some intensive work, ideally in group discussion. Do they enable you to pin down precisely what Derrida is saying about the relationship between word and world, and are his views as stark and uncompromising as they are often accused of being?

结构主义和后结构主义——一些实际差异

Structuralism and post-structuralism – some practical differences

这里的一个最初问题是，后结构主义经常声称它更多的是一种思想态度，而不是一种实用的批评方法。从某种意义上说，这是完全正确的，但对于后结构主义来说，也许并不比任何其他批评取向更真实。毕竟，在什么意义上，马克思主义或女权主义——甚至自由人文主义——批评可以被称为一种方法？当然，只是以最宽松的方式，因为这些都没有提供任何类似于分析文学作品的分步程序。他们所提供的只是针对一个典型的中心问题（即分别针对阶级、性别和个人道德的问题）和构成示例库的工作主体。

An initial problem here is that post-structuralism often claims that it is more an attitude of mind than a practical method of criticism. This is, in a sense, quite true, but perhaps no more true of post-structuralism than of any other critical orientation. After all, in what sense could, say, Marxist or feminist – or even liberal humanist – criticism be called a method? Only in the loosest way, surely, since none of these provide anything like a step by step procedure for analysing literary works. All they offer is an orientation towards a characteristic central issue (that is, towards issues of class, gender, and personal morality, respectively) and a body of work which constitutes a repertoire of examples.

那么，作为一种批评方法，后结构主义的特征似乎是什么？后结构主义文学批评家从事“解构”文本的任务。这个过程被命名为“解构”，可以粗略地定义为应用后结构主义。它通常被称为“逆向阅读”或“逆向阅读文本”，目的是“了解文本，因为它无法了解自身”。（这些是 Terry Eagleton 的定义。）描述这一点的一种方式是说解构阅读揭示了文本的无意识而不是有意识的维度，所有被其明显的文本性掩盖或未能识别的东西。语言中这种被压抑的潜意识可能会被感知，例如，hostis，意思是敌人。这暗示了客人的潜在双重方面，欢迎或不受欢迎，或者从一个转变为另一个。那么，这种“敌意”的概念就像这个词被压抑的无意识，解构过程在揭示文本的无意识时，可能会以这种方式利用词源学等学科。

What, then, seem to be the characteristics of post-structuralism as a critical method? The post-structuralist literary critic is engaged in the task of ‘deconstructing’ the text. This process is given the name ‘deconstruction’, which can roughly be defined as applied post-structuralism. It is often referred to as ‘reading against the grain’ or ‘reading the text against itself’, with the purpose of ‘knowing the text as it cannot know itself’. (These are Terry Eagleton’s definitions.) A way of describing this would be to say that deconstructive reading uncovers the unconscious rather than the conscious dimension of the text, all the things which its overt textuality glosses over or fails to recognise. This repressed unconscious within language might be sensed, for instance, in the example used earlier when we said that the word ‘guest’ is cognate with (that is, has the same original root as) the word ‘host’, which in turn comes from the Latin word hostis, meaning an enemy. This hints at the potential double aspect of a guest, as either welcome or unwelcome, or as changing from one to the other. This notion of ‘hostility’, then, is like the repressed unconscious of the word, and the process of deconstruction, in revealing the unconscious of the text, might draw upon such disciplines as etymology in this way.

解构阅读的另一个著名定义是芭芭拉约翰逊在《关键差异》（约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1980 年）中的定义：

Another well-known definition of deconstructive reading is Barbara Johnson’s in The Critical Difference (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1980):

解构不是“破坏”的同义词。事实上，它更接近“分析”一词的本意，即在词源上意味着“撤消”……文本的解构不是通过随机怀疑或任意颠覆来进行的，而是通过仔细梳理文本中交战的意指力量来进行的。
Deconstruction is not synonymous with ‘destruction’. It is in fact much closer to the original meaning of the word ‘analysis’, which etymologically means ‘to undo’ … The deconstruction of a text does not proceed by random doubt or arbitrary subversion, but by the careful teasing out of warring forces of signification within the text.

（约翰逊，关键差异， 第 5 页）

(Johnson, The Critical Difference, p. 5)

德里达自己对解构阅读的描述也有同样的主旨。解构阅读：

Derrida’s own description of deconstructive reading has the same purport. A deconstructive reading:

必须始终着眼于作者所命令的和他所使用的语言模式的不命令之间的某种关系，作者没有察觉到这种关系…… [它] 试图使看不见的东西变得可见。
must always aim at a certain relationship, unperceived by the writer, between what he commands and what he does not command of the patterns of language that he uses … [It] attempts to make the not-seen accessible to sight.

（《文字学》，第 158 和 163 页）

(Of Grammatology, pp. 158 and 163)

JA Cuddon 在他的文学词典术语中断言，在解构主义中：

J. A. Cuddon, in his Dictionary of Literary, Terms, asserts that in deconstruction:

一个文本可以被解读为说的东西与它表面上说的完全不同……它可以被解读为具有多重意义或者说许多不同的东西，这些东西从根本上与可能看到的不一致、矛盾和颠覆被批评为单一的“稳定”之意。因此，文本可能会“背叛”自己。
a text can be read as saying something quite different from what it appears to be saying … it may be read as carrying a plurality of significance or as saying many different things which are fundamentally at variance with, contradictory to and subversive of what may be seen by criticism as a single ‘stable’ meaning. Thus a text may ‘betray’ itself.

（来自解构的条目）

(from the entry on Deconstruction)

因此，解构主义者实践所谓的文本骚扰或对立阅读，阅读的目的是揭露文本中的内在矛盾或不一致，旨在显示其表面统一性背后的不统一性。相比之下，上一代“新批评家”的目的恰恰与此相反，要在表面上的不统一下显示统一。为了实现其目的，解构过程通常会关注文本中看似偶然的细节——例如，特定隐喻的出现——然后将其用作整个文本的关键，以便通读所有内容它。

So the deconstructionist practises what has been called textual harassment or oppositional reading, reading with the aim of unmasking internal contradictions or inconsistencies in the text, aiming to show the disunity which underlies its apparent unity. The aim of the ‘New Critics’ of the previous generation, by contrast, had been precisely the opposite of this, to show the unity beneath apparent disunity. In pursuance of its aims, the deconstructive process will often fix on a detail of the text which looks incidental – the presence of a particular metaphor, for instance – and then use it as the key to the whole text, so that everything is read through it.

在谈论结构主义时，我们讨论了结构主义者如何在文本中寻找平行、回声、反思等特征（第 51 页）。这样做的效果通常是在文本中显示目的的统一性，就好像文本知道它想做什么，并已将其所有手段都用于此目的。相比之下，解构主义者的目的是表明文本在与自身交战：它是一座分裂的、不统一的房子。解构主义者寻找证据各种缝隙、断裂、裂缝和不连续性。因此，显示结构主义和后结构主义在实践层面上的差异的图表可能如下所示：

In talking about structuralism we discussed how structuralists look for such features in the text as parallels, echoes, reflections, and so on (p. 51). The effect of doing this is often to show a unity of purpose within the text, as if the text knows what it wants to do and has directed all its means towards this end. By contrast, the deconstructionist aims to show that the text is at war with itself: it is a house divided, and disunified. The deconstructionist looks for evidence of gaps, breaks, fissures and discontinuities of all kinds. So a diagram showing the differences between structuralism and post-structuralism at the practical level might look like this:

在展示这个例子时，我会回头参考这个列表，并且还会建议一个简单的解构过程的三阶段模型。我将以一些问题结束，以帮助您尝试自己的“工作示例”。

In presenting the example, I will refer back to this list, and will also suggest a simple three-stage model of the deconstructive process. I will end with some questions to help you to try your own ‘worked example’.

后结构主义批评家做什么

What post-structuralist critics do

1. 他们“对照自身阅读文本”以揭示可能被认为是“文本潜意识”的东西，其中表达的意义可能与表面意义直接相反。

1. They ‘read the text against itself’ so as to expose what might be thought of as the ‘textual subconscious’, where meanings are expressed which may be directly contrary to the surface meaning.

2. 他们着重于单词的表面特征——声音的相似性、单词的根本含义、“死的”（或正在死去的）隐喻——并将它们带到前台，使它们成为整体含义的关键。

2. They fix upon the surface features of the words – similarities in sound, the root meanings of words, a ‘dead’ (or dying) metaphor – and bring these to the foreground, so that they become crucial to the overall meaning.

3. 他们试图表明文本的特点是不统一而不是统一。

3. They seek to show that the text is characterised by disunity rather than unity.

4. 他们专注于单个段落并如此深入地分析它，以至于无法维持“单一”的阅读，并且语言会爆炸成“多重意义”。

4. They concentrate on a single passage and analyse it so intensively that it becomes impossible to sustain a ‘univocal’ reading and the language explodes into ‘multiplicities of meaning’.

5. 他们在文本中寻找各种变化和中断，并将这些视为文本压抑、掩饰或默默忽略的证据。这些不连续点有时被称为“断层线”，这是一种地质隐喻，指的是岩层中的断裂，它提供了先前活动和运动的证据。

5. They look for shifts and breaks of various kinds in the text and see these as evidence of what is repressed or glossed over or passsed over in silence by the text. These discontinuities are sometimes called ‘fault-lines’, a geological metaphor referring to the breaks in rock formations which give evidence of previous activity and movement.

解构：一个例子

Deconstruction: an example

我在这里试图举一个解构主义实践的明确例子，展示它的独特之处，同时暗示它可能不会与更熟悉的批评形式完全决裂。

I try here to give a clear example of deconstructive practice, showing what is distinctive about it while at the same time suggesting it may not constitute a complete break with more familiar forms of criticism.

我将这里描述的解构过程的三个阶段称为口头、文本和语言。它们使用迪伦·托马斯 (Dylan Thomas) 的诗“拒绝哀悼伦敦一个孩子被火烧死”（附录 2）来说明。

The three stages of the deconstructive process described here I have called the verbal, the textual, and the linguistic. They are illustrated using Dylan Thomas’s poem ‘A Refusal to Mourn the Death, by Fire, of a Child in London’ (Appendix 2).

言语阶段与更传统形式的细读非常相似，正如 1920 年代和 30 年代在 Empson 的七种歧义和其他地方所开创的那样。它涉及在文本中寻找悖论和矛盾，在所谓的纯文字层面。例如，托马斯诗的最后一行是“第一次死亡之后，再无其他”。这个陈述自相矛盾并反驳自己：如果某物被称为第一，则隐含了第二、第三、第四等的序列。所以，“第一次的死”这个短语在字面上清楚地暗示着成为别人。对解构主义者来说，这种内部矛盾表明了语言特有的不可靠性和易变性，稍后将对此进行详细说明。诗中还有其他此类例子。请再看看这首诗，看看你能不能认出别人。您可能首先考虑将“直到”一词与“从不”结合使用。

The verbal stage is very similar to that of more conventional forms of close reading, as pioneered in the 1920s and 1930s in Empson’s Seven Types of Ambiguity, and elsewhere. It involves looking in the text for paradoxes and contradictions, at what might be called the purely verbal level. For instance, the final line of Thomas’s poem reads ‘After the first death there is no other’. This statement contradicts and refutes itself: if something is called the first then a sequence is implied of second, third, fourth, and so on. So, the phrase ‘the first death’ clearly implies, at the literal level, that there will be others. Internal contradictions of this kind are indicative, for the deconstructionist, of language’s endemic unreliability and slipperiness, of which more will be said later. There are other examples of this kind in the poem. Please look again at the poem and see if you can identify others. You might begin by considering the use of the word ‘until’ in combination with ‘never’.

与此相关的后结构主义的另一个方面是它倾向于颠倒常见的二元对立的极性，如男性和女性、白天和黑夜、光明和黑暗等等，因此第二个术语而不是第一个术语是“享有特权'并被认为是更可取的。因此，在诗中似乎是黑暗而不是光明，它被视为孕育着生命，正如诗人所说的“人类”制作/鸟兽和花朵/父亲和所有谦卑的黑暗'。这个悖论反映了这首诗的世界既是我们生活的世界的可识别版本，又是那个世界的倒置。对解构主义者来说，同样，这样的时刻是语言不反映或传达我们的世界但构成它自己的世界的方式的症状，一种平行宇宙或虚拟现实。那么，识别像这样的矛盾或矛盾的短语是违背这首诗的主旨的第一步，“反对它自己”来阅读它，展示“能指”与“所指”的战争，并揭示其被压抑的潜意识。第一阶段总是会出现有用的材料以供后续阶段使用。

One other facet of post-structuralism relevant here is its tendency to reverse the polarity of common binary oppositions like male and female, day and night, light and dark, and so on, so that the second term, rather than the first, is ‘privileged’ and regarded as the more desirable. Thus, in the poem it seems to be darkness, rather than light, which is seen as engendering life, as the poet talks of ‘the mankind making / Bird beast and flower / Fathering and all humbling darkness’. This paradox reflects the way the world of this poem is simultaneously a recognisable version of the world we live in, and an inversion of that world. For the deconstructionist, again, such moments are symptomatic of the way language doesn’t reflect or convey our world but constitutes a world of its own, a kind of parallel universe or virtual reality. Identifying contradictory or paradoxical phrases like these, then, is the first step in going against the grain of the poem, reading it ‘against itself’, showing the ‘signifiers’ at war with the ‘signified’, and revealing its repressed unconscious. This first stage will always turn up useful material for use in the later stages.

该方法的“文本”阶段超越了单个短语，对诗歌采取了更全面的看法。在第二阶段，批评家正在寻找诗歌连续性的转变或中断：这些转变揭示了态度的不稳定，因此缺乏固定统一的立场。它们可以是多种多样的（如前面给出的图表中所列）；它们可能是焦点的变化、时间的变化、语气的变化、观点的变化、态度的变化、节奏的变化或词汇的变化。它们很可能在语法中表示出来，例如，从第一人称到第三人称，或过去时到现在的转变。因此，与第一阶段的情况相比，它们在更大范围内表现出悖论和矛盾，将文本作为一个整体进行广泛的观察。例如，在“拒绝哀悼”的情况下，时间和观点发生了重大变化，不是一个顺利的时间顺序。因此，前两节想象了地质万古的流逝和“世界末日”的到来——最后的曙光破灭，大海终于平静，产生“鸟兽花”的循环结束了“一切卑微的黑暗”降临。但第三节以现在为中心——孩子的实际死亡，“孩子之死的威严和燃烧”。最后一节与前两节一样有着广阔的视野，但它似乎以伦敦有记载的历史的历史进程为中心，正如“无哀的水/骑马的泰晤士河”所见证的那样。因此，没有提供任何单一的更广泛的背景来以明确的视角“框架”和语境化儿童的死亡，而托马斯诗歌中的转变使得他的意思很难根植。

The ‘textual’ stage of the method moves beyond individual phrases and takes a more overall view of the poem. At this second stage the critic is looking for shifts or breaks in the continuity of the poem: these shifts reveal instabilities of attitude, and hence the lack of a fixed and unified position. They can be of various kinds (as listed in the diagram given earlier); they may be shifts in focus, shifts in time, or tone, or point of view, or attitude, or pace, or vocabulary. They may well be indicated in the grammar, for instance, in a shift from first person to third, or past tense to present. Thus, they show paradox and contradiction on a larger scale than is the case with the first stage, taking a broad view of the text as a whole. In the case of ‘A Refusal to Mourn’, for instance, there are major time shifts and changes in viewpoint, not a smooth chronological progression. Thus, the first two stanzas imagine the passing of geological aeons and the coming of the ‘end of the world’ – the last light breaks, the sea finally becomes still, the cycle which produces ‘Bird beast and flower’ comes to an end as ‘all humbling darkness’ descends. But the third stanza is centred on the present – the actual death of the child, ‘The majesty and burning of the child’s death’. The final stanza takes a broad vista like the first two, but it seems to centre on the historical progression of the recorded history of London, as witnessed by ‘the unmourning water / Of the riding Thames’. Hence, no single wider context is provided to ‘frame’ and contextualise the death of the child in a defined perspective, and the shifts in Thomas’s poem make it very difficult to ground his meaning at all.

再看看这首诗，看看你是否能发现这种更大规模的“文本”级别的中断和不连续的其他例子。请注意，遗漏在这里很重要，也就是说，当文本没有告诉我们我们希望被告知的事情时。你可能会问诗人是否告诉我们他为什么拒绝哀悼，或者更确切地说，为什么没有执行不这样做的明确意图。

Look again at the poem to see if you can detect other examples of this larger scale ‘textual’ level of breaks and discontinuities. Note that omissions are important here, that is, when a text doesn’t tell us things we would expect to be told. You might begin by asking whether the poet tells us why he refuses to mourn, or rather, why the expressed intention of not doing so is not carried out.

最后，“语言”阶段包括在诗歌中寻找语言本身作为交流媒介的充分性受到质疑的时刻。例如，当隐含或明确提及语言的不可靠性或不可信时，就会出现这种情况。例如，它可能涉及说某事是不可说的；或说不可能说出或描述某事然后又这样做；或者说语言夸大、缩小或歪曲了它的对象，然后继续使用它。例如，在“拒绝哀悼”中，整首诗都按照它所说的去做做：说话者声称他拒绝哀悼，但诗歌本身构成了哀悼行为。然后在第三节中，说话者说他不会“谋杀/带着严肃的事实离开她的人类”。这谴责了所有公认的谈论这一事件的方式，并且诗人声称站在陈词滥调、挽歌立场或“话语实践”的可用范围之外，仿佛超越这些必然妥协的话语形式的某种“纯粹”立场是可能的。然而，紧随其后的不是寂静，而是最后一节庄严的、准礼仪式的宣告：“伦敦的女儿躺在第一个死者的深处”，演讲者宣称，这听起来很像传统的赞颂演说，与死者化身为超凡脱俗的英雄人物，

The ‘linguistic’ stage, finally, involves looking for moments in the poem when the adequacy of language itself as a medium of communication is called into question. Such moments occur when, for example, there is implicit or explicit reference to the unreliability or untrustworthiness of language. It may involve, for instance, saying that something is unsayable; or saying that it is impossible to utter or describe something and then doing so; or saying that language inflates, or deflates, or misrepresents its object, and then continuing to use it anyway. In ‘A Refusal to Mourn’, for instance, the whole poem does what it says it won’t do: the speaker professes his refusal to mourn, but the poem itself constitutes an act of mourning. Then in the third stanza the speaker says that he will not ‘murder / The mankind of her going with a grave truth’. This condemns all the accepted ways of speaking about this event, and the poet professes to stand outside the available range of clichéd, elegiac stances or ‘discursive practices’, as if some ‘pure’ stance beyond these necessarily compromised forms of utterance were possible. Yet this is followed, not by silence, but by the solemn, quasi-liturgical pronouncements of the final stanza: ‘Deep with the first dead lies London’s daughter’, the speaker proclaims, which sounds very like traditional panegyrical oratory, with the dead person transformed into some larger than life heroic figure, becoming ‘London’s daughter’ (an impossible designation for her in life), ‘robed’ as for some great procession of the dead of all the ages, and now reunited with Mother Earth in the form of the London clay in which she is now buried.

在这首诗中，我们可以说，托马斯发现了语言陷阱，然后掉了进去。考虑到这个“文本”层面，再看一遍这首诗。是否还有其他例子表明 Thomas 被迫使用他刚刚展示的修辞策略？你可以先看看他对“母亲”和“女儿”这两个词的使用，然后思考关于这些词所暗示的隐喻“家庭”的性质。其他需要注意的隐喻结构是“谋杀”一词和“无哀悼”的泰晤士河概念中所包含的那些。

In this poem, we might say, Thomas identifies the language trap, and then falls into it. Look again at the poem with this ‘textual’ level in mind. Are there other examples of Thomas’s being forced to use the rhetorical strategies he has just exposed? You might start by looking at his use of the words ‘mother’ and ‘daughter’ and thinking about the nature of the metaphorical ‘family’ implied by these words. Other metaphorical constructs to look at are those entailed in the word ‘murder’ and in the notion of the ‘unmourning’ Thames.

一旦这首诗的精髓被打开，它就无法长期承受施加在它身上的解构压力，并以支离破碎的、矛盾的、文化和语言病症的症状展现自己。像这样的三步模型将适用于其他材料的应用；它赋予这种方法作为一种批判性实践的独特性，并将解构主义的优点和缺点置于审查之下，就像其他方法一样。那么，解构阅读的目的是产生- 统一，表明看似统一和连贯的东西实际上包含文本无法稳定和包含的矛盾和冲突。我们可以将其描述为唤醒沉睡的意指犬并将它们放在一起。相比之下，更传统的细读方式却有着相反的目的：他们会把一篇看起来支离破碎、不统一的文本表现出潜在的统一性，目的是将交战的狗分开，并用适当的甜言蜜语安抚它们重新入睡。然而，这两种方法，尽管他们认为自己相去甚远，却有着完全相同的缺点，即两者都倾向于使所有诗歌看起来相似。细心的读者在多恩复杂的形而上学歌词中发现了类似的含糊不清的奇迹，和简单的诗歌，如罗伯特·弗罗斯特的《雪夜林间小憩》，在长达 10 或 20 页的文章中得到了全面的解释性处理，以至于阅读它们的体验失去了所有的特殊性。同样，在解构主义处理之后，所有的诗歌都倾向于表现为充满焦虑、分裂的语言和其他形式的不确定性。

Once the grain of the poem is opened up, then, it cannot long survive the deconstructive pressures brought to bear upon it, and reveals itself as fractured, contradictory, and symptomatic of a cultural and linguistic malaise. A three-step model like this will lend itself to applications to other material; it gives this approach something distinctive as a critical practice, and lays the strengths and weaknesses of deconstruction open to scrutiny, just as other methods are open. The deconstructive reading, then, aims to produce dis-unity, to show that what had looked like unity and coherence actually contains contradictions and conflicts which the text cannot stabilise and contain. We might characterise it as waking up the sleeping dogs of signification and setting them on each other. In contrast, more conventional styles of close reading had the opposite aim: they would take a text which appeared fragmented and disunified and demonstrate an underlying unity, aiming to separate the warring dogs and soothe them back to sleep with suitable blandishments. Yet the two methods, far apart though they would see themselves as being, suffer from exactly the same drawback, which is that both tend to make all poems seem similar. The close reader detects miracles of poised ambiguity alike in Donne’s complex metaphysical lyrics, and simple poems like Robert Frost’s ‘Stopping by woods on a snowy evening’, which receive the full-scale explicatory treatment of the ten- or twenty-page article, so that the experience of reading them loses all its particularity. Similarly, after the deconstructionist treatment all poems tend to emerge as angst-ridden, fissured enactments of linguistic and other forms of indeterminacy.

我将进一步评论第 70 页图表的后结构主义方面列出的一些特征，以十八世纪诗人威廉考珀的一首著名诗作“漂流者”（附录 3）为例. 正如所有评论家所承认的那样，这首诗在两个层面上发挥作用：在“表面”上，它描述了一个从船上被冲下海的人的死亡，他在诗中用自己的声音说话并哀叹自己的命运。在“更深”的层面上，这首诗是关于考珀自己对他初期精神崩溃的恐惧和孤立。

I’ll comment further on some of the characteristics listed on the post-structuralist side of the diagram on page 70, using as an example ‘The Castaway’ (Appendix 3), a well-known poem by the eighteenth-century poet William Cowper. As all critics recognise, this poem works at two levels: on the ‘surface’ it is an account of the death of man washed overboard from a ship, who speaks in the poem in his own voice and laments his fate. At a ‘deeper’ level the poem is about Cowper’s own fear of and isolation within his incipient mental breakdown.

对于解构主义者来说，首先，揭露矛盾或悖论可能涉及表明一首诗中表达的感情可能与表达的感情不一致。例如，在“The Castaway”中，演讲者说他不会因为他的困境而责怪他的船员，但即使这样说也增加了他这样做的可能性。因此，在某一时刻他说他的朋友们竭尽全力救他，但在其他地方他暗示他们抛弃了他并匆忙离开以拯救自己。再看一遍这首诗，找出可以得出这些推论的地方。

For the deconstructionist, firstly, exposing contradictions or paradoxes might involve showing that the feelings professed in a poem can be at odds with those expressed. For instance, in ‘The Castaway’ the speaker says that he does not blame his shipmates for his plight, but even saying this raises the possibility that he does. Thus, at one point he says that his friends did all they could to save him, but elsewhere he implies that they desert him and hurry off to save themselves. Look again at the poem to identify the points where these inferences might be drawn.

其次，指出断裂、差距、裂痕、不连续性是暗示文本缺乏统一性和目的一致性的一种方式。例如，语气、视角或观点可能会发生变化。例如，在《漂流者》中，文本有时使用“我”，有时使用“他”来表示落水者：“像我这样一个注定要倒霉的人”，但“他的”永远漂浮在家'（我的斜体字）。再看一遍这首诗，看看你是否能找出其他例子。正如我已经指出的那样，在某种程度上，它是根据安森出版的期刊中对事件的描述，在探险家乔治安森的一次探险中，一名水手在一次探险中落水死亡的富有想象力的复述。在另一个层面上，这只是对考珀本人所感受到的孤立和沮丧的隐喻。但这两个层面之间的关系非常“不稳定”：例如，关于安森和他的探险的所有具体细节都分散了对损失、遗弃和孤立的一般概念的注意力，我们不规律地从一个转移到另一个。

Secondly, pointing to breaks, gaps, fissures, discontinuities is a way of implying that the text lacks unity and consistency of purpose. There may, for instance, be changes in tone, or perspective, or point of view. In ‘The Castaway’, for instance, the text sometimes uses ‘I’ and sometimes ‘he’ for the man lost overboard: ‘such a destin’d wretch as I’ but ‘His floating home for ever left’ (my italics). Look again at the poem and see if you can identify other examples of this. As I have already indicated, at one level it is an imaginative retelling of the death of a sailor lost overboard during one of the expeditions of the explorer George Anson, based on the account of the incident in Anson’s published journals. At another level this is merely a metaphor for the isolation and depression felt by Cowper himself. But the relationship between these two levels is very ‘unsettled’: for instance, all the specific details about Anson and his expedition distract from the generalised notion of loss, abandonment, and isolation, and we shift erratically from one to the other.

第三，似乎相关的“语言怪癖”包括几种语言怪癖或破坏安全意义的那种不合逻辑的逻辑。“The Castaway”中有很多这样的东西。在最后一节中，诗人说当“我们每个人都死了”——我的斜体字——时，没有神圣的帮助到来，但这首诗只显示了一个人的死亡。另一方面，如果陈述是关于我们所有人如何不得不独自面对死亡的笼统陈述，那么我们会期待现在时而不是过去时（'We perish' 而不是 'We perish'd'）。

Thirdly, the ‘linguistic quirks’ which seem relevant include several kinds of linguistic oddity or non sequitur of the kind which undermine secure meanings. There are many of these in ‘The Castaway’. In the final stanza the poet says that no divine assistance came when ‘We perish’d, each alone’ – my italics – but the poem has shown the death of only one person. On the other hand, if the statement is a general one about how we all have to face death alone, then we would expect the present tense rather than the past (‘We perish’ rather than ‘We perish’d’).

最后，“aporia”一词在解构主义批评中很流行。它的字面意思是死胡同，指的是文本中的一种无法解开或解决的结，因为所说的是自相矛盾的。因此，它可能对应于英国评论家威廉·恩普森 (William Empson) 在他的著作《七种类型的歧义》中(1930) 指定为文学中的第七种语言困难，即当“文本中存在不可调和的意义冲突”时发生的困难。例如，在第三节的开头，我们被告知溺水者“没有诗人为他哭泣”，但我们正在阅读的诗的存在与此相矛盾。似乎没有办法摆脱这种“束缚”。人们常说，罗兰·巴特 (Roland Barthes) 1968 年的文章《作者之死》标志着从结构主义到后结构主义的过渡，巴特在那篇文章中说，在文中，“一切都必须解开，什么都不能破译”。然而，困境是一个文本结，它无法解开纠结，上面讨论的几个元素作为矛盾、悖论或转变可能同样被归类在更普遍的困境之下。

The term ‘aporia’, finally, is a popular one in deconstructive criticism. It literally means an impasse, and designates a kind of knot in the text which cannot be unravelled or solved because what is said is self-contradictory. It perhaps corresponds, therefore, to what the British critic William Empson, in his book Seven Types of Ambiguity (1930) designated as the seventh type of verbal difficulty in literature, namely that which occurs when ‘there is an irreconcilable conflict of meaning within the text’. For instance, at the start of the third stanza we are told of the drowned man that ‘No poet wept him’, but the existence of the poem we are reading contradicts this. There seems to be no way out of this ‘bind’. It is often said that Roland Barthes’s 1968 essay ‘The Death of the Author’ marks the transition from structuralism to post-structuralism, and in that essay Barthes says that in the text ‘everything must be disentangled, nothing deciphered’. The aporia, though, is a textual knot which resists disentanglement, and several of the elements discussed above as contradictions, paradoxes, or shifts might equally be classified under the more general heading of aporia.

虽然很容易理解为什么这个过程可能被称为逆向阅读，但如果认为这首诗具有明显的“纹理”或批评家只需例行抵消的明显意义，就会产生误导。我希望阅读这首诗也会表明，结构主义和后结构主义的阅读实践彼此之间存在很大的分歧：以结构主义的方式识别模式和对称性会发现一个统一的文本，可以说，它是自得其乐的，而“针对自身阅读文本”会产生一种不统一感，一种文本与自身发生内战的感觉。

While it is easy to see why this process might be called reading against the grain, it is misleading to suggest that the poem has an obvious ‘grain’ or overt meaning which the critic has merely to routinely counteract. Reading this poem will also have shown, I hope, that structuralist and post-structuralist reading practices are much at odds with each other: identifying patterns and symmetries in the structuralist manner discovers a unified text which is, so to speak, happy with itself, whereas ‘reading the text against itself’ produces a sense of disunity, of a text engaged in a civil war with itself.

选读

Selected reading

巴特，罗兰，文本的乐趣，译。R. Miller (Hill & Wang, 1975)。

这本书代表了巴特“好玩”的一面：它简短、神秘、有趣。

Barthes, Roland, The Pleasure of the Text, trans. R. Miller (Hill & Wang, 1975).

This book represents the ‘playful’ side of Barthes: it is brief, enigmatic, and entertaining.

Culler, Jonathan，论解构：结构主义之后的理论与批评（Routledge，25 周年版，2007 年）。

包括一个新的前言，回顾了自 80 年代以来解构主义的历史，并评估了它在当今文化理论中的地位。

Culler, Jonathan, On Deconstruction: Theory and Criticism After Structuralism (Routledge, 25th anniversary edn, 2007).

Includes a new preface surveying deconstruction’s history since the 1980s and assessing its place within cultural theory today.

德里达，雅克，“过分的。方法问题”，第 157-64 页，在Of Grammatology 中，反式。Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak（约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1976 年）。

Derrida, Jacques, ‘The exorbitant. Question of method’, pp. 157–64 in Of Grammatology, trans. Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1976).

雅克·德里达，“人文科学话语中的结构、符号和游戏”，以缩写形式重印于 KM 牛顿的《二十世纪文学理论：读者》（麦克米伦出版社，1988 年）。

Derrida, Jacques, ‘Structure, sign and play in the discourse of the human sciences’, reprinted in abbreviated form in K. M. Newton’s Twentieth Century Literary Theory: A Reader (Macmillan, 1988).

德里达，雅克，“真理的提供者”，第 173-212 页，载于《被盗的坡：拉康、德里达和精神分析阅读》，编辑。John P. Muller 和 William J. Richardson（约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1988 年）。这篇文章是德里达对拉康阅读爱伦·坡的故事“失窃的信”的回应，并在该卷中进行了全面介绍。这个和前两个项目构成了对德里达的建议初步阅读。

Derrida, Jacques, ‘The purveyor of truth’, pp. 173–212 in The Purloined Poe: Lacan, Derrida, and Psychoanalytic Reading, ed. John P. Muller and William J. Richardson (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1988). This essay is Derrida’s response, fully introduced within the volume, to Lacan’s reading of Poe’s story ‘The Purloined Letter’. This and the two previous items constitute suggested initial reading of Derrida.

德里达，雅克，德里达读者，编辑。Peggy Kamuf（哥伦比亚大学出版社，1998 年）。

“辅助介绍”——德里达论文的大量选集，每篇都有单独的介绍。一本对持续接触德里达非常有用的书。

Derrida, Jacques, A Derrida Reader, ed. Peggy Kamuf (Columbia University Press, 1998).

An ‘assisted introduction’ – a substantial selection of Derrida’s essays, each with its individual introduction. A very useful book for sustained engagement with Derrida.

Deutscher、Penelope，《如何阅读德里达》（Granta Books，2005 年）。

这是从德里达开始的好地方，这本短书是“如何阅读”系列之一，代表了最近超简短介绍的趋势。

Deutscher, Penelope, How to Read Derrida (Granta Books, 2005).

A good place to begin with Derrida, this short book is one of the ‘How to Read’ series, representative of a recent trend towards ultra-brief introductions.

Jefferson, Ann 和 Robey, David, eds, Modern Literary Theory: A Comparative Introduction (Batsford, 2nd edn, 1986).

见第四章，“结构主义和后结构主义”。

Jefferson, Ann and Robey, David, eds, Modern Literary Theory: A Comparative Introduction (Batsford, 2nd edn, 1986).

See chapter four, ‘Structuralism and post-structuralism’.

Lechte, John，《五十位重要的当代思想家》（Routledge，第 2 版，2006 年）。

关于战后时期“关键思想家”的简短介绍性文章（不限于后结构主义和解构主义）。

Lechte, John, Fifty Key Contemporary Thinkers (Routledge, 2nd edn, 2006).

Short introductory essays on ‘key thinkers’ of the post-war period (not limited to post-structuralism and deconstruction).

诺里斯、克里斯托弗、德里达（方塔纳，1987 年）。

简短而有用的指南。

Norris, Christopher, Derrida (Fontana, 1987).

A brief and helpful guide.

Norris, Christopher，解构主义：理论与实践（Routledge，第 2 版，1991 年）。

一个标准的介绍帐户。

Norris, Christopher, Deconstruction: Theory and Practice (Routledge, 2nd edn, 1991).

A standard introductory account.

Royle, Nicholas, ed., Deconstructions: A User's Guide (Palgrave, 2000).

由一系列重要评论员撰写的一系列重点突出的文章。

Royle, Nicholas, ed., Deconstructions: A User’s Guide (Palgrave, 2000).

A series of well-focused essays by a range of important commentators.

Sarup, Madan，后结构主义和后现代主义入门指南（朗文出版社，第 2 版，1993 年）。

1993 年扩充和更新。参见“德里达与解构”一章。

Sarup, Madan, An Introductory Guide to Post-Structuralism and Postmodernism (Longman, 2nd edn, 1993).

Expanded and updated in 1993. See the chapter ‘Derrida and Deconstruction’.

4

后现代主义

4

Postmodernism

什么是后现代主义？什么是现代主义？

What is postmodernism? What was modernism?

与结构主义和后结构主义一样，关于现代主义和后现代主义究竟有何不同存在大量争论。这两个概念具有不同的历史，“现代主义”是一个长期存在的范畴，对理解 20 世纪文化至关重要，而众所周知的“后现代主义”一词自 1980 年代才流行起来. “现代主义”是对主导二十世纪上半叶艺术和文化的运动的称呼。现代主义是艺术界的一场地震，它摧毁了 20 世纪前音乐、绘画、文学和建筑领域的大部分实践结构。在 1890 年至 1910 年期间，这次地震的主要震中之一似乎是维也纳，但法国、德国、意大利，最终甚至在英国，出现了立体主义、达达主义、超现实主义和未来主义等艺术运动。它的余震至今仍能感受到，它倒塌的许多建筑从未重建过。不了解现代主义，就不可能了解二十世纪的文化。

As with structuralism and post-structuralism, there is a great deal of debate about how exactly modernism and postmodernism differ. The two concepts are of different vintage, ‘modernism’ being a long-standing category which is of crucial importance in the understanding of twentieth-century culture, whereas the term ‘postmodernism’, as is well known, has only become current since the 1980s. ‘Modernism’ is the name given to the movement which dominated the arts and culture of the first half of the twentieth century. Modernism was that earthquake in the arts which brought down much of the structure of pre-twentieth-century practice in music, painting, literature, and architecture. One of the major epicentres of this earthquake seems to have been Vienna, during the period of 1890–1910, but the effects were felt in France, Germany, Italy and eventually even in Britain, in art movements like Cubism, Dadaism, Surrealism, and Futurism. Its after-shocks are still being felt today, and many of the structures it toppled have never been rebuilt. Without an understanding of modernism, then, it is impossible to understand twentieth-century culture.

在现代主义所触及的所有艺术中，最基本的实践要素都受到挑战和拒绝：因此，旋律与和声在音乐中被搁置一旁；绘画中放弃了透视和直接的图形表现，有利于抽象程度；在建筑中传统的形式和材料（斜屋顶、圆顶和柱子、木头、石头和砖块）被拒绝支持简单的几何形式，通常用平板玻璃和混凝土等新材料执行。最后，在文学中，人们摒弃了传统的现实主义（按时间顺序排列的情节、全知叙述者转述的连续叙述、“封闭式结局”等），转而支持各种实验形式。

In all the arts touched by modernism what had been the most fundamental elements of practice were challenged and rejected: thus, melody and harmony were put aside in music; perspective and direct pictorial representation were abandoned in painting, in favour of degrees of abstraction; in architecture traditional forms and materials (pitched roofs, domes and columns, wood, stone, and bricks) were rejected in favour of plain geometrical forms, often executed in new materials like plate glass and concrete. In literature, finally, there was a rejection of traditional realism (chronological plots, continuous narratives relayed by omniscient narrators, ‘closed endings’, etc.) in favour of experimental forms of various kinds.

高度现代主义时期是从 1910 年到 1930 年的二十年，该运动的一些文学“大祭司”（用英语写作）是 TS Eliot、James Joyce、Ezra Pound、Wyndham Lewis、Virginia Woolf、Wallace Stevens 和Gertrude Stein 和（用法语或德语写作）Marcel Proust、Stéphane Mallarmé、André Gide、Franz Kafka 和 Rainer Maria Rilke。这些作家实践的文学现代主义的一些重要特征包括：

The period of high modernism was the twenty years from 1910 to 1930 and some of the literary ‘high priests’ of the movement (writing in English) were T. S. Eliot, James Joyce, Ezra Pound, Wyndham Lewis, Virginia Woolf, Wallace Stevens, and Gertrude Stein, and (writing in French or German) Marcel Proust, Stéphane Mallarmé, André Gide, Franz Kafka, and Rainer Maria Rilke. Some of the important characteristics of the literary modernism practised by these writers include the following:

1. 对印象主义和主观性的新强调，即强调我们如何看待而不是我们所见（意识流技术的使用中明显的一种关注）。

1. A new emphasis on impressionism and subjectivity, that is, on how we see rather than what we see (a preoccupation evident in the use of the stream-of-consciousness technique).

2. 远离由以下特征提供的明显客观性的运动（在小说中）：无所不知的外部叙述、固定的叙述观点和明确的道德立场。

2. A movement (in novels) away from the apparent objectivity provided by such features as: omniscient external narration, fixed narrative points of view and clear-cut moral positions.

3. 流派之间的区别变得模糊，例如，小说往往变得更加抒情和诗意，而诗歌则更加纪实和散文。

3. A blurring of the distinctions between genres, so that novels tend to become more lyrical and poetic, for instance, and poems more documentary and prose-like.

4. 对零散的形式、不连续的叙述和不同材料的看似随意的拼贴有了新的喜好。

4. A new liking for fragmented forms, discontinuous narrative, and random-seeming collages of disparate materials.

5.“反身性”倾向，使诗歌、戏剧和小说提出有关其自身性质、地位和作用的问题。

5. A tendency towards ‘reflexivity’, so that poems, plays and novels raise issues concerning their own nature, status, and role.

这些转变的总体结果是产生了一种似乎致力于实验和创新的文学。在达到顶峰之后，现代主义似乎在 1930 年代大幅后退，这无疑部分是由于政治和经济危机十年中产生的紧张局势，但在 1960 年代又出现了复苏（这十年具有有趣的相似点1920 年代，现代主义达到顶峰）。然而，现代主义再也没有恢复它在早期享有的卓越地位。
The overall result of these shifts is to produce a literature which seems dedicated to experimentation and innovation. After its high point, modernism seemed to retreat considerably in the 1930s, partly, no doubt, because of the tensions generated in a decade of political and economic crisis, but a resurgence took place in the 1960s (a decade which has interesting points of similarity with the 1920s, when modernism was at its height). However, modernism never regained the pre-eminence it had enjoyed in the earlier period.

这让我们大致了解现代主义是什么以及何时出现。那么，后现代主义是继续它还是反对它？为了决定这一点，我们需要尝试对第二个术语进行工作定义。作为起点，我们可以选择最容易获得的后现代主义描述。JA Cuddon 在他的《文学术语和文学理论词典》中的条目将后现代主义描述为“一种折衷的方法，[喜欢] 偶然写作，[以及] 模仿和模仿”。到目前为止，这并没有真正在现代主义和后现代主义之间划清界限，因为“折衷主义”这个词意味着使用碎片化的形式，正如我们刚才所说，这是现代主义的特征。（艾略特的荒原，例如，是并列的、不完整的故事或故事片段的拼贴画。）另外，“随机形式”，即包含随机性或偶然性元素的形式，对 1917 年的达达主义者很重要，例如，他们创作诗歌从报纸上随机摘取的句子。最后，模仿和模仿的使用显然与放弃隐含在无所不知的叙述立场中的作者身份的神圣自负有关，这也是现代主义的一个重要元素。那么，可以说，建立现代主义和后现代主义之间的区别的一种方法是通过回顾性地将现代主义的某些方面重新定义为后现代主义来消除它们之间的顺序联系。根据这种观点，它们不是艺术史上两个连续的阶段，

This gives us a rough indication of what and when modernism was. Does postmodernism, then, continue it or oppose it? To decide this we need to attempt a working definition of this second term. As a starting-point, we can take a selection of the most readily available descriptions of postmodernism. J. A. Cuddon’s entry in his Dictionary of Literary Terms and Literary Theory describes postmodernism as characterised by ‘an eclectic approach, [by a liking for] aleatory writing, [and for] parody and pastiche’. So far, this doesn’t really put much daylight between modernism and postmodernism, since the word ‘eclectic’ suggests the use of the fragmented forms which, as we have just said, are characteristic of modernism. (Eliot’s The Waste Land, for instance, is a collage of juxtaposed, incomplete stories, or fragments of stories.) Also ‘aleatory forms’, meaning those which incorporate an element of randomness or chance, were important to the Dadaists of 1917, who, for instance, made poems from sentences plucked randomly from newspapers. The use of parody and pastiche, finally, is clearly related to the abandonment of the divine pretensions of authorship implicit in the omniscient narratorial stance, and this too was a vital element in modernism. It could be said, then, that one way of establishing the distinction between modernism and postmodernism is to dissolve the sequential link between them, by retrospectively redefining certain aspects of modernism as postmodernist. According to this view, they are not two successive stages in the history of the arts, but two opposed moods or attitudes, differing as suggested in the next paragraph.
