杰里米·霍索恩 (Jeremy Hawthorn) 的当代文学理论简明词汇表(Edward Arnold, 1992)中关于这两个术语的出色联合条目总结了现代主义和后现代主义之间区别的本质。他说，两者都非常重视碎片化作为 20 世纪艺术和文化的一个特征，但他们是以截然不同的方式这样做的。现代主义者以这样一种方式来描绘它，以表达对信仰充实、权威完好无损的早期时代的深深怀念。例如，埃兹拉·庞德 (Ezra Pound) 称他的主要作品《诗章》( The Cantos)一个'rag-bag'，暗示这在现代是可能的，但也暗示对那个事实的遗憾。在他的诗“Hugh Selwyn Mauberley”中，他谈到第一次世界大战正在打响，“为了两尊破碎的雕像，/为了几千本破烂的书”，在同一首诗中，他显然很痛苦，就像“俗气的廉价品” / Shall outlast our days' 和'We see to kalon [beauty] / Decreed in the market place'，商业主义的兴起以牺牲'永恒的真理'为代价。在荒原， 同样，这个人物像对这首诗绝望地说，“我把这些碎片支撑在我的废墟上”。在这样的例子中，有一种对世界的哀叹、悲观和绝望的语气，它在这些“破碎”的艺术形式中找到了合适的表现（例如，Kurt Schwitters 的拼贴画，它混合了画布的绘画区域和随机剪报报纸、时间表和广告）。相比之下，对于后现代主义者来说，碎片化是一种令人振奋、解放的现象，是我们摆脱固定信仰体系的幽闭恐惧症的征兆。总之，现代主义者哀叹碎片化，而后现代主义者则庆祝碎片化。

The nature of the distinction between modernism and post-modernism is summarised in the excellent joint entry on the two terms in Jeremy Hawthorn’s Concise Glossary of Contemporary Literary Theory (Edward Arnold, 1992). Both, he says, give great prominence to fragmentation as a feature of twentieth-century art and culture, but they do so in very different moods. The modernist features it in such a way as to register a deep nostalgia for an earlier age when faith was full and authority intact. Ezra Pound, for instance, calls his major work, The Cantos, a ‘rag-bag’, implying that this is all that is possible in the modern age, but also implying regret about that fact. In his poem ‘Hugh Selwyn Mauberley’ he speaks of the First World War being fought ‘For two gross of broken statues, / For a few thousand battered books’, and is evidently pained, in lines from the same poem like ‘a tawdry cheapness / Shall outlast our days’ and ‘We see to kalon [beauty] / Decreed in the market place’, by the rise of commercialism at the expense of ‘eternal verities’. In The Waste Land, too, the persona says, as if despairingly of the poem, ‘These fragments I have shored against my ruins’. In instances like this there is a tone of lament, pessimism, and despair about the world which finds its appropriate representation in these ‘fractured’ art forms (the collages of Kurt Schwitters, for example, which mix painted areas of canvas with random clippings from newspapers, timetables, and advertisements). For the postmodernist, by contrast, fragmentation is an exhilarating, liberating phenomenon, symptomatic of our escape from the claustrophobic embrace of fixed systems of belief. In a word, the modernist laments fragmentation while the postmodernist celebrates it.

两者之间的第二个相关差异也是语气或态度的问题。现代主义的一个重要方面是强烈的禁欲主义，它发现 19 世纪过度精致的艺术形式令人反感和厌恶。这种禁欲主义在现代主义建筑师的声明中有其最具特色和最引人注目的表现之一，例如阿道夫·卢斯 (Adolf Loos) 的宣言“装饰是一种犯罪”，或者密斯·范德罗 (Miës van der Rohe) 的“少即是多”，或者勒·柯布西耶 (Le Corbusier) 的“房子”是一台用于居住的机器。这些声明导致了“鞋盒”和“红宝石”建筑，它们引起了如此多的仇恨和反对，尤其是在 1980 年代，但它们所代表的崇高理想主义仍然具有推动力。在极简主义文学中也可以看到同样精致的禁欲主义，极简主义（例如）将诗歌缩小为两行字的窄列，记录严格稀疏、精简的观察，或者在塞缪尔贝克特的戏剧中，其中的戏剧可以减少到十三分钟的运行时间，只有一个扬声器，没有设置，并且语言极其稀疏。相比之下，后现代主义再次拒绝在现代主义中很重要的“高雅”和“大众”艺术之间的区别，并相信过度、华而不实和“低俗”的品质混合。它蔑视现代主义的禁欲主义，将其视为精英主义，并乐于在同一栋建筑中混合不同建筑时期的点点滴滴——这里是仿格鲁吉亚山墙饰，那里是半开玩笑的古典门廊。只是表面，没有文学教育训练我们去寻找的深刻意义。在精神上，没有什么比那种朴素的现代主义禁欲主义更进一步了。

A second, and related, difference between the two is also a matter of tone or attitude. An important aspect of modernism was a fierce asceticism which found the over-elaborate art forms of the nineteenth century deeply offensive and repulsive. This asceticism has one of its most characteristic and striking manifestations in the pronouncements of modernist architects, such as Adolf Loos’s proclamation that ‘decoration is a crime’, or Miës van der Rohe’s that ‘less is more’, or Le Corbusier’s that ‘a house is a machine for living in’. These pronouncements resulted in the ‘shoe box’ and ‘carbuncle’ buildings which generated such hatred and opposition, particularly through the 1980s, but the high idealism they represent retains its power to move. The same refined asceticism is seen in literature in the minimalism which (for instance) shrinks poems to narrow columns of two-word lines registering rigorously sparse, pared-down observations, or in the drama of Samuel Beckett, in which a play may be reduced to a running time of thirteen minutes, with a single speaker, no set, and language which is sparse in the extreme. By constrast, again, postmodernism rejects the distinction between ‘high’ and ‘popular’ art which was important in modernism, and believes in excess, in gaudiness, and in ‘bad taste’ mixtures of qualities. It disdains the modernist asceticism as elitist and cheerfully mixes, in the same building, bits and pieces from different architectural periods – a mock-Georgian pediment here, a tongue-in-cheek classical portico there. A similar postmodernist ‘edifice’ in literature would be the ‘Martian’ poetry of writers like Craig Raine or Christopher Reid, where bizarrely colourful mixtures of imagery, viewpoint, and vocabulary jostle on a surface which seems happy to be nothing but surface, without the depths of significance which a literary education trains us to seek out. Nothing could be further in spirit from that austere modernist asceticism.

后现代主义的“地标”——哈贝马斯、利奥塔和鲍德里亚

‘Landmarks’ in postmodernism – Habermas, Lyotard and Baudrillard

后现代主义历史上的一个重要“时刻”是当代德国理论家于尔根·哈贝马斯 (Jürgen Habermas) 于 1980 年发表的具有影响力的论文“现代性——一个未完成的项目”。对于哈贝马斯来说，现代时期始于启蒙运动，那段大约一百年的时期，从 17 世纪中叶到 18 世纪中叶，一种新的信仰兴起，相信理性可以改善人类社会。德国的康德，法国的伏尔泰和狄德罗，英国的洛克和休谟的哲学都表达或体现了这样的思想。在英国，“理性时代”一词（直到最近）被用来指代同一时期。所谓的启蒙运动“计划”就是培养这样一种信念，即打破传统、盲目习惯和对宗教戒律和禁令的奴性服从，再加上公正的个人对理性和逻辑的应用，可以解决社会问题。这种观点就是哈贝马斯所说的“现代性”。法国大革命可以看作是在实践中检验这一理论的第一次尝试。对哈贝马斯来说，这种对理性和进步可能性的信念一直延续到 20 世纪，甚至在构成该世纪历史的灾难目录中依然存在。被称为现代主义的文化运动赞同这个“项目”，因为它构成了对丧失目的感、丧失连贯性、丧失价值体系的哀叹。对哈贝马斯来说，70 年代的法国后结构主义思想家，如德里达和福柯，代表了对这种启蒙运动“现代性”的具体否定。在他看来，他们袭击了，

A major ‘moment’ in the history of postmodernism is the influential paper ‘Modernity – an Incomplete Project’ delivered by the contemporary German theorist Jürgen Habermas in 1980. For Habermas the modern period begins with the Enlightenment, that period of about one hundred years, from the mid-seventeenth to the mid-eighteenth century, when a new faith arose in the power of reason to improve human society. Such ideas are expressed or embodied in the philosophy of Kant in Germany, Voltaire and Diderot in France, and Locke and Hume in Britain. In Britain the term ‘The Age of Reason’ was used (till recently) to designate the same period. The so-called Enlightenment ‘project’ is the fostering of this belief that a break with tradition, blind habit, and slavish obedience to religious precepts and prohibitions, coupled with the application of reason and logic by the disinterested individual, can bring about a solution to the problems of society. This outlook is what Habermas means by ‘modernity’. The French Revolution can be seen as a first attempt to test this theory in practice. For Habermas this faith in reason and the possibility of progress survived into the twentieth century, and even survives the catalogue of disasters which makes up that century’s history. The cultural movement known as modernism subscribed to this ‘project’, in the sense that it constituted a lament for a lost sense of purpose, a lost coherence, a lost system of values. For Habermas, the French post-structuralist thinkers of the 1970s, such as Derrida and Foucault, represented a specific repudiation of this kind of Enlightenment ‘modernity’. They attacked, in his view, the ideals of reason, clarity, truth, and progress, and as they were thereby detached from the quest for justice, he identified them as ‘young conservatives’.

“后现代主义”一词是在 1930 年代使用的，但可以说是从让-弗朗索瓦·利奥塔 (Jean-François Lyotard) 的《后现代状况：知识报告》开始的。 （曼彻斯特大学出版社，1979 年）。利奥塔的文章“回答问题：什么是后现代主义？”于 1982 年首次发表，1984 年作为后现代状况的附录添加，并收录在 1992 年布鲁克的现代主义/后现代主义中，主要针对哈贝马斯展开了这场关于启蒙运动的辩论，以稍微倾斜的方式。利奥塔开场即有效地将辩论变成一场斗争，以证明自己的对手是真正的保守派（这是文化论战写作中常见的“底线”）。“来自各个方向”，他说，“我们都被敦促结束实验”，在引用了其他几个例子之后，他写道（显然是哈贝马斯）：

The term ‘postmodernism’ was used in the 1930s, but its current sense and vogue can be said to have begun with Jean-François Lyotard’s The Postmodern Condition: A Report on Knowledge (Manchester University Press, 1979). Lyotard’s essay ‘Answering the Question: What is Postmodernism?’, first published in 1982, added in 1984 as an appendix to The Postmodern Condition and included in Brooker’s Modernism/Postmodernism, 1992, takes up this debate about the Enlightenment, mainly targeting Habermas, in a slightly oblique manner. Lyotard opens with a move which effectively turns the debate into a struggle to demonstrate that one’s opponents are the real conservatives (a familiar ‘bottom line’ of polemical writing on culture). ‘From every direction’, he says, ‘we are being urged to put an end to experimentation’, and after citing several other instances he writes (obviously of Habermas):

我读过一位著名的思想家，他捍卫现代性，反对那些他称之为新保守派的人。他认为，在后现代主义的旗帜下，后者希望摆脱现代主义未完成的启蒙运动。
I have read a thinker of repute who defends modernity against those he calls the neo-conservatives. Under the banner of postmodernism, the latter would like, he believes, to get rid of the uncompleted project of modernism, that of the Enlightenment.

（布鲁克，第 141 页）

(Brooker, p. 141)

哈贝马斯只是合唱团中的一个声音，合唱团呼吁结束“艺术实验”和“秩序……统一、认同、安全”（布鲁克，第 142 页）). 一言以蔽之，这些声音想要“清算先锋派的遗产”。对于利奥塔来说，哈贝马斯希望继续其项目的启蒙运动只是对事物——如基督教、马克思主义或科学进步的神话——的一种可能是权威的“包罗万象”、“总体化”的解释。这些旨在解释和安抚的“元叙事”[“超级叙事”]，实际上是幻觉，是为了扼杀差异、对立和多元化而培育出来的。因此，利奥塔 (Lyot​​ard) 对后现代主义做出了著名的定义，简单地说，它就是“对元叙事的怀疑”。因此，关于进步和人类完美性的“宏大叙事”不再站得住脚，我们所能期望的最好的是一系列“迷你叙事”，它们是临时的、偶然的、暂时的，和相关性，为特定群体在特定当地情况下的行动提供了基础。因此，后现代性“解构”了启蒙运动的基本目标，即“历史和主体的单一终结的观念”。
Habermas’s is simply one voice in a chorus which is calling for an end to ‘artistic experimentation’ and for ‘order … unity, for identity, for security’ (Brooker, p. 142). In a word, these voices want ‘to liquidate the heritage of the avant-gardes’. For Lyotard the Enlightenment whose project Habermas wishes to continue is simply one of the would-be authoritative ‘overarching’, ‘totalising’ explanations of things – like Christianity, Marxism, or the myth of scientific progress. These ‘metanarratives’ [‘super-narratives’], which purport to explain and reassure, are really illusions, fostered in order to smother difference, opposition, and plurality. Hence Lyotard’s famous definition of postmodernism, that it is, simply, ‘incredulity towards metanarratives’. ‘Grand Narratives’ of progress and human perfectibility, then, are no longer tenable, and the best we can hope for is a series of ‘mininarratives’, which are provisional, contingent, temporary, and relative and which provide a basis for the actions of specific groups in particular local circumstances. Postmodernity thus ‘deconstructs’ the basic aim of the Enlightenment, that is ‘the idea of a unitary end of history and of a subject’.

另一位后现代主义的主要理论家是当代法国作家让·鲍德里亚，他的著作《模拟》 （1981，1983译）标志着他进入这一领域。鲍德里亚是与通常所说的“失去真实感”相关联，这种观点认为在当代生活中，电影、电视和广告图像的普遍影响导致真实与想象、现实与现实之间的区别消失错觉，表面和深度。其结果是一种“超现实”文化，其中它们之间的区别被侵蚀了。他的命题在他的论文“Simulacra and Simulations”中得到了阐述，该论文以删节形式重印于 Brooker，1992 年。内在恩典的外在标志”，引用罗马天主教要理问答的话）。但是，他问道，如果一个符号不是潜在现实的索引，而仅仅是其他符号的索引，那又怎样呢？然后整个系统就变成了他所说的模拟物。然后他用模拟的概念代替了表示。符号通过一系列步骤达到目前的空性阶段，我将通过将它们与不同类型的绘画进行比较来说明这一点。

Another major theorist of postmodernism is the contemporary French writer Jean Baudrillard, whose book Simulations (1981, translated 1983) marks his entry into this field. Baudrillard is associated with what is usually known as ‘the loss of the real’, which is the view that in contemporary life the pervasive influence of images from film, TV, and advertising has led to a loss of the distinction between real and imagined, reality and illusion, surface and depth. The result is a culture of ‘hyperreality’, in which distinctions between these are eroded. His propositions are worked out in his essay ‘Simulacra and Simulations’ reprinted in abridged form in Brooker, 1992. He begins by evoking a past era of ‘fullness’, when a sign was a surface indication of an underlying depth or reality (‘an outward sign of inward grace’, to cite the words of the Roman Catholic Catechism). But what, he asks, if a sign is not an index of an underlying reality, but merely of other signs? Then the whole system becomes what he calls a simulacrum. He then substitutes for representation the notion of simulation. The sign reaches its present stage of emptiness in a series of steps, which I will try to illustrate by comparing them to different kinds of paintings.

首先，标志代表了一个基本现实：让我们以二十世纪英国艺术家 LS Lowry 的作品中工业城市索尔福德的表现为例。上世纪中叶，在这样一个地方工作的人们生活艰苦，画作有一种单调和重复的气氛——街道上到处都是畏缩的、棍棒般的人物，色彩柔和，地平线上充满了阴森森的工厂般的建筑。那么，作为标志，洛瑞的画似乎代表了他们所描绘的地方的基本现实。

Firstly, then, the sign represents a basic reality: let’s take as an example of this the representations of the industrial city of Salford in the work of the twentieth-century British artist L. S. Lowry. Mid-century life for working people in such a place was hard, and the paintings have an air of monotony and repetitiveness – cowed, stick-like figures fill the streets, colours are muted, and the horizon filled with grim factory-like buildings. As signs, then, Lowry’s paintings seem to represent the basic reality of the place they depict.

标志的第二个阶段是它歪曲或歪曲了其背后的现实。作为这方面的一个例子，让我们以维多利亚时代艺术家阿特金森·格里姆肖 (Atkinson Grimshaw) 的画作中对利物浦和赫尔等城市的迷人表现为例。这些画作描绘了夜晚的城市，潮湿的人行道反射着码头商店明亮的灯光，月亮从云层中露出来，以及在天空映衬下成群结队的船桅。当时这些地方的生活大概也很严峻，但这些画提供了一种浪漫而迷人的形象，所以这个标志可以说是歪曲了它所展示的内容。

The second stage for the sign is that it misrepresents or distorts the reality behind it. As an example of this let’s take the glamorised representations of cities like Liverpool and Hull in the paintings of the Victorian artist Atkinson Grimshaw. These paintings show the cities at night, wet pavements reflecting the bright lights of dockside shops, the moon emerging from behind clouds, and a forest of ships’ masts silhouetted against the sky. Life in these places at that time was presumably grim, too, but the paintings offer a romantic and glamorised image, so the sign can be said to misrepresent what it shows.

符号的第三个阶段是符号掩饰下面没有对应现实的事实。为了说明这一点，以超现实主义艺术家 René Magritte 的作品中使用的设备为例，在这幅画中，一个画架上放着画家的画布，立在窗户旁边：画中的画布上画着我们可以透过窗户看到的外部场景。但窗外所显示的并不是真实，可以判断画中画，而只是另一种符号，另一种描绘，并不比画中画更具权威性或真实性（实际上是对画中画的再现）表示）。

The third stage for the sign is when the sign disguises the fact that there is no corresponding reality underneath. To illustrate this, take a device used in the work of the surrealist artist René Magritte, where, in the painting, an easel with a painter’s canvas on it is shown standing alongside a window: on the canvas in the painting is painted the exterior scene which we can see through the window. But what is shown beyond the window is not reality, against which the painting within the painting can be judged, but simply another sign, another depiction, which has no more authority or reality than the painting within the painting (which is actually a representation of a representation).

符号的第四个也是最后一个阶段是它与任何现实都没有关系。作为这个阶段的例证，我们可以简单地想象一幅完全抽象的画，它根本不具有代表性，例如马克·罗斯科 (Mark Rothko) 的一幅伟大的紫色情绪画布。我要强调的是，我并不是说这四幅画是标志的四个阶段的例子，只是说这四个阶段可以被认为类似于这些画表示或代表事物的四种不同方式。

The fourth and last stage for the sign is that it bears no relation to any reality at all. As an illustration of this stage we have simply to imagine a completely abstract painting, which is not representional at all, like one of the great purple mood canvases of Mark Rothko, for instance. I should emphasise that I’m not suggesting that these four paintings are examples of the four stages of the sign, merely that the four stages can be thought of as analogous to the four different ways in which these paintings signify or represent things.

这些阶段的前两个阶段相当清楚，后两个阶段可能就不那么清楚了。鲍德里亚自己的第三阶段（当标志隐藏缺席时）的例子是迪斯尼乐园。当然，从某种意义上说，它是第二种类型的标志，是对美国神话化的误传：

The first two of these stages are fairly clear, the second two perhaps less so. Baudrillard’s own example of the third stage (when the sign hides an absence) is Disneyland. In one way, of course, it is a sign of the second type, a mythologised misrepresentation of the United States:

它的所有 [美国] 价值观都在这里以微型和连环漫画的形式得到提升。防腐和安抚……美国生活方式的摘要，对美国价值观的赞美，对矛盾现实的理想化转换。
All its [the USA’s] values are exalted here, in miniature and comic-strip form. Embalmed and pacified … digest of the American way of life, panegyric to American values, idealised transposition of a contradictory reality.

（布鲁克，现代主义/后现代主义， 第 154 页）

(Brooker, Modernism/Postmodernism, p. 154)

但迪斯尼乐园实际上是一个“三阶模拟”（一个隐藏缺席的标志）：

But Disneyland is actually a ‘third-order simulation’ (a sign which conceals an absence):

迪斯尼乐园在那里是为了掩盖一个事实，即它是“真实的”国家，所有“真实的”美国，这就是迪斯尼乐园（就像监狱在那里是为了掩盖一个事实，即它是一个完整的社会，平庸无处不在，这是癌症）。迪斯尼乐园被呈现为虚构的，以便让我们相信其余的都是真实的。
Disneyland is there to conceal the fact that it is the ‘real’ country, all of ‘real’ America, which is Disneyland (just as prisons are there to conceal the fact that it is the social in its entirety, in its banal omnipresence, which is carceral). Disneyland is presented as imaginary in order to make us believe that the rest is real.

总之，迪斯尼乐园具有“掩盖真实不再真实的事实，从而挽救现实原则”的效果。在后现代主义中，真实与虚构之间的区别模拟倒塌：一切都是模型或图像，都是表面没有深度；这就是鲍德里亚所说的超现实。

In a word, Disneyland has the effect of ‘concealing the fact that the real is no longer real, and thus of saving the reality principle’. Within postmodernism, the distinction between what is real and what is simulated collapses: everything is a model or an image, all is surface without depth; this is the hyperreal, as Baudrillard calls it.

这种豪言壮语，具有很强的感染力。人们可能会将其视为一种近代柏拉图主义，它的信徒享受着一种神秘的洞察力，即通常被视为坚实而真实的世界实际上只是一堆梦幻般的图像。如果后现代状况的第二个方面，即真实的丧失，被接受为一个事实，那么就很难找到文学理论占据的基础，因为所有的文学解释方法——马克思主义、女权主义、结构主义等等on——取决于表面和深度之间的区别，在文本中看到的和一些潜在的含义之间的区别。一旦我们接受所见即所得，那么很明显，文学评论家或理论家可以声称自己在做的事情就很少了。

The grand sweep of this kind of rhetoric has a strong appeal. One might see it as a kind of latter-day Platonism, its devotees enjoying the mystical insight that what is normally taken as a solid and real world is actually just a tissue of dreamlike images. If this second aspect of the postmodern condition, this loss of the real, is accepted as a fact, then it is hard to see a ground for literary theory to occupy, since all methods of literary interpretation – Marxist, feminist, structuralist, and so on – depend upon the making of a distinction between surface and depth, between what is seen in the text and some underlying meaning. Once we accept that what we see is all we get, then there is, clearly, very little which a literary critic or theorist can claim to be doing.

更一般地说，对于后现代主义，存在某些始终存在的问题和条件。在这种极端的鲍德里亚形式中，“真实的丧失”似乎使对苦难的冷酷无情合法化。在一个现在臭名昭著的声明中，鲍德里亚坚持认为海湾战争从未发生过，“真正”发生的是一种电视虚拟现实。（但请参阅第 14 章对此事的讨论.) 同样，如果我们接受“真实的丧失”以及现实和模拟崩溃为一种虚拟现实，那么大屠杀呢？这也可能是图像网络中“丢失”的现实的一部分吗？换句话说，如果不相信后现代主义削弱的某些概念——例如历史、现实和真理——我们很可能会发现自己置身于一些相当令人厌恶的公司。

More generally, for postmodernism there are certain ever-present questions and provisos. In this extreme Baudrillardian form, the ‘loss of the real’ may seem to legitimise a callous indifference to suffering. In a now notorious pronouncement Baudrillard maintained that the Gulf War never happened, that what ‘really’ took place was a kind of televisual virtual reality. (But see the discussion of this matter in chapter 14.) Likewise, if we accept the ‘loss of the real’ and the collapsing of reality and simulation into a kind of virtual reality, then what of the Holocaust? Could this, too, be part of the reality ‘lost’ in the image networks? In other words, without a belief in some of the concepts which postmodernism undercuts – history, reality, and truth, for instance – we may well find ourselves in some pretty repulsive company.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

鲍德里亚四阶段模型中的关键范畴是第三个，这个符号掩盖了一种不在场，它掩盖了一个事实，即它所代表的所谓“真实”已不复存在，除了表面的游戏之外别无他物。

The crucial category in Baudrillard’s four-stage model is the third one, the sign which conceals an absence, which conceals the fact that the supposedly ‘real’ which it represents is no longer there, that beyond the play of surfaces there is nothing else.

要准确理解这个概念并不容易。如果你试着想一些迪斯尼乐园以外的例子，这样做可能会有所帮助。例如，广告中呈现的男性气质或女性气质的理想化形象可能是有帮助：这些也是没有原件的复制品或再现——没有真实的人与这些完全相同，尽管人们可能会努力变得像他们一样。这样，形象就趋向于变成现实，两者趋于难以区分。

It is not easy to achieve a precise understanding of this concept. It may help in doing so if you try to think of examples other than Disneyland. The idealised images of masculinity or femininity presented in advertisements, for instance, may be helpful: these also are copies or representations for which no original exists – no actual people are quite like these, though people might strive to become like them. In this way the image tends to become the reality, and the two tend to become indistinguishable.

此外，如果我们同意实在界确实已经丢失，那么我们需要决定我们如何应对这一事实。如果我们要陶醉于由此产生的无边界地带，我们将需要确保“真实”是一个我们可以没有的概念。也许最近发生的事件表明情况并非如此。在第一次海湾战争的电视报道中，我们看到高科技“智能”武器的计算机影像影片正在瞄准伊拉克目标，而评论则谈到可以“摧毁”敌方关键设施的“外科手术式打击”。新闻公告还包括飞行员用同样“不真实”的术语谈论他们正在做的事情的镜头，例如，使用视频格斗游戏的术语。也许这些事情是真实范畴被侵蚀时可能发生的事情的征兆。同样，我们是否可以在没有真实的范畴的情况下谴责大屠杀，

Further, if we agreee that the real has indeed been lost then we need to decide how we react to this fact. If we are to revel in the boundary-free zone which results, we will need to be sure that the ‘real’ is a concept we can do without. Perhaps recent events suggest otherwise. In the televsion coverage of the first Gulf War we saw computer-image film of high-tech ‘smart’ weapons homing in on Iraqi targets, while the commentary spoke of ‘surgical strikes’ which could ‘take out’ key enemy installations. News bulletins also included footage of pilots who spoke of what they were doing in the same ‘unreal’ terms, using the terminology of video combat games, for instance. Perhaps these things are symptomatic of what can happen when the category of the real is eroded. Likewise, could we condemn the Holocaust without the category of the real, or campaign against (say) racial discrimination or environmental pollution?

后现代主义批评家做什么

What postmodernist critics do

1. 他们发现 20 世纪文学作品中的后现代主义主题、倾向和态度，并探索其含义。

1. They discover postmodernist themes, tendencies, and attitudes within literary works of the twentieth century and explore their implications.

2. 他们将小说置于前景，可以说是“真实消失”概念的例证，其中可以看到不断变化的后现代身份，例如，在文学体裁的混合中（惊悚小说、侦探小说、神话传奇） , 以及现实主义心理小说等）。

2. They foreground fiction which might be said to exemplify the notion of the ‘disappearance of the real’, in which shifting postmodern identities are seen, for example, in the mixing of literary genres (the thriller, the detective story, the myth saga, and the realist psychological novel, etc.).

3. 他们强调文学中可能被称为“互文元素”的东西，例如戏仿、模仿和典故，在所有这些中，一个文本与另一个文本之间存在很大程度的引用，而不是文本与安全的外部对象之间的引用现实。

3. They foreground what might be called ‘intertextual elements’ in literature, such as parody, pastiche, and allusion, in all of which there is a major degree of reference between one text and another, rather than between the text and a safely external reality.

4. 他们强调讽刺，在 Umberto Eco 所描述的意义上，即现代主义者试图摧毁过去，后现代主义者意识到必须重新审视过去，但要“带有讽刺意味”（现代主义/后现代主义，编辑彼得·布鲁克，第 227 页）。

4. They foreground irony, in the sense described by Umberto Eco, that whereas the modernist tries to destroy the past, the postmodernist realises that the past must be revisited, but ‘with irony’ (Modernism/Postmodernism, ed. Peter Brooker, p. 227).

5. 他们突出了叙事技巧中的“自恋”元素，也就是说，小说关注并争论自己的目的和过程，从而使内容“去自然化”。

5. They foreground the element of ‘narcissism’ in narrative technique, that is, where novels focus on and debate their own ends and processes, and thereby ‘de-naturalise’ their content.

6. 他们挑战高雅文化和低俗文化之间的区别，并突出显示作为两者混合体的文本。

6. They challenge the distinction between high and low culture, and highlight texts which work as hybrid blends of the two.

后现代主义批评：一个例子

Postmodernist criticism: an example

Jeffrey Nealon 的“Samuel Beckett and the Postmodern: Language games, Play, and Waiting for Godot”是后现代主义批评的一个有用的例子，它直接应用了利奥塔的思想。戈多与残局，编辑。史蒂文康纳，1992 年）。这主要显示了上述六种后现代主义批判活动中的第一种，但也包含第二种元素，因为语言作为一个独立系统的概念与利奥塔的“真实的消失”思想密切相关。Nealon 首先解释了源自维特根斯坦的“语言游戏”概念，据此，当我们声称某件事是真实的时，我们并不是根据某些外部绝对标准来衡量它，而是根据仅在指定范围内运作并且没有任何影响的内部规则和标准。 ‘超越’的地位超越了这一点。这些具有有限的适用性，就像游戏中控制动作的规则一样。因此，Knight to King's Rook Four在国际象棋比赛中可能是必胜棋步，但在足球比赛中毫无意义，或者在争论谁应该洗碗时。同样，哲学讨论中确定命题为真或有效的“行动”仅在哲学的“语言游戏”中有效。对于贝克特戏剧《等待戈多》中的尼伦、弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈来说，从事这种类型的“语言游戏”，但没有意识到它们的全部意义。实际上，后现代主义者认为，这样的语言游戏就是我们所拥有的；它们背后没有超越的现实，它们实际上是自我验证的，并为我们提供了我们寻求的社会身份。但弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈渴望在这之上有更深层次或“超越”的现实。因此，Nealon 说，“这是 Vladimir 和 Estragon 的话剧，对他们来说没有任何约定的意义，这构成了他们的社会纽带。等待他们在戈多的社会合法化，从一开始就没有必要”。

A useful example of postmodernist criticism, which makes a straightforward application of ideas derived from Lyotard, is Jeffrey Nealon’s ‘Samuel Beckett and the Postmodern: Language games, Play, and Waiting for Godot’ (reprinted in the Macmillan ‘New Casebook’ on Waiting for Godot and Endgame, ed. Steven Connor, 1992). This mainly shows the first of the six postmodernist critical activities listed above, but also has elements of the second, in the sense that the notion of language as a self-contained system relates closely to Lyotard’s idea of the ‘disappearance of the real’. Nealon first explains the notion of ‘language games’, derived from Wittgenstein, whereby when we claim that something is true we are not measuring it against some external absolute standard, but by internal rules and criteria which operate only within that designated sphere and have no ‘transcendent’ status beyond that. These have a restricted applicability, just like the rules which govern moves in a game. Thus, Knight to King’s Rook Four might be a winning move in a chess game, but would carry no weight at all in a game of football, say, or an argument about who should do the washing-up. Likewise, the ‘move’ in a philosophical discussion which establishes a proposition as true or valid has its validity only within the ‘language game’ of philosophy. For Nealon, Vladimir and Estragon in Beckett’s play, Waiting for Godot, engage in ‘language games’ of this type, but without realising their full significance. Actually, such language games, the postmodernists agree, are all we have; there is no transcendent reality behind them and they are actually self-validating, and provide us with the social identity we seek. But Vladimir and Estragon hanker for some deeper or ‘transcendent’ reality over and above this. Thus, says Nealon, ‘it is the play of Vladimir and Estragon’s words, not any agreed-upon meaning for them, which constitutes their social bond. Waiting for legitimation of their society in Godot is, from the beginning, unnecessary’.

因此，弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈难以接受这种“游戏”就足够的后现代观点（Just Gaming是利奥塔一本书的书名）：他们希望得到某种“宏大叙事”所提供的保证和绝对验证的安全感。这种理想的全面保证在剧中与基督教的救赎观念联系在一起，“恢复”（大致意思是解释和赋予意义）日常生活中看似毫无意义的细节和考验。（'提供'，我的天主教老师会在回应任何关于不公平或不公正的轻微抱怨时说。）然后，弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈被困在“现代主义”阶段，因此对失去的整体性充满怀旧之情。过去的。对于尼伦来说，弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈寻求的那种合法化话语在第一幕接近尾声的幸运儿的“思考”中得到了模仿。这是对哲学和宗教的“总体化”“元话语”的模仿，“真理的语言游戏”的实际演示，这是我们所能获得的全部。Nealon 说，这是一种破坏和解构所有普遍的、非历史的、一致的元叙事概念的叙事——所有戈多。如果戈多出现了，言下之意，除了这种虔诚而迂腐的胡言乱语，他还能提供什么？

Vladimir and Estragon, then, have difficulty in accepting this postmodern view that ‘gaming’ is enough (Just Gaming is the title of one of Lyotard’s books): they wish to have the security provided by some ‘Grand Narrative’ of guarantee and absolute validation. This desired comprehensive reassurance is linked in the play with Christian notions of redemption, which ‘recuperate’ (meaning, roughly, explain and give significance to) the apparently meaningless details and trials of daily life. (‘Offer it up’, my Catholic teachers would say in response to any minor complaint about unfairness or injustice.) Vladimir and Estragon, then, are trapped at the ‘modernist’ stage, and hence riven with nostalgia for the lost wholeness of the past. For Nealon, the kind of legitimating discourse which Vladimir and Estragon seek is parodied in Lucky’s ‘think’ near the end of the first act. This is a parody of the ‘totalising’ ‘metadiscourse’ of philosophy and religion, a practical demonstration of the ‘language game of truth’ which is all that is available to us. It is, says Nealon, a narrative that disrupts and deconstructs all notions of universal, ahistorical, consistent metanarrative – all Godots. Had Godot turned up, the implication is, what could he have offered but pious and pedantic gibberish of this kind?

Lucky 已经察觉到这一点，因此他兴高采烈地模仿，但其他人反对，因此他的演讲充满暴力。也就是说，现代主义者希望继续相信被推翻的神灵和戈多。在尼伦看来，弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈在整部剧中都处于“破坏性突破”的边缘。当他们忘记戈多时，他们在语言游戏中快乐而富有创造力，我们可以说，陶醉于“后现代主义条件”的开放性和不确定性中。但他们一再回到戈多，以及他对他们施加的假定限制和命令。“让我们远离这里吧”，弗拉基米尔在某一时刻提议，对此的回应是“我们不能……我们必须明天回来……等待戈多”。我们可以这样来描述这种观点：弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈最终证明了他们自己对我们在 20 世纪看到的真理和价值观的碎片化持现代主义态度。他们渴望回归失去了过去的圆满目标，因此他们的支离破碎的经历是怀旧和焦虑的。有时，他们似乎即将转变（或如尼伦所说的“突破”）到后现代态度，在这种态度中，碎片化成为一种受欢迎和享受的状态，但最终他们未能做到这一点。

Lucky has perceived this, hence his exuberant and joyous parody, but the others resist it, so his speech is met with violence. The modernist, that is, wishes to go on believing in the toppled gods and Godots. Vladimir and Estragon, for Nealon, are, throughout the play, on the verge of a ‘deconstructive breakthrough’. When they forget about Godot they are happy and inventive in their language games, revelling, we might say, in the openness and uncertainties of ‘the postmodernist condition’. But repeatedly they come back to Godot, and the supposed restraints and imperatives he places upon them. ‘Let’s go far away from here’, Vladimir proposes at one point, to which the response is ‘We can’t … We have to come back tomorrow … To wait for Godot’. We might characterise this view by saying that Vladimir and Estragon prove themselves in the end to have a modernist attitude to the fragmentation of truths and values which we have seen in the twentieth century. They long for a return to the lost fullness of purpose of the past, so their experience of fragmentation is nostalgic and angst-ridden. At times they seem on the verge of making a transition (or ‘breakthrough’, as Nealon calls it) to a postmodern attitude, in which fragmentation becomes a condition welcomed and enjoyed, but in the end they fail to do this.

支撑这种解读的现代主义/后现代主义二分法可以应用于许多其他作品。有哪些是你印象最深刻的？例如，等待似乎是 20 世纪戏剧中的一项重要活动，尤其是在哈罗德·品特 (Harold Pinter) 的戏剧中—— 《笨侍者》就是一个非常明显的例子。你可能想考虑在解释你熟悉的他的任何戏剧时使用后现代主义思想的价值或其他方面。另一个可以尝试非常相似的阅读的“等待”剧本是安东契诃夫的三姐妹（1901 年），剧中同名姐妹奥尔加、玛莎和伊琳娜被困在俄罗斯北部的资产阶级体面生活中，从邻近的任何规模的城镇乘火车 23 小时（见迈克尔弗雷恩对契诃夫戏剧的梅修恩版）。姐妹们 - 就像弗拉基米尔和爱斯特拉冈 - 徒劳地等待着某种外部力量进入她们外省的生活并改变她们，而每个松树所追求的理想都可以被视为个人的“元叙事”，例如社会进步的理想，或认为他们的苦难将以某种方式为未来更好的人类生活做出贡献。例如，伊琳娜在该剧接近尾声时说，“总有一天人们会明白这一切的目的，所有这些苦难的目的是什么，对我们隐藏的东西将不再隐藏”。对于姐妹们来说，

The modernist/postmodernist dichotomy that underpins this reading could be applied to many other works. Are there any which stand out in your mind? Waiting, for instance, seems to be an important activity in twentieth-century drama, notably in the plays of Harold Pinter – The Dumb Waiter would be a very obvious example. You might like to consider the value or otherwise of using the ideas of postmodernism in the explication of any of his plays with which you are familiar. Another ‘waiting’ play on which a very similar reading might be attempted is Anton Chekhov’s The Three Sisters (1901), in which the sisters of the title, Olga, Masha, and Irina, are stranded in lives of bourgeois respectability in northern Russia, twenty-three hours by train from the next town of any size (see Michael Frayn’s introduction to the Methuen edition of Chekhov’s plays). The sisters wait in vain – like Vladimir and Estragon – for some external force to enter their provincial lives and transform them, and the ideals for which each pines can be seen as personal ‘metanarratives’, such as an ideal of social progress, or the notion that their sufferings will in some way contribute to a better human life in the future. Irina, for instance, says near the end of the play that ‘A time will come when people will understand what it was all for, what the purpose was of all this suffering, and what was hidden from us will be hidden no more’. For the sisters, too, the actually self-sufficient reality of their condition is provided by the language games they play endlessly, and the image of the capital city of Moscow, a glittering amalgam of memory and desire, which constitutes for them a kind of hyperreality or simulacrum.

选读

Selected reading

本杰明，安德鲁，编辑。利奥塔读本(Blackwell, 1989)。

一个非常有用的来源。

Benjamin, Andrew, ed. The Lyotard Reader (Blackwell, 1989).

A very useful source.

布鲁克，彼得，编辑。现代主义/后现代主义（Longman，1992）。

与 Docherty 和 Waugh 一起研究该主题的普通读者。我发现介绍使现代主义/后现代主义变得沉重区别，但这是哈贝马斯、利奥塔、鲍德里亚、詹姆逊、艾柯、哈钦等人的主要作品以及早期材料的精简集。

Brooker, Peter, ed. Modernism/Postmodernism (Longman, 1992).

A general reader on the topic to examine alongside Docherty’s and Waugh’s. I find the introduction makes heavy going of the modernism/postmodernism distinction, but this is a compact collection of the key items by Habermas, Lyotard, Baudrillard, Jameson, Eco, Hutcheon, etc., as well as earlier material.

Connor, Steven，后现代主义文化：当代理论导论（Blackwell，第 2 版，1996 年）。

Connor 一直是该领域的重要代言人，清晰有力地阐述了问题和困境。

Connor, Steven, Postmodernist Culture: An Introduction to Theories of the Contemporary (Blackwell, 2nd edn, 1996).

Connor’s has been an important voice in this field, stating issues and dilemmas with clarity and force.

多切蒂，托马斯，编辑。后现代主义：读者（哥伦比亚大学出版社，1993 年）。

不朽的。Waugh's 的竞争对手读者。一个非常有用的材料集合，有子部分，每个部分都有自己的介绍，但我更喜欢 Waugh，因为它整体清晰和方便。

Docherty, Thomas, ed. Postmodernism: A Reader (Columbia University Press, 1993).

Monumental. The rival reader to Waugh’s. A very useful collection of material, with sub-sections, each with its own introduction, but I prefer Waugh for its overall clarity and convenience.

Sarup, Madan，后结构主义和后现代主义入门指南（朗文出版社，第 2 版，1993 年）。

关于后现代主义的有用部分，包括利奥塔和鲍德里亚，以及对选定的后现代主义“文化实践”（如视频和建筑）的考虑。

Sarup, Madan, An Introductory Guide to Post-Structuralism and Postmodernism (Longman, 2nd edn, 1993).

A helpful section on postmodernism, including Lyotard and Baudrillard, and considerations of selected postmodernist ‘cultural practices’ such as video and architecture.

沃，帕特里夏，编辑。后现代主义：读者（阿诺德，1992 年）。

一个有价值的材料集合，其中包括相关的美国论文（例如苏珊桑塔格的开创性“反对解释”）早于“后现代”一词的普遍使用 - 以及利奥塔，鲍德里亚和哈贝马斯的关键作品：还有来自詹姆逊和伊格尔顿之间关于后现代主义的马克思主义辩论的文章，​​其中后现代主义不情愿地被接受为不可避免的“晚期资本主义的文化逻辑”。著名的后现代主义理论家如 Linda Hutcheon 和 Brian McHale 也发表了论文。

Waugh, Patricia, ed. Postmodernism: A Reader (Arnold, 1992).

A valuable collection of material, which includes relevant American essays (such as Susan Sontag’s seminal ‘Against Interpretation’) which pre-date the general use of the term ‘postmodern’ – as well as key pieces by Lyotard, Baudrillard, and Habermas: also essays from the Marxist debate on postmodernism between Jameson and Eagleton, where postmodernism is reluctantly accepted as the inevitable ‘cultural logic of late capitalism’. Essays too from prominent theorists of post-modernism like Linda Hutcheon and Brian McHale.

Woods, Tim, Beginning Postmodernism（曼彻斯特大学出版社，第 2 版，2009 年）。

以生动易读的方式全面介绍后现代主义。这是“开始”系列中的标题之一。

Woods, Tim, Beginning Postmodernism (Manchester University Press, 2nd edn, 2009).

A comprehensive account of postmodernism presented in a lively and readable way. This is one of the titles in the ‘Beginnings’ series.

5

精神分析批评

5

Psychoanalytic criticism

介绍

Introduction

精神分析批评是文学批评的一种形式，它在文学解释中使用了一些精神分析技术。精神分析本身是一种治疗形式，旨在“通过调查头脑中有意识和无意识因素的相互作用”来治愈精神障碍（如简明牛津词典把它）。这样做的经典方法是让患者自由地交谈，以这种方式将导致问题的被压抑的恐惧和冲突带入有意识的头脑并公开面对，而不是继续“掩埋”在无意识中。这种做法是基于思想、本能和性欲如何运作的特定理论。这些理论是由奥地利人西格蒙德·弗洛伊德 (Sigmund Freud, 1856–1939) 提出的。如今，越来越多的人认为这种方法的治疗价值是有限的，而且弗洛伊德毕生的工作都因方法论上的不规范而存在严重缺陷。尽管如此，弗洛伊德仍然是一股重要的文化力量，他对我们如何看待自己的影响是无法估量的。

Psychoanalytic criticism is a form of literary criticism which uses some of the techniques of psychoanalysis in the interpretation of literature. Psychoanalysis itself is a form of therapy which aims to cure mental disorders ‘by investigating the interaction of conscious and unconscious elements in the mind’ (as the Concise Oxford Dictionary puts it). The classic method of doing this is to get the patient to talk freely, in such a way that the repressed fears and conflicts which are causing the problems are brought into the conscious mind and openly faced, rather than remaining ‘buried’ in the unconscious. This practice is based upon specific theories of how the mind, the instincts, and sexuality work. These theories were developed by the Austrian, Sigmund Freud (1856–1939). There is a growing consensus today that the therapeutic value of the method is limited, and that Freud’s life-work is seriously flawed by methodological irregularities. All the same, Freud remains a major cultural force, and his impact on how we think about ourselves has been incalculable.

弗洛伊德的主要思想包括在接下来的三段中以斜体字标出的思想。弗洛伊德的所有工作都依赖于无意识的概念，无意识是意识之外的思想部分，但它对我们的行为有强烈的影响。弗洛伊德并不是无意识的发现者：他的独特之处在于他赋予无意识在我们的生活中如此决定性的作用。与此相关的是压抑的概念，即“忘记”或忽视未解决的冲突、未承认的欲望或创伤性的过去事件，这样他们就被迫离开有意识的意识，进入无意识的领域。一个类似的过程是升华，压抑的材料被“提升”成更宏伟的东西或伪装成“高贵”的东西。例如，性冲动可能会以强烈的宗教体验或渴望的形式得到升华的表达。在他职业生涯的后期，弗洛伊德提出了一个三部分而非两部分的心理模型，将其分为自我、超我和本我，这三个人格“层次”大致对应于，分别是意识、良心和无意识。

Freud’s major ideas include those italicised in the next three paragraphs. All of Freud’s work depends upon the notion of the unconscious, which is the part of the mind beyond consciousness which nevertheless has a strong influence upon our actions. Freud was not the discoverer of the unconscious: his uniqueness lies in his attributing to it such a decisive role in our lives. Linked with this is the idea of repression, which is the ‘forgetting’ or ignoring of unresolved conflicts, unadmitted desires, or traumatic past events, so that they are forced out of conscious awareness and into the realm of the unconscious. A similar process is that of sublimation, whereby the repressed material is ‘promoted’ into something grander or is disguised as something ‘noble’. For instance, sexual urges may be given sublimated expression in the form of intense religious experiences or longings. Later in his career Freud suggested a three-part, rather than a two-part, model of the psyche, dividing it into the ego, the super-ego, and the id, these three ‘levels’ of the personality roughly corresponding to, respectively, the consciousness, the conscience, and the unconscious.

弗洛伊德的许多观点都与性有关。例如，婴儿性行为是这样一种观念，即性行为不是从青春期开始的，随着身体的成熟，而是从婴儿期开始，尤其是通过婴儿与母亲的关系。与此相关的是俄狄浦斯情结，弗洛伊德说，男婴由此产生了消灭父亲并成为母亲性伴侣的愿望。弗洛伊德主义者认为许多形式的代际冲突具有俄狄浦斯的色彩，例如职业竞争，弗洛伊德主义者通常将其视为兄弟姐妹之间争夺父母恩惠的再现。（正如俄狄浦斯情结的概念所暗示的那样，弗洛伊德的理论往往带有深深的男性主义偏见。）另一个关键思想是性欲，这是与性欲相关的能量驱动。在经典的弗洛伊德理论中，它分为三个阶段：口腔、肛门和阳具。个人的力比多是更普遍的驱动力的一部分，后来的弗洛伊德称之为爱欲（希腊语中的“爱”），大致意思是生命本能，与之相反的是Thanatos（希腊语中的“死亡”） ，这大致意味着死亡本能，当然是一个有争议的概念。

Many of Freud’s ideas concern aspects of sexuality. Infantile sexuality, for instance, is the notion that sexuality begins not at puberty, with physical maturing, but in infancy, especially through the infant’s relationship with the mother. Connected with this is the Oedipus complex, whereby, says Freud, the male infant conceives the desire to eliminate the father and become the sexual partner of the mother. Many forms of inter-generational conflict are seen by Freudians as having Oedipal overtones, such as professional rivalries, often viewed in Freudian terms as reproducing the competition between siblings for parental favour. (As the very idea of the Oedipal complex would suggest, Freudian theory is often deeply masculinist in bias.) Another key idea is that of the libido, which is the energy drive associated with sexual desire. In classic Freudian theory it has three stages of focus, the oral, the anal, and the phallic. The libido in the individual is part of a more generalised drive which the later Freud called Eros (the Greek word for ‘love’), which roughly means the life instinct, the opposite of which is Thanatos (the Greek word for ‘death’), which roughly means the death instinct, a controversial notion, of course.

几个关键术语涉及所谓的心理过程，例如移情，即接受分析的患者将分析中回忆起的情绪重定向到精神分析师的现象：因此，过去对父母形象的对抗或怨恨可能会重新激活，但针对分析师。另一种这样的机制是投射，当我们自己的某些方面（通常是消极的）不被认为是我们自己的一部分，而是被感知到或归因于另一个人时；例如，我们自己的欲望或对抗可能会在这个过程中被“否认”方法。这两者都可以被视为防御机制，即避免痛苦承认或承认的心理程序。另一个是屏幕记忆，它是一种琐碎或无关紧要的记忆，其功能是抹杀更重要的记忆。这些机制的一个众所周知的例子是弗洛伊德式的失误，弗洛伊德自己称之为“失误”，即无意识中被压抑的材料通过诸如口误、笔误或意外行为等日常现象找到了一个出口。

Several key terms concern what might be called psychic processes, such as transference, the phenomenon whereby the patient under analysis redirects the emotions recalled in analysis towards the psychoanalyst: thus, the antagonism or resentment felt towards a parental figure in the past might be reactivated, but directed against the analyst. Another such mechanism is projection, when aspects of ourselves (usually negative ones) are not recognised as part of ourselves but are perceived in or attributed to another; our own desires or antagonisms, for instance, may be ‘disowned’ in this way. Both these might be seen as defence mechanisms, that is, as psychic procedures for avoiding painful admissions or recognitions. Another such is the screen memory, which is a trivial or inconsequential memory whose function is to obliterate a more significant one. A well-known example of these mechanisms is the Freudian slip, which Freud himself called the ‘parapraxis’, whereby repressed material in the unconscious finds an outlet through such everyday phenomena as slips of the tongue, slips of the pen, or unintended actions.

弗洛伊德的一个重要术语的最后一个例子是梦的工作，真实事件或欲望被转化为梦图像的过程。其中包括：置换，即一个人或事件由另一个以某种方式与之联系或关联的人或事件来代表，这可能是因为发音相似的词，或通过某种形式的符号替代；和凝结，在梦中，许多人、事件或意义被组合起来，并由一个单一的形象来代表。因此，人物、动机和事件在梦中以非常“文学”的方式表现出来，包括通过梦的工作将抽象的想法或感受转化为具体的形象。梦，就像文学一样，通常不会做出明确的陈述。两者都倾向于间接或间接地交流，避免直接或公开陈述，并通过时间、地点或人物的具体体现来表达意义。

A final example of important Freudian terminology is the dream work, the process by which real events or desires are transformed into dream images. These include: displacement, whereby one person or event is represented by another which is in some way linked or associated with it, perhaps because of a similar-sounding word, or by some form of symbolic substitution; and condensation, whereby a number of people, events, or meanings are combined and represented by a single image in the dream. Thus, characters, motivation, and events are represented in dreams in a very ‘literary’ way, involving the translation, by the dream work, of abstract ideas or feelings into concrete images. Dreams, just like literature, do not usually make explicit statements. Both tend to communicate obliquely or indirectly, avoiding direct or open statement, and representing meanings through concrete embodiments of time, place, or person.

弗洛伊德式的解释是如何运作的

How Freudian interpretation works

弗洛伊德的解释通常被认为是给物体赋予性内涵的问题，例如，塔和梯子被视为阳具的象征。这种事情甚至在弗洛伊德生前就成了笑话，我们应该记得他曾经说过，“有时候雪茄就是雪茄”。（请注意，弗洛伊德是一个重度雪茄烟民，所以他这么说是出于既得利益。）实际上，弗洛伊德的解释往往非常巧妙，而不是非常简单。例如，让我们想象一下如何解释一个以罗马士兵为主角的梦。弗洛伊德认为，梦是一个逃生舱门或安全阀，被压抑的欲望、恐惧或记忆通过它寻求进入意识的出口。有问题的情绪被有意识的头脑审查，因此不得不伪装进入梦境，谁打扮成别人进来的。罗马士兵可能会通过一连串的联想与梦中的真实主题联系起来。假设做梦者是一个年轻的成年人，仍然处于专制父亲的控制之下，但想要摆脱他的影响，充分体验成人生活。罗马士兵可能通过联想过程代表父亲：父亲与家庭领域的严格、权威和权力的观念相关；罗马士兵与政治领域中的相同事物相关联；所以一个被另一个代替了。所以梦中的士兵是父亲的象征。

Freudian interpretation is popularly thought to be a matter of attributing sexual connotations to objects, so that towers and ladders, for instance, are seen as phallic symbols. This kind of thing had become a joke even in Freud’s own lifetime, and we should remember that he once said, ‘Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar’. (Freud was a heavy cigar smoker, mind you, so he had a vested interest in saying that.) In reality, Freudian interpretation is often highly ingenious, rather than highly simplistic. For example, let’s imagine how a dream featuring a Roman soldier might be interpreted. Freud believes that a dream is an escape-hatch or safety-valve through which repressed desires, fears, or memories seek an outlet into the conscious mind. The emotion in question is censored by the conscious mind and so has to enter the dream in disguise, like a person barred from a club who gets in by dressing up as somebody else. The Roman soldier might be connected with the real subject of the dream by a chain of associations. Let’s say that the dreamer is a young adult still under the thumb of an authoritarian father but wanting to break away from his influence and experience adult life to the full. The Roman soldier might represent the father by a process of association: the father is associated with ideas of strictness, authority, and power in the domestic sphere; the Roman soldier is linked to the same things in the political sphere; so the one is substituted for the other. So the soldier in the dream is a symbolic representation of the father.

但是这个符号可能浓缩了几个含义。假设做梦者想通过与父亲发生性关系来反抗父亲，而父亲肯定不赞成这种关系。罗马士兵也可能代表这个人，想象中的情人；也许陈词滥调的“拉丁情人”可能促使了这一点。于是，令人畏惧的父亲和渴望的情人都被浓缩成一个罗马士兵的梦境形象。

But several meanings might be condensed into this symbol. Suppose the dreamer is tempted to rebel against the father by entering into a sexual liaison of which the father would certainly disapprove. The Roman soldier might also represent this person, the envisaged lover; perhaps the clichéd phrase ‘Latin lover’ might have prompted this. Thus, both the feared father and the desired lover are condensed into the single dream figure of the Roman soldier.

置换和冷凝等设备的目的有两个。首先，正如我们所说，他们掩饰梦中包含的被压抑的恐惧和愿望，以便他们能够通过通常阻止他们浮出水面的审查员有意识的头脑。其次，他们将这种材料塑造成可以在梦中表现的东西，即形象、符号和隐喻。为了梦，物质必须变成这种形式，因为梦不说东西，它们展示东西。特别是在这个意义上，正如我们已经指出的，它们非常像文学。因此，文学评论家对弗洛伊德的解释方法产生了兴趣。

The purpose of devices like displacement and condensation is two-fold. Firstly, as we said, they disguise the repressed fears and wishes contained in the dream so that they can get past the censor which normally prevents their surfacing into the conscious mind. Secondly, they fashion this material into something which can be represented in a dream, that is, into images, symbols, and metaphors. Material has to be turned into this form for dreams, since dreams don’t say things, they show things. In this sense especially, as we have indicated, they are very like literature. Hence the interest of literary critics in Freudian methods of interpretation.

这应该会引起您的疑问，即我们如何决定弗洛伊德的解释何时合理，何时不合理。我想再举一个例子，这一次来自弗洛伊德的一本名为《日常生活的精神病理学》的书。尽管它的标题如此，但这是弗洛伊德最令人愉快和最容易理解的出版物之一。它的副标题解释了它的内容：“遗忘、口误、拙劣的行为、迷信和错误”。（笨拙的行为是当你做一些事情，比如打开糖果，把纸放进嘴里，然后扔掉糖果。）潜在的假设是，当一些愿望、恐惧、记忆或欲望难以面对时，我们可能会尝试去面对通过抑制它来应对它，也就是说，将它从清醒的头脑。但这并不能使它消失：它在无意识中仍然存在，就像埋在海底的放射性物质一样，并不断寻找回到有意识的方法，最终总是成功。正如弗洛伊德的名言，“被压抑的事物总会回归”。口误或笔误、名字的遗忘以及类似的“事故”表明这种被压抑的材料正在寻找回归之路。

This should raise questions in your mind about how we decide when a Freudian interpretation is plausible and when not. I want to take one more example, this time from a book by Freud called The Psychopathology of Everyday Life. In spite of its title, this is one of Freud’s most enjoyable and accessible publications. Its subtitle explains what it’s about: ‘Forgetting, slips of the tongue, bungled actions, superstitions and errors’. (Bungled actions are when you do things like unwrapping a sweet, putting the paper in your mouth, and throwing away the sweet.) The underlying assumption is that when some wish, fear, memory, or desire is difficult to face we may try to cope with it by repressing it, that is, eliminating it from the conscious mind. But this doesn’t make it go away: it remains alive in the unconscious, like radioactive matter buried beneath the ocean, and constantly seeks a way back into the conscious mind, always succeeding eventually. As Freud famously said, ‘There is always a return of the repressed’. Slips of the tongue or pen, the forgetting of names, and similar ‘accidents’ show this repressed material in the act of seeking a way back.

这个例子来自弗洛伊德自己的经历，它将重要性归因于忘记引文中的一个词。值得花一点时间，因为它代表了复杂性和独创性的品质，我认为这在弗洛伊德的解释中很常见。弗洛伊德解释说，在与家人度假时，他遇到了一位学术青年，他和弗洛伊德一样都是犹太人，他们讨论了可能阻碍他们职业生涯的反犹太主义。年轻人对此事表达了强烈的感情，并表示希望下一代能够纠正这种错误。他引用了拉丁诗人维吉尔的话来说明这一点，引用了迦太基女王狄多在被埃涅阿斯抛弃时所说的话。她的话是“Exoriare aliquis nostris ex ossibus ultor”，意思是“愿有人从我们的骨头中崛起为复仇者”，但在引用拉丁语中的这句话时，年轻人不小心漏掉了“aliquis”（意思是“某人”）这个词。弗洛伊德更正了引文，年轻人（读过弗洛伊德的书）挑战他解释这种简单的遗忘行为的意义。弗洛伊德接受了挑战，并要求年轻人“如果你没有任何明确的目标，将注意力集中在被遗忘的词上，那么坦率地、不加批判地说出你想到的任何东西”。这会产生以下关联序列：

The example is from Freud’s own experience and it attributes significance to the forgetting of a word from a quotation. It is worth spending a little time on, since it typifies the quality of complexity and ingenuity which I have suggested is common in Freudian interpretation. Freud explains that while on holiday with his family he met an academic young man who, like Freud, was Jewish and they discussed the anti-semitism which might hinder their careers. The young man voiced strong feelings on this matter, expressing the wish that such wrongs might be put right by a future generation. He made this point with a quotation from the Latin poet Virgil, using words spoken by Dido, Queen of Carthage, when she is abandoned by Aeneas. Her words are ‘Exoriare aliquis nostris ex ossibus ultor’, meaning ‘May someone arise from our bones as an avenger’, but in quoting the line in Latin the young man accidently leaves out the word ‘aliquis’ (which means ‘someone’). Freud corrects the quotation, and the young man (who has read Freud’s books) challenges him to explain the significance of this simple act of forgetting. Freud accepts the challenge, and asks the young man to say ‘candidly and uncritically whatever comes into your mind if you direct your attention to the forgotten word without any definite aim’. This produces the following sequence of associations:

首先，类似发音的词，如文物、液化、流动性和流动性。

Firstly, similar-sounding words like relics, liquefying, fluidity, and fluid.

其次，特伦特的圣西蒙，他几年前看到了他的遗物。

Secondly, St Simon of Trent, whose relics he saw some years ago.

第三，意大利报纸上的一篇文章，名为“圣奥古斯丁对女性的看法”。

Thirdly, an article in an Italian newspaper called ‘What St Augustine says about women’.

第四， St Januarius，他的血液保存在那不勒斯一座教堂的小瓶中，在某个特定的圣日，它奇迹般地液化了。他说，“如果延迟，人们会非常激动”。弗洛伊德指出，其中两位圣人（亚努阿里乌斯和奥古斯丁）的名字与日历密切相关，他已经得出结论为什么这个年轻人忘记了“aliquis”这个词。这个年轻人一直对某件事感到不安，如果他说出“aliquis”这个词，他会再次想起这种焦虑：所以无意识通过从他的有意识记忆中删除这个词来保护他。或许你已经知道这个年轻人担心的是什么事情了。他停下来，有些尴尬地说：“我突然想到一位年轻女士，我可能很容易从她那里听到一条消息，这对我们俩来说都很尴尬”。他犹豫了一下，弗洛伊德问道：“她的月经已经停止了吗？” 年轻人很惊讶，弗洛伊德解释了他是如何知道的：“想想日历上的圣徒，在特定的一天开始流血，当事件没有发生时的干扰。”

Fourthly, St Januarius, whose blood is kept in a phial in a church at Naples and on a particular holy day it miraculously liquefies. He says ‘the people get very agitated if it is delayed’. Freud points out that two of these saints (Januarius and Augustine) have names which link them closely with the calendar, and he has already worked out why the young man forgot the word ‘aliquis’. The young man has been uneasy about a certain event, and if he had said the word ‘aliquis’ that would have reminded him again of this anxiety: so the unconscious protects him by deleting the word from his conscious memory. Perhaps you can already work out what the event is which the young man is worried about. He breaks off and says in some embarrassment ‘I’ve suddenly thought of a young lady from whom I might easily hear a piece of news that would be very awkward for both of us’. He hesitates, and Freud asks ‘That her periods have stopped?’ The young man is astonished, and Freud explains how he knew: ‘Think of the calendar saints, the blood that starts to flow on a particular day, the disturbance when the event fails to take place.’

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

就其详尽性及其对文学评论家所称的“象征主义”的使用而言，这个例子在精神分析解释的各个方面是相当典型的。你觉得它有多令人信服？

In its elaborateness, and its use of what literary critics would call ‘symbolism’, this example is fairly typical of aspects of psychoanalytic interpretation. How convincing do you find it?

尝试以特定方式确定您自己的反应。你的判断依据是什么？你是否因为这个例子过于复杂而不信任它？（我假设存在某种程度的不信任，因为这是我每次使用它时遇到的情况。）是否应该限制在单据及其解释之间允许的关联步骤的数量？没有这样的限制，难道不能使联想链延伸到几乎任何解释目的地吗？或者是步骤的性质，而不是步骤的数量，导致示例最终无法令人信服？如果是这样，它们有什么作用？

Try to pin-point your own reaction in a specific way. What is your judgement based upon? Do you distrust the example because of its elaborateness? (I am assuming some degree of distrust, since that is what I have encountered whenever I have used it.) Should there be a limit to the number of associative steps allowable between the slip and its interpretation? Without some such limit, could not the chain of associations be made to stretch to almost any interpretative destination? Or is it the nature of the steps, rather than their number, which makes the example finally unconvincing? If so, what is it about them which has this effect?

请注意，这个例子似乎需要无意识来预测有意识的思想流动，看到任何暗示液体的词都会提醒人们害怕怀孕，然后先发制人地从有意识中消除拉丁词“aliquis”头脑。

Note that the example seems to require the unconscious to anticipate the flow of conscious thought, to see that any word suggesting liquid will act as a reminder of the feared pregnancy, and then to eliminate the Latin word ‘aliquis’, preemptively, from the conscious mind.

我个人对此的感觉是，这个例子有一种吸引人的复杂性，与通常被称为“弗洛伊德”的平庸解释相去甚远。焦虑年轻人的感觉被证明充满了思想，在我看来这是一种非常合理的方式，而不是被锁在某个特定的隔间里；因此，它很可能出现在任何地方。但也许这只是说我喜欢这个例子的精巧之处。

My own feeling about it is that there is an attractive complexity about this example, far removed from the banalities of interpretations which are popularly called ‘Freudian’. The anxiety felt by the young man is shown to suffuse the mind, in what seems to me a very plausible way, rather than being locked away in some specific compartment; hence, it is likely to surface anywhere at all. But perhaps this is simply to say that the elaborateness is what I like about this example.

因此，弗洛伊德式的解释一直引起文学评论家的极大兴趣。同样，基本原因是无意识，如诗歌、小说或戏剧，不能直接和明确地说话，而是通过图像、符号、标志和隐喻来表达。文学也不涉及直接明确地陈述生活，而是通过意象、象征、隐喻等方式展示和表达经验。然而，由于所做的“陈述”并不明确，因此不可避免地涉及到“判断”因素，因此对文学的精神分析解释常常引起争议。

Freudian interpretation, then, has always been of considerable interest to literary critics. The basic reason, again, is that the unconscious, like the poem, or novel, or play, cannot speak directly and explicitly but does so through images, symbols, emblems, and metaphors. Literature, too, is not involved with making direct explicit statements about life, but with showing and expressing experience through imagery, symbolism, metaphor and so on. However, because the ‘statements’ made are not explicit there is an inevitable ‘judgemental’ element involved, and in consequence psychoanalytic inter-petations of literature are often controversial.

弗洛伊德与证据

Freud and evidence

近年来，对弗洛伊德的不信任一直在增加，部分原因是他对女性的看法主要是负面的，如认为女性的性行为是基于自恋、受虐和被动的感觉，以及认为她们患有天生的自卑感被称为“阴茎嫉妒”。最近的研究似乎表明，这些观点是通过误读甚至歪曲他的病人向他提供的证据来维持的；例如，将童年时期的性虐待视为幻想而不是现实。弗洛伊德故意误读的案例研究通常简称为“多拉”，但正式名称为“癔症病例分析片段”（鹈鹕弗洛伊德图书馆第 8 卷）。女权主义评论家和其他人将此案例研究作为对弗洛伊德进行心理分析的一种方式来阅读。例如，在朵拉的案例中：弗洛伊德、歇斯底里和女权主义（查尔斯·伯恩海默和克莱尔·卡汉主编，Virago，1985 年）。1900 年秋天，18 岁的“朵拉”被父亲带到弗洛伊德那里接受治疗。她的父母发现了一张威胁自杀的字条，这是一段退缩和困难时期的高潮。多拉在得出任何结论之前就中断了治疗，因此弗洛伊德称这个病例为“癔症病例分析的片段”。大部分材料是弗洛伊德对她在治疗过程中与他有关的两个梦的分析和解释，我们将集中讨论其中一个。

Distrust of Freud has been growing in recent years, partly as a result of his mainly negative views on women, as seen in the notion that women’s sexuality is based upon feelings of narcissism, masochism, and passivity, and the idea that they suffer from an innate form of inferiority complex known as ‘penis envy’. Recent work seems to show that these views were maintained by misreading, or even misrepresenting, the evidence presented to him by his patients; for instance by taking accounts of sexual abuse in childhood as fantasies rather than reality. Freud’s wilful misreading is seen in the case study usually known simply as ‘Dora’, but officially entitled ‘Fragment of an Analysis of a Case of Hysteria’ (volume 8 in the Pelican Freud Library). Feminist critics, and others, have read this case study as a means of psychoanalysing Freud. For instance, a collection of essays on the case appeared in 1985 under the title In Dora’s Case: Freud, Hysteria, and Feminism (ed. Charles Bernheimer and Claire Kahane, Virago, 1985). ‘Dora’ was brought to Freud for treatment in the autumn of the year 1900, by her father, as an eighteen-year-old. Her parents had found a note threatening suicide, which was the culmination of a period of withdrawal and difficulty. Dora broke off the treatment before it reached any conclusion, so Freud calls the case ‘Fragment of an Analysis of a Case of Hysteria’. The bulk of the material is Freud’s analysis and interpretation of two dreams which she related to him in the course of the treatment, and we’ll concentrate on one of these.

分析发生时的家庭情况是，朵拉富有的父母在婚姻中并不幸福，但他们与另一对夫妇 K 夫妇建立了亲密的友谊。上了好几年。K 先生知道这件事，所有三个成年人似乎都达成了一个不言而喻的协议，作为交换，应该让 K 先生可以接触到 Dora。K 先生两次接近她，第一次是在他的办公室，当时她十四岁；在明显兴奋的状态下，他突然抓住她，开始亲吻她。她带着强烈的厌恶感跑了出去。弗洛伊德认为这种反应是神经质的：在他看来，“这肯定正是在一个十四岁的女孩身上唤起明显的性兴奋感的情况”，因为 K 先生，p. 60）。

The family situation at the time the analysis took place is that Dora’s wealthy parents were unhappy in their marriage, but they had formed a close friendship with another couple, Mr and Mrs K. A sexual relationship developed between Dora’s father and Mrs K, which went on for several years. Mr K knew of this, and all three adults seemed to have an unspoken agreement that in exchange, as it were, Dora should be made available to Mr K. Mr K made approaches to her on two occasions, the first in his office, when she was fourteen; in a state of obvious excitement he suddenly took hold of her and began to kiss her. She reacted with a violent feeling of disgust and ran out. Freud considered this reaction neurotic: in his view ‘this was surely just the situation to call up a distinct feeling of sexual excitement in a girl of fourteen’, since Mr K, as he explains in a footnote, was ‘still quite young and of prepossessing appearance’ (p. 60).

第二次发生在多拉十六岁的时候。她和K先生一起在湖边散步，他“居然敢向她提建议”。她扇了他一巴掌，然后匆匆离去。弗洛伊德对她拒绝的“残忍形式”感到困惑，并再次认为她的反应是神经质的。当多拉告诉她父亲发生的事情时，他要求 K 先生作出解释，但 K 先生否认这件事曾经发生过。她的父亲相信他而不是朵拉。鉴于这些情况，弗洛伊德对这种情况的看法似乎非常反常。大部分分析集中在两个梦境中，第一个是反复出现的梦境，第一次发生是在他们住在湖边的一所房子里时，K 先生在那里提出了他的不雅提议：

The second occasion happened when Dora was sixteen. She and Mr K were walking together beside a lake, and he ‘had the audacity to make a suggestion to her’. She slapped his face and hurried away. Freud is puzzled by the ‘brutal form’ of her refusal, and again sees her reaction as neurotic. When Dora told her father about what had happened he asked Mr K for an explanation, but Mr K denied that the incident had ever taken place. Her father believed him rather than Dora. Given these circumstances, Freud’s view of the situation seems remarkably perverse. The first of the two dreams on which much of the analysis centres was a recurrent one, which first happened when they were staying in a house by the lake where Mr K made his indecent proposal:

一座房子着火了。父亲站在我的床边叫醒了我。我迅速穿好衣服。母亲想停下来救她的珠宝盒，父亲却说“为了你的珠宝盒，我不肯让自己和我的两个孩子被烧死”。我们赶紧下楼，一出门我就醒了。
A house was on fire. My father was standing beside my bed and woke me up. I dressed quickly. Mother wanted to stop and save her jewel-case, but father said ‘I refuse to let myself and my two children be burnt for the sake of your jewel-case’. We hurried downstairs, and as soon as I was outside I woke up.

（鹈鹕弗洛伊德图书馆，第 8 卷，第 99 页）

(The Pelican Freud Library, vol. 8, p. 99)

弗洛伊德评论说，首先，这个梦的直接导火索是当他们到达这个小木屋时，她父亲说他担心如果那里着火会发生什么。其次，下午，朵拉在沙发上小睡了一会，醒来发现 K 先生站在她身边。在梦中，父亲和 K 先生被调换了位置。第三，几年前，她曾听到她的父母为珠宝发生严重争吵。第四，弗洛伊德指出，德语单词“jewel-case”是女性生殖器的俚语。因此，根据弗洛伊德的说法，梦表达了朵拉压抑的想要给 K 先生想要的东西（即她的珠宝盒）的愿望：火代表了她自己压抑的激情。K 先生的形象与父亲的形象互换，以表达她希望她以前对父亲的恋母情结能够保护她免受诱惑屈服于 K 先生的挑逗。弗洛伊德在朵拉对她父亲和 K 夫人之间关系的怨恨中看到了这种俄狄浦斯情结的残余痕迹，一种认为 K 夫人是她成功争夺父爱的对手的感觉。面对她父亲 K 先生和弗洛伊德的联合男性力量，朵拉似乎几乎没有机会，而且整个案例研究无疑表明弗洛伊德和精神分析处于最弱的地位。第 6 章女权主义。）

Freud comments, firstly, that the immediate trigger of the dream is that when they arrived at this small wooden house her father said he was afraid of what would happen if there was a fire there. Secondly, in the afternoon Dora had woken up from an afternoon nap on the sofa to find Mr K standing over her. In the dream the father and Mr K are transposed. Thirdly, some years before she had heard her mother and father having a serious argument about jewels. Fourthly, Freud points out that the German word ‘jewel-case’ is a slang term for the female genitals. According to Freud, therefore, the dream expresses Dora’s repressed wish to give Mr K what he wants (that is, her jewel-case): the fire represents her own repressed passion. The figure of Mr K is transposed with that of the father to express the wish that her former Oedipal love for her father will protect her from the temptation to yield to Mr K’s advances. Freud sees in Dora’s resentment of the relationship between her father and Mrs K a residual trace of this Oedipus complex, a feeling that Mrs K is her successful rival for her father’s love. Against the combined male forces of her father, Mr K, and Freud it would seem that Dora has little chance, and the whole case study certainly shows Freud and psychoanalysis at their weakest. (Psychoanalysis in relation to feminism is further discussed in Chapter 6 on feminism.)

弗洛伊德式的精神分析批评家做什么

What Freudian psychoanalytic critics do

1. 在文学解释中，他们非常重视有意识和无意识之间的区别。他们将文学作品的“显性”内容与前者联系起来，将“隐性”内容与后者联系起来，将后者视为作品“真正”的内容，并试图将两者区分开来。

1. They give central importance, in literary interpretation, to the distinction between the conscious and the unconscious mind. They associate the literary work’s ‘overt’ content with the former, and the ‘covert’ content with the latter, privileging the latter as being what the work is ‘really’ about, and aiming to disentangle the two.

2. 因此，他们密切关注无意识的动机和感受，无论是 (a) 作者的动机和感受，还是 (b) 作品中描绘的人物的动机和感受。

2. Hence, they pay close attention to unconscious motives and feelings, whether these be (a) those of the author, or (b) those of the characters depicted in the work.

3. 它们展示了经典精神分析症状、条件或阶段在文学作品中的存在，例如婴儿情绪和性发育的口腔、肛门和阳具阶段。

3. They demonstrate the presence in the literary work of classic psychoanalytic symptoms, conditions, or phases, such as the oral, anal, and phallic stages of emotional and sexual development in infants.

4. 他们将精神分析概念大规模应用于一般文学史；例如，哈罗德·布鲁姆 (Harold Bloom) 的著作《影响的焦虑》( The Anxiety of Influence , 1973) 将每一代诗人在其前辈的伟大“威胁”下为身份而进行的斗争视为俄狄浦斯情结的上演。

4. They make large-scale applications of psychoanalytic concepts to literary history in general; for example, Harold Bloom’s book The Anxiety of Influence (1973) sees the struggle for identity by each generation of poets, under the ‘threat’ of the greatness of its predecessors, as an enactment of the Oedipus complex.

5. 他们以社会或历史背景为代价，为文学作品确定了一个“心理”背景，将个人“心理剧”置于阶级冲突的“社会剧”之上。例如，几代人或兄弟姐妹之间的冲突，或者同一个人内部相互竞争的欲望之间的冲突，比社会阶层之间的冲突要大得多。

5. They identify a ‘psychic’ context for the literary work, at the expense of social or historical context, privileging the individual ‘psycho-drama’ above the ‘social drama’ of class conflict. The conflict between generations or siblings, or between competing desires within the same individual looms much larger than conflict between social classes, for instance.

弗洛伊德精神分析批评：例子

Freudian psychoanalytic criticism: examples

弗洛伊德的精神分析理论可以帮助解决什么样的文学问题？让我们从莎士比亚的哈姆雷特开始，一个众所周知的例子已经成为陈词滥调。上面列出的弗洛伊德批评家所做的相关项目是：1. 强调有意识和无意识之间的区别，2. 揭示人物的无意识动机，以及3. 在文学作品中看到经典精神分析条件的体现。在剧中，哈姆雷特的父亲被他的亲兄弟谋杀，哈姆雷特的叔叔后来娶了哈姆雷特的母亲。哈姆雷特父亲的鬼魂出现在哈姆雷特面前，告诉他杀死他的叔叔以报仇雪恨。这样做并没有明显的困难，但哈姆雷特大部分时间都在拖延和找借口。为什么？他不是特别娇气，因为他在演出过程中杀了其他人。此外，鬼魂所揭示的只是证实了哈姆雷特独立形成自己的怀疑，他收集了其他外部证据，证明鬼魂告诉他的是实话。那么为什么会延迟呢？批评者长期以来一直在争论这个问题，但没有得出任何普遍接受的结论。精神分析批评提供了一个巧妙而简单的解决方案：哈姆雷特无法为这一罪行报仇，因为他有罪，因为他想自己犯同样的罪行。他有恋母情结，即对自己母亲的性欲受到压抑，并因此希望除掉父亲。因此，叔叔只是做了哈姆雷特自己偷偷做的事 哈姆雷特无法为这一罪行报仇，因为他自己也想犯同样的罪行。他有恋母情结，即对自己母亲的性欲受到压抑，并因此希望除掉父亲。因此，叔叔只是做了哈姆雷特自己偷偷做的事 哈姆雷特无法为这一罪行报仇，因为他自己也想犯同样的罪行。他有恋母情结，即对自己母亲的性欲受到压抑，并因此希望除掉父亲。因此，叔叔只是做了哈姆雷特自己偷偷做的事希望_做：因此他很难成为复仇者。弗洛伊德在《梦的解析》（ The Interpretation of Dreams，1900 年）中首次勾勒出该剧的这一观点。正如弗洛伊德总结的那样，哈姆雷特无法

What kind of literary problem can Freudian psychoanalytic theories help with? Let’s start with Shakespeare’s Hamlet, an example which is so well-known that it has become a cliché. The relevant items in the above list of what Freudian critics do are: 1. stressing the distinction between conscious and unconscious, 2. uncovering the unconscious motives of characters, and 3. seeing in the literary work an embodiment of classic psychoanalytic conditions. In the play Hamlet’s father is murdered by his own brother, Hamlet’s uncle, who then marries Hamlet’s mother. The ghost of Hamlet’s father appears to Hamlet and tells him to avenge the murder by killing his uncle. There is no obvious difficulty about doing this, but Hamlet spends most of the play delaying and making excuses. Why? He is not particularly squeamish, as he kills other people in the course of the play. Also, what the ghost reveals merely confirms suspicions Hamlet had independently formed himself, and he gathers other external evidence that the ghost is telling him the truth. So why the delay? Critics have long debated the question without coming to any generally accepted conclusions. Psychoanalytic criticism offers a neat and simple solution: Hamlet cannot avenge this crime because he is guilty of wanting to commit the same crime himself. He has an Oedipus complex, that is, a repressed sexual desire for his own mother, and a consequent wish to do away with his father. Thus, the uncle has merely done what Hamlet himself secretly wished to do: hence the difficulty for him of being the avenger. This view of the play was first sketched out by Freud in The Interpretation of Dreams (1900). As Freud summarises the matter, Hamlet is unable to

报复那个杀死父亲并与母亲一起取代父亲位置的男人，这个男人向他展示了他童年时被压抑的愿望。因此，本应驱使他报复的厌恶在他身上被自责和良心的顾忌所取代，这提醒他，他自己实际上并不比他要惩罚的罪人好多少。
take vengeance on the man who did away with his father and took that father’s place with his mother, the man who shows him the repressed wishes of his own childhood realized. Thus the loathing which should drive him on to revenge is replaced in him by self-reproaches, by scruples of conscience, which remind him that he himself is literally no better than the sinner he is to punish.

（企鹅弗洛伊德图书馆，第 4 卷，第 367 页）

(Penguin Freud Library, vol. 4, p. 367)

作为该剧观点的证据，精神分析评论家指出哈姆雷特在卧室场景中表现出对他母亲性取向的强烈和不寻常的意识。弗洛伊德将哈姆雷特在剧中的处境与莎士比亚本人的处境联系起来（“当然，在哈姆雷特中我们面对的只能是诗人自己的思想'). 他引用了这样一种观点，即它是在莎士比亚自己的父亲于 1601 年去世后立即写成的（“当他童年对父亲的感情刚刚恢复时”），他补充说，“众所周知，莎士比亚的亲生儿子也死了在很小的时候就有了“Hamnet”的名字，这与“Hamlet”相同（第 368 页）。尽管如此，发现俄狄浦斯冲突的人物是哈姆雷特，而不是作者莎士比亚。那么，这就是文学中的一个著名问题，精神分析可以为该问题提供解决方案的基础。弗洛伊德提出的解释戏剧的草图后来由他的英国同事欧内斯特琼斯在哈姆雷特和俄狄浦斯（1949）中发展。这种精神分析自传式的观点有一个著名的持续文学模仿詹姆斯·乔伊斯 ( James Joyce) 的《尤利西斯》 (1922)中的哈姆雷特。
As evidence for this view of the play, the psychoanalytic critic points to the bedroom scene in which Hamlet shows an intense and unusual awareness of his mother’s sexuality. Freud links the situation of Hamlet in the play to that of Shakespeare himself (‘It can, of course, only be the poet’s own mind which confronts us in Hamlet’). He cites the view that it was written immediately after the death of Shakespeare’s own father in 1601 (‘while his childhood feelings about his father had been freshly revived’) and he adds, ‘It is known, too, that Shakespeare’s own son who died at an early age bore the name of “Hamnet”, which is identical with “Hamlet”’ (p. 368). All the same, it is Hamlet the character in whom the Oedipal conflict is detected, not Shakespeare the author. Here, then, is a famous problem in literature, to which psychoanalysis can offer the basis of a solution. The sketch for an interpretation of the play put forward by Freud was later developed by his British colleague Ernest Jones in Hamlet and Oedipus (1949). There is a famous sustained literary pastiche of this psychoanalytical-autobiographical view of Hamlet in James Joyce’s Ulysses (1922).

另一个精神分析评论家可以提供帮助的令人费解的剧本的例子是哈罗德·品特 (Harold Pinter) 的《英雄归来》。这个例子说明了精神分析批评家所做的清单中的第三项，戏剧中体现的经典弗洛伊德条件是母亲的固着。返校节以伦敦东区的一个全男性家庭为中心，该家庭由一个专制的父亲和两个成年的儿子组成。母亲已经去世多年，但鳏夫和她的儿子们对她的记忆深表崇拜。第三个儿子移居美国，是一名大学教授。他回来拜访他的家人，带着他的妻子（这是标题的字面意思）。在拜访期间，儿子们和父亲想到了让他们兄弟的妻子在 Soho 公寓里当妓女，并靠所得为生。他们的兄弟同意了这一点，而妻子在向她提出时也平静地接受了，首先提出了尽可能最好的财务条款，并明确表示她将在很多方面成为这个新家庭的老板。她的丈夫带着她和他们的三个孩子（都是男孩）回到了美国。这些事件看起来如此离奇，以至于该剧经常被当作一出超现实的闹剧来演出。

Another example of a puzzling play with which the psychoanalytic critic can offer help is Harold Pinter’s The Homecoming. This example illustrates the third item in the list of what psychoanalytic critics do, the classic Freudian condition embodied in the play being that of the mother fixation. The Homecoming centres on an East End of London all-male household consisting of an autocratic father and two grown-up sons. The mother has been dead for some years but her memory is worshipped by the widower and her sons. There is a third son who has emigrated to America where he is a college professor. He comes back on a visit to his family, bringing his wife (this being the literal homecoming of the title). During the visit the sons and the father have the idea of setting their brother’s wife up as a prostitute in a Soho flat, and living off the proceeds. Their brother agrees to this, and the wife accepts it calmly when it is put to her, having first extracted the best possible financial terms, and made it clear that she will be in many ways the boss of this new household. Her husband goes back to America without her, and to their three children (all boys). These events seem so bizarre that the play is often performed as a kind of surreal farce.

但是，精神分析批评家再次能够提供一种解释，使它们具有一定的意义。在她的文章“品特的弗洛伊德式的归乡”（批评随笔，1991 年 7 月，第 189–207 页）MW Rowe 表示，潜在的解释可以在弗洛伊德的文章“性生活中最普遍的退化形式”中找到。剧中展现的全男性家庭患有一种被称为母亲固定的典型情况，其中对母亲有一种夸张的崇敬。这些人只被长得像母亲的女人所吸引，但正因为如此，乱伦禁忌的阴影使得对她们表达性感情变得困难或不可能。因此，他们唯一的出路就是寻求与不像母亲的女性发生性关系，因此她们鄙视这些女性。因此，为了产生性兴奋，这些男人不得不贬低他们的爱情客体，因为如果他们不那么堕落，他们就会像母亲一样，因此，在男人的心目中，不能作为性伴侣。因此，女性一方面被两极分化为理想化的母性形象，另一方面又被分化为妓女形象。对母亲过分的崇敬通常会在青春期大大淡化，但如果母亲在孩子进入青春期之前就去世了，就像剧中的家庭一样，那么一个有害的、理想化的母亲形象就会继续存在，并使孩子的形象黯然失色。所有可能的性伴侣。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。妇女被两极化，一方面是理想化的母性形象，另一方面是妓女形象。对母亲过分的崇敬通常会在青春期大大淡化，但如果母亲在孩子进入青春期之前就去世了，就像剧中的家庭一样，那么一个有害的、理想化的母亲形象就会继续存在，并使孩子的形象黯然失色。所有可能的性伴侣。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。妇女被两极化，一方面是理想化的母性形象，另一方面是妓女形象。对母亲过分的崇敬通常会在青春期大大淡化，但如果母亲在孩子进入青春期之前就去世了，就像剧中的家庭一样，那么一个有害的、理想化的母亲形象就会继续存在，并使孩子的形象黯然失色。所有可能的性伴侣。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。对母亲过分的崇敬通常会在青春期大大淡化，但如果母亲在孩子进入青春期之前就去世了，就像剧中的家庭一样，那么一个有害的、理想化的母亲形象就会继续存在，并使孩子的形象黯然失色。所有可能的性伴侣。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。对母亲过分的崇敬通常会在青春期大大淡化，但如果母亲在孩子进入青春期之前就去世了，就像剧中的家庭一样，那么一个有害的、理想化的母亲形象就会继续存在，并使孩子的形象黯然失色。所有可能的性伴侣。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。并使所有可能的性伴侣黯然失色。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。并使所有可能的性伴侣黯然失色。因此，当兄弟俩提出妓女计划时，丈夫接受了这一点，因为这是他自己对妻子的想法或幻想，以便与她发生性关系。那么，我们在剧中看到的动作再次证明是对其中一个中心人物被压抑的欲望的表演。

But, again, the psychoanalytic critic is able to offer an explanation which makes some sense of them. In her article ‘Pinter’s Freudian Homecoming’ (Essays in Criticism, July 1991, pp. 189–207) M. W. Rowe suggests that the underlying explanation is to be found in Freud’s essay, ‘The most prevalent form of degradation in erotic life’. The all-male family shown in the play suffers from a classic condition known as a mother fixation, in which there is an exaggerated reverence for the mother. Such people are attracted only to women who resemble the mother, but because of this the shadow of the incest taboo makes the expression of sexual feelings towards them difficult or impossible. Hence, their only way out is to seek sexual relationships with women who do not resemble the mother, and whom they therefore despise. So in order to generate sexual excitement such men have to degrade their love objects, since if they are not so degraded they will resemble the mother, and hence, in the man’s mind, not be available as a sexual partner. Thus, women are polarised into idealised maternal figures on the one hand and prostitute figures on the other. The exaggerated reverence for the mother is usually much diluted by adolescence, but if the mother has died before the child reached adolescence, as in the household shown in the play, then a damaging, idealised image of her can live on, and eclipse that of all possible sexual partners. Hence, when the brothers propose the prostitute plan the husband accepts this because that is how he himself has thought about or fantasised about his wife in order to make a sexual relationship with her possible. Again, then, the action which we see presented in the play turns out to be an enacting of the suppressed desires of one of the central characters.

拉康

Lacan

雅克·拉康（Jacques Lacan，1901-1981）是一位法国精神分析学家，他的著作对近代文学理论的许多方面产生了非凡的影响。拉康的职业生涯始于获得医学学位，然后在 20 年代接受精神病学培训。在 1930 年代，他研究偏执狂，发表了关于他的病人 Aimée 的论文。他著名的“镜像阶段”理论（稍后解释）于 1936 年首次在一次会议上提出。随后，他的思想受到了先后主导巴黎知识分子生活的人物的影响，例如人类学家克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯（Claude Lévi-Strauss，1908-）和语言学家 Ferdinand de Saussure (1857–1913) 和 Roman Jakobson (1896–1982)。直到 50 年代，拉康才开始挑战其学科领域的正统观念。1955 年在维也纳举行的一次会议上，他呼吁建立一种新的“返璞归真”弗洛伊德主义。但他的意思是，不是理解“有意识的人格”（“自我”）并根据对无意识运作的理解（许多人认为这是弗洛伊德主义的全部观点）来解释其行为的新尝试，而是一种新的强调无意识本身，作为“我们存在的核心”。1959 年，这些非正统的观点导致他被国际精神分析协会（一种弗洛伊德分析师的世界大会）开除，并于 1964 年在巴黎成立了自己的独立学院弗洛伊德学院，并在标题下发表了他的培训课程的一部分 而是重新强调无意识本身，作为“我们存在的核心”。1959 年，这些非正统的观点导致他被国际精神分析协会（一种弗洛伊德分析师的世界大会）开除，并于 1964 年在巴黎成立了自己的独立学院弗洛伊德学院，并在标题下发表了他的培训课程的一部分 而是重新强调无意识本身，作为“我们存在的核心”。1959 年，这些非正统的观点导致他被国际精神分析协会（一种弗洛伊德分析师的世界大会）开除，并于 1964 年在巴黎成立了自己的独立学院弗洛伊德学院，并在标题下发表了他的培训课程的一部分急救员。此时他本人已是巴黎最著名的知识分子之一。

Jacques Lacan (1901–1981) was a French psychoanalyst whose work has had an extraordinary influence upon many aspects of recent literary theory. Lacan began his career by taking a medical degree and then training in psychiatry in the 1920s. In the 1930s he worked on paranoia, publishing his thesis on his patient Aimée. His famous theory of the ‘mirror stage’ (explained later) was first presented at a conference in 1936. Subsequently his ideas were influenced by figures who successively dominated Parisian intellectual life, such as the anthropologist Claude Lévi-Strauss (1908–), and the linguists Ferdinand de Saussure (1857–1913) and Roman Jakobson (1896–1982). Only in the 1950s did Lacan begin to challenge the orthodoxies of his subject field. In 1955 at a conference in Vienna he called for a new ‘back-to-basics’ Freudianism. But he meant, not a new attempt to understand the ‘conscious personality’ (the ‘ego’) and interpret its behaviour in the light of an understanding of the workings of the unconscious (which many would take to be the whole point of Freudianism), but rather a new emphasis on the the unconscious itself, as ‘the nucleus of our being’. In 1959 these unorthodox views resulted in his expulsion from the International Psychoanalytic Association (a kind of World Congress of Freudian analysts) and in 1964 in Paris he set up his own breakaway Ecole Freudienne and published a section of his training sessions under the title Ecrits. By this time he himself was one of the most prominent Parisian intellectuals.

那么，拉康的名声就建立在出版的“研讨会”，即Ecrits 上。法语研讨会不是小组讨论，而是一种针对研究生水平的扩展讲座。这些场合的紧张气氛在 1950 年代拉康研讨会的目击者描述中有所体现：

Lacan’s reputation, then, rests on the published ‘seminars’, the Ecrits. A French seminar is not a group discussion but a kind of extended lecture for graduate-level students. The intense atmosphere of these occasions is suggested in an eyewitness account of Lacan’s seminars in the 1950s:

他说话的声音摇摆不定、断断续续或雷鸣般，还夹杂着叹息和犹豫。他事先记下他要说的话，然后，在公众面前，他像皇家莎士比亚剧团的演员一样即兴表演……他用令人印象深刻的语言让观众着迷……拉康不分析，他联想。拉康不讲课，他制造共鸣。在这次集体治疗的每一节课上，学生们都有这样的印象：在秘密发给每个人的编码信息中谈论他们并为他们说话。
He speaks in a wavering, syncopated or thundering voice, spiced with sighs and hesitations. He notes down in advance what he is going to say, then, before the public, he improvises like an actor from the Royal Shakespeare Company … he fascinates his audience with his impressive language … Lacan does not analyse, he associates. Lacan does not lecture, he produces resonances. At each session of this collective treatment, the pupils have the impression that the master speaks about them and for them in a coded message secretly destined for each one.

（由 John Lechte 在Julia Kristeva 中引述， Routledge，1990 年，第 36-7 页）

(Quoted by John Lechte in Julia Kristeva, Routledge, 1990, pp. 36–7)

请注意这里强调表演技巧、即兴创作、绕过讲座中常见的正式结构化的思想表达，以及作为启动过程的一部分以编码形式传递信息。拉康在下面讨论的文章中说，唯一名副其实的教学是你只能用自己的方式接受的教学。我强调所有这些是为了让你为拉康写作最初的陌生感做好准备，所有这些都是基于半即兴的冥想，这些冥想占据了这些每周场合的两到三个小时。
Note here the emphasis on showmanship, on improvisation, on by-passing the formally structured presentation of ideas usual in lectures, and on the transmission of information in a coded form as part of an initiation process. Lacan says, in the piece discussed below, that the only teaching worthy of the name is teaching you can only come to terms with in its own terms. I emphasise all this to prepare you for the initial strangeness of Lacan’s writing, all of which was based on the semi-improvised meditations which occupied the two to three hours of these weekly occasions.

拉康的大量著作并没有引起文学评论家的同等兴趣。主要兴趣在于以下方面：

The vast output of Lacan has not all been of equal interest to literary critics. The major interest has been in the following:

1. 论文“无意识中对字母的坚持”，转载于 David Lodge，编辑。现代批评与理论（Longman，1988 年），第 79-106 页。

1. The essay ‘The insistence of the letter in the unconscious’, reprinted in David Lodge, ed. Modern Criticism and Theory (Longman, 1988), pp. 79–106.

2. 埃德加·爱伦·坡的故事“失窃的信”研讨会，转载于失窃的坡：拉康、德里达和精神分析阅读，编。John P. Muller 和 William J. Richardson（约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1988 年），第 28-54 页，附有广泛的编辑评论和注释。

2. The seminar on Edgar Allan Poe’s story ‘The Purloined Letter’, reprinted in The Purloined Poe: Lacan, Derrida, and Psychoanalytic Reading, ed. John P. Muller and William J. Richardson (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1988), pp. 28–54, with extensive editorial commentary and annotations.

3.哈姆雷特研讨会， “欲望和哈姆雷特对欲望的解释”，转载于文学与精神分析：阅读问题：否则， Shoshana Felman 编。（约翰霍普金斯大学出版社，1982 年），第 11-52 页。

3. The seminar on Hamlet, ‘Desire and the Interpretation of desire in Hamlet’, reprinted in Literature and Psychoanalysis: the Question of Reading: Otherwise, Shoshana Felman, ed. (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1982), pp. 11–52.

拉康自己对其思想的解释常常晦涩难懂。我建议，在阅读他的作品时，你应该花一些学习时间将同一篇文章多读几遍，而不是只读一遍他的大量作品。在与拉康的斗争中，我发现以下内容特别有用：

Lacan’s own explication of his ideas is often intimidatingly obscure. I would suggest that in reading him you should devote some study time to reading the same piece several times, rather than reading through a great deal of his work once only. In grappling with Lacan I have found the following particularly helpful:

1. David Lodge 对拉康“无意识中字母的坚持”论证的初步总结，《现代批评与理论》第 79-80 页。

1. David Lodge’s pre-summary of the argument of Lacan’s ‘The insistence of the letter in the unconscious’, pp. 79–80 in Modern Criticism and Theory.

2. John Lechte 对拉康思想的描述，他的书Julia Kristeva中的第二章“无意识的影响”，第 13-64 页。我也借鉴了上面给出的传记细节。

2. John Lechte’s account of Lacan’s thinking, chapter two ‘The effect of the unconscious’ in his book Julia Kristeva, pp. 13–64. I have also drawn upon this for the biographical details given above.

3. Toril Moi 的总结，第 99–101 页，载于《性/文本政治》（Methuen，1985 年）。

3. A summary by Toril Moi, pp. 99–101 in Sexual/Textual Politics (Methuen, 1985).

4. 拉康的批判，第五章“镜像阶段——批判性反思”，第 131-63 页，雷蒙德·塔利斯 (Raymond Tallis) 的《不是索绪尔：后索绪尔文学理论的批判》（麦克米伦出版社，1988 年）。

4. The critique of Lacan, chapter five ‘The mirror stage – a critical reflection’, pp. 131–63 in Raymond Tallis’s Not Saussure: A Critique of Post-Saussurean Literary Theory (Macmillan, 1988).

对文学学生来说最重要的拉康主义文本是“信件的坚持”，它于 1957 年首次交付给哲学学生的“外行”听众，而不是实习精神病学家，而是使用专业研讨会的材料。在下文中，我试图对论点进行总结，试图说明为什么这些观点被文学评论家如此频繁地使用。
The most important Lacanian text for literary students is ‘The insistence of the letter’, first delivered in 1957 to a ‘lay’ audience of philosophy students, rather than to trainee psychiatrists, but using material from the professional seminars. In what follows I attempt a summary of the argument, trying to show why these ideas have been used so intensively by literary critics.

拉康以效忠于语言研究的知识主导地位开始了这篇文章：他问（修辞地）“今天的精神分析学家怎么可能没有意识到他的真理领域实际上就是这个词？” 那么，语言是核心，这是因为在研究无意识时，分析师总是在使用和检查语言——实际上，弗洛伊德的精神病学完全是一门语言科学。无意识并不是像以前所认为的那样是一堆杂乱无章的不同材料，而是一个有序的网络，就像语言的结构一样复杂：“精神分析经验在无意识中发现的是语言的整个结构”。

Lacan begins the piece by paying allegiance to the intellectual dominance of language studies: he asks (rhetorically) ‘how could a psychoanalyst of today not realise that his realm of truth is in fact the word?’ Language, then, is central, and this is so because in investigating the unconscious the analyst is always both using and examining language – in effect, Freudian psychiatry is entirely a verbal science. And the unconscious is not a chaotic mass of disparate material, as might formerly have been thought, but an orderly network, as complex as the structure of a language: ‘what the psychoanalytic experience discovers in the unconscious is the whole structure of language’.
