自 20 世纪 70 年代以来，最著名的英国马克思主义批评家是特里·伊格尔顿 (Terry Eagleton)，他的作品反映了广泛的影响，包括一度受到阿尔都塞 (Althusser) 的影响。马克思主义批评的基本假设似乎与后结构主义和后现代主义的基本假设相冲突，而 1980 年代和 90 年代最重要的马克思主义著作涉及与这些运动错综复杂的互动过程。马克思主义批评传统上也反对对行为的精神分析解释，理由是精神分析错误地将个人与他们所在的社会结构隔离开来。尽管如此，美国马克思主义批评家弗雷德里克·詹姆森（在《政治无意识：叙事作为一种社会 Symbolic Act, 1981) 试图调和这两者。从本质上讲，詹姆森对“无意识”和“压抑”等基本精神分析术语提供了政治延伸。在他看来，文学常常试图压制历史真相，但分析可以揭示其潜在的意识形态（即无意识）。伊格尔顿、詹姆逊和整个辩论领域的基本出发点是阅读詹姆逊的文章“理论的政治：后现代主义辩论中的意识形态立场”和伊格尔顿的“资本主义、现代主义和后现代主义”，这些文章作为项目重印David Lodge 的《现代批评与理论：读者》第 22 和 23 页。

Since the 1970s the best-known British Marxist critic has been Terry Eagleton, whose work has reflected a wide range of influences, including for a time that of Althusser. Marxist criticism seems to conflict in its basic assumptions with those of post-structuralism and postmodernism, and the most significant Marxist writing in the 1980s and 1990s involved a process of intricate interaction with these movements. Marxist criticism has also traditionally been opposed to psychoanalytic explanations of conduct, on the grounds that psychoanalysis falsely isolates individuals from the social structures in which they exist. All the same, the American Marxist critic Fredric Jameson (in The Political Unconscious: Narrative as a Socially Symbolic Act, 1981) has tried to reconcile the two. Essentially, Jameson offers political extensions of basic psychoanalytic terms like ‘the unconscious’ and ‘repression’. Literature, in his view, often tries to repress historical truth, but analysis can reveal its underlying ideology (that is, its unconscious). A basic starting point on Eagleton, Jameson, and this whole area of debate would be to read Jameson’s essay ‘The politics of theory: Ideological positions in the postmodernism debate’ and Eagleton’s ‘Capitalism, modernism, and postmodernism’, which are reprinted as items 22 and 23 in David Lodge’s Modern Criticism and Theory: A Reader.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

总则：马克思主义批评的主要信条——文学的本质受到产生它的社会和政治环境的影响——很可能会被立即接受为不言而喻的真实。

General: The main tenet of Marxist criticism – that the nature of literature is influenced by the social and political cirumstances in which it is produced – might well be immediately accepted as self-evidently true.

难点和争议完全在于决定影响有多近。你是要采取“决定论”的立场，认为文学是社会经济力量的被动产物，还是采取更“自由”的路线，认为社会经济的影响更为遥远和微妙？

The difficulty and controversy lie entirely in deciding how close the influence is. Are you going to adopt a ‘determinist’ position, and argue that literature is the passive product of socio-economic forces, or do you take a more ‘liberal’ line and see the socio-economic influence as much more distant and subtle?

你的主要困难是在给定的文学作品中展示这些经济力量的运作（无论你采用“强”还是“弱”模型）。文学作品中直接或间接作用的社会经济力量究竟是什么样的？

Your main difficulty will be to show the operation of these economic forces (no matter whether you take the ‘strong’ or the ‘weak’ model) in a given literary work. What exactly do directly operating or indirectly operating socio-economic forces look like in a literary work?

具体：这些问题很难抽象地处理，你会发现在具体例子的背景下思考它们会很有帮助。因此，在下面的示例中，采用的是“决定论”还是“自由主义”路线，这是如何表示的？评论家是从戏剧的情节内容、人物刻画还是文学形式本身中看到社会经济影响，如果是的话，又是如何看待的？

Specific: These are difficult questions to cope with in the abstract, and you will find it helpful to think about them in the context of a specific example. In the example below, therefore, is a ‘determinist’ or a ‘liberal’ line being taken, and how is this indicated? Is the socio-economic influence seen by the critic in the plot content of the play, in the characterisation, or in the literary form itself, and if so how?

马克思主义批评家做什么

What Marxist critics do

1. 他们对文学作品的“显性”（显性或表面）和“隐性”（潜在或隐藏）内容进行区分（就像精神分析批评家所做的那样），然后将文学作品的隐性主题与基本内容联系起来马克思主义主题，例如阶级斗争或社会在各个历史阶段的进步，例如从封建主义到工业资本主义的过渡。因此，《李尔王》中的冲突可以被解读为“真正”关于上升阶级（资产阶级）和没落阶级（封建霸主）之间的阶级利益冲突。

1. They make a division between the ‘overt’ (manifest or surface) and ‘covert’ (latent or hidden) content of a literary work (much as psychoanalytic critics do) and then relate the covert subject matter of the literary work to basic Marxist themes, such as class struggle or the progression of society through various historical stages, such as the transition from feudalism to industrial capitalism. Thus, the conflicts in King Lear might be read as being ‘really’ about the conflict of class interest between the rising class (the bourgeoisie) and the falling class (the feudal overlords).

2. 马克思主义批评家使用的另一种方法是将作品的语境与作者的社会阶层地位联系起来。在这种情况下，假设（这又类似于精神分析批评家所做的假设）作者并不知道他或她在文本中到底在说什么或揭示什么。

2. Another method used by Marxist critics is to relate the context of a work to the social-class status of the author. In such cases an assumption is made (which again is similar to those made by psychoanalytic critics) that the author is unaware of precisely what he or she is saying or revealing in the text.

3. 第三种马克思主义方法是根据“产生”它的社会时期来解释整个文学体裁的性质。例如，伊恩·瓦特 (Ian Watt)的《小说的兴起》(The Rise of the Novel)将 18 世纪小说的发展与那个时期中产阶级的扩张联系起来。小说为这个社会阶层“代言”，就像悲剧为君主制和贵族“代言”，民谣为农村和半城市“工人阶级”“代言”一样。

3. A third Marxist method is to explain the nature of a whole literary genre in terms of the social period which ‘produced’ it. For instance, The Rise of the Novel, by Ian Watt, relates the growth of the novel in the eighteenth century to the expansion of the middle classes during that period. The novel ‘speaks’ for this social class, just as, for instance, tragedy ‘speaks for’ the monarchy and the nobility, and the ballad ‘speaks for’ for the rural and semi-urban ‘working class’.

4. 第四种马克思主义实践是将文学作品与它被“消费”的那个时代的社会假设联系起来，这种策略特别用于后来被称为文化唯物主义的马克思主义批评变体（见第 9 章，第. 175-82).

4. A fourth Marxist practice is to relate the literary work to the social assumptions of the time in which it is ‘consumed’, a strategy which is used particularly in the later variant of Marxist criticism known as cultural materialism (see Chapter 9, pp. 175–82).

5. 第五种马克思主义实践是“文学形式的政治化”，即文学形式本身是由政治环境决定的主张。例如，在一些评论家看来，文学现实主义带有对保守社会结构的含蓄认可；对于其他人来说，十四行诗和抑扬格五音步的形式和韵律错综复杂是社会稳定、礼仪和秩序的对应物。

5. A fifth Marxist practice is the ‘politicisation of literary form’, that is, the claim that literary forms are themselves determined by political circumstance. For instance, in the view of some critics, literary realism carries with it an implicit validation of conservative social structures; for others, the formal and metrical intricacies of the sonnet and the iambic pentameter are a counterpart of social stability, decorum, and order.

马克思主义批评：一个例子

Marxist criticism: an example

作为马克思主义批评的一个例子，我们将以埃利奥特·克里格 (Elliot Krieger)对莎士比亚喜剧的马克思主义研究中的第十二夜第五章为例（1979）。正如这里所讨论的，这个例子主要展示了刚刚列出的五项马克思主义批判活动中的第一项。该剧以奥西诺公爵和奥利维亚夫人之间的爱情为中心。他的爱是奢侈而执着的表达，但她起初拒绝了他，为死去的父亲献出了一段长期的哀悼。随后她爱上了一位年轻的贵妇人维奥拉，她暂时女扮男装，充当他的仆人和中间人（化名西萨里奥）。奥利维亚也受到她的管家严格而一丝不苟的马伏里奥的爱，马伏里奥被她的叔叔托比贝尔奇爵士欺骗，相信他对她的爱得到了回报。

As an example of Marxist criticism we will take chapter five, on Twelfth Night, in Elliot Krieger’s A Marxist Study of Shakespeare’s Comedies (1979). As it is discussed here, the example mainly shows the first of the five Marxist critical activities just listed. The play centres on the love between the Duke Orsino and the Lady Olivia. His love is extravagantly and persistently expressed but she at first rejects him, having dedicated herself to a period of protracted mourning for her dead father. Subsequently she falls in love with Viola, a young noblewoman who is temporarily disguised as a man and acting as his servant and go-between (under the name Cesario). Olivia is also loved by her steward, the strict and punctilious Malvolio, who is tricked by her uncle, Sir Toby Belch, into believing that his love for her is returned.

这篇文章首先引用了该剧的主流批评观点，即它呈现了自我放纵的各种极端（例如 Orsino 沉溺于浪漫爱情的幻想和 Toby Belch 对肉体欲望的自我放弃），并将这些与极端的自我放纵进行对比清教主义和对享乐的抵制，如马伏里奥所见。该剧被认为是在推荐一种平衡和礼仪，在这种平衡和礼仪中，可以避免这些极端，并使适当的人类成就成为可能。克里格指出，这忽略了剧中的阶级问题：当“秩序”最终恢复时，贵族人物并没有受到特别的不良影响，而马伏里奥的命运要严重得多，但马伏里奥的私利显然不同于奥西诺和奥利维亚的自恋和托比爵士的利己狂欢只是因为礼仪禁止他的职位之一“自取其辱”（第 99 页）。因此，“只有特权社会阶层才能获得放纵的道德”。事实上，根据定义，“统治阶级的成员通过过度放纵食欲来找到自己的身份”（第 100 页）。

The essay begins by citing the dominant critical view of the play, which is that it presents various extremes of self-indulgence (such as Orsino’s wallowing in fantasies of romantic love and Toby Belch’s self-abandonment to physical appetites) and contrasts these with an extreme puritanism and resistance to pleasure, as seen in Malvolio. The play is seen as recommending a balance and decorum in which these extremes are avoided and proper human fulfilment becomes possible. Krieger points out that this ignores the question of class in the play: when ‘order’ is restored at the end, the aristocratic characters suffer no particular ill effects, while Malvolio’s fate is much more severe, yet Malvolio’s self-interest differs from the obviously narcissistic preoccupations of Orsino and Olivia and the egoistic revelry of Sir Toby only because decorum forbids one of his rank to ‘surfeit on himself’ (p. 99). Thus ‘only a privileged social class has access to the morality of indulgence’. Indeed, by definition, ‘the members of the ruling class find their identities through excessive indulgence in appetite’ (p. 100).

他继续说，贵族阶级的每个成员都有一个私人的“第二世界”。对于托比爵士来说，这是他通过饮酒到达的无拘无束的世界，因为他“强迫每个人都关心他，同时利用醉酒的强迫无能和故意忘记时间来保护自己免受关心他人的可能性”（p . 102 ). 同样，奥利维亚通过退回到丧亲之痛的私人世界来保护自己免受他人的需要，而奥西诺进入一个完全主观的爱情痴迷世界，其中一切都成为“公爵心理状况的附属物和伴随物”（第104页）。在这些“私有化”的“二级世界”中，每个人都不是社区的一部分，而是“一个自我的国王”（第 103 页）。维奥拉也试图退回到这些第二世界之一，但尽管她实际上是贵族，但她采用的伪装使她能够选择一种暂时的非贵族身份（“我将为这位公爵服务”），因此她成为“Orsino、Olivia 和 Toby 爵士的次级世界中的一个对象”（第 107 页），他们认为某个人可供他们使用或操纵。

Each of the members of the aristocratic class, he continues, has a private ‘secondary world’. For Sir Toby it is the unfettered world he reaches by drink, for he ‘forces everyone to care for him while using the enforced incompetence of drunkenness and the willed oblivion of time in order to protect himself from the possibility of caring for others’ (p. 102). Likewise, Olivia protects herself from the needs of others by retreating into a private world of bereavement, and Orsino into a wholly subjective world of love obsession in which everything becomes ‘an adjunct of, and accompaniment to, the Duke’s psychological condition’ (p. 104). In these ‘privatised’ ‘secondary worlds’, each becomes, not part of a community, but ‘one self king’ (p. 103). Viola, too, attempts to retreat into one of these secondary worlds, but though she is actually aristocratic, the disguise she adopts enables her to choose a temporary non-aristocratic status (‘I’ll serve this duke’), and she thus becomes ‘an object within the secondary worlds of Orsino, Olivia and Sir Toby’ (p. 107), someone they assume is available for their use or manipulation.

在剧中的仆人世界中，非常强调“愿望”：新仆人西萨里奥/维奥拉取代瓦伦丁和库里奥的特权进入奥西诺公爵的位置，而在奥利维亚的家庭中，不断争夺权力玛丽亚（另一个仆人）和马伏里奥之间的位置。事实上，两者的目标都是嫁入这个家庭，玛丽亚最终通过嫁给托比爵士来实现这一目标，作为对她对马伏里奥的决定性羞辱的奖励。因此，克里格将她视为剧中的重要元素：

Within the world of the servants in the play, there is much emphasis on ‘aspiration’: the new servant Cesario/Viola displaces Valentine and Curio from their positions of privileged access to Duke Orsino, and in Olivia’s household there is a constant struggle for prime position between Maria (another of the servants) and Malvolio. Both, in fact, aim to marry into the family, which Maria eventually achieves by marrying Sir Toby as a reward for her decisive humiliation of Malvolio. Krieger therefore sees her as a significant element in the play:

玛丽亚算不上是一个原始资产阶级，因为她的愿望支持和确认而不是挑战贵族特权的持续有效性，但她有能力将自我与职业分开，在强加的义务之外表达自我，并通过她的行动获得进步在社会层面上，只有《第十二夜》中的玛丽亚表明了资产阶级和清教徒对独立、竞争、地位与功绩的重视。（第 121 页）
Maria is hardly a proto-bourgeoise, in that her aspiration supports and confirms rather than challenges the continued validity of aristocratic privilege, but with her abilities to separate self from vocation, to express self apart from imposed duty, and to earn by her actions advancement in social degree, only Maria in Twelfth Night indicates the bourgeois and Puritan emphasis on independence, competition, and the association of stature with merit. (p. 121)

相比之下，马伏里奥更不能代表任何一种社会秩序的变化，因为他对贵族的所有外表都怀有极大的敬意，并将他认为使他自己的晋升成为可能的环境归因于贵族为了'财富'和他的'星星'。因此，命运在剧中是一种力量，就像“自然”一样，它常常是不在场证明或对继承的贵族特权的合理化。那么，对于马克思主义批评家来说，该剧展示了主人和仆人之间存在的鸿沟，并体现了每个阶级特有的心态。这篇文章的马克思主义特征是它把社会阶级的概念引入戏剧解释的方式：这是它对大量关于社会阶级的批评写作的特殊“干预”玩，其中的话题从未被提出。这篇文章确实很少谈及写作它的确切历史时刻的细节：相反，围绕社会阶级冲突、阶级特权和对现在的愿望的普遍概念编织了一种微妙而原始的解读被称为向上的社会流动性。

In contrast, Malvolio is much less of a representative of any kind of change in the social order, since he has an extreme reverence for all the trappings of aristocracy, and attributes the circumstances which, he thinks, have made possible his own elevation to the aristocracy to ‘fortune’ and his ‘stars’. Thus, fortune in the play is a force, like ‘nature’ which is often an alibi or a rationalisation of inherited aristocratic privilege. For the Marxist critic, then, the play demonstrates the gulf which exists between masters and servants and manifests something of the state of mind that is characteristic of each class. The Marxist feature of this essay is the way it introduces the notion of social class into interpretations of the play: this is its special ‘intervention’ into the large body of critical writing on the play, in which the topic is never raised. Very little indeed is said in the essay about the specifics of the precise historical moment in which it was written: rather, a subtle and original reading is woven round the generalised notions of social-class conflict, class privilege, and aspirations towards what would now be called upward social mobility.

选读

Selected reading

Dowling, William C., Jameson, Althusser, Marx: An Introduction to The Political Unconscious (Methuen, 1994). 对詹姆逊的政治无意识

的“情境化介绍” 。优秀而简短，确实是开始研究马克思主义思想的最新关注点及其与德里达、拉康和后现代主义的变革性接触的最佳起点。

Dowling, William C., Jameson, Althusser, Marx: An Introduction to The Political Unconscious (Methuen, 1994).

A ‘contextualising introduction’ to Jameson’s The Political Unconscious. Excellent and brief, and really the best place to begin in studying the recent concerns of Marxist thinking and its transforming engagements with Derrida, Lacan, and postmodernism.

Eagleton, Terry, Marxism and Literary Criticism (Routledge, 1976)。对该领域的简短而全面的介绍。

Eagleton, Terry, Marxism and Literary Criticism (Routledge, 1976). A brief yet thorough introduction to this field.

伊格尔顿，特里，审美意识形态（布莱克威尔，1990 年）。代表伊格尔顿最近的担忧。

Eagleton, Terry, The Ideology of the Aesthetic (Blackwell, 1990). Representative of Eagleton’s more recent concerns.

Goldstein, Philip，文学理论的政治学：马克思主义批评导论（佛罗里达州立大学出版社，1990 年）。

对特定领域有用，例如：法兰克福学派，第 17-21 页；后结构主义马克思主义，第 22-8 页；特里·伊格尔顿 (Terry Eagleton)，第 59–65 页；阿尔都塞、德里达和福柯，第 164-74 页。

Goldstein, Philip, The Politics of Literary Theory: An Introduction to Marxist Criticism (Florida State University Press, 1990).

Useful on specific areas, such as: The Frankfurt School, pp. 17–21; post-structuralist Marxism, pp. 22–8; Terry Eagleton, pp. 59–65; Althusser, Derrida, and Foucault, pp. 164–74.

Howard, Jean E. 和 Shershow, Scott Cutler，马克思主义莎士比亚(Routledge, 2000)。

“莎士比亚口音”系列中非常有用的一本书，由特伦斯·霍克斯主编，承担了梅休恩“新口音”系列将文学理论引入文学文本的使命。

Howard, Jean E., and Shershow, Scott Cutler, Marxist Shakespeares (Routledge, 2000).

A very useful book in the ‘Accents on Shakespeare’ series, edited by Terence Hawkes, which takes up the mission of Methuen’s ‘New Accents’ series of bringing literary theory to literary text.

Jameson, Frederic, The Political Unconscious: Narrative as a Social Symbolic Act（康奈尔大学出版社，1981 年）。

詹姆逊的关键文本，但无疑难以阅读。首先阅读 William C. Dowling（上文）会有所帮助。

Jameson, Frederic, The Political Unconscious: Narrative as a Socially Symbolic Act (Cornell University Press, 1981).

The key text for Jameson, but undoubtedly difficult reading. It would be helpful to read William C. Dowling (above) first.

Krieger, Elliott，莎士比亚喜剧的马克思主义研究（麦克米伦出版社，1979 年）。“应用”马克思主义批评。

Krieger, Elliott, A Marxist Study of Shakespeare’s Comedies (Macmillan, 1979). ‘Applied’ Marxist criticism.

Mulhern, Francis, 编辑。当代马克思主义文学批评（朗文出版社，1992）。

一个深思熟虑和广泛的介绍和一些关键文件。

Mulhern, Francis, ed. Contemporary Marxist Literary Criticism (Longman, 1992).

A thoughtful and wide-ranging introduction and some key documents.

Prawer, SS, Karl Marx and World Literature（牛津大学出版社，1978 年）。

详细介绍和讨论“马克思在他一生的不同时期对文学的看法”。

Prawer, S. S., Karl Marx and World Literature (Oxford University Press, 1978).

A detailed presentation and discussion of ‘what Marx said about literature at various times in his life’.

'Ruis'，马克思初学者（Writers & Readers Cooperative/Unwin Paperbacks，1976/1986）。

一部以漫画形式总结马克思思想的“纪实漫画书”。如果您以前没有接触过马克思的思想，这是一个很好的起点。

‘Ruis’, Marx for Beginners (Writers & Readers Cooperative/Unwin Paperbacks, 1976/1986).

A ‘documentary comic book’ which summarises Marx’s ideas in comic strip form. A good place to begin if you have not encountered Marx’s ideas before.

Williams, Raymond, Marxism and Literature（牛津大学出版社，1977 年）。对马克思主义的基本概念以及威廉姆斯对它们的改编很有用。参见 1.4 意识形态，2.1 基础和上层建筑，2.6 霸权，2.8 主导、残余和涌现，2.9 感觉结构。

Williams, Raymond, Marxism and Literature (Oxford University Press, 1977). Useful on basic Marxist concepts, and Williams’s adaptations of them. See 1.4 Ideology, 2.1 Base and Superstructure, 2.6 Hegemony, 2.8 Dominant, Residual, and Emergent, 2.9 Structures of feeling.

9

新历史主义和文化唯物主义

9

New historicism and cultural materialism

新历史主义

New historicism

“新历史主义”一词是由美国评论家斯蒂芬·格林布拉特创造的，他的著作《文艺复兴时期的自我塑造：从莫尔到莎士比亚》（1980 年）通常被认为是新历史主义的开端。然而，在 1970 年代出版的各种评论家的作品中可以发现类似的趋势，一个很好的例子是 JW Lever 的国家悲剧：詹姆士一世时期戏剧研究（由 Methuen 于 1971 年出版，并于 1987 年重新发行，并由乔纳森·多利莫尔）。这本简短而划时代的书挑战了对詹姆士一世戏剧的保守批评观点，并且比以前的评论家更紧密地将戏剧与他们那个时代的政治事件联系起来。

The term ‘new historicism’ was coined by the American critic Stephen Greenblatt, whose book Renaissance Self-Fashioning: from More to Shakespeare (1980) is usually regarded as its beginning. However, similar tendencies can be identified in work by various critics published during the 1970s, a good example being J. W. Lever’s The Tragedy of State: A Study of Jacobean Drama (published by Methuen in 1971, and re-issued in 1987 with an introduction by Jonathan Dollimore). This brief and epoch-making book challenged conservative critical views about Jacobean theatre, and linked the plays much more closely with the political events of their era than previous critics had done.

新历史主义的一个简单定义是，它是一种基于平行阅读文学和非文学文本的方法，通常是同一历史时期的文本。也就是说，新历史主义拒绝（至少表面上）“赋予”文学文本“特权”：它设想和实践一种研究模式，而不是文学“前景”和历史“背景”，文学和非文学文本被赋予同等的权重，并不断地相互通知或审问。美国评论家路易斯·蒙特罗斯 (Louis Montrose) 对新历史主义的定义提出了这种“同等权重”：他将其定义为对“历史的文本性、文本的历史性”的综合兴趣。它涉及（用格林布拉特的话来说）“一种强烈的阅读所有内容的意愿”过去的文本痕迹，传统上只关注文学文本。所以新历史主义（顾名思义）体现了一个悖论（对某些人来说，是一个丑闻）；这是一种没有文学特权的文学方法（尽管我们稍后会看到这种说法需要一些限定）。

A simple definition of the new historicism is that it is a method based on the parallel reading of literary and non-literary texts, usually of the same historical period. That is to say, new historicism refuses (at least ostensibly) to ‘privilege’ the literary text: instead of a literary ‘foreground’ and a historical ‘background’ it envisages and practises a mode of study in which literary and non-literary texts are given equal weight and constantly inform or interrogate each other. This ‘equal weighting’ is suggested in the definition of new historicism offered by the American critic Louis Montrose: he defines it as a combined interest in ‘the textuality of history, the historicity of texts’. It involves (in Greenblatt’s words) ‘an intensified willingness to read all of the textual traces of the past with the attention traditionally conferred only on literary texts’. So new historicism (as indeed the name implies) embodies a paradox (and, for some, a scandal); it is an approach to literature in which there is no privileging of the literary (though we will see later that this statement requires some qualification).

通常，一篇新的历史论文会将文学文本置于非文学文本的“框架”中。因此，从文学研究的角度来看，格林布拉特的主要创新是将文艺复兴时期的戏剧与“那个时代所有主要欧洲列强所推行的可怕的殖民主义政策”并列（休·格雷迪，在现代主义莎士比亚). 他提请注意“被压制的其他人的边缘化和非人化”（格雷迪），通常是在一篇文章的开头分析当代历史文献，该文献在某种程度上与该剧的主题重叠。格林布拉特本人将挪用的历史文献称为“轶事”，典型的新历史主义文章省略了关于先前发表的对所讨论戏剧的解释的惯常学术准备，并以一个强有力的、戏剧性的轶事开始，例如，路易斯·蒙特罗斯 (Louis Montrose)，在稍后讨论的文章的第一句话中：“我想重述伊丽莎白时代的梦想——而不是莎士比亚的仲夏夜之梦但 Simon Forman 在 1597 年 1 月 23 日梦见了一个。这些戏剧性的开场常常引用日期和地点，并具有纪录片、目击者叙述的所有力量，强烈唤起生活体验的质量而不是“历史”。由于这些历史文献不作为语境从属，而是以其自身的权利进行分析，我们或许应该称它们为“共同文本”而不​​是“语境”。所使用的文本和副文本将被视为同一历史“时刻”的表达，并进行相应的解释。理查德·威尔逊 (Richard Wilson) 和理查德·达顿 (Richard Dutton) 在他们的论文集《新历史主义和文艺复兴戏剧》的序言中很好地描述了这个过程：

Typically, a new historical essay will place the literary text within the ‘frame’ of a non-literary text. Thus, Greenblatt’s main innovation, from the viewpoint of literary study, was to juxtapose the plays of the Renaissance period with ‘the horrifying colonialist policies pursued by all the major European powers of the era’ (Hugh Grady, in The Modernist Shakespeare). He draws attention to ‘the marginalization and dehumanizing of suppressed Others’ (Grady), usually by starting an essay with an analysis of a contemporary historical document which overlaps in some way with the subject matter of the play. Greenblatt himself refers to the appropriated historical document as the ‘anecdote’, and the typical new historicist essay omits the customary academic preliminaries about previously published interpretations of the play in question, and begins with a powerful and dramatic anecdote, as signalled, for instance, by Louis Montrose, in the first sentence of the essay discussed later: ‘I would like to recount an Elizabethan dream – not Shakespeare’s A Midsummer Night’s Dream but one dreamt by Simon Forman on 23 January 1597’. These dramatic openings often cite date and place and have all the force of the documentary, eyewitness account, strongly evoking the quality of lived experience rather than ‘history’. Since these historical documents are not subordinated as contexts, but are analysed in their own right, we should perhaps call them ‘co-texts’ rather than ‘contexts’. The text and co-text used will be seen as expressions of the same historical ‘moment’, and interpreted accordingly. This process is well described by Richard Wilson and Richard Dutton in the introduction to their collection of essays New Historicism and Renaissance Drama:

[早期]批评将莎士比亚神秘化为英语口语的化身，[新历史主义]发现这些戏剧嵌入了其他书面文本，如刑事、医疗和殖民文件。在这个档案连续体中阅读，它们所代表的不是和谐，而是清教徒对狂欢节的暴力攻击、奴隶制的强加、父权制的兴起、对越轨行为的追捕，以及福柯所谓的“时代”期间监狱大门的轰然倒塌的监禁，在监狱社会的黎明时期” ['carceral' 来自拉丁词 carcer ，意思是监狱]
Where [earlier] criticism had mystified Shakespeare as an incarnation of spoken English, it [new historicism] found the plays embedded in other written texts, such as penal, medical and colonial documents. Read within this archival continuum, what they represented was not harmony but the violence of the Puritan attack on carnival, the imposition of slavery, the rise of patriarchy, the hounding of deviance, and the crashing of prison gates during what Foucault called ‘the Age of Confinement, at the dawn of carceral society’ [‘carceral’ comes from the Latin word carcer, meaning a prison]

（威尔逊和达顿，第 8 页）

(Wilson and Dutton, p. 8)

这简洁地传达了新历史主义的基调和野心，“在档案连续体中”阅读文学的短语是对该方法的生动概括。

This succinctly conveys the tone and ambitions of new historicism, and the phrase about reading literature ‘within the archival continuum’ is a vivid encapsulation of the method.

新旧历史主义——一些差异

New and old historicisms – some differences

当我们说新历史主义涉及文学和非文学文本的平行研究时，“平行”一词概括了这种方法与早期使用历史数据的文学方法之间的本质区别。这些早期的方法在文学文本和历史“背景”之间进行了层次分离，文学文本是有价值的对象，可以说是宝石，而历史“背景”仅仅是背景，根据定义，价值较低。

When we say that new historicism involves the parallel study of literary and non-literary texts, the word ‘parallel’ encapsulates the essential difference between this and earlier approaches to literature which had made some use of historical data. These earlier approaches made a hierarchical separation between the literary text, which was the object of value, the jewel, as it were, and the historical ‘back-ground’, which was merely the setting, and by definition of lesser worth.

对文学和非文学材料给予“同等权重”的做法是“新”和“旧”历史主义之间的第一个也是主要的区别。作为“旧”历史主义的代表，我们可以引用 EMW Tillyard 的《伊丽莎白时代的世界图画》（1943 年）和莎士比亚的历史剧（1944），新历史主义经常定义自己的书籍。这些书描述了一套保守的精神态度（对社会、对神灵、对创造的宇宙等），蒂尔亚德将其视为伊丽莎白时代观点的典型，并反映在莎士比亚的戏剧中。研究莎士比亚的“传统”方法（一直到 1970 年代）的特点是将这一历史框架与“细读”实践以及“意象模式”分析相结合。

The practice of giving ‘equal weighting’ to literary and non-literary material is the first and major difference between the ‘new’ and the ‘old’ historicism. As representative of the ‘old’ historicism we could cite E. M. W. Tillyard’s The Elizabethan World Picture (1943) and Shakespeare’s History Plays (1944), books against which new historicism frequently defines itself. These books described the set of conservative mental attitudes (to society, to the deity, to the created universe, etc.) which Tillyard saw as typifying the Elizabethan outlook and reflected in Shakespeare’s plays. The ‘traditional’ approach to Shakespeare (through to the 1970s) was characterised by the combination of this historical framework, with the practice of ‘close reading’, and the analysis of ‘patterns of imagery’.

新旧历史主义之间的第二个重要区别体现在前面引用的“档案连续体”一词中的“档案”一词中，因为该词表明新历史主义确实是一种历史主义，而不是历史主义运动。也就是说，它感兴趣的是书面文件中以历史文本形式呈现和记录的历史。它会争辩说，历史事件本身已经不可挽回地丢失了。这种强调受到文学研究中长期熟悉的观点的影响，即实际思想，或作家的感情或意图永远无法恢复或重建，因此真实的生活个体现在完全被传给我们的文学文本所取代。可以说，过去的话语取代了过去的世界。由于对于新历史主义者而言，过去的事件和态度现在仅作为文字存在，因此将文字置于以前为文学文本保留的那种严密分析中是有意义的。

A second important difference between old and new historicisms is encapsulated in the word ‘archival’ in the phrase ‘the archival continuum’ quoted earlier, for that word indicates that new historicism is indeed a historicist rather than a historic al movement. That is, it is interested in history as represented and recorded in written documents, in history-as-text. Historical events as such, it would argue, are irrecoverably lost. This emphasis bears the influence of the long-familiar view in literary studies that the actual thoughts, or feelings, or intentions of a writer can never be recovered or reconstructed, so that the real living individual is now entirely superseded by the literary text which has come down to us. As it were, the word of the past replaces the world of the past. Since, for the new historicist, the events and attitudes of the past now exist solely as writing, it makes sense to subject that writing to the kind of close analysis formerly reserved for literary texts.

这种对过去文字记录的偏爱中包含着解构主义的影响。新历史主义接受德里达的观点，即文本之外没有任何东西，在特殊意义上，关于过去的一切都只能以文本化的形式提供给我们：它是“三次处理”的，首先是通过意识形态、观点或话语实践它自己的时代，然后通过我们的时代，最后通过语言本身的扭曲网络。文本中的任何内容都因此被重新制作。新的历史主义文章本身总是构成另一种改造，另一种对过去的排列，因为所讨论的戏剧或诗歌与选定的文件并列，从而形成一个新的实体。从这个意义上说，所选择的文件可能与该剧并不真正“相关”的反对意见被解除了，

Incorporated into this preference for the textual record of the past is the influence of deconstruction. New historicism accepts Derrida’s view that there is nothing outside the text, in the special sense that everything about the past is only available to us in textualised form: it is ‘thrice-processed’, first through the ideology, or outlook, or discursive practices of its own time, then through those of ours, and finally through the distorting web of language itself. Whatever is represented in a text is thereby remade. New historicist essays always themselves constitute another remaking, another permutation of the past, as the play or poem under discussion is juxtaposed with a chosen document, so that a new entity is formed. In this sense the objection that the documents selected may not really be ‘relevant’ to the play is disarmed, for the aim is not to represent the past as it really was, but to present a new reality by re-situating it.

新历史主义与福柯

New historicism and Foucault

新历史主义坚决反对既定体制，总是含蓄地站在个人自由的自由主义理想一边，接受和庆祝所有形式的差异和“越轨”。然而，与此同时，面对镇压国家的力量，它似乎同时对这些人的生存感到绝望，它不断揭示出能够渗透和玷污个人生活最私密的领域。这种国家作为全能和全视的概念源于后结构主义文化历史学家米歇尔福柯，他对国家的普遍形象是“全景”（意思是“全视”）监视。圆形监狱是 18 世纪功利主义者杰里米·边沁 (Jeremy Bentham) 构思的圆形监狱设计：该设计由分层排列的牢房组成，所有这些牢房都可以由位于圆圈中心的一名看守进行调查。然而，全景状态维持其监视不是通过武力和恐吓，而是通过其“话语实践”（使用福柯的术语——“话语”是从名词“话语”派生的形容词）的力量——在整个政治体中传播其意识形态。

New historicism is resolutely anti-establishment, always implicitly on the side of liberal ideals of personal freedom and accepting and celebrating all forms of difference and ‘deviance’. At the same time, though, it seems simultaneously to despair of the survival of these in the face of the power of the repressive state, which it constantly reveals as able to penetrate and taint the most intimate areas of personal life. This notion of the state as all-powerful and all-seeing stems from the post-structuralist cultural historian Michel Foucault whose pervasive image of the state is that of ‘panoptic’ (meaning ‘all-seeing’) surveillance. The Panopticon was a design for a circular prison conceived by the eighteenth-century utilitarian Jeremy Bentham: the design consisted of tiered ranks of cells which could all be surveyed by a single warder positioned at the centre of the circle. The panoptic state, however, maintains its surveillance not by physical force and intimidation, but by the power of its ‘discursive practices’ (to use Foucault’s terminology – ‘discursive’ is the adjective derived from the noun ‘discourse’) – which circulates its ideology throughout the body politic.

话语不仅仅是一种说话或写作的方式，而是包含特定社会所有成员思想的整个“心理状态”和意识形态。它不是单一的和单一的——话语的多样性总是存在的——因此权力结构的运作在（比如说）家庭中和在政府层级中一样是一个重要的因素。因此，与他们竞争可能涉及，例如，像改变政党政治一样改变性政治的斗争。因此，个人领域成为一个可能的政治行动领域，其方式可能会引起女权主义批评家的兴趣。那么，在这里，我们可能会看到政治乐观主义的理由。另一方面，当政治权力在如此多的领域运作和渗透时，根本性变革和转型的可能性似乎变得非常渺茫。

Discourse is not just a way of speaking or writing, but the whole ‘mental set’ and ideology which encloses the thinking of all members of a given society. It is not singular and monolithic – there is always a multiplicity of discourses – so that the operation of power structures is as significant a factor in (say) the family as in layers of government. Hence, contesting them may involve, for example, the struggle to change sexual politics just as much as party politics. Thus, the personal sphere becomes a possible sphere of political action in ways which might well interest a feminist critic. Here, then, we might see grounds for political optimism. On the other hand, when political power operates in and suffuses so many spheres, the possibility of fundamental change and transformation may come to seem very remote.

总的来说，新历史主义似乎强调这种“思想控制”的程度，暗示“越轨”思想可能在字面上变得“不可想象”（或仅可想象），因此国家被视为一个整体结构改变几乎是不可能的。福柯的著作着眼于能够维持这种权力的制度，例如国家惩罚、监狱、医疗行业和有关性的立法。福柯对“压抑结构”和“意识形态结构”的区分不像阿尔都塞那样严格（见第 8 章）。尽管如此，葛兰西的“霸权”（见第 8 章）、阿尔都塞的“质询”（见第 8章）之间有着明显的相似性)，以及福柯的“话语实践”，因为所有这些都涉及权力被剥夺权力的人内化的方式，因此不必不断地从外部强制执行。

On the whole, new historicism seems to emphasise the extent of this kind of ‘thought control’, with the implication that ‘deviant’ thinking may become literally ‘unthinkable’ (or only thinkable), so that the state is seen as a monolithic structure and change becomes almost impossible. Foucault’s work looks at the institutions which enable this power to be maintained, such as state punishment, prisons, the medical profession and legislation about sexuality. Foucault makes a less rigid distinction than is found in Althusser between ‘repressive structures’ and ‘ideological structures’ (see Chapter 8). All the same, there is a clear affinity between Gramsci’s ‘hegemony’ (see Chapter 8), Althusser’s ‘interpellation’ (see Chapter 8), and Foucault’s ‘discursive practices’, since all of these concern the way power is internalised by those whom it disempowers, so that it does not have to be constantly enforced externally.

应该补充的是，尽管新历史主义突出了“历史主义”一词，但它确实代表了文学研究帝国的重要延伸，因为它需要以文学批评的方式对非文学作品进行深入的“细读”。 -文学作品。很少提供完整的文件：取而代之的是摘录然后对其进行严格审查。（文档的语境化通常很少，部分是作为增加其影响力的作家策略。）此外，很少有人关注以前关于同一文本的写作，就好像新历史主义的出现已经把学术界的石板擦干净了一样。因此，这是一种真正的“页面上的文字”方法，在这种方法中，语境被摒弃，然后像 IA Richards 在 1920 年代为批评提供的去语境化、孤立的诗歌一样研究材料。因此，一个单一的历史文本有时是唯一的见证，例如，对性的某些方面的态度发生了声称的变化。因此，对单个文件施加的解释权重通常非常大。因此，我们不应指望发现新历史主义的方法会受到历史学家的高度重视或推崇。相反，它是

It should be added that new historicism, in spite of its foregrounding of the word ‘historicism’, really represents a significant extension of the empire of literary studies, for it entails intensive ‘close reading’, in the literary-critical manner, of non-literary texts. Documents are seldom offered entire: instead an extract is made which is then subjected to intensive scrutiny. (Contextualisation of the document is usually minimal, partly as a writerly ploy to increase its impact.) Further, little attention is paid to previous writing about the same text, as if the advent of new historicism has wiped the academic slate clean. Hence, this is a true ‘words on the page’ approach in which context is dispensed with and the material then studied like the decontextualised, isolated poems which I. A. Richards offered for criticism in the 1920s. Thus, a single historical text is sometimes the sole witness, for, say, a claimed change in attitude towards some aspect of sexuality. The interpretative weight thus placed upon a single document is often very great. So we should not expect to find the methods of new historicism greatly valued or admired by historians. It is, on the contrary, a way of ‘doing’ history which has a strong appeal for non-historians.

新历史主义的优缺点

Advantages and disadvantages of new historicism

然而，出于各种原因，新历史主义的号召力无疑是巨大的。首先，尽管它建立在后结构主义思想的基础上，但它是以一种更易于理解的方式编写的，在很大程度上避免了后结构主义特有的密集风格和词汇。它提供数据并得出结论，如果有时质疑数据的解释方式很容易，这部分是因为（如弗洛伊德理论的情况）解释所依据的经验基础是公开可用的审查。其次，材料本身往往引人入胜，在文学研究的背景下完全与众不同。

However, the appeal of new historicism is undoubtedly great, for a variety of reasons. Firstly, although it is founded upon post-structuralist thinking, it is written in a far more accessible way, for the most part avoiding post-structuralism’s characteristically dense style and vocabulary. It presents its data and draws its conclusions, and if it is sometimes easy to challenge the way the data is interpreted, this is partly because (as in the case of Freud’s theories) the empirical foundation on which the interpretation rests is made openly available for scrutiny. Secondly, the material itself is often fascinating and is wholly distinctive in the context of literary studies. These essays look and feel different from those produced by any other critical approach and immediately give the literary student the feeling that new territory is being entered.

特别是，由于没有引用以前对文学作品的讨论，散文的“整洁”、“精简”感觉给了它们一种鲜明和戏剧性的感觉。第三，新历史主义写作的政治锋芒总是尖锐的，但与此同时，它避免了“直截了当”的马克思主义批评中经常遇到的问题：它似乎不那么公开辩论，更愿意让历史证据自己发声。

Particularly, the ‘uncluttered’, ‘pared-down’ feel of the essays, which results from not citing previous discussions of the literary work, gives them a stark and dramatic air. Thirdly, the political edge of new historicist writing is always sharp, but at the same time it avoids the problems frequently encountered in ‘straight’ Marxist criticism: it seems less overtly polemical and more willing to allow the historical evidence its own voice.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

“做”新历史主义本质上涉及将文学材料与当代非文学文本并置。但是你会如何尝试自己着手做这件事，而不是仅仅阅读使用这个公式的已发表论文？

‘Doing’ new historicism essentially involves the juxtaposition of literary material with contemporary non-literary texts. But how would you attempt to set about doing this yourself, rather than just reading published essays which use this formula?

例如，如果你想用新历史主义方法写一篇关于莎士比亚喜剧的文章，你会在哪里寻找合适的历史材料？然后，找到材料后，论文本身的格式是什么？

For instance, if you wished to use the new historicist method for an essay about, say, a Shakespeare comedy where would you look for suitable historical material? Then, having found the material, what would be the format of the essay itself?

我不想掩盖其中的困难，但这里有一个建议：莎士比亚的喜剧在主题上是“家庭”的，关注性道德、求爱、男女关系和代际冲突。因此，我们将寻找有关社会和家族史的材料。

I wouldn’t want to gloss over the difficulties involved, but here is a suggestion: Shakespeare’s comedies are ‘domestic’ in theme, and concern sexual mores, courtship, relations between men and women, and inter-generational conflict. Hence, we would be looking for material on social and family history.

一本著名的相关书籍是劳伦斯·斯通 (Lawrence Stone) 的The Family, Sex, and Marriage in England, 1500–1800 (Penguin, 1979)。第五章，“父权制的强化”，有一些有用的材料，例如第三节“丈夫和妻子”，小节分为“妻子的从属地位”和“女性的教育”。第七章和第八章是“婚姻与求爱”，第五部分是“性”。

A well-known relevant book would be Lawrence Stone’s The Family, Sex, and Marriage in England, 1500–1800 (Penguin, 1979). Chapter five, ‘The Reinforcement of Patriarchy’, has useful material, such as Section 3, ‘Husband and Wife’, sub-sectioned into ‘The Subordination of Wives’ and ‘The Education of Women’. Chapters seven and eight are on ‘Marriage and Courtship’, and Part five is on ‘Sex’.

不太为人所知，但包含与主要新历史主义者使用的数据相似的数据的是《米德尔塞克斯的性爱：马萨诸塞州一个县的流行习俗，1649-1699》，罗杰·汤普森 (Roger Thompson)（马萨诸塞大学出版社，1986 年）。请参阅第一节“青少年习俗”和第二节“已婚习俗”。

Less well-known, but containing data similar to that used by the major new historicists, is Sex in Middlesex: Popular Mores in a Massachusetts County, 1649–1699, Roger Thompson (University of Massachusetts Press, 1986). See Section one, ‘Adolescent Mores’ and Section two, ‘Married Mores’.

此类已出版的历史数据和社会历史应该为新的历史方法提供一个可访问的“共同文本”来源。在不回避与该方法相关的问题的情况下，您至少能够以这种方式获得新历史主义作为一种实用的批评方法的“实践”经验。

Published historical data and social history of this kind should provide an accessible source of ‘co-texts’ for the new historical approach. Without by-passing the problems associated with the method, you would in this way at least be able to gain ‘hands-on’ experience of new historicism as a practical approach to criticism.

新历史主义者做什么

What new historicists do

1. 他们将文学和非文学文本并置，根据后者来阅读前者。

1. They juxtapose literary and non-literary texts, reading the former in the light of the latter.

2. 他们试图借此“陌生化”经典文学文本，将其从先前文学学术积累的重量中分离出来，并将其视为新的。

2. They try thereby to ‘defamiliarise’ the canonical literary text, detaching it from the accumulated weight of previous literary scholarship and seeing it as if new.

3. 他们将注意力（在文本和副文本中）集中在国家权力及其维持方式、父权制结构及其延续、殖民化过程及其伴随的“心态”等问题上。

3. They focus attention (within both text and co-text) on issues of state power and how it is maintained, on patriarchal structures and their perpetuation, and on the process of colonisation, with its accompanying ‘mind-set’.

4. 在这样做的过程中，他们利用了后结构主义观点的各个方面，尤其是德里达认为现实的每个方面都是文本化的观点，以及福柯的社会结构由占主导地位的“话语实践”决定的观点。

4. They make use, in doing so, of aspects of the post-structuralist outlook, especially Derrida’s notion that every facet of reality is textualised, and Foucault’s idea of social structures as determined by dominant ‘discursive practices’.

新历史主义：一个例子

New historicism: an example

作为实践中新历史主义的一个例子，让我们仔细看看一篇不是格林布拉特的文章，而是路易斯·蒙特罗斯的文章。他的文章“仲夏夜之梦和伊丽莎白时代文化的塑造幻想：性别、权力、形式”最初发表在美国期刊Representations 上，这是新历史主义的“家庭杂志”，并在 Wilson 和 Dutton 上转载。蒙特罗斯对新历史主义的著名定义是，它以文本的历史性和历史的文本性为中心，而这篇文章可能被视为该声明的体现。他的总体论点是，该剧“创造了创造它的文化，塑造了塑造它的幻想”（第 130 页）). 因此，对处女女王的崇拜既受到斯宾塞的《仙后》等文学作品的熏陶以及一系列的宫廷面具和盛会，同时产生了这样的文学：生活和文学相互激发，相互游戏。伊丽莎白可以将自己塑造成童贞具有神秘和神奇力量的女王，因为这样的形象在宫廷假面舞会、喜剧和田园史诗中得到了广泛应用。相反，伊丽莎白的形象刺激了此类作品和意象的产生和推广。因此，在这个意义上，历史是文本化的，文本是历史化的。一个简单的现代类比是电影中男性气质和女性气质的形象渗透我们生活的方式，并为我们提供了表现自己的方式：它们给了我们“榜样”，我们可以被困在里面，这样现实生活就会模仿电影对生活的表现.

As an example of new historicism in practice let us take a closer look at an essay, not by Greenblatt, but by Louis Montrose. His essay ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream and the Shaping Fantasies of Elizabethan Culture: Gender, Power, Form’ appeared originally in the American journal Representations, the ‘house magazine’ of the new historicism, and is reprinted in Wilson and Dutton. Montrose’s famous definition of new historicism is that it centres upon the historicity of the text and the textuality of history, and the essay might be seen as an embodiment of that pronouncement. His overall thesis is that the play ‘creates the culture by which it is created, shapes the fantasies by which it is shaped’ (p. 130). Thus, the cult of the Virgin Queen is both fostered by literature like Spenser’s The Faerie Queene and a whole range of court masks and pageants, and at the same time generates such literature: life and literature stimulate and play upon each other. Elizabeth can project herself as the Queen whose virginity has mystical and magical potency because such images are given currency in court masques, in comedies, and in pastoral epic poetry. Conversely, the figure of Elizabeth stimulates the production and promotion of such work and imagery. Hence, in this sense, history is textualised and texts are historicised. A simple modern parallel would be the way images of masculinity and femininity in film pervade our lives and offer us ways of representing ourselves: they give us ‘role models’ which we can become trapped inside, so that real life mimics the filmic representation of life.

蒙特罗斯的文章也代表了新历史主义的折衷主义，因为它借鉴了精神分析，尤其是弗洛伊德的梦分析和女权主义。它以西蒙福尔曼的梦开始，已经提到过，在梦中福尔曼描述了与女王的色情相遇，然后是一位老妇人：这个梦打开了“等待”女王和“压在她身上”的双关语。她的裙子拖在泥里，他提出让她的肚子抬起来解决问题（“我的意思是等你，而不是在你身下”）。在梦中，福尔曼刚刚将女王从“一个织工，一个长着红胡子的高个子”的纠缠中救了出来，蒙特罗斯将此解释为俄狄浦斯三角关系。他将此与女王将自己塑造为国家之母的形象联系起来，p. 111). 然后，他将所有这一切与特殊情况所产生的紧张关系联系起来，即一个高度父权制的社会，在这个社会中，所有的权力都被赋予了男人，然而却由一个女人统治，因此她对她所有的臣民，男人和女人，以及有权提升或结束她的男性廷臣的职业生涯。在莎士比亚的戏剧中，有几个女王被“控制”并因此被女性化的例子——亚马逊女王希波吕忒被忒修斯击败，她现在必须服从并嫁给忒修斯：蔑视她丈夫奥伯伦对换生灵男孩的依恋，因此被他羞辱，让帕克服用魔法药水，这使她爱上了她醒来时看到的第一个生物。在整部剧中，父亲对女儿的权利和丈夫对妻子的权利有很多，男性欲望的前提是女性的服从。“幸福”的结局取决于父权制的强化：

Montrose’s essay also represents the eclecticism of new historicism, for it draws upon psychoanalysis, especially Freudian dream analysis, and feminism. It opens with an account of Simon Forman’s dream, already mentioned, in which Forman describes an erotic encounter with the Queen, then an elderly woman: the dream turns on the pun of ‘wait upon’ the Queen and ‘weight upon her’. Her dress is trailing in the mud and he offers to solve the problem by causing her belly to lift (‘I mean to wait upon you not under you’). In the dream Forman has just saved the Queen from being pestered by ‘a weaver, a tall man with a reddish beard’, and Montrose interprets this as an Oedipal triangle. He links this to the Queen’s projection of herself as mother of the nation, but also as a virgin who is openly flirtatious and provocative – Montrose quotes the French ambassador’s accounts of her extremely revealing style of dress (‘She kept the front of her dress open, and one could see the whole of her bosom’ … p. 111). He then relates all this to the tensions generated by the peculiar situation that a highly patriarchal society in which all power was vested in men was nevertheless ruled by a woman who therefore had absolute powers of life over all her subjects, men and women, and the power to advance or end the careers of her male courtiers. In Shakespeare’s play, there are several instances of a queen who is ‘mastered’, and thereby feminised – Hippolyta, the Amazonian queen, has been defeated by Theseus, whom she must now submit to and marry: Titania, queen of the fairies, has defied her husband Oberon in her attachment to the changeling boy and hence is humiliated by him in having Puck administer the magic potion which makes her fall in love with the first being she sees on waking. Throughout the play, there is much about the rights of fathers over daughters and husbands over wives, and the precondition of male desire is female subjection. The ‘happy’ ending depends upon the reinforcement of patriarchy:

仲夏夜之梦的节日结束，它庆祝浪漫和有生育能力的异性结合，取决于一个过程的成功，在这个过程中，女性的骄傲和权力表现在厌恶人类的战士、占有欲强的母亲、不守规矩的妻子和任性的女儿身上得到控制丈夫和领主。（第 120 页）
The festive conclusion of A Midsummer Night’s Dream, its celebration of romantic and generative heterosexual union, depends upon the success of a process whereby the female pride and power manifested in misanthropic warriors, possessive mothers, unruly wives, and wilful daughters are brought under the control of husbands and lords. (p. 120)

因此，有人建议，该剧可能被视为隐含的叛国行为，因为：

Hence, it is suggested, the play might be seen as implicitly treasonous, since:

当一位处女统治者表面上是她臣民的处女母亲时，男性生殖能力、自生和对女性的控制等主题就会引起煽动性的共鸣。在皇室盛会中，女王永远是主角；她的童贞是魔法力量的源泉。然而，在《仲夏夜之梦》中，这种神奇的力量被赋予了国王。（第 127 页）
When a virgin ruler is ostensibly the virgin mother of her subjects, then the themes of male procreative power, autogeny, and mastery of women acquire a seditious resonance. In royal pageantry, the queen is always the cynosure; her virginity is the source of magical potency. In A Midsummer Night’s Dream, however, such magical powers are invested in the king. (p. 127)

因此，“莎士比亚的喜剧象征性地中和了它表面上所崇拜的王权”（第 127 页）。在实践中，尽管女性处于权力的顶峰，但通过不断坚持伊丽莎白与其他女性的区别，父权制得以维持。即使在今天，这也是一种熟悉的策略，因为拥有一位女性领导人并没有导致保守党改变其关于女性社会角色的观念——相反，在“铁娘子”的统治下（这是一个有趣的措辞） context）反动思想得到巩固和强化。因此，“伊丽莎白的统治并不是为了破坏她文化中的男性霸权。事实上，强调她与其他女性的差异可能有助于加强这种差异”（第 124 页）). 如果选美和赞美不断地同时宣称她是“少女、主妇和母亲”，那么她就不是一个真正的女人，而是一个宗教谜团。因此，在整篇文章中，该剧的叙述与男性试图接受女性君主和严格的父权结构同时存在的尝试交织在一起。对于男性朝臣来说，成为处女女王的贞洁仆人似乎有些“无人问津”，而那些向她寻求进步的人则像是寻求国家母亲宠爱的孩子。（蒙特罗斯描述了一场奢侈而旷日持久的娱乐活动，罗利和格雷维尔在其中演绎了这个比喻。）所有这些都表明了坚持文本的历史性和历史的文本性在实践中的意义。

Hence, ‘Shakespeare’s comedy symbolically neutralises the royal power to which it ostensibly pays homage’ (p. 127). In practice, patriarchy is maintained in spite of the presence of a woman at the pinnacle of power, by constantly insisting on Elizabeth’s difference from other women. This is a familiar strategy even today, for having a female leader did not lead the Tory Party to revise its ideas about the role of women in society – on the contrary, under the rule of the ‘iron lady’ (an interesting locution in this context) reactionary ideas were reinforced and strengthened. Thus, ‘Elizabeth’s rule was not intended to undermine the male hegemony of her culture. Indeed, the emphasis upon her difference from other women may have helped to reinforce it’ (p. 124). If the pageants and the encomiums constantly proclaimed her simultaneously ‘Maiden, Matron and Mother’ then she becomes, not a real woman, but a religious mystery. Throughout the essay, then, the account of the play entwines it with male attempts to come to terms with the simultaneous existence of a female monarch and a rigorous patriarchal structure. For male courtiers, there might seem to be a certain ‘unmanning’ involved in being chaste servants of the Virgin Queen, while those who sought advancement from her seemed like children seeking the favours of the nation’s mother. (Montrose describes an extravagant and protracted entertainment in which Raleigh and Greville acted out this metaphor.) All this demonstrates what is meant in practice by insisting upon the historicity of the text and the textuality of history.

文化唯物主义

Cultural materialism

英国评论家格雷厄姆霍尔德尼斯将文化唯物主义描述为“一种政治化的史学形式”。我们可以将其解释为意思是在一个政治化的框架内研究历史材料（包括文学文本），这个框架包括那些文学文本以某种方式帮助塑造的现在。“文化唯物主义”一词在 1985 年流行起来，当时乔纳森·多利莫尔 (Jonathan Dollimore) 和艾伦·辛菲尔德 (Alan Sinfield)（最著名的文化唯物主义者）将其用作他们编辑的政治莎士比亚论文集的副标题。他们在前言中将该术语定义为指定具有四个特征的批判方法：它结合了对以下方面的关注：

The British critic Graham Holderness describes cultural materialism as ‘a politicised form of historiography’. We can explain this as meaning the study of historical material (which includes literary texts) within a politicised framework, this framework including the present which those literary texts have in some way helped to shape. The term ‘cultural materialism’ was made current in 1985 when it was used by Jonathan Dollimore and Alan Sinfield (the best-known of the cultural materialists) as the subtitle of their edited collection of essays Political Shakespeare. They define the term in a foreword as designating a critical method which has four characteristics: it combines an attention to:

1. 历史背景，

1. historical context,

2.理论方法，

2. theoretical method,

3. 政治承诺，以及

3. political commitment, and

4.文本分析。

4. textual analysis.

简要评论其中的每一个：首先，强调历史背景“破坏了传统上赋予文学文本的超验意义”。这里的“超越”一词大致意味着“永恒”。当然，所采取的立场需要面对一个明显的反对意见，即如果我们今天仍在研究和阅读莎士比亚，那么他的戏剧确实证明了它们在简单意义上是“永恒的”，即它们显然不受它们所处的历史环境的限制被生产。但这是一个程度问题：文化唯物主义这一方面的目的是让文学文本“恢复其历史”，而以前的研究往往忽略了这一点。恢复的历史将涉及将戏剧与诸如“圈地和农村穷人的压迫、国家权力和对它的抵抗……巫术”等现象联系起来，p. 3 ). 其次，强调理论方法意味着与自由人本主义的决裂，吸取了结构主义、后结构主义等自 20 世纪 70 年代以来兴起的方法的教训。第三，对政治承诺的强调标志着马克思主义和女权主义观点的影响，打破了迄今为止主导莎士比亚批评的保守派-基督教框架。最后，对文本分析的强调“将对传统方法的批判置于不容忽视的位置”。换句话说，不仅要致力于提出抽象的理论，还要致力于在（主要）经典文本上练习它，这些文本仍然是大量学术和专业关注的焦点，并且是突出的国家和文化标志。

To comment briefly on each of these: firstly, the emphasis on historical context ‘undermines the transcendent significance traditionally accorded to the literary text’. Here the word ‘transcendent’ roughly means ‘timeless’. The position taken, of course, needs to face the obvious objection that if we are today still studying and reading Shakespeare then his plays have indeed proved themselves ‘timeless’ in the simple sense that they are clearly not limited by the historical circumstances in which they were produced. But this is a matter of degree: the aim of this aspect of cultural materialism is to allow the literary text to ‘recover its histories’ which previous kinds of study have often ignored. The kind of history recovered would involve relating the plays to such phenomena as ‘enclosures and the oppression of the rural poor, state power and resistance to it … witchcraft, the challenge and containment of the carnivalesque’ (Dollimore and Sinfield, p. 3). Secondly, the emphasis on theoretical method signifies a break with liberal humanism and absorbing the lessons of structuralism, post-structuralism, and other approaches which have become prominent since the 1970s. Thirdly, the emphasis on political commitment signifies the influence of Marxist and feminist perspectives and break from the conservative-Christian framework which hitherto dominated Shakespeare criticism. Finally, the stress on textual analysis ‘locates the critique of traditional approaches where it cannot be ignored’. In other words, there is a commitment not just to making theory of an abstract kind, but to practising it on (mainly) canonical texts which continue to be the focus of massive amounts of academic and professional attention, and which are prominent national and cultural icons.

对“文化唯物主义”一词中的两个词进行了进一步定义：“文化”将包括所有文化形式（“电视、流行音乐和小说等形式”）。也就是说，这种方法并不局限于像莎士比亚戏剧这样的“高级”文化形式。“唯物主义”意味着“唯心主义”的对立面：“唯心主义”的信念是高雅文化代表着有才华的个人思想的自由和独立发挥；相反的“唯物主义”信念是文化不能“超越物质力量和生产关系”。文化不仅仅是经济和政治制度的反映，但也不能独立于它之外。这些对唯物主义的评论代表了马克思主义批评的标准信念，它们或许确实指出了在“直接的”马克思主义批评和文化唯物主义之间做出有用区分的困难。然而，补充说，相关历史不仅仅是四百年前的历史，而是莎士比亚产生和再现的时代（包括我们自己的时代）。因此，在文化唯物主义中，强调了现在将莎士比亚带给我们的机构的功能——皇家莎士比亚公司、电影业、为学校和大学制作教科书的出版商，以及国家课程，它奠定了降低了所有学生都必须学习特定莎士比亚戏剧的要求。

The two words in the term ‘cultural materialism’ are further defined: ‘culture’ will include all forms of culture (‘forms like television and popular music and fiction’). That is, this approach does not limit itself to ‘high’ cultural forms like the Shakespeare play. ‘Materialism’ signifies the opposite of ‘idealism’: an ‘idealist’ belief would be that high culture represents the free and independent play of the talented individual mind; the contrary ‘materialist’ belief is that culture cannot ‘transcend the material forces and relations of production. Culture is not simply a reflection of the economic and political system, but nor can it be independent of it’. These comments on materialism represent the standard beliefs of Marxist criticism, and they do perhaps point to the difficulty of making a useful distinction between a ‘straight’ Marxist criticism and cultural materialism. However, it is added that the relevant history is not just that of four hundred years ago, but that of the times (including our own) in which Shakespeare is produced and reproduced. Thus, in cultural materialism there is an emphasis on the functioning of the institutions through which Shakespeare is now brought to us – the Royal Shakespeare Company, the film industry, the publishers who produce textbooks for school and college, and the National Curriculum, which lays down the requirement that specific Shakespeare plays be studied by all school pupils.

文化唯物主义在很大程度上借鉴了英国左翼评论家雷蒙德·威廉姆斯 (Raymond Williams) 的观点（及其名称）。威廉姆斯没有使用福柯的“话语”概念，而是发明了“感觉结构”一词：这些与“生活和感受的意义和价值”有关。感觉结构通常与明确的价值观和信仰体系以及社会中的主导意识形态都对立。他们在文学作品中很有特色，他们反对现状（狄更斯、勃朗特等人的价值观代表了与维多利亚时代的商业和唯物主义价值观不一致的人类情感结构）。结果是，文化唯物主义对变革的可能性更加乐观，有时愿意将文学视为对立价值观的来源。特别是文化唯物主义涉及使用过去来“解读”现在，通过我们选择强调或压制过去的东西来揭示我们自己社会的政治。英国的大量工作一直在破坏它所认为的莎士比亚作为英国文化中保守偶像的拜物教角色。这种形式的文化唯物主义可以方便地在三本“新口音”书中进行采样：莎士比亚神话，格雷厄姆霍尔德内斯：另类莎士比亚，编辑。John Drakakis 和That Shakespeherian Rag， Terence Hawkes。（这个古怪的标题源自 TS 艾略特在《荒原》中的一个典故。 ）伦敦书评上一年多来回应对其中第一个评论的评论的信件，在“Bardolatry”标题下。

Cultural materialism takes a good deal of its outlook (and its name) from the British left-wing critic Raymond Williams. Instead of Foucault’s notion of ‘discourse’ Williams invented the term ‘structures of feeling’: these are concerned with ‘meanings and values as they are lived and felt’. Structures of feeling are often antagonistic both to explicit systems of values and beliefs, and to the dominant ideologies within a society. They are characteristically found in literature, and they oppose the status quo (as the values in Dickens, the Brontës, etc., represent human structures of feeling which are at variance with Victorian commercial and materialist values). The result is that cultural materialism is much more optimistic about the possibility of change and is willing at times to see literature as a source of oppositional values. Cultural materialism particularly involves using the past to ‘read’ the present, revealing the politics of our own society by what we choose to emphasise or suppress of the past. A great deal of the British work has been about undermining what it sees as the fetishistic role of Shakespeare as a conservative icon within British culture. This form of cultural materialism can be conveniently sampled in three ‘New Accents’ books: The Shakespeare Myth, Graham Holderness: Alternative Shakespeares, ed. John Drakakis, and That Shakespeherian Rag, Terence Hawkes. (This quaint title is derived from an allusion by T. S. Eliot in The Waste Land.) A correspondence in response to a review of the first of these ran for over a year in the London Review of Books, under the heading ‘Bardolatry’.

文化唯物主义与新历史主义有何不同？

How is cultural materialism different from new historicism?

文化唯物主义在讨论中经常与美国的新历史主义联系在一起。虽然这两个运动属于同一个家庭，但他们之间的家庭争吵仍在继续。政治莎士比亚包括新的历史主义文章，导言解释了这两个运动之间的一些差异。

Cultural materialism is often linked in discussion with new historicism, its American counterpart. Though the two movements belong to the same family, there is an ongoing family quarrel between them. Political Shakespeare includes new historicist essays, and the introduction explains some of the differences between the two movements.

首先，在一个巧妙的区分中，多利莫尔和辛菲尔德引用了马克思的话，大意是“男人和女人创造了他们自己的历史，但不是在他们自己选择的条件下”（第 3 页）：他们说，文化唯物主义者倾向于专注于干预男人和女人借此创造他们自己的历史，而新历史主义者倾向于关注他们这样做的不太理想的环境，也就是说，关注限制他们的“社会和意识形态结构的力量”。结果是政治乐观主义和政治悲观主义之间的对比。

Firstly, in a neat distinction Dollimore and Sinfield quote Marx to the effect that ‘men and women make their own history but not in conditions of their own choosing’ (p. 3): cultural materialists, they say, tend to concentrate on the interventions whereby men and women make their own history, whereas new historicists tend to focus on the less than ideal circumstances in which they do so, that is, on the ‘power of social and ideological structures’ which restrain them. The result is a contrast between political optimism and political pessimism.

其次，文化唯物主义者认为新历史主义者通过接受特定版本的后结构主义及其对获得安全知识的可能性的激进怀疑，将自己与有效的政治立场隔离开来。后结构主义的兴起将知识、语言、真理等问题化，这一视角被吸纳到新历史主义中，成为其重要组成部分。针对这一指控的新历史主义辩护是，意识到所有事物的内在不确定性知识并不意味着我们放弃建立真理的努力，它只是意味着我们这样做时意识到所涉及的危险和局限性，从而赋予他们自己的智力探索以特殊的权威。这更像是明知故犯地驶入危险水域，并采取了所有明智的预防措施，而不是轻率地没有意识到危险并灯火通明。因此，当新历史主义者声称（用彼得维多森的话说）福柯让他们进入“一种非真理导向的文本历史主义研究形式”（第 161 页）时，这并不意味着他们不相信他们所相信的东西说的是真的，而是他们知道声称建立真相所涉及的风险和危险。

Secondly, cultural materialists see new historicists as cutting themselves off from effective political positions by their acceptance of a particular version of post-structuralism, with its radical scepticism about the possibility of attaining secure knowledge. The rise of post-structuralism problematises knowledge, language, truth, etc., and this perspective is absorbed into new historicism and becomes an important part of it. The new historicist defence against this charge would be that being aware of the in-built uncertainty of all knowledge doesn’t mean that we give up trying to establish truths, it simply means that we do so conscious of the dangers and limitations involved, thus giving their own intellectual enquiries a special authority. This is rather like sailing into dangerous waters knowingly, with all sensible precautions taken, rather than blithely unaware of the dangers and with all lights blazing. Thus, when new historicists claim (in Peter Widdowson’s words) that Foucault gives them entry into ‘a non-truth-oriented form of historicist study of texts’ (p. 161) this doesn’t mean that they do not believe that what they say is true, but rather that they know the risks and dangers involved in claiming to establish truths.

新历史主义和文化唯物主义之间的第三个重要区别是，前者的共同文本是与莎士比亚同时代的文献，而后者可能是皇家莎士比亚剧团当前作品的节目单、海湾战争飞行员对莎士比亚的引述，或关于莎士比亚的声明。政府部长的教育。换句话说：新历史主义者将文学文本置于它自己时代的政治情境中，而文化唯物主义者将其置于我们的政治情境中。这实际上是为了重申两种方法在政治重点上的差异。确实，可以说，刚才描述的所有这三种差异都将这种政治差异作为它们的共同点。

A third important difference between new historicism and cultural materialism is that where the former’s co-texts are documents contemporary with Shakespeare, the latter’s may be programme notes for a current Royal Shakespeare Company production, quotations of Shakespeare by a Gulf War pilot, or pronouncements on education by a government minister. To put this another way: the new historicist situates the literary text in the political situation of its own day, while the cultural materialist situates it within that of ours. This is really to restate the difference in political emphasis between the two approaches. Indeed, it could be said that all three of the differences just described have this political difference as their common denominator.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

我们花时间阐明了文化唯物主义和新历史主义之间的区别，这一事实表明它们之间存在相当大的重叠。它们只是本质上相同事物的两个民族变体，还是如所声称的那样存在根本差异（英国文化唯物主义者尤其强调）？

The fact that we have spent time spelling out the differences between cultural materialism and new historicism indicates that there is a considerable overlap between them. Are they just two national varieties of essentially the same thing, or are the radical differences (emphasised especially by the British cultural materialists) as deep as is claimed?

也许只有通过阅读和比较每种类型的文章才能正确回答这个问题。据称，分歧主要在于两个方面：一是政治观，二是对后结构主义视角的重视程度。

Perhaps the question can only be properly answered by reading and comparing essays of each type. Allegedly, the differences lie mainly in two aspects: firstly, in political outlook, and secondly, in the degree of emphasis on the post-structuralist perspective.

在思考这个问题时，首先要比较本书中每个例子中明显的态度，只要你能从给出的简短说明中做出判断。然后阅读并比较另外两篇文章（借鉴本节末尾建议的阅读内容）。

In thinking about the question, start by comparing the attitudes evident in the examples of each included in this book, in so far as you are able to judge from the brief accounts given. Then read and compare two further pieces (drawing on the reading suggested at the end of this section).

当然，这两种方法之间的差异部分是由于它们不同的知识框架。新历史主义深受福柯的影响，福柯经常将“话语实践”视为主流意识形态的强化。另一方面，文化唯物主义在很大程度上归功于雷蒙德·威廉姆斯，他认为“感受的结构”包含着对主流意识形态产生反抗的种子。对这两种方法持怀疑态度的人认为，新历史主义者一定很难解释英国内战是如何开始的（因为他们似乎设想了一种无所不在的国家权力，这将使抵抗几乎不可能），而对于文化唯物主义者来说，这一定是很难解释它是如何结束的（因为他们的“感觉结构”不断地提出新的想法，这似乎使停滞变得不可能）。然而，在实践中，这两种方法之间经常引起的政治分歧肯定不如这种明显的二分法所暗示的那样统一和可预测。

Of course, the differences between these two approaches are partly the result of their different intellectual frameworks. New historicism was much influenced by Foucault, who sees ‘discursive practices’ as frequently a reinforcement of dominant ideology. Cultural materialism, on the other hand, owes much to Raymond Williams, who sees ‘structures of feeling’ as containing the seeds from which grows resistance to the dominant ideology. A sceptic about both approaches suggested that it must be hard for the new historicists to explain how the English Civil War ever got started (since they seem to envisage a pervasive state power which would make resistance virtually impossible) while for the cultural materialists it must be difficult to explain how it ever ended (since their ‘structures of feeling’ constantly throw up new ideas which would seem to make stasis impossible). In practice, however, the frequently evoked political difference between the two approaches is surely less uniform and predictable than such stark dichotomies would imply.

文化唯物主义批评家做什么

What cultural materialist critics do

1. 他们阅读文学文本（通常是文艺复兴时期的戏剧）的方式使我们能够“恢复其历史”，即它出现的剥削背景。

1. They read the literary text (very often a Renaissance play) in such a way as to enable us to ‘recover its histories’, that is, the context of exploitation from which it emerged.

2.与此同时，他们突出了作品当前传播和语境化中的那些元素，这些元素首先导致了那些历史的丢失（例如，“遗产”行业将莎士比亚包装为历史选美，国家吟游诗人、文化偶像等）。

2. At the same time, they foreground those elements in the work’s present transmission and contextualising which caused those histories to be lost in the first place (for example, the ‘heritage’ industry’s packaging of Shakespeare in terms of history-as-pageant, national bard, cultural icon, and so on).

3. 他们结合使用了马克思主义和女权主义的方法来处理文本，尤其是为了完成其中的第一项（上文），并且为了打破保守派先前的统治地位尤其是莎士比亚批评中的社会、政治和宗教假设。

3. They use a combination of Marxist and feminist approaches to the text, especially in order to do the first of these (above), and in order to fracture the previous dominance of conservative social, political, and religious assumptions in Shakespeare criticism in particular.

4.他们使用细密文本分析的技术，但经常使用结构主义和后结构主义技术，特别是在保守的文化和社会假设的框架内打破了传统的细密文本分析。

4. They use the technique of close textual analysis, but often employ structuralist and post-structuralist techniques, especially to mark a break with the inherited tradition of close textual analysis within the framework of conservative cultural and social assumptions.

5.与此同时，他们主要在经典的传统概念范围内工作，理由是写更多晦涩的文本几乎不会构成有效的政治干预（例如，在关于学校课程或国家身份的辩论中）。

5. At the same time, they work mainly within traditional notions of the canon, on the grounds that writing about more obscure texts hardly ever constitutes an effective political intervention (for instance, in debates about the school curriculum or national identity).

文化唯物主义：一个例子

Cultural materialism: an example

这种方法的一个非正式变体的例子是 Terence Hawkes 的论文“Telmah”（在他的书That Shakespeherian Rag中）。这是本书的第四篇文章，每一篇都以本世纪早期一位主要的莎士比亚评论家的作品为中心，整体策略是研究莎士比亚是如何被中介和处理给我们的。在本章中，评论家是约翰·多佛·威尔逊 (John Dover Wilson)，他以 1930 年代的著作《哈姆雷特发生了什么？开头部分考虑了哈姆雷特的各个方面，强调戏剧的循环和对称元素，例如开头如何呼应结尾，相同的情况如何在其中多次出现（如几个父子平行）并考虑任何表演的开始和结束是多么不确定，因为在人们看到它之前，该剧已经以某种方式在文化上位于人们的脑海中。剧中反复回顾过去的主题（回顾比现在更好的过去）导致霍克斯想象一个“颠倒的”哈姆雷特，它与实际的戏剧相映成趣，即他的头衔“Telmah”。

An example of an informal variant of this approach is Terence Hawkes’s essay ‘Telmah’ (in his book That Shakespeherian Rag). This is the fourth piece in the book, each one being centred on the work of one of the major Shakespearian critics of the early part of the century, within an overall strategy of looking at how Shakespeare is mediated and processed to us. In this chapter the critic is John Dover Wilson, best known for his 1930s book What Happens in Hamlet? The opening section considers aspects of Hamlet, emphasising cyclical and symmetrical elements of the play, such as how the beginning echoes the end, how the same situation occurs several times in it (like the several father-son parallels) and considering how indefinite the start and end of any performance are, since the play is already culturally situated in some way in people’s minds before they see it. A repeated motif of looking backwards in the play (to a past which was better than the present) leads Hawkes to imagine a ‘reversed’ Hamlet which shadows the actual play, the ‘Telmah’ of his title.

第二部分的标题是“到桑德兰站”，暗指俄国革命的著名历史的标题，称为“到芬兰站”。1917 年，约翰·多佛·威尔逊 (John Dover Wilson) 在前往桑德兰 (Sunderland) 的火车上进行了记述，政府派他去解决军火厂的劳工问题，并阅读了 WW Greg 关于哈姆雷特(Hamlet) 的文章，该文章认为国王的失败公开对哑剧的反应表明他是一个复杂的人物，而不仅仅是故事书中的反派。如果他是这样，那么他就开始引起我们的一些注意，并分散我们对哈姆雷特本人的注意力，这一直是对戏剧做出反应的传统方式，至少从浪漫主义时代开始是这样。威尔逊对这一观点的愤怒与对秩序的狂热渴望有关，这体现在他发表的有关俄罗斯的著作中，这些著作将其视为风景如画的“有机”封建国家，而这反过来又看起来像是他的社会阶层所认为的英格兰版本怀旧和恐惧可能会丢失。多佛·威尔逊 (Dover Wilson) 在回复格雷格 (Greg) 以及后来的哈姆雷特(Hamlet) 时急于为受到威胁的文化偶像哈姆雷特 (Hamlet) 辩护书，也被视为这方面的症状。第一次世界大战后不久，威尔逊成为纽博尔特委员会的成员，该委员会报告了英语教学，并认为它提供了一种社会凝聚力形式，可以使国家免于重蹈俄国覆辙的命运。霍克斯还引用了内维尔·张伯伦赞扬《哈姆雷特》中发生的事情的一封信，从而创造了一种安抚和包容差异的模式。因此，一种解释该剧的方式被置于 20 世纪生活的几个共同文本中，因此该剧本身在文化上发生了转变。霍克斯对戏剧结尾的最终解读包括插入一个额外的舞台方向，他对这种批评的模式是爵士音乐家不传输收到的文本，而是翻译形成他所表现的形式。这可能被视为文化唯物主义批评的这种变体的特征。

The second section is entitled ‘To the Sunderland Station’, alluding to the title of a well-known history of the Russian Revolution called To the Finland Station. An account is given of John Dover Wilson on the train to Sunderland in 1917, sent by the government to sort out labour problems in a munitions factory, and reading W. W. Greg’s article on Hamlet which argues that the king’s failure to react openly to the dumb show indicates that he is a figure of some complexity, not just a story-book villain. If he is this then he begins to claim some of our attention, and distract us from the exclusive focus on Hamlet himself which had been the traditional way of responding to the play, at least from the time of the Romantics. Wilson’s excited outrage at this notion is related to a fanatical desire for order manifested in his published writings about Russia which see it as a picturesque ‘organic’ feudal state, which, in turn, looks like a version of the England which his social class regards with nostalgia and fears might be lost. Dover Wilson’s rushing to the defence of Hamlet, the threatened cultural icon, in his reply to Greg, and later in his Hamlet book, are seen as symptomatic of this too. Shortly after the First World War Wilson was a member of the Newbolt Committee which reported on the teaching of English, and saw it as providing a form of social cohesion which might save the country from the fate which overtook Russia. Hawkes also quotes a letter from Neville Chamberlain praising What Happens in Hamlet?, and thus creates a pattern of appeasing and containing difference. Hence, a way of interpreting the play is placed among several co-texts from twentieth-century life, and thus the play itself is culturally transformed. Hawkes’s final reading of the end of the play involves inserting an extra stage direction, and his model for a criticism of this kind is that of the jazz musician who doesn’t transmit a received text, but transforms what he performs. That might be taken as the characteristic feature of this variant of cultural materialist criticism.

很难知道如何“放置”这种文字。活泼有趣，语气个性而投入，摒弃了学术写作的大部分形式。开场是戏剧性的，过渡是突然的：通过隐瞒有关身份或情况的关键细节直到影响最大的时刻来维持悬念。该结构是一系列看似无关的事件或情况，结果却紧密地交织在一起。所有这些特征都是小说性的，显然这是一种“创造性写作”，不接受文学和批评之间的任何绝对区分。正如在新历史主义中一样，文学和历史是交织在一起的，但视角和历史化比新历史主义本身更符合我们这个时代的观点和历史化。

It is difficult to know how to ‘place’ writing of this kind. It is lively and interesting, personal and engaged in tone, and most of the formalities of academic writing are dispensed with. Openings are dramatic, transitions abrupt: suspense is maintained by holding back key details about identity or situation till the moment of maximum impact. The structure is a series of seemingly unrelated incidents or situations which turn out to be intimately intertwined. All these features are novelistic, and there is clearly a sense in which this is ‘creative writing’ which would not accept any absolute distinction between literature and criticism. As in new historicism, literature and history are intertwined, but the perspective and the historicising are much more those of our own day than would be the case with new historicism itself.

选读

Selected reading

大通，辛西娅，编辑。浪漫主义(Longman Critical Readers, 1993)。

Chase, Cynthia, ed. Romanticism (Longman Critical Readers, 1993).

包含该时期新历史主义方法的三个例子，即卡伦斯旺关于柯勒律治的克里斯塔贝尔的章节、马乔里莱文森关于济慈的章节以及杰罗姆克里斯滕森关于拜伦的萨达纳帕卢斯的章节。

Contains three examples of new historicist approaches to the period, namely, the chapters by Karen Swann on Coleridge’s Christabel, by Marjorie Levinson on Keats, and by Jerome Christensen on Byron’s Sardanapalus.

Dollimore, Jonathan 和 Sinfield, Alan, eds, Political Shakespeare: New Essays in Cultural Materialism（曼彻斯特大学出版社，第 2 版，1994 年）。

引言对新历史主义进行了有用的说明，并解释了它与文化唯物主义的区别。该书转载了格林布拉特的论文《看不见的子弹》。

Dollimore, Jonathan and Sinfield, Alan, eds, Political Shakespeare: New Essays in Cultural Materialism (Manchester University Press, 2nd edn, 1994).

The introduction gives a useful account of new historicism and explains how it differs from cultural materialism. The book reprints Greenblatt’s essay ‘Invisible Bullets’.

Drakakis, John, ed. 另类莎士比亚（修订版，Routledge，2002 年）。这些文章没有使用“文化唯物主义”一词，但它们通常代表了这种方法；他们寻求“加速打破莎士比亚批评的既定经典”，举例说明“探索特定历史解读的产生方式”。

Drakakis, John, ed. Alternative Shakespeares (revised edn, Routledge, 2002). The term ‘cultural materialism’ is not used of these essays, but they are generally representative of this approach; they seek ‘to accelerate the break with established canons of Shakespeare criticism’, exemplifying ‘explorations of the ways in which historically specific readings are generated’.

Gallagher, Catherine 和 Greenblatt, Stephen，Practicing the New Historicism（芝加哥大学出版社，2000 年）。

凯瑟琳·加拉格尔和斯蒂芬·格林布拉特在通俗易懂的散文中聚焦新历史主义的五个核心方面：轶事的反复使用、对再现本质的专注、对身体历史的迷恋、对被忽视的细节的敏锐关注，以及意识形态的怀疑分析。（出版商的宣传语。）

Gallagher, Catherine and Greenblatt, Stephen, Practicing the New Historicism (University of Chicago Press, 2000).

‘In lucid and jargon-free prose, Catherine Gallagher and Stephen Greenblatt focus on five central aspects of new historicism: recurrent use of anecdotes, preoccupation with the nature of representations, fascination with the history of the body, sharp focus on neglected details, and skeptical analysis of ideology.’ (Publisher’s blurb.)

Grady, Hugh，The Modernist Shakespeare（牛津大学出版社，新版，1994 年）。

第 225-35 页是关于新历史主义的。一本优秀的书，始终清晰易读。关于蒂尔亚德（“旧历史主义”）的第四章非常有用。第五章讨论了当代批评趋势在莎士比亚身上的应用。

Grady, Hugh, The Modernist Shakespeare (Oxford University Press, new edn, 1994).

Pages 225–35 are on the new historicism. An excellent book, always sharp and readable. Chapter four on Tillyard (the ‘old historicism’) is very useful. Chapter five discusses the application of contemporary critical trends to Shakespeare.

斯蒂芬·格林布拉特 ( Shakespearian Negotiations: The Circulation of Social Energy in Renaissance England )（加州大学出版社，1991 年）。

关于莎士比亚喜剧中异装的文章“小说与摩擦”是新历史主义的一个很好的起点。散文“看不见的子弹”是这本书中最著名的一篇。

Greenblatt, Stephen, Shakespearian Negotiations: The Circulation of Social Energy in Renaissance England (California University Press, 1991).

The essay ‘Fiction and Friction’, on cross-dressing in Shakespearian comedies, is a good starting-point on new historicism. The essay ‘Invisible Bullets’ is the best-known piece in the book.

Hawkes, Terence, That Shakespeherian Rag (Methuen, 1986)。

文化唯物主义在实践中的例子。整本书读起来很生动，将莎士比亚和我们遇到他的环境进行了一些惊人的并置。

Hawkes, Terence, That Shakespeherian Rag (Methuen, 1986).

Examples of cultural materialism in practice. The whole book is a lively read which makes some startling juxtapositions of Shakespeare and the circumstances in which we encounter him.

霍尔德尼斯，格雷厄姆，莎士比亚神话（曼彻斯特大学出版社，1988 年）。

研究“文化产生和历史决定的莎士比亚神话”，以及“对莎士比亚在教育、戏剧、新闻和电视领域的杰出调解人的采访”。

Holderness, Graham, The Shakespeare Myth (Manchester University Press, 1988).

Studies of the ‘culturally-produced and historically-determined Shakespeare myth’, along with ‘interviews with prominent mediators of Shakespeare in education, theatre, the press, and television’.

莱文森，马乔里，编辑。反思历史主义：浪漫史的批判读物（布莱克威尔，1989 年）。

新历史主义适用于浪漫主义。

Levinson, Marjorie, ed. Rethinking Historicism: Critical Readings in Romantic History (Blackwell, 1989).

New historicism applied to Romanticism.

Sinfield, Alan, Shakespeare, Authority, Sexuality: Unfinished Business in Cultural Materialism (Routledge, 'Accents on Shakespeare' series, 2006).

请特别参阅这本由文化唯物主义先驱之一撰写的精彩著作的第 1 章和第11章（“未完成的事业：文化唯物主义中的问题”和“未完成的事业 II”）。

Sinfield, Alan, Shakespeare, Authority, Sexuality: Unfinished Business in Cultural Materialism (Routledge, ‘Accents on Shakespeare’ series, 2006).

See especially chapters 1 and 11 (‘Unfinished Business: Problems in Cultural Materialism’ and ‘Unfinished Business II’) in this exciting book by one of the pioneers of cultural materialism.

Veeser，H. Aram，编辑。新历史主义 (Routledge, 1989)。

有用且有价值的资源。

Veeser, H. Aram, ed. The New Historicism (Routledge, 1989).

A useful and valuable source.

Veeser, H. Aram，《新历史主义读本》（Routledge，1994 年）。

涵盖一系列英国和美国文学，而不仅仅是文艺复兴时期。

Veeser, H. Aram, The New Historicism Reader (Routledge, 1994).

Covers a range of British and American literature, not just the Renaissance.

Wilson, Richard 和 Dutton, Richard, eds, New Historicism and Renaissance Drama (Longman, 1992).

一个有用的关键文章集合，介绍得很好。

Wilson, Richard and Dutton, Richard, eds, New Historicism and Renaissance Drama (Longman, 1992).

A useful collection of key articles, well introduced.

10

后殖民批评

10

Postcolonial criticism

背景

Background

直到 1990 年代，后殖民批评才作为一个独特的类别出现。例如，在 Selden 的《当代文学理论读者指南》（1985 年）或 Jeremy Hawthorn 的《当代文学理论简明词汇表》（1992 年）的第一版中没有提到它。它通过以下书籍的影响获得了流行：在其他世界（Gayatri Spivak，1987）；帝国回信(Bill Ashcroft, 1989)；民族与叙事(Homi Bhabha, 1990) 和文化与帝国主义(Edward Said, 1993)。一个重要的相关论文集（尽管它没有使用“后殖民主义”一词）是“种族”、写作和差异(1986)，转载自Critical Inquiry杂志的两期，由小亨利·路易斯·盖茨 (Henry Louis Gates, Jr) 编辑，他是该领域最著名的美国人物之一。

Postcolonial criticism emerged as a distinct category only in the 1990s. It is not mentioned, for instance, in the first edition of Selden’s A Reader’s Guide to Contemporary Literary Theory (1985) or Jeremy Hawthorn’s A Concise Glossary of Contemporary Literary Theory (1992). It gained currency through the influence of such books as: In Other Worlds (Gayatri Spivak, 1987); The Empire Writes Back (Bill Ashcroft, 1989); Nation and Narration (Homi Bhabha, 1990) and Culture and Imperialism (Edward Said, 1993). An important collection of relevant essays (though it does not use the term ‘postcolonialism’) is ‘Race’, Writing and Difference (1986), reprinted from two issues of the journal Critical Inquiry and edited by Henry Louis Gates, Jr, one of the best-known American figures in this field.

后殖民批评的一个重要影响是进一步削弱了自由人文主义批评家曾经代表文学提出的普遍主义主张。如果我们声称伟大的文学具有永恒和普遍的意义，那么我们就会贬低或忽视文化、社会、地区和国家在经验和观点方面的差异，而宁愿用一个单一的、所谓的“普遍”标准来判断所有文学。因此，例如，关于哈代小说的“威塞克斯”背景的一个常规说法是，它实际上是一幅画布，哈代在上面描绘和检验人类状况的基本、普遍方面。因此，哈代的书不被认为主要是区域性的或历史性的或男性化的或白人的或工人阶级的小说——它们只是小说，建立在这种态度之上的是这样一种假设，即这种写作和表现现实的方式是毋庸置疑的规范，因此所描述的情况可以代表所有可能的人类互动形式。这种普遍主义被后殖民批评所拒绝；每当一件作品被要求具有普遍意义时，白人的、以欧洲为中心的规范和实践就会被巧妙地提升到这种崇高的地位，而所有其他人则相应地沦为次要的、边缘化的角色。

One significant effect of postcolonial criticism is to further undermine the universalist claims once made on behalf of literature by liberal humanist critics. If we claim that great literature has a timeless and universal significance we thereby demote or disregard cultural, social, regional, and national differences in experience and outlook, preferring instead to judge all literature by a single, supposedly ‘universal’, standard. Thus, for instance, a routine claim about the ‘Wessex’ setting of Hardy’s novels is that it is really a canvas on which Hardy depicts and examines fundamental, universal aspects of the human condition. Thus, Hardy’s books are not thought of as primarily regional or historical or masculine or white or working-class novels – they are just novels, and built into this attitude is the assumption that this way of writing and representing reality is the unquestioned norm, so that the situations depicted can stand for all possible forms of human interaction. This universalism is rejected by postcolonial criticism; whenever a universal signification is claimed for a work, then, white, Eurocentric norms and practices are being promoted by a sleight of hand to this elevated status, and all others correspondingly relegated to subsidiary, marginalised roles.

后殖民批评的源头可以追溯到弗朗茨·法农的《地球的悲惨世界》，1961 年以法语出版，表达了对法国非洲帝国的所谓“文化抵抗”。法农（来自马提尼克岛的精神病学家）认为，“被殖民化”的人寻找发言权和身份认同的第一步是找回自己的过去。几个世纪以来，欧洲的殖民势力贬低了这个国家的过去，将其前殖民时代视为前文明的边缘地带，甚至是历史的空白。儿童，无论是黑人还是白人，都将被教导将历史、文化和进步视为始于欧洲人的到来。如果迈向后殖民视野的第一步是重拾自己的过去，那么第二步就是开始侵蚀贬低过去价值的殖民主义意识形态。

The ancestry of postcolonial criticism can be traced to Frantz Fanon’s The Wretched of the Earth, published in French in 1961, and voicing what might be called ‘cultural resistance’ to France’s African empire. Fanon (a psychiatrist from Martinique) argued that the first step for ‘colonialised’ people in finding a voice and an identity is to reclaim their own past. For centuries the European colonising power will have devalued the nation’s past, seeing its precolonial era as a pre-civilised limbo, or even as a historical void. Children, both black and white, will have been taught to see history, culture and progress as beginning with the arrival of the Europeans. If the first step towards a postcolonial perspective is to reclaim one’s own past, then the second is to begin to erode the colonialist ideology by which that past had been devalued.

因此，爱德华·萨义德 (Edward Said) 的《东方主义》(Orientalism, 1978)是另一本可以说开创了后殖民批评的重要著作，它具体揭露了欧洲中心主义的普遍主义，认为欧洲或西方的优越性与西方的劣势是理所当然的。什么不是。赛义德确定了“东方主义”的欧洲文化传统，这是一种将东方视为“他者”并低于西方的特殊且长期存在的方式。他说，东方在西方思想中的特征是“一种替代品，甚至是地下自我”（《现代世界文学》，丹尼斯·沃尔德 (Dennis Walder) 编辑，第 236 页). 这实际上意味着，东方成为西方人不愿承认的自身那些方面（残忍、淫荡、颓废、懒惰等）的储存库或投射。与此同时，自相矛盾的是，东方被视为充满异国情调、神秘而诱人的迷人国度。它也往往被视为同质的，那里的人是匿名的群众而不是个人，他们的行为是由本能的情绪（欲望、恐惧、愤怒等）决定的，而不是而不是有意识的选择或决定。他们的情绪和反应总是由种族因素决定（他们之所以这样是因为他们是亚洲人、黑人或东方人），而不是个人地位或环境（例如，因为他们碰巧是姐姐、叔叔或古董陶器收藏家）。正如赛义德所说，在引用一位殖民行政官 1907 年对大马士革生活的描述后，“在这些陈述中，我们立即注意到‘阿拉伯人’或‘阿拉伯人’具有一种独立、明确和集体自洽的氛围[我的斜体]例如用可讲述的生活史抹去任何阿拉伯人的痕迹。

Hence, another major book, which can be said to inaugurate postcolonial criticism proper is Edward Said’s Orientalism (1978), which is a specific exposé of the Eurocentric universalism which takes for granted both the superiority of what is European or Western, and the inferiority of what is not. Said identifies a European cultural tradition of ‘Orientalism’, which is a particular and long-standing way of identifying the East as ‘Other’ and inferior to the West. The Orient, he says, features in the Western mind ‘as a sort of surrogate and even underground self’ (Literature in the Modern World, ed. Dennis Walder, p. 236). This means, in effect, that the East becomes the repository or projection of those aspects of themselves which Westerners do not choose to acknowledge (cruelty, sensuality, decadence, laziness, and so on). At the same time, and paradoxically, the East is seen as a fascinating realm of the exotic, the mystical and the seductive. It also tends to be seen as homogenous, the people there being anonymous masses rather than individuals, their actions determined by instinctive emotions (lust, terror, fury, etc.) rather than by conscious choices or decisions. Their emotions and reactions are always determined by racial considerations (they are like this because they are asiatics or blacks or orientals) rather than by aspects of individual status or circumstance (for instance, because they happen to be a sister, or an uncle, or a collector of antique pottery). As Said says, after quoting the example of a colonial administrator’s 1907 account of life in Damascus, ‘In such statements as these we note immediately that “the Arab” or “Arabs” have an aura of apartness, definiteness, and collective self-consistency [my italics] such as to wipe out any traces of individual Arabs with narratable life Histories’.

后殖民阅读

Postcolonial reading

例如，以“东方主义”的视角阅读文学作品会让我们批判性地意识到叶芝在他的两首“拜占庭”诗歌（“驶向拜占庭”，1927 年和“拜占庭”，1932 年）中如何提供了一个形象伊斯坦布尔，前罗马帝国的东方首都，以麻木、淫荡和异国情调的神秘主义而著称。在这样的时刻，叶芝采取了一种种族中心主义或欧洲中心主义的视角，将东方视为异国情调的“他者”，成为他自己追求和关注的对比衬托，而所有这些都在诗歌中呈现为规范。有趣的是，爱德华赛义德写了一篇关于叶芝的文章，在后殖民主义的背景下阅读他（转载于赛义德的文化与帝国主义). 赛义德认为，叶芝作品中经常表达的渴望与更早的、神话般的、民族主义的爱尔兰重新接触的愿望是后殖民主义作家的典型代表，这与法农需要重拾过去的想法密切相关。典型地，后殖民作家唤起或创造他们自己国家的前殖民版本，拒绝现代和当代，因为它们被他们国家的殖民地位所污染。那么，这就是后殖民批评的第一个特征——意识到将非欧洲人描述为异国情调或不道德的“他者”。

Reading literature with the perspective of ‘Orientalism’ in mind would make us, for instance, critically aware of how Yeats in his two ‘Byzantium’ poems (‘Sailing to Byzantium’, 1927, and ‘Byzantium’, 1932) provides an image of Istanbul, the Eastern capital of the former Roman Empire, which is identified with torpor, sensuality, and exotic mysticism. At such moments Yeats adopts an ethnocentric or Eurocentric perspective, seeing the East as an exotic ‘Other’ which becomes the contrasting foil to his own pursuits and concerns, all of which the poem presents as normative. Interestingly, Edward Said has written an essay on Yeats which reads him in the context of post-colonialism (reprinted in Said’s Culture and Imperialism). Said views the desire, frequently expressed in Yeats’s work, to regain contact with an earlier, mythical, nationalistic Ireland as typical of writers whose own position is postcolonial, and this is closely related to Fanon’s idea of the need to reclaim the past. Characteristically, post-colonial writers evoke or create a precolonial version of their own nation, rejecting the modern and the contemporary, which is tainted with the colonial status of their countries. Here, then, is the first characteristic of postcolonial criticism – an awareness of representations of the non-European as exotic or immoral ‘Other’.
