对叶芝来说，就像经常与后殖民作家一样，对殖民地语言的不安态度是显而易见的：他对爱尔兰诗人的禁令，他们应该学习他们的手艺，暗示需要为一个卑微的学徒服务。这种对语言的“谦虚”态度可能会提醒我们斯蒂芬·迪达勒斯 (Stephen Dedalus) 在詹姆斯·乔伊斯 (James Joyce) 的《青年艺术家的肖像》 （1914-1915 年以连载形式出版）中对英语的看法，尤其是早期斯蒂芬因使用英语而受到英国牧师光顾的场景当地方言词。斯蒂芬告诉自己“我们所说的语言先是他的，然后才是我的……我的灵魂在他的语言的阴影下烦恼”（肖像， 第五章). 最近，爱尔兰诗人谢默斯·希尼 (Seamus Heaney) 在一首题为“恐惧部”的诗中，回忆起他童年时对英语发音的不安和自我意识（“那些来自山外的平头靴 / Were walking, by God, all over the fine / Lawns of elocution') 并评论说'阿尔斯特是英国人，但没有权利 / The English lyric' (see the collection North,1975). 这种语言上的尊重相当于一种感觉，即语言家具属于其他人，因此不应未经许可四处移动。一些后殖民作家得出的结论是，殖民者的语言是永久性的污点，用它写作需要对殖民结构的一种至关重要的默许。那么，语言本身就是后殖民批评关注的第二个领域。（从后殖民的角度来看一篇关于诗歌语言的文章，请参阅 Stan Smith 的“黑暗英语：Seamus Heaney 和 Derek Walcott 的语言中的后帝国争论”英文版， 1994 年春季。）

For Yeats, as often with the postcolonial writer, an uneasy attitude to the colonial language is evident: his injunction to Irish poets, that they should learn their craft, implies the need to serve a humble apprenticeship. This ‘humble’ attitude to language may remind us of Stephen Dedalus’s thoughts about the English language in James Joyce’s A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man (published in serial form in 1914–1915), especially the early scene in which Stephen is patronised by an English priest because of his use of a local dialect word. Stephen tells himself ‘the language in which we are speaking is his before it is mine … My soul frets in the shadow of his language’ (Portrait, chapter five). More recently, the Irish poet Seamus Heaney, in a poem entitled ‘The Ministry of Fear’, recalls his childhood unease and self-consciousness about his pronunciation of English (‘Those hobnailed boots from beyond the mountain / Were walking, by God, all over the fine / Lawns of elocution’) and remarks that ‘Ulster was British, but with no rights on / The English lyric’ (see the collection North, 1975). This linguistic deference amounts to a sense that the linguistic furniture belongs to somebody else, and therefore shouldn’t be moved around without permission. Some postcolonial writers have concluded that the colonisers’ language is permanently tainted, and that to write in it involves a crucial acquiescence in colonial structures. Language itself, then, is a second area of concern in postcolonial criticism. (For an essay on poetic language from this postcolonial perspective see Stan Smith’s ‘Darkening English: Post-imperial contestations in the language of Seamus Heaney and Derek Walcott’ in English, Spring 1994.)

由此可见，叶芝作为爱尔兰新教统治阶级的一员，具有殖民者和被殖民者的双重身份，而正是对这种双重身份的承认成为后殖民主义观点的优势之一。因此，尼日利亚小说家 Chinua Achebe 于 1958 年出版了他的第一部小说《土崩瓦解》，被一位早期评论家批评为影响与非洲村民的认同，而实际上他的大学教育和他在首都拉各斯的广播工作应该使他认同，它被暗示，与“文明”的价值观，据说是由欧洲人带到非洲的。（参见阿契贝在现代世界文学中的论文“殖民主义批评”，编辑。Dennis Walder, Oxford University Press, 1990.) 这种对双重身份、混合身份或不稳定身份的强调是后殖民方法的第三个特征。

As this implies, Yeats, being a member of the Protestant ruling class in Ireland, has a double identity as both coloniser and colonised, and it is the recognition of such double identities which is one of the strengths of the postcolonialist view. Thus, the Nigerian novelist Chinua Achebe, publishing his first novel, Things Fall Apart, in 1958, was criticised by an early reviewer for affecting to identify with African villagers when actually his university education and his broadcasting job in the capital city of Lagos should make him identify, it was implied, with the values of ‘civilisation’, supposedly brought to Africa by Europeans. (See Achebe’s paper ‘Colonialist Criticism’ in Literature in the Modern World, ed. Dennis Walder, Oxford University Press, 1990.) This emphasis on identity as doubled, or hybrid, or unstable is a third characteristic of the postcolonial approach.

在某种程度上，阿切贝对非洲村庄的使用对应于叶芝对前殖民地、神话般的英雄爱尔兰的唤起和女主角。在另一个层面上，双重或混合身份恰恰是后殖民形势所带来的。1980 年代和 90 年代态度的转变是后殖民作家认为他们自己主要使用非洲或亚洲形式，并辅以欧洲衍生的影响，而不是像小说那样主要在欧洲体裁中工作，只是在其中添加一定程度的异国情调非洲化。可以说，所有后殖民文学似乎都在进行这种转变。他们首先毫无疑问地接受欧洲模式的权威（尤其是在小说中），并怀着创作完全符合这一传统的杰作的雄心壮志。这可以称为“采用' 殖民文学的阶段，因为作家的野心是采用目前的形式，假设它具有普遍有效性。第二阶段可以称为“适应”阶段，因为它旨在使欧洲形式适应非洲题材，从而承担对该类型的部分干预权。在最后阶段，可以说是一种文化独立宣言，非洲作家据此根据自己的规范改造形式，而不参考欧洲规范。这可能被称为 ' Adept'阶段，因为它的特点是假设殖民地作家在形式上是一个独立的“行家”，而不是像第一阶段那样的卑微学徒，或者像第二阶段那样仅仅是被许可人。这种对“跨文化”互动的强调是后殖民主义批评的第四个特征。

At one level Achebe’s use of a village Africa corresponds to Yeats’s evocation of a precolonial, mythological Ireland of heroes and heroines. At another level, the double or hybrid identity is precisely what the postcolonial situation brings into being. The shift in attitudes in the 1980s and 1990s was towards postcolonial writers seeing themselves as using primarily African or Asian forms, supplemented with European-derived influences, rather than as working primarily within European genres like the novel and merely adding to them a degree of exotic Africanisation. All postcolonial literatures, it might be said, seem to make this transition. They begin with an unquestioning acceptance of the authority of European models (especially in the novel) and with the ambition of writing works that will be masterpieces entirely in this tradition. This can be called the ‘Adopt’ phase of colonial literature, since the writer’s ambition is to adopt the form as it stands, the assumption being that it has universal validity. The second stage can be called the ‘Adapt’ phase, since it aims to adapt the European form to African subject matter, thus assuming partial rights of intervention in the genre. In the final phase there is, so to speak, a declaration of cultural independence whereby African writers remake the form to their own specification, without reference to European norms. This might be called the ‘Adept’ phase, since its characteristic is the assumption that the colonial writer is an independent ‘adept’ in the form, not a humble apprentice, as in the first phase, or a mere licensee, as in the second. This stress on ‘cross-cultural’ interactions is a fourth characteristic of postcolonialist criticism.

这种后殖民作家特有的双重、分裂或流动身份的概念解释了后结构主义和解构主义对后殖民批评家的巨大吸引力。后结构主义主要关注个人和性别认同的流动性和不稳定性，文本中不断变化的、“多价的”、矛盾的意义流，以及文学本身是意识形态斗争上演的场所的方式。这种心态非常适合表达后殖民作家和评论家不断意识到的无数矛盾和多重忠诚。这种后结构主义视角在小亨利·路易斯·盖茨、加亚特里·斯皮瓦克和霍米·巴巴等代表人物的作品中得以体现。同样，在所有这三者中，写作的表面都很困难，任何后续政治行动（或立场，甚至）的途径都必然是间接的。因此，这种后殖民批评大致对应于与朱莉娅·克里斯蒂娃或海伦·西苏等人物相关的理论化的“法国”女权主义批评。后来提供的后殖民批评的例子来自爱德华·赛义德的作品，他的理论不那么明显，似乎接受了自由人文主义的一些前提，并且具有更“预先”的政治联系（他对巴勒斯坦阿拉伯人的认同原因）。在这方面，他的作品让人想起“英美”女权主义批评的变体，同样（对我而言），这种批评似乎更具有公开的政治色彩，当然也更容易理解。

This notion of the double, or divided, or fluid identity which is characteristic of the postcolonial writer explains the great attraction which post-structuralism and deconstruction have proved to be for the postcolonial critic. Post-structuralism is centrally concerned to show the fluid and unstable nature of personal and gender identity, the shifting, ‘polyvalent’, contradictory currents of signification within texts, and the way literature itself is a site on which ideological struggles are acted out. This mind-set is admirably suited to expressing the numerous contradictions and multiple allegiances of which the postcolonial writer and critic is constantly aware. This post-structuralist perspective is seen in the work of such representative figures as Henry Louis Gates Jr, Gayatri Spivak, and Homi Bhabha. In all three of these a complex Derridean–Foucauldian notion of textuality and fields of discourse is immediately apparent. Similarly in all three, the surface of the writing is difficult and the route through to any consequent political action (or stance, even) is necessarily indirect. This kind of postcolonial criticism roughly corresponds, then, to the theoreticised ‘French’ feminist criticism associated with figures like Julia Kristeva or Hélène Cixous. The example of postcolonial criticism offered later is from the work of Edward Said, who is less overtly theoretical, seems to accept some of the premises of liberal humanism, and has a more ‘up-front’ political affiliation (his identification with the Palestinian Arab cause). His work is in this regard reminiscent of the ‘Anglo-American’ variety of feminist criticism, which likewise seems (to me) more overtly political and certainly more immediately accessible.

如果前面提到的三个阶段（Adopt、Adapt 和 Adept）提供了一种看待后殖民文学的方式，那么一种看待后殖民批评阶段的方式就是表明，正如我们刚才所做的那样，它们与发展阶段密切相关女性主义批评的阶段。在它的最早阶段，也就是说在它为人所知之前，后殖民批评将殖民国家的白人代表作为其主要主题，并批评它们的局限性和偏见：因此，批评家会讨论约瑟夫对非洲的代表康拉德的黑暗之心，或 EM 福斯特的印度之行中的印度，或阿尔贝加缪的局外人中的阿尔及利亚。这对应于 70 年代初期的女权主义批评阶段，当时的主题是 DH 劳伦斯或亨利米勒等男性小说家对女性的表现——经典的例子是凯特米利特的《性政治》。第二个后殖民批评阶段包括转向后殖民作家对自身及其社会的探索。在这个阶段，庆祝和探索多样性、混合性和差异性成为中心。这是该领域著名开创性作品“帝国回信”的阶段。这对应于女权主义批评的“gynotext”阶段，此时女性在书中转向探索女性经验和身份。这两种类型的批评之间的类比可能会被推得更远一些，因此也可能会被认为与女权主义批评在“理论”和“经验”版本之间的分裂有相似之处，如上文所建议的那样。因此，在后殖民批评中，我们可能会看到受到直接影响的变体之间的分裂由解构主义和后结构主义——例如霍米·巴巴 (Homi Bhabha) 的作品——以及赛义德 (Said) 这样的作品，它大量接受了自由人文主义，以更易于理解的方式编写，似乎更适合政治参与。

If the three stages mentioned earlier (Adopt, Adapt, and Adept) provide a way of seeing postcolonial literature, then a way of seeing the stages of postcolonial criticism would be to suggest, as we have just been doing, that they closely parallel the developmental stages of feminist criticism. In its earliest phase, which is to say before it was known as such, postcolonial criticism took as its main subject matter white representations of colonial countries and criticised these for their limitations and their bias: thus, critics would discuss the representation of Africa in Joseph Conrad’s Heart of Darkness, or of India in E. M. Forster’s A Passage to India, or of Algeria in Albert Camus’s The Outsider. This corresponds to the early 1970s phase of feminist criticism when the subject matter was the representation of women by male novelists like D. H. Lawrence or Henry Miller – the classic instance is Kate Millett’s Sexual Politics. The second phase of postcolonial criticism involved a turn towards explorations of themselves and their society by postcolonial writers. At this stage the celebration and exploration of diversity, hybridity, and difference become central. This is the stage when, in the title of the well-known pioneering work in this field, ‘the empire writes back’. This corresponds to the ‘gynotext’ phase of feminist criticism, when there is a turn towards the exploration of female experience and identities in books by women. The analogy between these two types of criticism might be pushed a little further, so that a parallel might also be perceived with the split in feminist criticism between ‘theoretical’ and ‘empirical’ versions, as suggested above. Thus, in postcolonial criticism we might see a split between variants very directly influenced by deconstruction and post-structuralism – such as the work of Homi Bhabha – and work like Said’s which accepts a good deal from liberal humanism, is written in a more accessible way, and seems perhaps to lend itself more directly to political engagement.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

后殖民批评引起人们对文学文本中文化差异问题的关注，是我们考虑过的几种关注具体问题的批评方法之一，包括性别问题（女权主义批评）、阶级问题（马克思主义批评）和性取向问题（女同性恋） /同性恋批评）。

Postcolonial criticism draws attention to issues of cultural difference in literary texts and is one of several critical approaches we have considered which focus on specific issues, including issues of gender (feminist criticism), of class (Marxist criticism), and of sexual orientation (lesbian/gay criticism).

这就提出了一种“超级读者”能够以所有这些方式对文本做出平等和充分回应的可能性。实际上，对于大多数读者来说，其中一个问题往往会压倒所有其他问题。

This raises the possibility of a kind of ‘super-reader’ able to respond equally and adequately to a text in all these ways. In practice, for most readers one of these issues tends to eclipse all the rest.

例如，Gilbert 和Gubar 的《阁楼上的疯女人》 （第 6 章）中女权主义批评的例子并没有评论后殖民评论家会感兴趣的《呼啸山庄》的各个方面，例如艾米莉·勃朗特将希刺克厉夫描述为种族歧视“其他”（一个吉普赛人、“一个小拉斯卡，或者一个美国或西班牙的漂流者”）。吉尔伯特和古巴尔将他描述为凯瑟琳的“另一个自我或本我”，并在他的黑暗中与主持农庄的金发埃德加形成对比，尽管具有讽刺意味的是，田庄被描述为“天堂”、“社会”和“原因'。这是将种族差异与可能被认为不敏感的本我或潜意识的非理性力量混为一谈。

For instance, the example of feminist criticism, from Gilbert and Gubar’s The Madwoman in the Attic (Chapter 6) doesn’t comment on aspects of Wuthering Heights which would interest postcolonial critics, such as Heathcliff’s being described by Emily Brontë in terms of a racial ‘Other’ (a gipsy, ‘a little Lascar, or an American or Spanish castaway’). He is described by Gilbert and Gubar as Catherine’s ‘alter-ego or Id’, and contrasted in his darkness with the blond Edgar who presides over the Grange, which is presented, however ironically, as ‘heaven’, ‘society’, and ‘reason’. This is a conflating of racial Otherness with the irrational forces of the id or the subconscious which might be thought insensitive.

总的来说，我们应该尝试成为超级读者，拥有多层次的同情和意识，还是尝试这样做只会产生平淡和肤浅？

Should we, in general, try to become super-readers, with multiple layers of sympathy and awareness, or will trying to do so merely produce blandness and superficiality?

显然，任何人都不可能替别人回答这个问题。我自己的感觉是，虽然在所有这些问题上均匀传播意识在理论上是可能的，但在实践中，仅仅为了政治正确的利益而以此为目标，几乎必然会产生肤浅。对这些问题之一的真正兴趣真的只能来自自身情况的各个方面。这些观点不能像西装一样穿脱——它们必须以某种紧迫感出现并表明自己。

Obviously, it is impossible for anybody to answer this question for anybody else. My own feeling is that while an even spread of awareness across all these issues is theoretically possible, in practice aiming for this, merely in the interests of political correctness, is almost bound to produce superficiality. A genuine interest in one of these issues can really only arise from aspects of your own circumstances. These perspectives cannot be put on and off like a suit – they have to emerge and declare themselves with some urgency.

后殖民批评家做什么

What postcolonial critics do

1. 他们拒绝代表经典西方文学提出的普遍主义主张，并试图表明其观点的局限性，尤其是其普遍无法跨越文化和种族差异的界限。

1. They reject the claims to universalism made on behalf of canonical Western literature and seek to show its limitations of outlook, especially its general inability to empathise across boundaries of cultural and ethnic difference.

2. 他们检查文学中其他文化的表现，作为实现这一目标的一种方式。

2. They examine the representation of other cultures in literature as a way of achieving this end.

3. 它们展示了此类文学作品如何在与殖民和帝国主义有关的问题上经常含糊其辞地保持沉默（例如，参见下面描述的例子中对简·奥斯汀的曼斯菲尔德公园的讨论）。

3. They show how such literature is often evasively and crucially silent on matters concerned with colonisation and imperialism (see, for instance, the discussion of Jane Austen’s Mansfield Park in the example described below).

4. 他们突出文化差异和多样性的问题，并检查相关文学作品对它们的处理。

4. They foreground questions of cultural difference and diversity and examine their treatment in relevant literary works.

5. 他们庆祝混合性和“文化多元性”，即个人和群体同时属于一种以上文化的情况（例如，殖民者的文化，通过殖民学校系统，被殖民者的文化，通过当地和口述传统）。

5. They celebrate hybridity and ‘cultural polyvalency’, that is, the situation whereby individuals and groups belong simultaneously to more than one culture (for instance, that of the coloniser, through a colonial school system, and that of the colonised, through local and oral traditions).

6. 他们发展了一种观点，不仅适用于后殖民文学，边缘化状态、多元化和感知到的“他者”被视为能量和潜在变化的来源。

6. They develop a perspective, not just applicable to postcolonial literatures, whereby states of marginality, plurality and perceived ‘Otherness’ are seen as sources of energy and potential change.

后殖民批评：一个例子

Postcolonial criticism: an example

让我们以爱德华赛义德关于简奥斯汀的曼斯菲尔德公园的文章为例，这篇文章迅速取得了一定的地位，并且可以在穆尔赫恩的当代马克思主义批评，牛顿的理论付诸实践，伊格尔顿的雷蒙德威廉斯：批判视角和赛义德自己的文化和帝国主义。在“简·奥斯汀与帝国”的标题下，萨义德仔细地“突出了奥斯汀小说的背景”，这是托马斯·伯特伦爵士在安提瓜岛拥有的庄园，曼斯菲尔德的庄园也是通过它公园得到维护。那么，具有讽刺意味的是，代表秩序和文明理想的英国庄园是由世界之外的另一个庄园维持的，因此如果没有奴隶贸易、糖和殖民地种植园主，曼斯菲尔德公园就不可能存在class”（Mulhern，第 111 页），因为正如 Said 所说，“Thomas 爵士在加勒比海的财产必须是一个由奴隶劳工维持的糖料种植园（直到 1830 年代才被废除）”（第 106 页）). 因此，赛义德将小说的“道德地理学”作为中心，并将奥斯汀视为小说中一条通往康拉德和吉卜林的小说线的起点，在这些小说中考察了殖民化的过程。正如 Mulhern 在他的介绍性说明中所说，结果是“英国文化的帝国阶段的年代必须从正式帝国开始到 18 世纪倒退”（第 97 页）). 因此，托马斯爵士回到家乡并迅速重建秩序，从没想过他的观点和直觉可能是狭隘或错误的，他是典型的殖民化人物，他以自己为文明的规范。赛义德说，他是“一个让事情井井有条的鲁滨逊”。他说，没有什么能阻止我们假设，他“在安提瓜做完全相同的事情——在更大的范围内……持有和统治曼斯菲尔德公园就是持有和统治与之相关的帝国地产”（第 104 页）。

Let us take the essay by Edward Said on Jane Austen’s Mansfield Park, an essay rapidly achieving something of a definitive status and available in Mulhern’s Contemporary Marxist Criticism, in Newton’s Theory into Practice, in Eagleton’s Raymond Williams: Critical Perspectives and in Said’s own Culture and Imperialism. Under the title ‘Jane Austen and the Empire’ Said carefully ‘foregrounds the background’ of Austen’s novel, which is the estate in Antigua which Sir Thomas Bertram owns, and through which the estate of Mansfield Park is maintained. The central irony, then, is that the estate in England which represents an ideal of order and civilisation is sustained by another estate a world away, so that Mansfield Park would ‘not have been possible without the slave trade, sugar, and the colonial planter class’ (Mulhern, p. 111), for as Said remarks, ‘Sir Thomas’s property in the Caribbean would have had to be a sugar plantation maintained by slave labour (not abolished until the 1830s)’ (p. 106). Said thus makes central the ‘moral geography’ of the novel, and sees Austen as the start of a line in fiction which leads to Conrad and Kipling in which the processes of colonialisation are examined. As Mulhern puts it in his introductory note, the consequence is that the ‘dating of British culture’s imperial phase must be revised backwards from the beginning of formal Empire into the eighteenth century’ (p. 97). Thus, Sir Thomas, returning home and rapidly re-establishing order, without ever the thought that his views and instincts could be narrow or mistaken, is the quintessential colonialising figure who takes himself as the norm of civilisation. He is, says Said, ‘a Crusoe setting things in order’. Nothing prevents our assuming, he says, that he ‘does exactly the same things – on a larger scale – in Antigua … to hold and rule Mansfield Park is to hold and rule an imperial estate in association with it’ (p. 104).

这种阅读涉及“具体化”小说的一个维度，这在很大程度上是隐含的：它涉及，不一定要争论小说中所有这些东西都“存在”，但这是阅读它的正确方式。尽管如此，赛义德坚持认为，确切地说，这些东西是存在的：“所有这些与外来事物有关的东西，在我看来，在她的暗示和抽象语言的暗示中无疑是存在的”。So Said 援引细读的过程来支持他，在很大程度上是令人信服的，但最终他的呼吁似乎是针对（尤其是）白人和中产阶级读者的良心：

This reading involves ‘concretising’ a dimension of the novel which is largely left implicit: it involves, not necessarily arguing that all these things are ‘there’ in the novel, but that this is the right way to read it. All the same, Said insists, precisely, that these things are there: ‘all these things having to do with the outside brought in, seem to me unmistakably there in the suggestiveness of her allusive and abstract language’. So Said invokes the processes of close reading in his support, for the most part convincingly, but in the end his appeal seems to be to the conscience of the (especially) white and middle-class reader:

我们不能轻易地说，既然《曼斯菲尔德庄园》是一部小说，它与一段特别肮脏的历史的联系是无关紧要的或超越的，不仅因为这样说是不负责任的，而且因为我们知道的太多了，不能没有恶意地这样说。（第 112 页）
We cannot easily say that since Mansfield Park is a novel, its affiliations with a particularly sordid history are irrelevant or transcended, not only because it is irresponsible to say that, but because we know too much to say so without bad faith. (p. 112)

我认为，阅读萨义德文章的效果是毋庸置疑的。我们可能对这方面的任何“纯真”小说写道：从今往后，如果不时刻注意那个缺席的定居者-种植者，就不可能阅读它，他在某种意义上处于一切的中心，但在另一种意义上却不断退缩和边缘化。赛义德的阅读同样将这本书的中心定位在一种不在场的情况下，在未说和未指定的事物中。从这个意义上说，它是一种受后结构主义观点影响的马克思主义批评形式，与克里格的“直截了​​当”的马克思主义形成鲜明对比。与新历史主义一样，它也更接近于实际命名特定社会/殖民地情况的细节（18 世纪安提瓜的缺席种植园主阶级），而不是仅仅唤起殖民剥削的普遍概念。

There is, I think, no doubt about the effect of reading Said’s essay. Any ‘innocence’ we might have had about this aspect of the novel goes: it is impossible henceforth to read it without a constant awareness of that absentee settler-planter who is at the centre of everything, in one sense, and yet constantly withdrawn and marginal in another. Said’s reading likewise locates the centre of the book in an absence, in things unsaid and unspecified. In this sense it is a form of Marxist criticism influenced by post-structuralist views, contrasting with Krieger’s much ‘straighter’ Marxism. It also, like new historicism, comes closer to actually naming the details of a specific social/colonial situation (the absentee planter-landlord class of eighteenth-century Antigua) rather than just evoking a generalised notion of colonial exploitation.

选读

Selected reading

Ashcroft、Bill 和 Ahluwalia、Pal、Edward Said（Routledge，2001 年）。

“Routledge Critical Thinkers”系列中的一本有用的书。

Ashcroft, Bill, and Ahluwalia, Pal, Edward Said (Routledge, 2001).

A useful book in the ‘Routledge Critical Thinkers’ series.

Ashcroft, Bill, et al., The Empire Writes Back: Theory and Practice in Post-colonial Literature (Routledge, 2nd edn, 2002).

一本通俗易懂的书，为这个主题提供了一个很好的开端。

Ashcroft, Bill, et al., The Empire Writes Back: Theory and Practice in Post-colonial Literature (Routledge, 2nd edn, 2002).

A readable and comprehensive book which provides an excellent start on this topic.

Ashcroft, Bill, et al., The Post-Colonial Studies Reader (Routledge, 1994).

涵盖范围广泛的材料。

Ashcroft, Bill, et al., The Post-Colonial Studies Reader (Routledge, 1994).

Covers a vast range of material.

Ashcroft, Bill等人，后殖民研究：关键概念（Routledge，1998 年）。Empire Writes Back团队

的 A 到 Z 指南。

Ashcroft, Bill, et al., Post-Colonial Studies: The Key Concepts (Routledge, 1998).

An A to Z guide by the Empire Writes Back team.

Bhabha, Homi K., ed. 民族与叙事（Routledge，1990）。

该领域权威的早期收藏，收录了多位主要人物的作品。

Bhabha, Homi K., ed. Nation and Narration (Routledge, 1990).

A definitive early collection in this field, with pieces by several of the major figures.

Bhabha, Homi K.，文化的定位（Routledge，1994 年）。

检查“存在于性别、种族、阶级和性取向之间的文化和政治界限”。讨论莫里森、戈迪默和拉什迪。不是一个随和的作家，但是（托尼·莫里森说）“如果不提及 Bhabha 先生，任何关于后殖民/后现代学术的严肃讨论都是不可想象的”。

Bhabha, Homi K., The Location of Culture (Routledge, 1994).

Examines ‘the cultural and political boundaries which exist in between the spheres of gender, race, class and sexuality’. Discusses Morrison, Gordimer and Rushdie. Not an easy writer, but (says Toni Morrison) ‘any serious discussion of post-colonial/postmodern scholarship is inconceivable without referencing Mr Bhabha’.

Césaire, Aimé, Return to My Native Land（企鹅诗人出版社，1969 年）。

这个和下一个标题是后殖民主义的早期创始文本，它们的地位与女权主义中的“女太监”或“女性的奥秘”等“经典”相对应。

Césaire, Aimé, Return to My Native Land (Penguin Poets, 1969).

This and the next title are early founding texts of postcolonialism, their status corresponding to that of ‘classics’ like The Female Eunuch or The Feminine Mystique within feminism.

Fanon, Frantz, The Wretched of the Earth (Penguin, 1961).

Fanon, Frantz, The Wretched of the Earth (Penguin, 1961).

盖茨，小亨利·路易斯，编。“种族”，写作与差异（芝加哥，1987 年）。

Gates, Henry Louis, Jr, ed. ‘Race’, Writing and Difference (Chicago, 1987).

Loomba, Ania, Colonialism/Post-Colonialism（Routledge，New Critical Idiom 系列，第 2 版，2005 年）。

另一个很好的介绍。

Loomba, Ania, Colonialism/Post-Colonialism (Routledge, New Critical Idiom series, 2nd edn, 2005).

Another good introduction.

McLeod, John，Beginning Postcolonialism（曼彻斯特大学出版社，第 2 版，2009 年）。

“开始”系列中的一本优秀且可读的书。

McLeod, John, Beginning Postcolonialism (Manchester University Press, 2nd edn, 2009).

An excellent and readable book in the ‘Beginnings’ series.

Said, Edward, Culture and Imperialism (Vintage, new edn, 1994).

对欧洲文化中“帝国主义根源”的广泛描述。

Said, Edward, Culture and Imperialism (Vintage, new edn, 1994).

A broad account of the ‘roots of imperialism’ in European culture.

Said, Edward, Orientalism (Penguin, new edn, 1995).

Said 的工作对该领域产生了重大影响，他是一个有用的切入点，因为他的作品具有直接的可访问性和清晰的影响。此重新发行有大量新的“后记”。

Said, Edward, Orientalism (Penguin, new edn, 1995).

Said’s work has been a major influence in this field, and he is a useful entry-point since his writing has an immediate accessibility and clarity of impact. This re-issue has a substantial new ‘Afterword’.

Spivak, Gayatri Chakravorty，在其他世界：文化政治论文（Routledge，1987 年）。

斯皮瓦克是另一个主要人物，但她与后结构主义的密切联系使她的写作要求很高。一个起点可能是她在牛顿理论到实践中的论文“Draupadi”（关于她翻译和重印的孟加拉短篇小说） 。

Spivak, Gayatri Chakravorty, In Other Worlds: Essays in Cultural Politics (Routledge, 1987).

Spivak is another major figure, but her close involvement with post-structuralism makes her writing quite demanding. A starting point might be her essay ‘Draupadi’ (on a Bengali short story, which she translates and reprints) in Newton’s Theory into Practice.

瓦尔德，丹尼斯，编辑。现代世界文学（牛津大学

Walder, Dennis, ed. Literature in the Modern World (Oxford University

出版社, 1990).

包含 Chinua Achebe 的论文“殖民主义批评”，以及相关部分的其他有用材料。

Press, 1990).

Contains Chinua Achebe’s paper ‘Colonialist Criticism’, and other useful material in the relevant section.

11

文体

11

Stylistics

文体学：理论还是实践？

Stylistics: a theory or a practice?

文体学是一种批判性方法，它使用语言学的方法和发现来分析文学文本。这里的“语言学”是指对语言及其结构的科学研究，而不是对个别语言的学习。文体学发展于二十世纪，其目的是展示文学作品的技术语言特征，例如句子的语法结构，如何影响其整体意义和效果。

Stylistics is a critical approach which uses the methods and findings of the science of linguistics in the analysis of literary texts. By ‘linguistics’ here is meant the scientific study of language and its structures, rather than the learning of individual languages. Stylistics developed in the twentieth century and its aim is to show how the technical linguistic features of a literary work, such as the grammatical structure of its sentences, contribute to its overall meanings and effects.

下面给出的说明将大量强调批判实践而不是批判理论，我们应该在一开始就问文体学是否真的是批判理论的一种形式。大多数当前可用的文学理论指南的编写者都认为它不是，因为他们对此只字不提。但很难看出这种假设的根据。这当然是一种研究文学的方法，它产生了大量在语气和方法上与我们习惯的截然不同的实际工作。这种实践是关于文学语言及其运作方式的非常具体的理论的产物，这些理论通常与实践一起教授。

The account given below will put a good deal of emphasis on critical practice rather than critical theory, and we should ask at the outset whether stylistics is really a form of critical theory at all. The compilers of most currently available guides to literary theory assume that it is not, since they say nothing about it. But the grounds for this assumption are difficult to see. It is certainly an approach to literature which has yielded a large amount of practical work distinctly different in tone and method from what we are accustomed to. This body of practice is the product of very specific theories about literary language and how it works, and these theories are usually taught alongside the practice.

因此，排除文体学的理由可能在于该学科背后的理论观点的性质，因为自由人文主义和文体学有很多共同点。首先，两者都有很强的实证偏见，即偏向于详细的口头表达分析特定的经典文学文本，而不是致力于建立普遍的理论立场。其次，两者都远离折衷主义，这种折衷主义导致了马克思主义、女权主义、结构主义和后结构主义方法之间的大量交叉。第三，两者通常都拒绝接受“浮动能指”的概念（即，通过语言建立的意义天生就是流动的、不确定的和变化的）。

The grounds for excluding stylistics, therefore, probably lie in the nature of the theoretical outlook behind the discipline, for liberal humanism and stylistics have a good deal in common. Firstly, both have a strong empirical bias, that is, a bias towards detailed verbal analysis of specific canonical literary texts, rather than a commitment to establishing generalised theoretical positions. Secondly, both have kept aloof from the eclecticism which has led to so much cross-fertilisation between Marxist, feminist, structuralist, and post-structuralist approaches. And thirdly, both have generally refused to take on board the notion of the ‘floating signifier’ (that is, the idea that the meanings established through language are innately fluid, indeterminate, and shifting).

这些相似之处可能使我们期望两者是天然的盟友，但事实上，在 1960 年代，至少在自由人文主义与一般理论之间的敌对行动爆发之前至少十年，文体学和自由人文主义彼此进行了激烈的斗争。然而，文体学也与其他形式的批判理论不同，因为它抵制了渗透在大多数其他类型的理论话语中的“相对主义”。文体学之外的不确定性规则无处不在：所有批评家都小心翼翼地避免“总括主张”，并承认不可能有概览，只有观点，每个观点都是片面的。相比之下，文体学在观点上仍然是实证主义的；也就是说，它坚信通过无私的探究者对外部现象进行的实证研究来积累知识。那么，有充分的理由将文体视为不同的，但在我看来，没有充分的理由将其视为非理论的。对于那些刚开始学习理论的人来说，它的优势还在于它确实提供了范围广泛的新的实用方法来解释文学作品，其中许多方法实践起来很有趣，尤其是在课堂上分组学习时。

These similarities might lead us to expect the two to be natural allies, but in fact stylistics and liberal humanism fought with each other very bitterly, in the 1960s, at least a decade before the outbreak of hostilities between liberal humanism and theory in general. However, stylistics also has its differences from other forms of critical theory, for it has resisted the ‘relativism’ which permeates most other kinds of theoretical discourse. Everywhere outside stylistics indeterminacy rules: all critics scrupulously avoid ‘totalising claims’ and acknowledge that there can be no overviews, only viewpoints, each of which is partial. Stylistics, by contrast, remains positivist in outlook; that is, it maintains its faith in the accumulation of knowledge by empirical investigation of external phenomena carried out by disinterested enquirers. There are good reasons, then, for regarding stylistics as different, but none, in my view, for regarding it as untheoretical. Its advantage, too, for those who are just beginning theory is that it does offer a wide range of new practical methods for explicating literature, many of which can be enjoyable to practise, especially when working in class in groups.

应该补充的是，文体学并不局限于文学分析：它同样可以应用于说明性散文、政治演讲、广告等。因此，它假设文学语言不是“特例”：相反，可以像分析任何其他语言一样分析文学语言，以准确揭示效果是如何产生的。因此，文体学不承认文学语言有任何特殊的神秘品质：它不被视为神圣或受人尊敬；它只是可以使用该方法的数据。当然，今天很少有任何文学批评家会半神秘地宣称诗歌是受到启发的，或者是不可言喻的，或者在分析可以分析的领域中超越理性运作，这是真的永远不会完全渗透。但另一方面，他们中的许多人也没有提出相反的说法——文学语言从来没有任何超越日常的维度。

Stylistics, it should be added, is not confined to the analysis of literature: it can be applied equally to expository prose, political speeches, advertisements, and so on. It thus assumes that the language of literature is not a ‘special case’: on the contrary, literary language can be analysed just like any other kind to reveal precisely how effects are created. Hence, stylistics concedes no special mysterious qualities to literary language: it is not seen as sacred or revered; it is simply the data on which the method can be put to use. It is true, of course, that very few literary critics of any persuasion today would make semi-mystical claims that poetry is inspired, or ineffable, or operates beyond reason in a realm which analysis can never fully penetrate. But on the other hand, neither do many of them proclaim the contrary – that literary language never has any transcendent dimension which lifts it above the everyday.

一个简短的历史记录：从修辞学，到语文学，到语言学，到文体学，再到新文体学

A brief historical account: from rhetoric, to philology, to linguistics, to stylistics, to new stylistics

从某种意义上说，文体学是被称为“修辞学”的古代学科的现代版本，它教会学生如何构建论点，如何有效地使用修辞格，以及如何在总体上塑造和改变演讲或一篇文章，这样才能产生最大的影响。中世纪的修辞学在为教会、法律职业、政治或外交生活培养人才方面发挥了重要作用，但一旦脱离了这一职业目的，它就退化为对语言表面特征的相当枯燥和机械的研究，其中涉及，例如，识别和分类修辞格。它的从业者迂腐的观点（例如，他们喜欢冠冕堂皇的标签）经常被乔叟、莎士比亚等人讽刺。

Stylistics is, in a sense, the modern version of the ancient discipline known as ‘rhetoric’, which taught its students how to structure an argument, how to make effective use of figures of speech, and generally how to pattern and vary a speech or a piece of writing so as to produce the maximum impact. Rhetoric in medieval times played an important part in training people for the Church, the legal profession, and political or diplomatic life, but once divorced from this vocational purpose it degenerated into a rather arid and mechanical study of the mere surface features of language which involved, for instance, identifying and classifying figures of speech. The pedantic outlook of its practitioners (for instance, their love of impressive-sounding labels) is frequently satirised by Chaucer, Shakespeare and others. Traces of this degenerate form of the discipline survived in school teaching until quite recently.

在整个 19 世纪，这种中世纪意义上的修辞学逐渐被语言学所吸收。在那个时候，语言学通常被称为“语言学”，并且几乎完全侧重于历史。它涉及研究语言的演变及其之间的相互联系，并推测语言本身的起源。在 20 世纪，人们开始远离这种历史重点，开始关注语言作为一个系统是如何构建的，着眼于意义的建立和维护方式以及构建中可用的选项（及其后果）等方面句子。这是一种重生的修辞形式出现的地方，在第一次世界大战前不久，对文学风格及其影响产生了新的兴趣，第 8 章，第 155–6 页）在 1920 年代，以及第二次世界大战后居住在美国的布拉格语言学圈的领袖，俄罗斯语言学家罗曼·雅各布森（第 8 章，第 156 页）的著作中。著名的“风格会议”在印第安纳大学举行1958 年出版，并于 1960 年作为语言风格出版，由 Thomas Sebeok（麻省理工学院技术出版社和纽约 John Wiley & Sons 的技术出版社）编辑。这次会议值得注意的是，除其他外，雅各布森的“闭幕声明”似乎宣布了语言学方面对文学的收购要约：

Throughout the nineteenth century, rhetoric in this medieval sense was gradually absorbed into linguistics. At this time linguistics was usually known as ‘philology’, and was almost entirely historical in emphasis. It involved studying the evolution of languages, and the interconnections between them, and speculating about the origins of language itself. In the twentieth century there was a movement away from this historical emphasis and a new concentration on how language as a system is structured, looking at such aspects as the way meanings are established and maintained, and the options available (and their consequences) in structuring sentences. This is where a kind of born-again form of rhetoric emerged, shortly before the First World War, with a new interest in literary style and its effects, an interest seen also in the work of the Russian Formalists (Chapter 8, pp. 155–6) in the 1920s, and in the work of the Russian linguist Roman Jakobson, leader of the Prague Linguistic Circle (Chapter 8, p. 156), who lived in America after the Second World War. A famous ‘Conference on Style’ was held at Indiana University in 1958, and the proceedings published in 1960 as Style in Language, edited by Thomas Sebeok (Technology Press of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and John Wiley & Sons, New York). The conference was notable, among other things, for Jakobson’s ‘Closing Statement’, which seemed to announce a takeover bid for literature on the part of linguistics:

诗学处理语言结构问题：由于语言学是语言结构的全球科学，诗学可以被视为语言学的一个组成部分[这里的“诗学”是指对一般文学的研究，而不仅仅是诗歌]。
Poetics deals with problems of verbal structure: Since linguistics is the global science of verbal structure, poetics may be regarded as an integral part of linguistics [‘Poetics’ here means the study of literature in general, not just poetry].

Sebeok 材料集的主旨是声称语言学提供了一种更客观的文学研究方法，该书倾向于在文学和语言研究之间建立“阵营的对抗”（罗杰·福勒的用语）。福勒通过编辑一本名为《文体与语言散文：文学研究的语言学和批判方法》 （1966 年）的文集来回应他认为这种无益的两极分化，该文集试图弥补福勒认为“之间不必要的分裂”所造成的损害。语言”和“文学”。但结果，如果有的话，就是扩大了差距：海伦文德勒在批评论文杂志上评论了福勒的收藏，1966 年，第 457-63 页。她建议，虽然语言学研究具有巨大潜力，但目前语言学家“在诗歌阅读方面的教育不足”，并且正在研究“他们无法吸收其主要意义和价值的文献”（第 460 页）。这刺激了福勒的反击，引发了他与杂志编辑 FW Bateson 之间的一场被广泛引用的辩论（参见Essays in Criticism 1967，第 332-47 页和 1968 年，第 164-82 页）。其结果再次巩固了语言-文学的两极分化。

The gist of the Sebeok collection of material is to claim that linguistics offers a more objective way of studying literature, and the book tends to set up ‘a confrontation of camps’ (Roger Fowler’s phrase) between literary and language studies. Fowler responded to what he saw as this unhelpful polarisation by editing a collection called Essays on Style and Language: Linguistic and Critical Approaches to Literary Studies (1966), which tried to mend the damage done by what Fowler regarded as ‘an unnecessary schism between “language” and “literature”’. But the result, if anything, was to widen the gap: Fowler’s collection was reviewed by Helen Vendler in the journal Essays in Criticism, 1966, pp. 457–63. She suggested that while linguistic study had great potential, at present linguists are ‘simply under-educated in the reading of poetry’ and are taking on ‘documents whose primary sense and value they are not equipped to absorb’ (p. 460). This stung Fowler into a riposte which inaugurated a much-cited debate between himself and F. W. Bateson, the journal’s editor (see Essays in Criticism 1967, pp. 332–47, and 1968, pp. 164–82). The outcome of this was, again, to solidify the language–literature polarisation.

但是直到 1980 年代为止，Helen Vendler 所说的语言学所缺乏的发展，即一种“语篇分析”的形式，使语言学能够评论和分析完整作品的结构，而不仅仅是文章的结构。孤立的短语和句子，它以前被限制在其中。这意味着非语言学家开始对语言学论文的发现产生一些兴趣，与此同时，撰写此类材料的语言学家意识到有必要咨询和结合非语言材料。据称，这导致了 1980 年代所谓的“新文体学”，其折衷主义程度有限（因为它借鉴了其他新型批评的发现——女权主义、结构主义、后结构主义, 等等）并且不太可能声称它独自以客观的方式研究文学。

But the period up to the 1980s saw the development of what Helen Vendler had said was lacking in linguistics, namely a form of ‘discourse analysis’ which would enable linguistics to comment on and analyse the structure of complete pieces of writing, rather than just the isolated phrases and sentences to which it had previously been restricted. This meant that non-linguists began to take some interest in the findings of linguistic essays, while, at the same time, linguists writing such material realised the need to consult and incorporate non-linguistic material. Allegedly, this resulted, during the 1980s, in what came to be called the ‘new stylistics’, which had a limited degree of eclecticism (in that it drew on the findings of other new kinds of criticism – feminist, structuralist, post-structuralist, and so on) and was less likely to claim that it alone studied literature in an objective way.

然而，事实上，双方的优势主张仍在继续。例如，福勒在他 1986 年出版的《语言批评》一书中将语言批评描述为“对文本的客观描述”（第 4 页），而相比之下，传统批评使用“随机描述性行话”（第 3 页）) 并且仅仅是使用准语法术语的“业余评论”。此外，他在 1980 年代的著作中重复了与他在 1960 年代反对贝特森时使用的论点非常相似的论点。因此，他在 1986 年说，反对者说得好像语言学是一个单一的实体，而实际上它内部使用了许多不同的技术，有些适合文学研究，有些则不适合。这与他在 1960 年代提出的观点完全相同：“没有一种语言学……对‘语言学’的乏味、不明确的描述毫无用处”（Essays in Criticism， 1967 年，第 325 页）). 同样，并非所有 1960 年代的文体学都毫不妥协地对这门学科提出排他性的要求，因此被认为是新文体学与众不同的更自由的态度并不是 80 年代才出现的。因此，福勒在贝特森的争论中再次强调，仅仅作为一名语言学家并不能成为充分处理诗歌的资格。相反，“虽然文学是语言，因此对普通的正式语言学调查开放……它与其他形式上与众不同的文本一样，具有本质上与众不同的语境，语言学家和批评家都必须研究这些语境”（Essays in Criticism， 1967，p . 325 ).

In fact, however, the superiority claims from both sides continued. Fowler, for instance, in his 1986 book Linguistic Criticism characterises linguistic criticism as ‘objective description of texts’ (p. 4), while conventional criticism, by contrast, uses ‘random descriptive jargon’ (p. 3) and is merely ‘amateur commentary’ using only quasi-grammatical terms. Also, his 1980s writing repeated very similar arguments to those he had used in the 1960s against Bateson. Thus, opponents, he says in 1986, speak as if linguistics were a single entity, whereas actually there are many different techniques in use within it, some appropriate for literary study and some not. This is exactly the same point as he had made in the 1960s: ‘there is no one linguistics … bland undefined accounts of “linguistics” lead nowhere’ (Essays in Criticism, 1967, p. 325). Likewise, not all stylistics in the 1960s made uncompromisingly exclusive claims for the discipline, so the more liberal attitude said to be distinctive of the new stylistics is not something which appears only in the 1980s. Thus, Fowler, again, in the Bateson dispute, stressed that just being a linguist isn’t a qualification for dealing adequately with poetry. On the contrary, ‘although literature is language, and therefore open to ordinary formal linguistic investigation … it has, like other formally distinctive texts, essentially distinctive contexts which the linguist no less than the critic must study’ (Essays in Criticism, 1967, p. 325).

因此，建立文体学让位于新文体学的序列的理由是微不足道的。好斗的“旧”文体态度在今天很普遍，并且在该领域最近的许多著作中都很明显。例如，奈杰尔·法布 (Nigel Fabb) 和艾伦·杜兰特 (Alan Durant) 在描述 20 世纪 80 年代中期文体学和文学批评之间的区别时说，在后者中，批评评论“通常是在没有任何伴随的系统的，甚至是明确的，对其自身方法或假设的审查的情况下做出的'（《写作语言学：语言与文学之间的争论》，曼彻斯特大学出版社，1987 年，第 228 页）。因此，虽然说今天的文体学倾向于比以往任何时候都更愿意接受那些在其他知识研究领域工作的人的意见，如果暗示与“新文体学”一词所暗示的与过去的强硬路线彻底决裂，那就太夸张了。Routledge（系列编辑 Ronald Carter）的“界面”系列代表了当前的合作氛围，其目的是“在传统上划分的语言研究和文学研究学科之间架起桥梁”。应该补充的是，毫无疑问，过去对文体学的强硬态度仍然存在，但近年来，结构主义和后结构主义，而不是文体学，通常被视为批评中对传统价值观的主要威胁，其结果是大多数自由人文主义的论战著作都是针对这些目标的。

Hence, the grounds for setting up a sequence in which stylistics gives way to new stylistics are slender. Combative ‘old’ stylistics attitudes are common today and are explicit in much recent writing in the field. For instance, Nigel Fabb and Alan Durant, describing the difference between stylistics and literary criticism in the mid-1980s, say that in the latter critical comment is ‘often made without any accompanying systematic, or even explicit, scrutiny of its own methods or assumptions’ (The Linguistics of Writing: Arguments between Language and Literature, Manchester University Press, 1987, p. 228). Thus, while it is true to say that stylistics today tends to be more open than before to input from those working in other areas of intellectual enquiry, it would be exaggerating to imply the kind of clean break with the hard-line past implied by the term ‘new stylistics’. The current mood of co-operation is represented by the ‘Interface’ series from Routledge (series editor Ronald Carter), which aims to ‘build bridges between the traditionally divided disciplines of language studies and literary studies’. It should be added that doubtless the old hard-line attitudes against stylistics still exist too, but in recent years structuralism and post-structuralism, rather than stylistics, have usually been seen as the major threat to traditional values in criticism, with the consequence that most liberal humanist polemical writing has been directed at these targets.

文体学与标准细读有何不同？

How does stylistics differ from standard close reading?

文体分析试图提供客观和科学的评论，基于具体的可量化数据，并以系统的方式应用。相比之下，正如我们所见，传统的“细读”通常被文体学家（或多或少）视为印象派、直觉和随机的。尽管如此，对于不经意的观察者来说，这两种方法之间的差异可能看起来很肤浅，因此值得尝试详细说明它们。传统细读和文体学之间的具体区别包括：

Stylistic analysis attempts to provide a commentary which is objective and scientific, based on concrete quantifiable data, and applied in a systematic way. In contrast, as we have seen, conventional ‘close reading’ is often seen by the stylistician (to a greater or lesser extent) as impressionistic, intuitive, and randomised. All the same, the differences between the two approaches might well seem superficial to a casual observer, so it is worth trying to specify them. The specific differences between conventional close reading and stylistics include the following:

1. 精读强调文学语言与一般言语社区的差异；它倾向于将文学文本孤立起来，将其视为纯粹的审美艺术对象，或“语言图标”，其语言按照自己的规则运作。相比之下，文体学强调联系介于文学语言和日常语言之间。这种对文学语言的不同看法实际上是一场非常古老的争论的延续。例如，华兹华斯和柯勒律治之间的关键分歧在于，华兹华斯认为最有效的诗歌语言是最朴素和最像散文的，也就是说，当它尽可能接近“男人'。相比之下，柯勒律治认为诗歌语言的效果取决于诗人的升华或强化。它（通过模式化、压缩、重复等），从而使其更加专业化，并使其远离日常语言的模式。

1. Close reading emphasises differences between literary language and that of the general speech community; it tends to isolate the literary text and see it as a purely aesthetic art object, or ‘verbal icon’, whose language operates according to rules of its own. Stylistics, by contrast, emphasises connections between literary language and everyday language. This difference of view about literary language is actually a continuation of a very old dispute. For instance, the critical break between Wordsworth and Coleridge lay in the fact that Wordsworth believed that poetic language when most effective was at its plainest and most prose-like, that is, when it is as close as possible to the language actually used by ‘men’. In contrast, Coleridge believed that poetic language depended for its effect on the poet’s heightening or intensifying it (through patterning, compression, repetition, and so on) and thus making it more specialised and taking it further away from the patterns of everyday speech.

2. 文体学使用源自语言学的专业术语和概念，如“及物性”、“欠词汇化”、“搭配”和“衔接”（所有这些都在本章的最后一节中解释） ). 像这样的术语是特定知识探究领域的技术词汇的一部分，它们在该领域之外没有任何通用性。除非你是在和同学们“谈生意”，否则你不能在不解释它们的含义和（更重要的）它们的用途的情况下将这些术语引入到随意的谈话中。相比之下，细读（通常）使用外行人的术语和概念，这些术语和概念可能略带“书本”气息，但仍然是日常语言的一部分；术语，例如，像“语言的细微差别”、“讽刺”、“歧义”、“悖论”，和“矛盾心理”。如果你在同一个随意的谈话中开始解释这些术语的含义，你可能会显得有点居高临下，尽管在批评中使用这些术语可能会被认为稍微专业化，并且它们中的每一个在内部都有自己的共鸣和联想。纪律。但关键是，这些术语显然不像“词汇不足”那样是“技术性的”。

2. Stylistics uses specialised technical terms and concepts which derive from the science of linguistics, terms like ‘transitivity’, ‘under-lexicalisation’, ‘collocation’, and ‘cohesion’ (all of which are explained in the final section of this chapter). Terms like these are part of the technical vocabulary of a particular field of intellectual enquiry and they do not have any currency outside this field. Unless you were ‘talking shop’ with fellow students you could not introduce these terms into casual conversation without explaining what they meant and (more importantly) what they were for. In contrast, close reading (typically) uses lay-person’s terms and concepts which may have a slightly ‘bookish’ air, but are nevertheless part of ordinary everyday language; terms, for instance, like ‘verbal nuance’, ‘irony’, ‘ambiguity’, ‘paradox’, and ‘ambivalence’. If you started to explain the meaning of these terms in the same casual conversation, you would probably seem rather patronising, even though the use of these terms in criticism might be considered slightly specialised, and each of them has its own resonance and associations within the discipline. The point is, though, that these terms are clearly not ‘technical’ in the way that ‘under-lexicalisation’ is.

3. 与细读相比，文体学更强调科学的客观性，强调它的方法和程序可以被所有人学习和应用。因此，它的目标部分是文学和批评的“去神秘化”。因此，就文学而言，正如我们上面所见，它旨在表明文学语言与其他书面交流形式之间的连续性。在批评的情况下，它旨在提供一套所有人都可以公开访问的程序，这与细读中强调批评家需要对文学文本发展“机智”和“敏感性”的趋势形成对比避免详细说明要遵循的方法或程序。因此，例如，众所周知，FR Leavis 不愿详细描述或阐述他的批评方法。同样地，分析，使文学的核心是一种神秘莫测的本质。如果像许多人所相信的那样，一首诗中表达的情感独特地体现在诗人所选择的词语形式中，那么可以得出的结论是，通过批判性探究可以添加的内容是有严格限制的。

3. Stylistics makes greater claims to scientific objectivity than does close reading, stressing that its methods and procedures can be learned and applied by all. Hence, its aim is partly the ‘demystification’ of both literature and criticism. Thus, in relation to literature it aims to show, as we saw above, the continuity between literary language and other forms of written communication. In the case of criticism, it aims to provide a set of procedures which are openly accessible to all, in contrast to the tendency within close reading to stress the need for the critic to develop ‘tact’ and ‘sensitivity’ towards the literary text and avoid spelling out a method or procedure to be followed. Hence, for instance, the notorious reluctance of F. R. Leavis to describe or set out in detail his critical methods. Likewise, readers often express the feeling that the language of literature achieves its effects in ways which may prove inherently inaccessible to analysis, so that at the core of literature is a kind of mysterious impenetrable essence. If, as many believe, the sentiments expressed in a poem are uniquely embodied in the form of words chosen by the poet, then it must follow that there are strict limits to what can be added by critical enquiry.

文体学的野心

The ambitions of stylistics

1.文体学家试图提供“硬”数据来支持对文学作品的现有“直觉”。文体学并不总是只对个别文学作品进行解释，但当它从事直接的文本解释时，它常常试图用硬语言数据来支持普通读者的（正如他们所看到的那样）印象派预感。因此，在阅读海明威的短篇小说时，我们可能会留下类似“海明威的朴素风格非常独特”的印象。文体学家会尝试更具体：他们的问题可能是“我们所说的‘简单’到底是什么意思？” 好吧，也许我们不需要语言训练就能意识到海明威通常会避免使用副词和形容词等描述性词语：如果另一位作家可能会说“史密斯有目的地跑过大雨”，海明威会省略副词“有目的地”和形容词“沉重” '. 他希望这些事情隐式出现，在他看来，这实际上会给它们带来更大的影响。所以这句话很简单，就是“Smith ran through the rain”。文体师可能会计算海明威在给定故事中的用法，在这样的陈述中“海明威在……中使用的名词和动词的百分之七十三没有形容词或副词限定”。可能会与其他通常被认为风格不那么朴素的作家的作品进行比较，这可能导致声称这些作家只有 30% 的名词和动词是不合格的。当然，计算将仅适用于作品的一部分，也许适用于每个相关作家的故事，直觉上这些故事对每个人来说都是典型的。结果并没有给我们新的信息，确切地说，关于海明威，因为每位读者很快就会意识到，他简洁朴素的风格是他最与众不同的品质之一。但它会告诉我们很多关于如何在语言学方面准确地实现和保持简单性的信息。

1. Stylisticians try to provide ‘hard’ data to support existing ‘intuitions’ about a literary work. Stylistics is not always just about the interpreting of individual literary works, but when it is engaged in straight textual interpretation it often tries to back up the (as they would see them) impressionistic hunches of common readers with hard linguistic data. Thus, we might, in reading a Hemingway short story, register an impression something like ‘Hemingway has a plain style which is very distinctive’. Stylisticians would try to be much more specific: their question might be ‘what do we mean, exactly, by “plain”?’ Well, perhaps we need no linguistic training to realise that Hemingway generally avoids descriptive words like adverbs and adjectives: where another writer might say something like ‘Smith ran purposefully through the heavy rain’ Hemingway would omit the adverb ‘purposefully’ and the adjective ‘heavy’. He would want these things to emerge implicitly, which would actually, in his view, given them greater impact. So the sentence would be, simply, ‘Smith ran through the rain’. The stylistician might calculate Hemingway’s usage in a given tale, in a statement like ‘seventy-three per cent of the nouns and verbs used by Hemingway in … are without adjectival or adverbial qualification’. There might be a comparision with work by other writers generally perceived as having a less plain style, perhaps resulting in the claim that these writers have only thirty per cent of nouns and verbs unqualified. Of course, the calculating would be applied to a section of the work only, perhaps to a tale by each of the writers concerned which would be intuitively felt to be typical of each. The result is not to give us new information, exactly, about Hemingway, since every reader realises very quickly that his sparse, plain style is one of his most distinctive qualities. But it will have told us a good deal about precisely how, in linguistic terms, the plainness is achieved and maintained.

2.文体学家根据语言学证据提出对文学作品的新解释。文体学带来了一种特殊的专业知识来研究文本的语言特征，因此看到了普通读者不会意识到的材料的一个维度。这个维度很可能包含可以改变我们对作品的解释的材料。例如，Colin MacCabe 在一篇关于文体学的文章中指出，莎士比亚历史剧中的 Falstaff 具有性模糊的元素。例如，他经常提到他的大肚子，以及它如何让勇敢变得非常困难，但他使用的词不是“胃”而是“子宫”（“我的子宫，我的子宫，我的子宫使我崩溃”）。MacCabe 说，在剧本创作时，“子宫”这个词正处于语义转换的状态。也就是说，它的含义正在逐渐从旧义转变为新义：在它的旧意义上，它是“胃”的通用词，可以在男性和女性之间互换使用。但它随后也获得了更专业的现代意义，它是性别特定的，并指定女性解剖学的特定部分。由于这个词的两种意义都可能存在，而它处于从一种意义到另一种意义的过渡阶段，福斯塔夫对这个词的使用表明他自己也有相应的性矛盾心理。只有拥有这种语义变化专业知识的读者才会意识到这一点：其他读者一开始会对这个词感到困惑，然后可能会在词汇表中查找它，最后得出结论，这个词只是在一个词中被使用。过时的意义，因此与表征或解释问题无关。我认为，有两个都。例如，今天的“不感兴趣”这个词正在发生语义变化，但每个给定的用法都表示“公正”或“不感兴趣”，而不是这些含义的组合。一个更普遍的问题是决定证据的地位低于除专业语言学家外，所有读者的感知阈值。例如，这些含义是如何进入文本的？作者故意栽赃？大概不会。如果除了现代文本之外的一群读者是无法预测其存在的，它们通常是难以察觉的，那么它们在什么意义上“存在”？尽管如此，总的观点很明确：语言学家不仅利用他们的专业知识来支持现有的解读，而且还建立新的解读。

2. Stylisticians suggest new interpretations of literary works based on linguistic evidence. Stylistics brings a special expertise to bear on the linguistic features of a text, and therefore sees a dimension of the material which the ordinary reader would be unaware of. This dimension may well contain material which could alter our interpretation of the work. For instance, Colin MacCabe argues in an essay on stylistics that Falstaff in Shakespeare’s history plays has an element of sexual ambiguity. He frequently refers, for example, to his large stomach, and how it makes bravery very difficult, but the word he uses is not ‘stomach’ but ‘womb’ (‘My womb, my womb, my womb undoes me’). At the time the play was written, says MacCabe, the word ‘womb’ was in a state of semantic transition. That is to say, its meaning was gradually changing from an older sense to a newer one: in its old sense it was a general word for ‘stomach’ and was used interchangeably of both men and women. But it was also then acquiring its more specialised modern meaning, where it is gender-specific and designates a particular part of female anatomy. Since both senses of the word were possible while it was in the transition stage from one sense to the other, Falstaff’s use of the word suggests a corresponding sexual ambivalence in himself. Only the reader in possession of this specialised knowledge about semantic change would realise this: other readers would at first be puzzled by the word, would then perhaps look it up in a glossary, and would finally conclude that the word is simply being used in an obsolete sense, and hence had no bearing upon questions of characterisation or interpretation. There are, I think, problems in accepting MacCabe’s account of this example: he assumes that words which are in process of semantic change have traces of both meanings present in every usage, but it seems more likely that in these cases a word can have either meaning, but not both. For example, the word ‘disinterested’ today is in process of semantic change, but every given usage signifies either ‘impartial’ or else ‘not interested’, and never a combination of these meanings. A more general problem is to decide the status of evidence which is below the threshold of perception of all readers except professional linguists. How, for instance, did such meanings get into the text? Deliberately planted by the author? Presumably not. And in what sense are they ‘there’ at all if normally imperceptible except to a group of readers whose existence, except in the case of present-day texts, could not have been predicted? All the same, the general point is clear: linguists use their specialised knowledge not just to support existing readings but to establish new ones.

3.文体学家试图建立关于文学意义如何产生的一般观点。这里的要点是，与所有其他研究文学的新方法一样，文体学不仅对单个文学作品感兴趣，而且对有关文学如何运作的更普遍的问题感兴趣。例如，语言学家认为，文学效果是在形式和内容方面同时产生的。在哈代的《德伯家的苔丝》中，苔丝对亚历克的社会和身体优势的屈从既体现在所说的话上，也体现在“诱惑”（或“强奸”场景）的语法结构方面，因为亚历克下意识地强化了他的权力（或他的某些属性）经常成为句子的主语，而苔丝的力量缺乏由于她经常成为语法宾语而得到加强：因此句子有这样的模式：他[主语]触摸了她[宾语]；他的手指[主题]沉入她体内[对象]，等等。这种论点如果被接受，将对文学效果的产生方式和运作方式产生影响。言下之意，强大的文学效果是“过度决定的”，即它来自不同因素的组合，以至于内容被语法结构、整体“话语结构”、用词选择、意象等巧妙地强化。这表明，文学意义深入到语言的根基，并反映在语法和句子结构的层面上。因此，语言的任何方面都不是中性的；语法和句法、语素和音素的模式都与文学意义有关。同样，我认为将此作为一般论点存在困难：例如，它似乎使作者成为直觉天才人物，他们本能地“知道”现代语言学的内容。都一样，主要要点很明确：文体学试图确立关于文学作品方式的普遍正确的事物。

3. Stylisticians attempt to establish general points about how literary meanings are made. The point here is that, like all the other new approaches to literature, stylistics is interested not just in the individual literary work, but also in much more general questions about how literature works. For instance, linguists argue that a literary effect is created simultaneously in terms of both form and content. In Hardy’s Tess of the D’Urbervilles, Tess’s subjection to the social and physical superiority of Alec is expressed both in terms of what is said, and in terms of the grammatical structure of the ‘seduction’ (or ‘rape’ scene), for his having power is reinforced subliminally by Alec (or some attribute of him) frequently being the subject of sentences, while Tess’s lack of power is reinforced by her frequently being the grammatical object: thus sentences have patterns like: he [subject] touched her [object]; his fingers [subject] sank into her [object], and so on. This kind of argument, if accepted, has implications about how literary effects are created and how they operate. The implication is that the powerful literary effect is ‘overdetermined’, that is, it comes from different factors combining, so that content is subtly reinforced by grammatical structure, overall ‘discourse structure’, word choice, imagery, and so on. Literary meaning, this suggests, goes down to the very roots of language and is reflected at the level of grammar and sentence structure. Hence, no aspect of language is neutral; the patterns of grammar and syntax, morphemes, and phonemes are all implicated in literary meaning. Again, I think there are difficulties with this as a general argument: for instance, it seems to make authors into intuitive genius figures who instinctively ‘know’ the content of modern linguistics. All the same, the main point is clear: stylistics tries to establish things which are generally true about the way literature works.

停下来想一想

STOP and THINK

如果您从未学过任何正式语法，那么文体学中使用的语言术语可能看起来令人望而生畏，但是尝试学习正式语法作为抽样文体学的前奏可能是不明智的。更好的方法是使用一些基本的参考工具，并在您阅读本节末尾列出的一些项目时使用这些工具以供参考。我建议您使用A Dictionary of Stylistics, Katie Wales (Longman, 1989) 和一本最新的英语语法纲要。我发现专为高级英语学习者准备的那种比其他的更有用。一个很好的例子是 Michael Swann 的Practical English Usage，牛津大学出版社，1980 年。

The linguistic terminology used in stylistics may seem daunting if you have never been taught any formal grammar, but it is probably unwise to try to learn formal grammar as a prelude to sampling stylistics. A better way is to make use of a few basic reference tools and have these by you for consultation as you read some of the items listed at the end of this section. I would suggest you use A Dictionary of Stylistics, Katie Wales (Longman, 1989) and a good up to date compendium of English grammar. I have found the kind intended for advanced learners of English more useful than others. A good example is Michael Swann’s Practical English Usage, Oxford University Press, 1980.

当您开始参与这个主题时，需要关注的一个问题是斯坦利·菲什 (Stanley Fish) 在他的文章“什么是文体学以及他们为什么对文体学说如此糟糕的事情？”中强调的那个问题。Fish 说，文本中确定的语言特征与文体学家对它们的解释之间总是存在差距。我们可以将这个问题称为解释学差距（“解释学”意味着与解释行为有关）。

A problem to focus on as you begin your involvement with this topic is the one highlighted by Stanley Fish in his essay ‘What is Stylistics and Why are they Saying such Terrible Things About It?’ Fish says that there is always a gap between the linguistic features identified in the text and the interpretation of them offered by the stylistician. We might call this problem the hermeneutic gap (‘hermeneutic’ means concerned with the act of interpretation).

例如，可以说一句话使用了大量的被动动词——那些模式化的“我被告知……”：这是语言特征。然后我们可能会被告知，这些被动句表明文本中有一定程度的含糊其词：这就是解释。

For instance, it may be said that an utterance uses a large number of passive verbs–those patterned ‘I have been informed that …’: this is the linguistic feature. These passives, we may then be told, indicate a degree of evasiveness in the text: this is the interpretation.

困难在于我们如何确定被动语态的使用与回避之间存在联系。我们能确定被动语态的使用者通常以某种方式回避吗，例如，试图隐瞒举报人的身份，或者说，隐瞒这种隐瞒？（当我在上一段中使用被动时，我是在回避吗？）如果被动只是有时回避，是什么情况使它如此？

The difficulty is knowing how we can be sure that there is a link between the use of the passive and evasiveness. Can we be sure that the user of the passive is usually being evasive in some way, for instance, trying to conceal the identity of the informant, and, so to speak, to conceal that concealment? (Was I being evasive when I used passives in the previous paragraph?) If the passive is only sometimes evasive, what are the circumstances which make it so?

那么，在阅读以下示例以及本节末尾列出的一些项目时，请尝试确定评论家从描述语言数据过渡到解释它的时刻——“解释学鸿沟”打开的时刻向上 - 并考虑如何令人信服或以其他方式桥接。

In your reading of the following examples, then, and of some of the items listed at the end of the section, try to identify the moment when the critic passes from describing linguistic data to interpreting it – the moment when the ‘hermeneutic gap’ opens up – and consider how convincingly, or otherwise, it is bridged.

文体评论家做什么

What stylistic critics do

1. 他们描述文本语言的技术方面——例如语法结构——然后在解释中使用这些数据。

1. They describe technical aspects of the language of a text – such as grammatical structures – and then use this data in interpretation.

2. 这样做的目的有时只是为了提供客观的语言数据，以支持对文学作品的现有阅读或直觉。

2. The purpose of doing this is sometimes simply to provide objective linguistic data to support existing readings or intuitions about a literary work.

3. 在其他时候，目的是建立一种新的解读，它可能只基于或主要基于这种语言数据，并且可能挑战或反驳现有的解读。

3. At other times the purpose is to establish a new reading, which may be based only, or mainly, on this linguistic data, and may challenge or counter existing readings.

4. 这些关于文学中意义是如何形成的技术性解释是一个整体项目的一部分，该项目涉及表明文学没有不可言喻的、无法分析的神秘核心：相反，它是共同“话语世界”的一部分，并使用与其他语言使用相同的技术和资源。

4. These technical accounts of how meanings are made in literature are part of an overall project which involves showing that literature has no ineffable, mystical core which is beyond analysis: rather, it is part of a common ‘universe of discourse’ and uses the same techniques and resources as other kinds of language use.

5. 为此，文体学并不局限于对文学的分析，而是经常将文学和其他类型的话语并置，例如，将诗歌中使用的语言手段与广告中使用的语言手段进行比较。

5. To this end, stylistics does not confine itself to the analysis of literature and often juxtaposes literary and other kinds of discourse, for instance, comparing the linguistic devices used in poetry with those of advertising.

6.文体学从“句子语法”转向“文本语法”，考虑文本如何作为一个整体发挥作用以实现（或不实现）其目的（例如，娱乐、制造悬念或说服）并检查语言有助于实现这些目标的功能。

6. Stylistics moves beyond ‘sentence grammar’ to ‘text grammar’, considering how the text works as a whole to achieve (or not) its purposes (for instance, to amuse, to create suspense, or to persuade) and examining the linguistic features which contribute to these ends.

文体学：例子

Stylistics: examples

我不会详细考虑单个示例，而是更简要地参考三个示例，每个示例都使用语言的某些技术方面在批判性解释中。第一个使用语言术语“及物性”和“词汇不足”。这些是什么意思？前者是指动词可以出现的不同句型。传统上，当一个动词指定的动作具有明确的“目标”或“接受者”或“对象”时，该动词被称为及物动词。因此，在“She shut the door”这句话中，关门的动作是由门“接收”或“承受”的。因此，动词“关”被认为是“及物”，大致意思是“通过”，意思是动作“通过”到门。在刚刚引用的句子中，“门”被认为是这个动词的宾语。相比之下，在“她消失了”这句话中，动词被称为“不及物”，因为该动作不会“通过”任何陈述的对象——它只是发生了，可以这么说，自给自足。那么，这两个例子代表了不同的及物性模式，虽然语法类别“及物”和“不及物”源自传统语法，最初是为了描述拉丁语的结构而设计的，“及物性”的抽象概念，指定动词可能的模式范围，源自语言学家 MAK Halliday 在 1960 和 70 年代的工作。Halliday 在分析小说时使用了这个概念，而 Roger Fowler 在这方面效仿了他。

Rather than considering a single example in detail, I will refer more briefly to three, each of which uses some technical aspect of language in critical interpretation. The first makes use of the linguistic terms ‘transitivity’ and ‘under-lexicalisation’. What do these mean? The former refers to the different sentence patterns in which verbs can occur. Traditionally a verb is said to be transitive when the action it designates has a stated ‘goal’ or ‘recipient’ or ‘object’. Thus, in the sentence ‘She shut the door’ the action of shutting is ‘received’ or ‘suffered’ by the door. Hence the verb ‘shut’ is said to be ‘transitive’, which roughly means ‘passing through’, in the sense that the action ‘passes through’ to the door. ‘Door’ is said to be the object of this verb in the sentence just cited. By contrast, in the sentence ‘She vanished’ the verb is said to be ‘intransitive’, since the action does not ‘pass through’ to any stated object – it just happens, and is, so to speak, self-sufficient. These two examples, then, represent different transitivity patterns, and while the grammatical categories ‘transitive’ and ‘intransitive’ are derived from traditional grammar, as originally devised to describe the structures of the Latin language, the abstract notion of ‘transitivity’, designating the range of patterns possible for verbs, derives from the workof the linguist M. A. K. Halliday in the 1960s and 1970s. Halliday made use of the concept in analysing fiction, and Roger Fowler follows him in this.

最后，“词汇化不足”是福勒发明的一个术语：它指的是“缺乏足够的词组来表达特定概念”的情况（K. Wales）。因此，我们可能不知道特定工具的词，而是称其为“thingy”或“wotsit”；或者我们可能会忘记某个特定对象的词（例如“handle”这个词），而是使用一个模糊的描述性替代词（例如“holding thing”）。这些将是略有不同类型的词汇化不足的例子。

‘Under-lexicalisation’, finally, is a term invented by Fowler: it refers to cases where there is a ‘lack of an adequate set of words to express specific concepts’ (K. Wales). Thus, we might not know the word for a particular implement and instead call it a ‘thingy’ or a ‘wotsit’; or we might forget the word for a particular object (the word ‘handle’, say) and use a vague descriptive substitute instead (such as ‘the holding thing’). These would be examples of slightly different types of under-lexicalisation.

现在让我们看看评论家如何使用这些术语来讨论威廉·福克纳的小说《喧嚣与骚动》的开头（在罗杰·福勒的文章中，来自文体与语言文集， 1966 年，已经提到过）。开场是从班吉的角度叙述的，班吉是一个 33 岁的男人，有着孩子般的头脑。本吉正在观看一场高尔夫球比赛：

Let’s now look at how a critic uses these terms in discussing the opening of William Faulkner’s novel The Sound and the Fury (in the essay by Roger Fowler from the collection Essays on Style and Language, 1966, already referred to). The opening is narrated from the point of view of Benjy, who is a thirty-three-year-old man with the mind of a young child. Benjy is watching a game of golf:

透过栅栏，在卷曲的花丛之间，我可以看到它们在撞击。他们朝旗帜所在的地方走来，我沿着栅栏走去。光彩在花丛中猎猎树。他们拿出旗帜，开始击球。然后他们把旗子放回去，他们走到桌子旁，他击球，另一个击球。
Through the fence, between the curling flower spaces, I could see them hitting. They were coming towards where the flag was and I went along the fence. Luster was hunting in the grass by the flower tree. They took the flag out, and they were hitting. Then they put the flag back and they went to the table, and he hit and the other hit.

福勒写道：

Fowler writes:

及物性有一个一致的奇怪之处：几乎没有带宾语的及物动词，主要是不及物动词（“coming”、“went”、“hunting”等）和一个及物动词（“hit”）在没有宾语的情况下重复使用, 不合语法。
There is a consistent oddity in transitivity: there are almost no transitive verbs with objects, a preponderence of intransitives (‘coming’, ‘went’, ‘hunting’, etc.) and one transitive (‘hit’) used repeatedly without an object, ungrammatically.

这构成了语言数据。福勒现在从描述转向解释：这种“奇怪的传递性”（例如使用“击中”这个词而不说被击中的是什么）意味着“本吉对动作及其对物体的影响几乎没有感觉”。我认为这有点过于具体，但在我们阅读时，我们清楚地注意到本吉的语言有些奇怪，我们认为这表明他的思想有些奇怪。语言的“奇怪之处”与传递性模式有关。隐含地，福勒的观点是，作者选择这种语言特征来打扰是很重要的，因为，当然，在理论上，扰乱心理状态可以通过打扰任何完全没有语言功能。其次，Benjy 的词汇化不足体现在他经常使用描述性的绕口令而不是正确的词来描述事物：因此，他从不使用“高尔夫”这个词来形容他正在看的东西，他称灌木为“花树” . 这又是数据。解释它涉及这样的建议，即这样做表明角色无法像大多数其他人一样以社会可接受的方式感知世界。因此，文体师通过对与人物相关的语言方面的文体分析来解释人物的孤立程度。

This constitutes the lingusitic data. Fowler now takes the step from description to interpretation: this ‘oddity of transitivity’ (such as using the word ‘hit’ without saying what was hit) implies that ‘Benjy has little sense of actions and their effects on objects’. This is, I think, a little over-specific, but clearly we notice, as we read, that there is something strange about Benjy’s language and we register this as indicating that there is something strange about his mind. The ‘something strange’ about the language concerns the transitivity pattern. Implicitly, Fowler’s point is that the author’s choosing this linguistic feature to disturb is significant, for, of course, a disturbed state of mind could, in theory, be conveyed by disrupting any language feature at all. Secondly, Benjy’s under-lexicalisation is seen in the way he often uses descriptive circumlocutions rather than the right words for things: thus, he never uses the word ‘golf’ for what he is watching, and he calls a bush a ‘flower tree’. This, again, is the data. Interpreting it involves the suggestion that doing this indicates the character’s inability to perceive the world in socially acceptable ways, as most other people do. Thus, the stylistician explains the extent of the character’s isolation by a stylistic analysis of aspects of the language associated with him.

文体学家使用的语言数据类型的另一个例子是罗纳德卡特对 WH 奥登的诗“首都”的分析，卡特和伯顿合着，文学文本和语言研究，爱德华阿诺德，1982 年。卡特使用了“搭配'，这个术语'指的是单词的习惯性或预期的共同出现'（威尔士）。这是对这样一个事实的引用，即单词经常出现在具有一定程度可预测性的分组中，即使它们没有成为总是具有相同模式的固定短语。（英国电视游戏节目“Blankety-Blank”曾经利用过语言的这一方面。）为了证明我的意思，让我问你用一个单词完成以下每个短语（每种情况下使用不同的单词，并且在每种情况下都输入您首先想到的单词）：

Another example of the kind of linguistic data used by stylisticians is seen in Ronald Carter’s analysis of W. H. Auden’s poem ‘Capital’ in Carter and Burton, eds, Literary Text and Language Study, Edward Arnold, 1982. Carter makes use of the notion of ‘collocation’, a term which ‘refers to the habitual or expected co-occurrence of words’ (Wales). This is a reference to the fact that words frequently occur in groupings which have a degree of predictability, even when they fall short of being set phrases which invariably have the same pattern. (This aspect of language used to be exploited in the British TV game show ‘Blankety-Blank’.) To demonstrate what I mean, let me ask you to complete each of the following phrases with a single word (a different word in each case, and in each case putting in the word which first occurs to you):

一盒……一个黑……一个不请自来的……
A box of … A black … An uninvited …

第页上的注释。211表示我认为您可能用过的词来填补这些空白。这些短语不是固定的陈词滥调（例如“他变得像床单一样白”），而只是话语中每个单词逐渐缩小其后单词的可能性范围的产物。因此，如果我说“很好……”，你可以预测下一个词将是“天”或“下午”或类似的词。句子可以可以用“计算尖塔高度的方法”来完成，但任何给定的开场“这很好......”都不太可能以这种方式完成。现在，诗歌的一个共同特点是打破习惯性的搭配模式，让不常出现的词突然出现。诗人将词与他们通常的伙伴分开，并在我们从未想过会在一起的词之间提供不太可能的新伙伴关系。因此，卡特展示了奥登如何在诗中的某个地方避免使用预期的搭配，例如说人们正在“耐心等待”，而是说大城市中闲散的富人他们正在“昂贵地等待”为了奇迹的发生'（我的斜体字）。奥登还提到政治流亡者居住的城市的一部分（以及他们会面以计划最终在自己的国家重新掌权的地方）作为“恶意村庄”。“village”更常见的搭配是将它与赞许的形容词结合起来，形成诸如“friendly village”或“picturesque village”或“sleepy village”之类的短语。卡特的总体观点是，这种“搭配中断”标志着诗歌中“充满主题”的部分，因此将有助于进一步研究。

The note on p. 211 indicates the words I think you are likely to have used to fill these gaps. These phrases are not fixed clichés (like ‘He went as white as a sheet’), but simply a product of the way each word in an utterance progressively narrows down the range of possibilities for the words which succeed it. Thus, if I say ‘It’s a fine …’ you can predict that the next word will be ‘day’ or ‘afternoon’, or some such. The sentence could be completed with the words ‘way to calculate the height of a steeple’, but it is very unlikely that any given occurrence of the opening ‘It’s a fine …’ would be completed in this way. Now, a common feature of poetry is to break habitual collocation patterns, so that words not usually seen together suddenly occur. Poets divorce words from their usual partners and provide unlikely new partnerships between words which we would never have imagined getting together. Thus Carter shows how Auden, at one point in the poem, avoids an expected collocation like saying that people are ‘waiting patiently’, and instead says of the idle rich in big cities that they are ‘waiting expensively for miracles to happen’ (my italics). Auden also mentions a part of the city in which political exiles live (and where they meet to plan their eventual return to power in their own countries) as a ‘malicious village’. A more usual collocation for ‘village’ would combine it with approving adjectives to give phrases like ‘friendly village’ or ‘picturesque village’ or ‘sleepy village’. Carter’s overall point is that ‘collocational breaks’ of this kind signal parts of the poem which are ‘thematically-charged’ and will hence repay further investigation.

文体学家使用的最后一种语言数据涉及“衔接”。衔接是关于跨越句子之间界限的“词汇项”（词），将它们结合成一个连续的话语，即使它们在语法上是分开的句子。如果没有衔接，文本就会像孩子老式的早期阅读器那样笨拙地开始停止，就像这样：

A final kind of linguistic data used by the stylistician concerns ‘cohesion’. Cohesion is about ‘lexical items’ (words) which cross the boundaries between sentences, binding them into a single continuous utterance, even though they are grammatically separate sentences. Without cohesion a text has the awkward start-stop quality of a child’s old-fashioned early reader, like this:

这是曼迪。曼迪是我的朋友。曼迪和我一起去看照片。
This is Mandy. Mandy is my friend. Mandy and I go to the pictures together.

通过语言学家所谓的“代词化”（使用代词）可以消除停止质量并实现凝聚力，因此：

The stop-start quality can be removed and cohesion achieved by what linguists call ‘pronominalisation’ (using pronouns), thus:

这是曼迪。她是我的朋友。我们一起去拍照。
This is Mandy. She is my friend. We go to the pictures together.

请注意，虽然这些在语法上仍然是独立的句子，但它们现在作为一个单独的连接语句流动，因为代词“她”和“我们”指的是已经命名的人。现代作家对于扭曲衔接所产生的特殊效果兴趣颇浓，了解这个概念有助于理解下面发生的事情，这是美国作家唐纳德·巴塞尔姆 (Donald Barthelme) 短篇小说的开头：

Notice that although these are still grammatically separate sentences they now flow as a single connected utterance, since the pronouns ‘She’ and ‘We’ refer back to people already named. Modern writers have been interested in the effects of distorting patterns of cohesion, and an awareness of this concept helps to appreciate what is going on in something like the following, which is the start of a short story by the American writer Donald Barthelme:

爱德华看着餐刀上他的红胡子。然后爱德华和皮亚[不是'他和皮亚]去了瑞典，去了农场。在邮箱里，皮娅发现了一张瑞典政府寄给威利的支票。它的价格是 2300 克朗，看上去像是下了雨。Pia [不是'她'] 把支票放在她棕色外套的口袋里。Pia [不是'她']怀孕了。在伦敦，她每天都生病。
Edward looked at his red beard in the table-knife. Then Edward and Pia [not ‘he and Pia] went to Sweden, to the farm. In the mailbox Pia found a cheque for Willie from the government of Sweden. It was for twenty three hundred crowns and had a rained-on look. Pia [not ‘she’] put the cheque in the pocket of her brown coat. Pia [not ‘She’] was pregnant. In London she had been sick everyday.

除了我已经指出的预期衔接模式的扭曲之外，这里还有许多其他语言效果。部分地，这种效果来自于当语法上连续的话语构成在逻辑上、概念上和情感上扭曲和支离破碎的内容时出现的不协调感。此外，简单的语言和简短的句子再次赋予了儿童读者的基调，但主题与这种基调非常不协调，尤其是成人和创伤。通过特定的语言使用方式，从而产生一定的文学效果，在这种情况下，我们就可以合理地使用语言技巧进行探索。

There are many other linguistic effects here apart from the distortions in the expected cohesion pattern which I have indicated. Partly, the effect comes from the sense of incongruity which arises when a grammatically continuous discourse frames content which is logically, conceptually, and emotionally distorted and fragmented. Also, the simple language and short sentences give the tone of a child’s reader, again, but the subject matter is very incongruous with this tone, being particularly adult and traumatic. Through a particular way of using language, then, a certain literary effect is created, and in these circumstance we can legitimately use linguistic techniques in our exploration.

笔记

Note

我在类中多次使用了这些相同的示例来演示搭配原则。这些短语必须在没有商议和长时间审议的情况下完成。大多数人写“一盒巧克力”或“一盒火柴”。少数人写“一盒手帕”或“一盒魔术”。这四个通常可以解释一组二十人所做的所有选择。'A black'通常由'cat'或'box'完成。“不请自来”总是完成由“客人”。可以肯定的是，这些短语永远不会由二十个人以二十种不同的方式完成。

I have used these same examples several times with classes to demonstrate the principle of collocation. The phrases have to be completed without conferring and without prolonged deliberation. Most people write ‘A box of chocolates’ or ‘A box of matches’. A few write ‘A box of hankies’ or ‘A box of tricks’. These four usually account for all the choices made by a group of twenty. ‘A black’ is usually completed by ‘cat’ or ‘box’. ‘An uninvited’ is always completed by ‘guest’. It is an absolute certainty that these phrases will never be completed in anything like twenty different ways by twenty different people.

选读

Selected reading

Birch, David, Language, Literature, and Critical Practice: Ways of Analyzing Text (Routledge, 1989).

Birch, David, Language, Literature, and Critical Practice: Ways of Analysing Text (Routledge, 1989).

Bradford, Richard, Stylistics（Routledge，New Critical Idiom 系列，1997 年）。

一个非常有用和最新的帐户。

Bradford, Richard, Stylistics (Routledge, New Critical Idiom series, 1997).

A very useful and up-to-date account.

Butler, Lance St John, Registering the Difference: Reading Literature Through Register（曼彻斯特大学出版社，1999 年）。

一种生动且用户友好的基于语言学的方法，用于从略微超出主流的文学。

Butler, Lance St John, Registering the Difference: Reading Literature Through Register (Manchester University Press, 1999).

A lively and user-friendly linguistics-based approach to literature from slightly outside the mainstream.

卡特，罗纳德，编辑。语言与文学：文体学入门读物（Allen & Unwin，1982 年）。

第五章是海明威的《雨中猫》。

Carter, Ronald, ed. Language and Literature: An Introductory Reader in Stylistics (Allen & Unwin, 1982).

Chapter five is on Hemingway’s ‘Cat in the Rain’.

Carter, Ronald 和 Simpson, Paul, eds. 语言、话语和文学：

话语文体学入门读物（Routledge，1988 年）。

Carter, Ronald and Simpson, Paul, eds. Language, Discourse and Literature:

An Introductory Reader in Discourse Stylistics (Routledge, 1988).

Carter, Ronald 和 Burton, Deirdre, eds, Literary Text and Language Study (Edward Arnold, 1982).

第二章，“诗歌中对语言的反应”。

Carter, Ronald and Burton, Deirdre, eds, Literary Text and Language Study (Edward Arnold, 1982).

Chapter two, ‘Responses to language in poetry’.

Chapman, Raymond，语言学和文学：文学文体学导论（Edward Arnold，1974 年）。

基本而简短。

Chapman, Raymond, Linguistics and Literature: An Introduction to Literary Stylistics (Edward Arnold, 1974).

Basic and short.

Cluysenaar, Anne，文学文体学导论（Batsford，1976 年）。

彻底和基本的。

Cluysenaar, Anne, An Introduction to Literary Stylistics (Batsford, 1976).

Thorough and basic.

Fabb, Nigel, et al., eds,写作语言学：语言与文学之间的争论（曼彻斯特大学出版社，1987 年）。

有用的材料。请特别参阅介绍，以及 Marie Louise Pratt、Maurice Halle 和 Henry Widdowson 撰写的章节。

Fabb, Nigel, et al., eds, The Linguistics of Writing: Arguments Between Language and Literature (Manchester University Press, 1987).

Useful material. See especially the introduction, and the chapters by Marie Louise Pratt, Maurice Halle and Henry Widdowson.

Fish，Stanley，这节课有课文吗？（哈佛大学出版社，1980 年）。

请参阅第二章和第十章，这是著名论文“什么是文体学以及他们为何对文体学说如此糟糕的事情？”的两个部分。

Fish, Stanley, Is There a Text in This Class? (Harvard University Press, 1980).

See chapters two and ten, the two parts of the famous essay called ‘What is Stylistics and Why are they Saying Such Terrible Things About it?’

Fowler, Roger, Linguistic Criticism（牛津平装本，新版，1996 年）。

一个很好的一般介绍。

Fowler, Roger, Linguistic Criticism (Oxford Paperbacks, new edn, 1996).

A good general introduction.

McRae, John，诗歌的语言（Routledge，1998）。

“Intertext”系列中的一本简短且非常有用的书。

McRae, John, The Language of Poetry (Routledge, 1998).

A brief and very helpful book in the ‘Intertext’ series.

Tambling, Jeremy,什么是文学语言？（开放大学出版社，1988）。

有一个关于“批评和修辞术语”的有用附录。

Tambling, Jeremy, What is Literary Language? (Open University Press, 1988).

Has a useful appendix on ‘Critical and rhetorical terms’.

Toolan, Michael, Language in Literature (Arnold, 1998).

一个非常有用的文体学介绍和工作簿。

Toolan, Michael, Language in Literature (Arnold, 1998).

A very useful introduction and workbook in stylistics.

工具，迈克尔，编辑。语言、文本和语境：文体学论文（Routledge，1992 年）。

一个有趣的集合，代表了最近的文体趋势，特别是对上下文的强烈强调。对于质疑这种语境化是否充分的文章，请参阅萨拉·米尔斯 (Sara Mills) 的“了解你的位置：马克思主义女性主义文体分析”一章。

Toolan, Michael, ed. Language, Text and Context: Essays in Stylistics (Routledge, 1992).

An interesting collection representative of recent trends in stylistics, particularly the strong emphasis on context. For an essay which questions the adequacy of this contextualising see Sara Mills’s chapter ‘Knowing your place: a Marxist feminist stylistic analysis’.

Toolan, Michael, Narrative: A Critical Linguistic Introduction（Routledge，第 2 版，2001 年）。

涵盖文学和非文学文本，包括电影、网络和电视。

Toolan, Michael, Narrative: A Critical Linguistic Introduction (Routledge, 2nd edn, 2001).

Covers literary and non-literary texts, including film, internet, and TV.

Widdowson, HG，文体学和文学教学（朗文出版社，1975 年）。

简短的指南。

Widdowson, H. G., Stylistics and the Teaching of Literature (Longman, 1975).

A brief and simple guide.

12

叙事学

12

Narratology

讲故事

Telling stories

本章讲述的是叙事学，即对叙事结构的研究。叙事学是结构主义的一个分支，但它已经从其母体中获得了一定的独立性，这证明它有理由独立成一章。此外，由于它的大部分特征和一些术语来自语言学理论，因此从逻辑上讲，它似乎紧接在文体学章节之后。因为叙事学是关于故事的，所以我将从我自己的故事开始。

This chapter is about narratology, which is the study of narrative structures. Narratology is a branch of structuralism, but it has achieved a certain independence from its parent, and this justifies it being given a chapter of its own. Also, because it takes much of its character and some of its terminology from linguistic theory, it seems logically to belong immediately after the chapter on stylistics. And because narratology is about stories, I will begin with one of my own.

几年前，我在一家名为“Berties”的餐厅里。菜单上的特色是那些色彩鲜艳、几乎是诗意的描述——例如，它没有提供“鳕鱼和薯条”，而是“新鲜捕获、多汁的北海鳕鱼，涂有一层浅金色的面糊和配上大量美味的炸薯条——你知道那种东西。在餐饮业中，这些描述被称为“叙述”——这本身就是一个有趣的事实。但他们担心，在交易中，顾客可能会按字面意思理解，因此会抱怨面糊根本不是金色的，而是有点褐色——这可能会让餐厅容易受到对商品或服务的虚假描述的指控。所以在菜单的底部有一个脚注，上面写着：“这些叙述只是指导方针，不能照字面意思理解。”

A few years ago I was in a restaurant called ‘Berties’. The menu featured those highly coloured, almost poetic descriptions of the meals on offer – it didn’t offer ‘cod and chips’, for instance, but ‘Fresh-caught, succulent North Sea cod, coated in a layer of light golden batter and served with a generous portion of delicious French fries’ – you know the kind of thing. In the catering trade these descriptions are called ‘narratives’ – an interesting fact in itself. But they worry, in the trade, that customers may take them literally and hence complain that the batter isn’t golden at all, but sort of brownish – perhaps leaving the restaurant vulnerable to charges of false description of goods or services. So at the bottom of the menu there is a footnote which reads: ‘The narratives are guidelines only, and are not to be taken literally.’

这让我开始思考叙事和叙事理论，以及叙事学，我们可以将其更准确地定义为研究叙事如何产生意义，以及所有讲故事行为共有的基本机制和程序。因此，叙事学不是对个别故事的阅读和解释，而是试图研究“故事”本身的本质，作为一种概念和一种文化实践。事实上，真正的一顿饭——鳕鱼和薯条——和它的叙事描述——“多汁的、新鲜捕获的鳕鱼”——之间的区别与叙事学家对“故事”和“情节”的基本区别非常相似。“故事”是事件发生时的实际顺序，而“情节”是那些经过编辑、排序、打包并以我们认为是叙事的方式呈现的事件。这是一个关键的区别；“故事”，即发生的事件，必须当然，从头开始，然后按时间顺序移动，没有遗漏任何内容。另一方面，“情节”很可能从一系列事件中间的某个地方开始，然后可能会回溯，为我们提供“闪回”，让我们了解之前发生的事情。情节也可能有向前闪现的元素，暗示稍后会发生的事件。所以“情节”是故事的一个版本，不应该从字面上理解，就像那些菜单描述一样。

This set me thinking about narratives and narrative theory, and about narratology, which we can define more closely as the study of how narratives make meaning, and what the basic mechanisms and procedures are which are common to all acts of story-telling. Narratology, then, is not the reading and interpretation of individual stories, but the attempt to study the nature of ‘story’ itself, as a concept and as a cultural practice. Indeed, that distinction between the actual meal – cod and chips – and the narrative account of it – the ‘succulent, fresh-caught cod’ – is much the same as the narratologist’s basic distinction between ‘story’ and ‘plot’. The ‘story’ is the actual sequence of events as they happen, whereas the ‘plot’ is those events as they are edited, ordered, packaged, and presented in what we recognise as a narrative. This is a crucial distinction; the ‘story’, being the events as they happen, has to begin at the beginning, of course, and then move chronologically, with nothing left out. The ‘plot’, on the other hand, may well begin somewhere in the middle of a chain of events, and may then backtrack, providing us with a ‘flashback’ which fills us in on things that happened earlier. The plot may also have elements which flash forward, hinting at events which will happen later. So the ‘plot’ is a version of the story which should not be taken literally, just like those menu descriptions.

“故事”和“情节”之间的区别是叙事学的基础，但叙事学的故事本身就是存在许多相互竞争的群体，每个群体都倾向于喜欢自己的术语；因此，您会发现用不同的术语进行相同的区分。例如，在他著名的论文“现实主义文本的分析和解释”（在他的著作《Working with Structuralism》中， RKP，1980 年）中，David Lodge 更喜欢俄罗斯形式主义术语fabula，而不是“故事”和sjuzhet（发音为“soojay”）表示“情节”，但我自己认为现在使用这些术语没有任何优势。大多数当前的北美叙事学著作都使用“故事”，但通常首选术语“话语”而不是“情节”。我认为这是明智的，因为问题不仅仅是狭义的“情节”，还有风格、观点、节奏等等，也就是说，整个叙事的“包装”这创造了整体效果。Gérard Genette（见下文，第 222-31 页）使用了另一组等价术语，这些术语是histoire，与“故事”或fabula具有相同的含义，recit与“情节”或sjuzhet 具有相同的含义。
